Reviews.Title: “Great views, pity about the bed”
Reviews.Author: gill190963
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights. Great view of the Sydney Opera House from my room. Easy to walk to Circular Quay. Room not as large as others I have stayed in in this category. Unfortunately they had two beds conncted together in the guise of a king size bed - very disappointing for a hotel of this calibre. You turn over to discover an uncomfortable ridge in the middle of the bed. They do a turn down service which I discovered coming back to my room one evening - only to discover a strange man in my room! A bit disconcerting as a solo female traveller. Perhaps there could be a way of letting guests know. That said, all staff are very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel (Just)”
Reviews.Author: sorrentofamily
Reviews.Content: My wife, 7 Year old daughter and I stayed at the Shangri-La Sydney over the Easter break. Overall we had a wonderful time, and thought the hotel was of a very high standard. We stayed in a Horizon Club room with a view of the city and opera house. The bed was exceptionally comfortable, and the room was quite modern and well appointed, and resonably spacious. As always with the Shangri-La, the staff were very friendly and professional. The pool was lovely, and the location of the hotel excellnet. The views from the Horizon club dining room were exceptional. Overall rate this hotel as excellent, but with room for improvement in a two small areas: - Small cups in the room - mugs are always welcome - and we had to call twice to replenish coffee and milk supplies (as you can probably tell we enjoy a few cups of coffee). No hot chocolate for the 7 year old. - The food in the horizon club was good but not quite up to the standard I have experienced in other Shangri-La properties around the world.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious, hospitable and well-looked after!”
Reviews.Author: Betty-Joy P
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent a day and a night at the Shangri-La in Sydney yesterday. It was a dual celebration - a combinied Christmas gift for the 'Chef for a day' experience as well as a 25th wedding celebration and we want to say Thank you to the Shangri-La for a memorable day and night following! My husband and I thoroughly enjoyed our 'Chef for a day' experience, learning how to make pasta and how to impress our guests with the finer details of a meal! The Executive Chef, Steven Krasicki, welcomed us warmly, and was relaxed and so knowledgeable about food. He sat with us to eat lunch, which was superbly presented and served, as we soaked in the outstanding views. It was an excellent way to spend 4 hours on a Saturday! Our room on the 26th floor was superbly clean, bed was very comfortable and the view was the best that Sydney Harbour can offer!! We were also delighted to receive a complimentary bottle of champagne and chocolates in our room to help us celebrate. When we returned to our room in the evening, we were again surprised to have a special cheese plate in our room from the Executive Chef wishing us an enjoyable stay. This finished the day beautifully! Thank you Chef! The weekend was capped off with a sumptuous buffet breakfast, and a quiet read of the newspaper in our room until check-out at 11am. Thank you again! We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “5* All the Way, Great Service, Awkward Location”
Reviews.Author: Trekkingtheglobe_10
Reviews.Content: This was my 2nd time staying at the Shang, and it has now become 1 of my absolute favorite hotels in the city. The good: 1. 5*, but not stuffy or pretentious; 2. Extremely attentive to guests' needs (anticipated and stated); 3. Excellent rooms, views of the Harbour, Harbour Bridge, Opera House & city; 4. Rooms are quiet, private and relaxing, a perfect retreat after a long day; 5. Cafe Mix has the best hotel breakfast buffet I have come across in any of my stays The NOT so good: 1. Although the reservation was made in my name and I was paying the bill, for some odd reason each time I spoke to hotel personnel from my room phone, the operator addressed me under my partner's name instead of mine. I politely attempted to inform the hotel staff, but the error was not corrected and I let it go -- not a big thing, but it feels somewhat disrespectful if I am the person paying the bill and had tried to address the matter. 2. Location: Shangri-La, Sydney is located on a steep hill. Unless you are driving/being driven to/from the hotel, you will get a workout...and I REALLY pity women who are wearing high heals and have been out to dinner or at an event and drinking. Be careful! Nonetheless, the Shangri-La Hotel, Sydney is a true 5* hotel, and the hotel in general makes it easy to call the hotel your home away from home.

Reviews.Title: “Impressed”
Reviews.Author: Calderooni
Reviews.Content: I have always stayed at The Amora Hotel when on my business trips and was asked to assess the Shangi-la. I found it to be clean, well kitted out, modern TV, modern bathroom and of course the views are great. I will be recommending this hotel to anyone who asks

Reviews.Title: “Yet another brilliant stay”
Reviews.Author: Guruswife
Reviews.Content: GD and I had tickets to Infinity (Ballet at the Opera House) and she had been in camp for sport until late in the afternoon so I decided to surprise her with a girly getaway overnight at the very last minute. Arriving home from camp due to some plumbing works we had no shower so we chuffed off in fairly ordinary clothes (GD was desperately in need of a wash!) Booked a Darling Harbour and was upgraded to a Grand Harbour (great view even with the rain) Check in: Fast and efficient. Even though we resemble drowned rats on arrival as Sydney has been incredibly wet we were treated with respect. Room: I've had exactly the same room before the refurb and do appreciate the padding adding to the sills for window seats. bed comfy as always and so quiet we slept till after 9am, usually I am up and around at 7am. Restaurants and Bars: Original plan was Opera bar for a snack before the show but the torrential rain and late arrival at the hotel made this less than attractive. We were booked in Altitude for Pre theatre and had an amazing meal (3 courses in total but only 2 each) within an hour. Not close together but made it in plenty of time to catch the taxi to The House. (Still torrential rain) Service was excellent and food very very good. Breakfast: Been a bit spoiled lately so Mix wasn't knock you socks off in comparison to Grand Hyatt or Sebel Adelaide. There were several occasions where trays were empty or i had to wait quite some time to order a coffee. Still there was plenty of food choice, fresh egg bar including Benny, great range of fresh fruit and lots and lots of sweet pastries. Check out: Fast and efficient. Again: Yep!

Reviews.Title: “Luxury at affordable prices”
Reviews.Author: Bob A
Reviews.Content: This is my thrid stay at Shangri La. I've found the hotel exactly meets my needs - staff are courteous and friendly, their food service is first class. Rooms are of a high standard and well maintained. I have stayed at most of the five star hotels in Sydney and this is one of the best if not THE BEST Congratulations

Reviews.Title: “WOW”
Reviews.Author: norisea1
Reviews.Content: I loved my stay the Shangri-la hotel,I loved the view from my room-it had harbour views,the bathroom was big,a bed you can sink into! I used the gym and pool,which was good,some other guests were a bit possessive about there space,but I had a great experience overall. Will definately return.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel ever!!”
Reviews.Author: Ben207
Reviews.Content: From check in to check out our experience was 100% perfect. We had breakfast and lunch in the restaurant whic could have been michelin star quality. We then chose to eat at the altitude restaurant which was one of the best meals I have ever eaten. The rooms were luxorious and fantastic. The view from our room, of the harbour bridge and the opera house were second to none. Thanks for making our stay so special. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Simply amazing customer service - hospitality at its best”
Reviews.Author: skichick09
Reviews.Content: The hotel is superb, we chose the Shangri La from recommendations on trip advisor and our guidebooks to make sure we picked a great location and a touch of luxury during our Australian trip. All the reviews and research paid off and we were overwhelmed by the hospitality received. Our room had a great view of the Sydney Harbour with the famous Opera house and circular quay. For three of us travelling we opted for a sofa bed at an extra surcharge which fitted neatly in the sofa/tv wing of the room and still had lots of room left. The hotel is right in the Rocks area which is a charming part of Sydney, make sure you visit the market if you are staying over a weekend, the tasty pizzas of the Australian Heritage Hotel around the corner and the excellent value at the Scarlett restaurant, notwithstanding trying all the great eateries on site. We enjoyed the starter buffet at the CafÃ© Mix and the cocktails and the sunset at the Blu Bar. We also enjoyed the pool and spa area - very relaxing. As an added bonus they were filming Masterchef for the next Australian series during our stay too! As fans of the UK series, this was a nice little extra. Unfortunately one of us was taken ill during the stay. The hotel could not have been more helpful and understanding at what became an extremely stressful time. In particular the hotel manager, Loa Menon was simply outstanding. It is the last thing you expect to happen on holiday and her support and assistance to us was amazing and unfaltered. As an advocate of smaller hotel chains and boutique accommodation, I rarely opt for the larger chains as I often feel they lack the personal touch. However, Shangri La have simply changed my mind and without a doubt I would recommend them again and again. Their customer service was second to none and their support to my family was unconditional. We are hoping to make another visit to Shangri La soon.

Reviews.Title: “Way over priced!!”
Reviews.Author: Glen S
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a 'Grand Harbour View room' over the weekend. Yes it was a nice room but i was expecting some 'wow' factor for a room that costs over $400 per night!! The views of the opera house and bridge were nothing spectacular especially from the 5th floor and the windows are tinted so you dont get the real picture!! Very dissapointed and wouldnt waste my money again at this place! Ive had friends stay at other hotels in the area with better views at a much lower price!

Reviews.Title: “overall it ticks a lot of boxes”
Reviews.Author: HayTravellerwales
Reviews.Content: I agree to an extent with other reviews that say it is probably more suited as a business hotel. However, it is well located for the delightful Rocks area and Circular Quay. It is seriously expensive now in Australia and this hotel is no exception. In some areas such as housekeeping staff appeared scarce possibly because labour is not easy to recruit and is costly. The Leisure facilities are modest in size, although this would not be uncommon say in other city hotels e.g. London. It is after all, not a resort. For those travellers familiar with Asian Shangri â€“ La hotels this one does not offer quite the same ambience. That said the staff are pleasant and helpful whilst the quality of food and service is good. It is beneficial to select the Horizon Club option, it has amazing harbour views and attentive staff overseen by the club manager Sabina who is very efficient, extremely helpful and â€œtuned inâ€� to meeting guest expectations. Finally, would I return on my next trip to Sydney? -yes overall it ticks a lot of boxes.

Reviews.Title: “Oh! What a view”
Reviews.Author: Jampala
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 1 night for our 1st anniversary. The best thing about the stay was the Premier Grand Harbour Room with a superb view. Its amazing to see Sydney from dusk to dawn. We celebrated with dinner in the restaurant which is very good. Our package includes breakfast and secured parking as well - which was a bonus. The rooms are bit outdated and they need to be renovated. Bed is very comfortable. Check in was pretty simple. Book this hotel for a view.

Reviews.Title: “A room with a view!!”
Reviews.Author: lasvegas-marmalade
Reviews.Content: We have recently returned from a trip to Australia and stayed for 2 nights at the Shangri-La Hotel. We were offered an upgrade to a room with a view of Circular Quay and although $65 a night for the upgrade it was worth every cent! I could quite easily have stayed in the room for our entire stay and just watched the comings and goings of the ferries, the traffic on the Harbour Bridge, the folks climbing the bridge and the view of the Opera House, well it could not have been better. The room was very large with a huge bed, the bathroom was in marble with expensive toiletries, a bath and a seperate large shower cabinet, the usual dressing gown and slippers that you find in good hotels, a well stocked mini fridge etc. The breakfast had a wide range of foods and all the staff were friendly and attentive. I could not fault this establishment.

Reviews.Title: “good service but rooms can be renovated”
Reviews.Author: ZootyShauz
Reviews.Content: Checking in was a breeze, the receptionists were so welcoming, we asked how much to be upgraded to a club harbour view room overlooking the opera house- for a minimal amount it was worth it. Room wasnt so big but okay for our family- not also so new.. Our aircon was busted- it was freezing and controls were not working so the maintenance guy came to fix it right away..Selection for breakfast was good- it had asian, japanese and you could order waffles and eggs benedict from the kitchen. We were there easter weekend so the queue was long for breakfast and the club was always full- so always come at 6 pm sharp if you want to get a table at the lounge. .. They were nice to our kids and were helpful with our transport needs and inquiries. Our kids were always excited to go back to the hotel , they saw it like a second home.. Express check out was convenient too. Perfect for families..

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, best views, good service.”
Reviews.Author: FoodFollower
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 1 night and booked a room on level 32 as part of the hozizon club. Well worth the extra to stay as part of the horizon club. Separate check-in and personal service as well as large rooms with excellent rooms. Also breakfast is served on the 30th floor with amazing views. Horizon club guests also get free drinks and canapÃ©s in the evenings as well as tea and coffee all day. Location is great and access is easy off the Harbour Bridge.

Reviews.Title: “Just short of excellent”
Reviews.Author: Bevcarriage
Reviews.Content: Reception welcome was warm and friendly and staff were swift to apologise for a queue for the lifts as a large party was on its way to convention centre. My room was large and comfortable with the promised view of the Opera House. The bed was beautifully comfortable and looking across the harbour really relaxing. I didn't mind the little pull up the hill and there was a perfect route to the Opera House and back for a half hour run. I ate in Cafe Mix on my first night...huge portion of spaghetti bolognese for me! Good service but predictably expensive. I did use laundry service as travelling for three weeks all told....pricey as you'd expect but well presented. My only disappointment was housekeeping: I just didn't think they were as thorough as I'd expect. A dirty cup was left and on day two my room still hadn't been done at 2pm.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing high tea”
Reviews.Author: Lynne P
Reviews.Content: I am sure it's a wonderful place to stay, has to be with that location, but the high tea is immensely disappointing, as chikkolouise says. From the room, in a corner, no view, one high window only, to the food and like warm tea, and no refreshing of tea. I have declined the offer of a complimentary high tea as I feel it would not serve any purpose and I couldn't stand sitting I that dark corner again. refunding the $44 car parking fee would be more appropriate!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant, typical Sydney 5-star hotel”
Reviews.Author: LowboNBA
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights in Nov 2011. Location is quite nice, in a quaint little area up on a hill and a short walk away from Circular Quay, although the walk back is a fairly steep uphill climb. Lobby is small and can be a little crowded at times. Rooms itself are pretty good, typical of a 5-star hotel. If you are lucky, you can have a room that oversees the harbour area. Prices throughout the hotel for the room, restaurants, bars, etc are not cheap, typical of Sydney. Overall experience was pleasant with nothing to complain about, however not much better or worse than other Sydney hotels I've stayed, such as the Westin, etc.

Reviews.Title: “totally unimpressed with the price,housekeeping plus cafe mix's service”
Reviews.Author: 651fiona
Reviews.Content: after reading the reviews on this site,i decided to stay for 2 nights on 7/4 and 8/4 at shangrila hotel sydney.my friend jo and i were going to sydney but she had to pull out due to personal reasons.i was allocated to room 903.the checkin and the porters were good and polite.however when i tried to take a shower later in the day, i discovered there was no shower cap supplied and also no bath gel,no shampoo,nor conditioner nor body lotion.so i just used the soap supplied which wasn't the nicest either as it hardly lathered.i also couldn't wash my hair due to that.then i put on the bathrobe and noticed a stain on the belt of it.it looked like a cigarette stain which hasn't been washed off. was the bathrobe laundered before i wore it???why was there a cigarette stain on the belt in a non smoking room???then i checked for the bottled water supplied and only found one small bottle only when i booked a room for two people.then i proceeded to sit on the desk chair and felt a wet patch on it.i stood up and found human secretions on the desk chair.i was so shocked that i didn't know how to react.i got up, changed as i can't believe it and got marc to report it when he arrived to take me out.when i got back in the evening and went to bed, i noticed pen marks on the bedsheet.i was really shocked as that gave me a horrible feeling that the bedsheet may not have been washed too.it really left me with a horrible feeling.on 9/4 when i went for breakfast,the waitress who was allocating tables,walked past me to take the name of the family behind me for a table.i was totally insulted as isn't it first come first serve basis or are asians to be given secondary treatment.to make matters worse at the eggs to order section,people waiting in the queue after me were served before me by the australian chef.also it took a long time for the hot breakfast buffett to be filled up after the food was eaten and we had to wait a long time to get what we wanted.for the price of $340 on 7/4 and $310 on 8/4 including breakfast without parking facilities,one has to pay $60 for parking. i think this is a real rip off as this type of service plus the lack of bathroom amenities,lack of bottled drinking water plus dirty desk chair and dirty belt for the bathrobe really leaves a bad taste in my mouth.i would not recommend this hotel to anyone

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic club experience”
Reviews.Author: jasperjonsson
Reviews.Content: Shangri-la knows how to do their club lounges. The service and lounge facilities were exceptional, so much better than other club lounges that I have experienced. The staff were so friendly and despite being at full capacity, they really tried hard and nothing was too much for them. The room was lovely, perfect. The views of course were to die for. Lucky we also got great weather to see across to the other side of Australia! Breakfasts at the club was the highlight, it was really beautiful with fresh homemade breads and yogurts, and great coffee. Highly recommend paying a few extra $ for the club rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel for any stay”
Reviews.Author: Chermark
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for our wedding anniversary and I can't say enough about it. The view was to die for -so much so that we had room service and watched the view. There is not many views better in Sydney-the Opera House and the Harbor Bridge combined. We stayed in a Grand Harbour view room- well appointed and the bed was one of the most comfortable I have ever slept in. Certainly be back here any chance we could get.

Reviews.Title: “Best View & Service”
Reviews.Author: PJ1975
Reviews.Content: This is my new favorite hotel in Sydney, I say if your in Sydney then you have to see the water, even better this hotel you see the harbor the opera house and the Sydney harbor bridge. WOW what a view this is one hotel that you don't need the high floor either I am on the 22nd and the view is sensational, I think it could even be better on the lower floors so you see straight thru to the opera house. The service and food here is also outstanding, rooms and beds sensational.

Reviews.Title: “Worth Every Cent.”
Reviews.Author: Parisiennessence
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at this hotel for 3 nights before embarking on a cruise. At first we were hesitant about the high price tag for the Premier Grand Harbour View room on a Horizon floor, but by the end of our stay we thought that it was worth every cent. This is a corner room on a high floor with stunning views of the Opera House, the Harbour Bridge and all the way out to Sydney Heads.. The large picture windows have extra wide window ledges which allows you to look out at the view from a comfortable vantage point. We chose to eat in Cafe Mix each morning and whilst Sunday morning was frantically busy the staff were unfailingly polite, attentive and professional. The staff in the Horizon Lounge were excellent, and the evening canapes and drinks were generous and plentiful. All in all an expensive stay but when you factor in "that view" the excellent service and the generous "extras" like afternoon tea and complimentary evening drinks we thought the tariff was actually very good value.

Reviews.Title: “The most luxurious hotel I've ever stayed!”
Reviews.Author: duffman1
Reviews.Content: I arrived on an early flight and was at the hotel by 10am hoping to leave my bags while I went out for a while. To my surprise, my room was ready to go and I was laying on the beautiful kings size bed with soft sheets by 10:20AM To say this hotel is nice is an understatement. The room is spectacular and offers a great view of the opera house. The bed is very comfortable and the pillows feel new and clean and very soft. It is a nice touch having the media hub allowing me to connect my iPad and iPhone to the home theatre and play music throughout the room. The shower is great with good pressure and a nice large head and the bathroom is all marble which is nice. Definitely worth the cash to stay in a place as nice as this!

Reviews.Title: “Best views and location in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Mumof1fromMalvern
Reviews.Content: Darling harbour view room with horizon club acess room great view from club loung amazing afternoon tea great canapÃ© before dinner brilliant !

Reviews.Title: “The best that Sydney has to offer!”
Reviews.Author: Jan W
Reviews.Content: Our trusted travel agent considers herself an "Aussie Specialist" and once again, she came through with flying colors! Our harbor view room on the 23rd floor was just amazing! We are seasoned travelers and we were so pleased at the exceptional service of the main concierge, Colin, who guided us through so much of what to see and what to do. The hotel is in a great location, walking distance to the "Quay" and "The Rocks". Fabulous on every count.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful room, excellent view, great location!”
Reviews.Author: Travelaround2009
Reviews.Content: We opted for a Executive Opera City View room and it was incredible. While we didn't see the Harbor View, I have to imagine this was worth the upgrade. All rooms have recently been renovated and they are a perfect combo of elegance and comfort. For a quick trip through town, the location is also excellent and it's nearby the Bridge, Opera House, Botanical Gardens, etc. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing view”
Reviews.Author: AussieNicky
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Shangri-La for our wedding anniversary. The view from our room was magnifscent. We could see the Sydney Opera House and right through to the heads. The bathroom was large for a hotel room and it had lovely Occitane accessories. The shower had perfect pressure, but the bath was a little small. The rooms had just been decorated so the decor was lovely, but I really can't understand, with such a beautiful view, why the hotel would face the bed towards Quay West and not the harbour. We were part of the Horizon Club which entitled us to all day tea, coffee and soft drinks, then pre-dinner drinks between 6-8pm and a continental breakfast (which included hot food) at the Club on the 30th floor. It had great views. Our stay was thoroughly enjoyable and we were even given a complimentary bottle of champagne for our anniversary. We also went to the restaurant Altitude but I wasn't impressed by the food or service for the hefty price we paid.

Reviews.Title: “Superior service, brilliant location”
Reviews.Author: eternalgringo
Reviews.Content: My most recent stay at the Shangri-la Sydney has set the bar very high! Having previously stayed at the hotel before the renovation, I was not expecting such a dramatic transformation, however the rooms have undergone a thorough renovation and the quality of the furnishings and fittings are very high. The large bathroom and amazingly comfortable bed made my work trip most enjoyable. Check in and check out was very smooth. The dining experience at Altitude and Blu bar was pleasant, and who could possibly complain about the view? The hotel breakfast is pretty impressive too - the Corn Cakes were a personal favourite of mine. The complimentary internet access was very convenient for this business trip, I will definitely be back for business travel and personal visits to Sydney in the future!

Reviews.Title: “Fall in love with Sydney all over again”
Reviews.Author: CurlyandMe
Reviews.Content: The Shangri La is a bustling place with people coming and going in every direction but we were greeted warmly as though we were the first people to front the reception desk. It is true to say I was excited about this two night stay as it was part of a gift and the thought of being a tourist in my own city somehow really appealed. We had booked a Premium Grand Harbour Room and were given a corner room on the 19th floor. The package included valet parking, full breakfast each morning as well as a bottle of champagne for each day as well as one on arrival. They were happy for us to not open the champagne but to take them home if that was what we preferred. Opening the curtains to the view of Circular Quay, Sydney Opera House and down the harbour and out to North Head literally took my breath away, even on that wet, grey and cloudy day. We marvelled at the beautiful cruise ship moored at the international terminal and never tired of watching the traffic coming ofer the Harbour Bridge. This is, without doubt, one of the world's most spectacular views and I was both buoyed by it and annoyed with myself that familiarity had made me oblivious to it. Our bags arrived almost as soon as we did and a request for fresh milk taken care of just as quickly. The room had wonderful natural light, king sized bed, separate sitting area with comfortable lounges, and black-out curtains that did not gape. The windows are triple glazed so there is little sound and they are set back to create window seats for sitting, watching and dreaming. Tea and coffee are provided, of course and there is a safe large enough to hold a laptop or handbag. The bathroom was marble and while not being overly large was well designed with a separate shower (a personal plus from me) separate bath and quality toiletries. The room also provided bathrobes and slippers. All in all a very lovely hotel room to spend time in. Our initial plan was to go out to dinner but the initial weather was foul so we opted to eat in-house on the first evening. Altitude Restaurant, their flagship restaurant is probably very nice and the view no doubt spectacular. However, the menu prices took our breath away! So we went down to Cafe Mix on either the 1st or 2nd floor which is a restaurant at night and breakfast room in the morning. This has an unfortunate name as it is so much more than a Cafe. The staff there were warm and welcoming and the Seafood Buffet on offer amazingly good. With sushi, Indian, roasts etc all vying for attention next to the seafood offerings, it was a wonderful meal. Hard to do justice to the amazing dessert buffet there as well. I recommend Cafe Mix to you highly! Also available on the ground floor is a Bar/Lounge where both coffee, tea etc as well as alcoholic beverages are available as well as cakes, toasted sandwiches can be purchased. A nice spot to sit and read or work. The Shangri La Hotel is close to The Rocks, it is true, but it is not that easy to access. There is one obvious, straightforward way to go but it is steep with stairs and not suited to many. There are taxis on tap at all times however. However, with trial and error we found there were many, many other ways to go, some of which are actually interesting walks through less touristy parts of The Rocks. Here is my one and only gripe with the Shangri La. They have a Concierge Desk but it is always, always busy with people needing assistance. If the Shangri La made a point whenever they employ ANY new staff member from cleaner to General Manager to take them on a walk around their environs, when people like me ask "how do I get to.......?" they will be able to tell them. The hotel has a back door for instance which leads onto a lovely walk, also there are stairs and a road that take you onto the other side of the Cahill Expressway where there are new archeaological diggings etc. Educating staff would be so much better than the blank look and shrug that EVERYONE gives you!! Despite the hotel itself being totally suitable if you are disabled or have small children, because of its position, it may prove awkward for sightseeing unless you are happy to use taxis from time to time..

Reviews.Title: “A favorite hotel chain”
Reviews.Author: AussieBD
Reviews.Content: I enjoy staying at this groups hotel as I've alway fund the suites and service excellent and the Sydney hotel lives up to the standard. The food at the Cafe restaurant is excellent particulary the breakfast and buffet evenings

Reviews.Title: “WONDERFUL, FIRST CLASS!!!”
Reviews.Author: KeepingYOUInformed
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 6 days/5 nights. From the time you walk in, everyone was very accommodating and courteous. The rooms were great as well as the gym. The pool, however, was not that big to get some good laps in but not a dealbreaker. The best part was the FREE, yes FREE unlimited internet in the rooms. Everyone else wants to charge these ridiculous prices in the hotels. The restaurant food was delicious, from the seafood buffet on Fri/Sat to the breakfast buffet in the mornings. The hotel is also in walking distance to some great shopping, dining and activities.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel but needs updating”
Reviews.Author: Brum74
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 2 days in March. First impressions are that it was well managed, nice lobby and lots of staff. Check in was excellent â€“ very efficient and friendly. Our room was on 30th floor with superb views of the harbour and opera house. The rooms itself was well furnished with a very large bathroom with good toiletries etc. lots of big fluffy towels We had a club room which meant we had access to the lounge on 30th floor. This room is hopelessly outdated and needs a major revamp. Service in the lounge was however excellent with very good drinks and canapÃ©s included in the room rate. We certainly thought it was worth having a club room. The leisure facilities are a let down â€“ the pool is small and indoors with an outdoor rest area. There were only 4 loungers and a few chairs for a hotel with what I suspect are over 200 rooms. It may be that business guests are out all day but the area was crowded and we could not relax outdoors. The area itself is not particularly lovely with a main road passing right by it but obviously the hotel cannot be blamed for the road system. The whole leisure area was ok but just not very lovely. On the whole, this hotel is more suited to business guests than leisure. It was a good base in a good location for us but if I was staying for longer than a couple of days, I think I would have looked for a hotel with better leisure facilities. The best thing about this hotel was the staff â€“ all of the staff we encountered were excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Views”
Reviews.Author: Tubby2WestMidland
Reviews.Content: We stayed here twice, once at the start of our Australian holiday and then secondly at the end. You book this hotel for the fantastic views. On both occassions our room gave us a panoramic vista of both the Harbour Bridge and The Opera House, spectacular. Other than that this a city business hotel not really geared up for tourists and very very busy. Although the hotel has six lifts, the hotel is that busy you wait forever to get one. Position wise it is in an ideal spot to walk and explore the city. Because it is predominantly a business hotel, the staff are efficient but not over friendly. Certainly not as welcoming or friendly as many of the other Shangri-La properties I have stayed in. To sum up, a very modern centrally located hotel with spectacular views and all amenities.

Reviews.Title: “The most breathtaking views !”
Reviews.Author: seatrav65
Reviews.Content: We spent three days in Sydney following a cruise from Singapore in January. I had informed the management that both my wife and I would be celebrating our birthdays in January, and that my wife had never visited this lovely city. Upon arrival, we were very efficiently and graciously welcomed, and escorted to a spacious, high floor room which featured truly "Drop Dead" views of both the Sydney Harbour Bridge and the Opera House. Because we had upgraded to a Concierge floor, we enjoyed "free" breakfasts and evening cocktails in a beautiful and well staffed lounge with equally fine views and tasty food. Most importantly, the lounge was staffed with highly competent people at all hours who were most helpful to us in "sorting out" our airline reservation issues. Finally, in recognition of our birthdays that month, a "Yummy" cake was delivered to us. I recommend this hotel without reservation.

Reviews.Title: “Fall in love with Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Renners083
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just enjoyed a night at the Shangri-La Sydney for our 2nd wedding anniversary. We booked the 'Sydney' package which included a king room with views over Darling Harbour and included a full buffet breakfast. We were lucky to be upgraded to a corner room on the 16th floor which was very spacious with a separate lounge room. The room was very clean and had the luxurious feel we were hoping for. The hotel really impressed us with a couple of special touches. We went out for the afternoon and came back to a bottle of chilled champagne and chocolates in our room (not advertised as part of the package). Then, at dinner, our dessert arrived with 'happy 2nd anniversary' written in chocolate on the plate. Such a nice touch! I would recommend Shangri-La to anyone celebrating a special occasion.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel..will be back”
Reviews.Author: keza123
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked a darling harbour view room on a high floor for our anniversary. We had stayed at other Sydney hotels with harbour views so decided to give this side of the city a try. We were very pleased whe did. We loved sitting on the wide window sill with great views going back towards Parramatta. We could see ships going to the docks on that side and watched weddings from above at Observatory Hill. We hadn't payed for champagne or chocolates but found to our delight both of these waiting in our room compliments of the hotel for our 27th anniversary. Very nice touch. Breakfast was included in our deal which did not disappoint. We did try to go to the bar up on the top floor however it was far too crowded so opted to go back to our room to see what else was happening out our window. We will be back

Reviews.Title: “Only average”
Reviews.Author: stacey114
Reviews.Content: Overall a very good hotel. Clean, well located, gorgeous views etc. A few issues; the toaster provided by room service shorted out the power which then took some time to be fixed, the concierge didn't know where the children's hospital was located, poisonous chlorine tablets were left in our bathroom after it was cleaned along with a dirty rag (no good when the room is occupied by one adult with two small children). Lastly we had return airport transfers arranged before prior to arriving at the hotel, upon arrival we received an electronic message confirming our return transfer and every day of our stay a letter reconfirming the transfer was placed under the door......1 hour before we were due to depart we received a phone call from the concierge to say they didn't have a car available at that time only a mini bus, did we need car seats etc etc.....was all good eventually but just a hassle you don't need when traveling with kids. Food was good at breakfast, room service expensive but as expected (very generous). Some staff had difficulty understanding English (service staff on the phone) and guys out front were great..... Definitely worth the extra $$$ for a harbor view room. The bed had a massive lump down the length of the centre. We would try somewhere else next time.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel, Average service”
Reviews.Author: slefleur
Reviews.Content: The hotel and location is great, however the service is no more than a 3 star hotel. Cheking in was a hassel as the staff had difficulty understanding english. We were part of the horizone club but had to ask several times where the club was located and what was included. Simple requests were not met or ignored on several occasions. We stayed at the Shangri-La Hong Kong and had wonderful friendly service. Furthermore we switched rooms the second night in order to get a harbour view, unfortunatly we had to go to the 29h floor which put us directly underneath he horizone club's dinning hall. This meant we were woken up by moving tales in the morning and could hear the same in he evening. I called o complan and was old by the manager that she ould speak with them, the noise did not stop.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel in Heritage District”
Reviews.Author: adalbore
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in The Rocks district just in the centre of the historic district close by to the city financial hub, the docks, and within walking distance from Sydeny Opera and the Royal Botanical Gardens. The hotel is well maintained with fast and efficient staff. Good rooms, some of them with a stunning view on Sydney bay. Truly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “5 Star Room and View, 2 Star Service”
Reviews.Author: Leah P
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for our three year anniversary in a Premier Grand Harbour View room. The room was fantastic and we had a wonderful dinner at Altitude restaurant where the staff were incredibly attentive, especially Aman who looked after us. Everything was great until the next morning when we tried to order from in-room dining. We ordered at 9:30am. By 10:30am we still hadn't heard anything so we called to enquire about what was happening and were told that they would find out and call us back. We were never called back. At 11:30am we called to ask again what was happening and were told that there was no record of our order. We were not offered any apology and went home without breakfast. To be honest, we've had better experiences in hotels a lot less prestigious than this one. It was a shame, because up until breakfast we really enjoyed our stay, but going home hungry does tend to put a dampener on things.

Reviews.Title: “Great service and location”
Reviews.Author: RhysChesterUK
Reviews.Content: My wife and two young children stayed in the Shangri-La earlier this month for a week. The hotel itself is ieadlly located in the centre of the Central Business District and is a short walk from both the Harbour Bridge, Opera House and the Circular Quay Harbour which means you are ideally located for day trips and getting around this amazing city. We booked an Horizon Club room with gave us outstanding views of the Opera House and Harbour aswell as access to the Horizon Club itself, which have the best views to enjoy a drink too. The club provides a breakfast buffett, snacks and evening canapes aswell as free drinks, the staff are very attentative and very rarely is your drink left empty. When we first visited the Horizon club we were greeted by Sabina who made our stay very special and looked after us (aswell as our two children) during our stay, my daughter wants to fly all the way back just to see her again. The value of the Horizon club is exceptional and we were very pleased to have booked the Shangri-La, especially when comparing similar offers at other hotels in the same price bracket. The rooms are clean, fresh and nicely decorated, the bathrooms are clean and well appointed and the bed very comfortable. All the staff we encounted were freindly, professional and eager to help. I would recommend this hotel to anyone visiting this amazing city for its staff, location and value.

Reviews.Title: “Great views and people”
Reviews.Author: PJJersey
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a commanding position overlooking the Harbour Bridge and Opera House. They say that they have spent millions refurbishing it recently but the Horizon Clubrooms have not yet been done. However I would still recommend spending the extra money and booking a Club level room which gives access to the Lounge throughout the day and evening. The dedicated team looking after Club guests could not have been more friendly or helpful. Jasmine, Sabrina and Iris particularly should get a mention, unfortunately I cannot recall all of the other names but they all were marvellous.

Reviews.Title: “What a view!”
Reviews.Author: marcoNorthantsUK
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Shangri-La in Sydney as part of a tour of Austrailia and New Zealand, and what a hotel it is! We opted for a harbour view twin room, and got one on the 22nd floor. On entering the room, the curtains were shut, but when we opened them, WOW, the view of the 2 Icons of Austrailia, Namely the Opera House and Sydney Harbour bridge! There can be not many hotels that share that view! The beds are very comfortable, and the bedroom well appointed. The bathroom had both a shower and bath with lovely soft towels. There is a Bar and restauarnt right at the top on floor 38, but it is packed every night, and you have to wait to be seated even for a drink! The Restaurant on the first floor serves an amazing buffet on Friday and Saturday nights, with a full seafood appetizer counter with Oysters, prawns, Bugs and crab to name a few, along with plenty of choice of salad (there is a choice of Sushi as well) The Main course is either Curry, Asian, and a carvery of meat all very good. The staff were very helpfull, and handled both holiday makers and business people very well.There is a small swimming pool on the 7th floor (indoor) and a fitness centre. You are central to the city centre, and Darling Harbour is in walking distance as is Circular Quay. The Hotel is all you would expect from a 5 star hotel and I would not hesitate recommending it to anyone

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel”
Reviews.Author: kjtolces
Reviews.Content: The room was wonderful. Try to get one that has a view of the Opera House and Harbor Bridge. It gives you a view out over the city and harbor and it is just beautiful. The bed was very compfy.

Reviews.Title: “Dream Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TheNomad0
Reviews.Content: My first trip to Australia.....and I almost didn't want to leave the room...Comfy bedrooms, nice bathroom.....Fantastic Bar with unrivalled scenic views....Excellent service.....5 nights of pure bliss

Reviews.Title: “5 Star luxury on the harbour front.”
Reviews.Author: jid563
Reviews.Content: From the moment you arrive you know that you are in a five star luxury hotel, check in with no issues luggage stored as your room is not ready as your flight has arrived early. Lobby and lounge area ideal and even free computers to use to check your emails or sort out you next flight and be able to check in online. Rooms are large and spacious with ours having a stunning view of Darling Harbour, enabling our daughter to see a different cruise ship every day. Location great for Circular Keys but warning very hill and not ideal for wheelchairs or prams but if you exit the back of the hotel nip through Quay West Hotel's lifts and then Four Seasons you can be on Geogre Street and the rest of Sydney city is more or less on one level. Hotel ideally located for CBD and The Rocks with its many restaurants and shops and the weekend markets my wife loved and managed to get a fab dress at. The Blue bar on the 36 floor has stunning views whilst having a cocktail, and even children are allowed in the lounge area which our daughter loved. A great experience and with the indoor pool a good base to see Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “High quality hotel with great views over Sydney harbour”
Reviews.Author: riverside-london
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my partner in the Sydney Shangri-La for 5 nights in mid March. It is a very comfortable and high quality hotel, with terrific views over the harbour. We opted for an Opera House view room, which are on the side of the hotel with a rather acute angle to see the Opera House. The best rooms are those with both the Opera House and Bridge view, although these are considerably more expensive (but probably worth it). The bar on the top floor has incredible views, with cocktail prices to match, although the service was very good. The hotel is located at the top of The Rocks, ideally placed for access to Circular Quay but with a significant hill to walk up to get to the hotel. Best things: the views over the harbour, high quality spacious room & bathroom with very comfortable bed, great central location, not stuffed with business people (didn't seem like just a corporate hotel) Negatives: expensive (breakfast, food, the spa....), some inconsistency in the maid service (toiletries sometimes not replaced) Overall, if you can afford it, this hotel is highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Unexciting, average, but does the job and not much you can really criticise”
Reviews.Author: fishytale
Reviews.Content: The good things: - the view of the harbour bridge and opera house - the breakfasts are fabulous - friendly staff in restaurant The not so good - lifts incredibly infrequent and can be difficult to direct if card not immediately recognised - could not get Ethernet connection to work over duration of stay - bulbs out and not replaced during long stay - housekeeping foibles - a long up hill climb from city and circular quay

Reviews.Title: “40th Wedding Anniversary”
Reviews.Author: Silvernomads
Reviews.Content: A really special stay at this wonderful hotel. From my initial booking to check - out all of the staff have been wonderful. Our room was amazing on 19th floor with fabulous views of The Bridge, The Harbour and The Opera House. I booked directly through the hotel, got a good rate and was able to tell the staff that it was an anniversary treat, they obviously made a note of this on our arrival we found a complimentary bottle of bubbly waiting for us in our room. Our meal in the Altitude restaurant was fabulous, again lovely staff and a dessert decorated with anniversary wishes made it an unforgettable occasion for us - and the view from our window table at night was just magic. We will be back !!!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing spa”
Reviews.Author: Mo211
Reviews.Content: The Shangri La is in an ideal location. Worth splashing out on the Opera House views as these are amazing. The rooms are lovely - great bathrooms and really comfortable bed. The spa is something really special so treat yourself to a visit. The service is generally good. Only thing that didn't match expectations? Room service menu - not enough light or healthy options.

Reviews.Title: “Almost perfect”
Reviews.Author: fussyvoyager
Reviews.Content: In order to help celebrate my husband's very special birthday we treated ourselves to a night at the Shangri La. We were very impressed by our room which was more like a suite. It was on the corner of the building. We walked into a small sitting room with a couch and then down a small hallway where the bathroom was off to the right and into the bedroom. The only thing I think could have been improved would have been to have a TV in the sitting room. There has obviously been one there on the past as the wall brackets were still there. Bed was very comfortable and bathroom clean and well stocked with amenities. We had club access so were on one of the high floors which afforded us a gorgeous view out to Darling Harbour and the Blue Mountains. The club was a good size and the views from it are stunning. You really get a different perspective on the bridge and harbour. The staff were attentive and generous with drinks. The only negative was that the club became very overcrowded. It was a Saturday night and absolutely flat out. Ordinarily we go for the club rooms as you can relax and unwind before dinner. Given the crowd and the noise, this wasn't possible. Overall a great hotel, well located, excellent views and great service.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend Escape To Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Lyse-Scott
Reviews.Content: I decided to take my husband to Sydney for a surprise birthday getaway. I wanted a Hotel with a view of Sydney Harbour and came across (through Google) the Shangri-La. From the moment I first called them, I received exemplary service. The reservations staff member could not have been more helpful or friendly. I received a pre-arrival email asking for any new/updated information. Upon arrival, the staff got the room ready far earlier than anticipated and also gave us a late checkout. The room itself was stunning - spacious, well appointed and with the most incredible view across Sydney Harbour, encompassing Sydney Harbour Bridge and the Opera House. The Bar upstairs was lovely, the pool and spa terrific and the cafe downstairs was relaxing. The staff couldn't do enough for us. Each morning we received a paper and every evening our bed was turned down, complete with slippers at the side and a bookmark on our pillow. I can't remember the last time a bed was turned down for me. We cannot recommend the Shangri-La highly enough with a special mention to Jaimie Kim.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Views of Sydney Harbor”
Reviews.Author: rkmoy
Reviews.Content: My wife and I visited in December, 2011. We were so glad we booked the Horizon Club rooms. We booked the Grand Harbor View Suite, and were so glad we did. We were on the 33rd floor and the views were stunning. Waking up in the morning to views of both the Harbor Bridge and Opera House were breathtaking. The Horizon Club rooms came with a spa credit (which we used), free internet , daily breakfast, and free drinks and canapes in the Horizon Club in the evening. Having evening cocktails, wine and champagne with views of the Harbor was truly romantic. The concierge staff also worked miracles as far as our restaurant reservations were concerned. We are foodies, and wanted to eat at two of the most booked restaurants in Sydney: Quay and Tetsuyas. Before visiting, we tried to get reservations ourselves, but were unable to. Somehow, the concierge was able to get us reservations for both! All in all, a wonderful stay. The Shangri-La chain is not well known in the U.S., but I would definitely recommend it to Americans. The chain provides the luxury of a Four Seasons, but with better value. These little perks and bonuses were the reasons that I chose the Shangri-La instead of other hotels in the CBD.

Reviews.Title: “a must stay in sydney”
Reviews.Author: frenchabroadFrance
Reviews.Content: if you can afford the grand harbour/opera house view - go for it the view is spectacular and the bar on the top floor has sensational views everything else in the hotel is excellent staff are friendly and service is faultless can't fault it perfect for Sydney

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: EKjamieT
Reviews.Content: My stay at the Shangri- La was exceptional. The view from my room looking out to the Oprah House was stunning. The staff provide amazing customer service. My room and bathroom were fantastic and really comfortable , I couldn't have asked for more. I will most defiantly staying again. 10/10

Reviews.Title: “Another day in paradise”
Reviews.Author: PixieE69
Reviews.Content: Everything you could ask for from a hotel. Not cheap, but you get what you pay for. And the location is breath-taking. The best place to stay in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “5 night stay at end of February”
Reviews.Author: Tommo2210
Reviews.Content: Hotel centrally placed for The Rocks and Circular Quay, room had super view of Opera House. Concierge service was excellent If you want a seat at Blu Bar on 36 by the window, get there well before the published opening time of 5pm

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location. Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: miz_ferreira
Reviews.Content: Perfect location! Wonderful reception and friendly staff! Spectacular views of the opera house, harbour bridge, and the skyline! Was met by the hotel manager in person, what a gentleman. Fantastic staff in the hair salon. But the real gem is dining at Altitude. Wow! The highlight of my trip to Australia! I WILL BE BACK!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing, well worth the price!”
Reviews.Author: Chris_reed20
Reviews.Content: Well where to start when we arrived at the hotel we had been upgraded to a better room! When we got into the room on the 6th floor it was clean and had a stunning view of the harbour, the bridge and the opera house! We then decided to go for a bit to eat in the hotel and since it was Sunday the main restaurant Wasnt open but the bar on the first floor was. The meal was nice after changing the Thai green curry for spag Bol as I didn't know it was so hot!! Silly me! We then went to the rooftop level and got a cocktail the view of the city was spectacular from the top floor and despite the drinks being $20 each it was worth it! When we got back to the room we had a good choice of tv and it had an iPod dock in so we could play some tunes! The bed was really comfortable and we both had a really nice nights sleep. In the morning check out was 11am which gave us plenty of time to get out and since we weren't going home straight away they kept our bags in the hotel lobby storage! Would Definately recommend this hotel, if you can stay on a Sunday you will save yourself a few notes (on the Thursday if was going to be Â£240, Sunday it was only Â£90, plus the upgrade) all in all this was an amazing experience in a fabulous hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Appalling service and a waste of money”
Reviews.Author: globetrotterplus
Reviews.Content: I have been here twice before and am really disappointed by how awful it was this time. The service was consistently dreadful from check-in to room service. Choose another hotel

Reviews.Title: “Lovely anniversary night”
Reviews.Author: Bijingo
Reviews.Content: Thank you Shangi-la Sydney for a restful night away from the kids for our wedding anniversary. The pool was lovely, Altitude Restaurant was superb, and we had the best night's sleep in years! Great bed and room, and a brilliant view. Breakfast was a little busy (seated a long way from the buffet, and no milk for our coffee despite requests), and concierge was rather cold. Otherwise, PERFECT weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing View worth the extra dollars”
Reviews.Author: Renee B
Reviews.Content: The best thing hands down about this hotel is the opera house view room. We were on the 28th floor and loved every second of this bridge and opera house view. Incredibly comfortable bed, great gym, WONDERFUL buffet breakfast with lots of variety (get the breakfast included). Very friendly and helpful staff. Nice bathroom, nothing fancy, but clean and spacious. In the middle of everything. Pretty expensive, slow elevators. It isn't the Elysian Hotel, but it was pretty top notch.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here for the amazing views”
Reviews.Author: dragoneti
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Shangri-La hotel in Sydney for 5 nights during the first week of March. It cost A$500.20 per night for a Premier Grand Harbour View Room with daily buffet breakfast at CafÃ© Mix. The hotel is located in the Rocks area just a stoneâ€™s throw away from Circular Quay, where the Opera House and Harbor Bridge are located. The main hotel entrance is located at the top of a steep hill. However, there is another entrance (Lower Ground level when you take the hotel elevators) on Gloucester Street, thus you would only need to climb half way up the steep hill. However, for check-in purposes you need to go to the main entrance. Upon arrival, I was greeted and bags taken promptly. The hotel lobby is not as grand or luxurious as compared to other Shangri-La hotels or its neighbor The Four Seasons. I arrived at 1pm and was told that my room was not available and had to wait 1hour. The receptionist said that she would phone me to let me know when the room was available. I decided to have some tea at the lobby lounge which cost A$7.50 a cup. The service was average, at times unprofessional when the young waiters were chatting away about their personal lives. After 1hr, there was no phone call, so I decided to approach the reception. I was surprised to find out that my room was still not ready. Another receptionist, Louis, was nice enough to offer me another room on a different floor that was currently available. However, it would have been better if they had called me earlier to inform me about this so that I didnâ€™t have to wait that long. The room is probably the main reason why one would choose to stay at this hotel. The premier grand harbor view room was stunning. It provides a 270 degree view of the Sydney harbor bridge and the opera house. You could also see the rooms from the adjacent Four Seasons hotel and Quay West. I could just lie in bed the whole day long with views of the opera house at my feet. The size of the room was quite big, giving you the feel of a junior suite. There was a large king bed that was on the softer side which was very comfortable for me. The room had a large flat screen TV, lounge area with nice sofa and also a work desk. Working the curtains was quite a chore (especially when you had really wide windows!) as you had to use quite a bit of strength to draw and un-draw them. Ideally, there should be remote-controlled blinds like in other hotels. The bathroom was nice but did not have in-built TV in the mirror or bath tubs with a view. Toiletries were also Shangri-La products and not Lâ€™occitane. Daily newspapers were provided and there was complimentary wireless internet access. House-keeping service was excellent. The room was well cleaned. Whatever I asked for (extra bathroom slippers, tea towels) was delivered promptly. Room service was excellent. I had the spaghetti bolognaise and the fish and chips which was excellent. However, be careful as the price of the items stated on the menu may not be the actual price charged. The delivery of food was prompt and the presentation was good. The whole experience of having a meal in the comfort of your room with stunning views of the harbor was amazing. I had my buffet breakfast everyday at CafÃ© Mix. The staff was very friendly, efficient and professional. The buffet spread was good but was mostly the same every day. I usually went around 930-1030am and the place was not crowded at all. I used the spa twice during my stay. The service and ambience were excellent. Catherine, one of the staff, was very friendly and helped to arrange my appointments. The massage service was excellent and tailored to your needs. There was also a high level of privacy ensured for the guests. Check out was efficient. The person who checked me out helped take my bags to the entrance and got me a taxi which was a nice personal touch. Overall, the best part of the entire experience was the room itself. You pay for the stunning views and the spacious rooms. I would definitely stay at the Shangri-La in Sydney again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay at The Rocks”
Reviews.Author: MC-7
Reviews.Content: In Sydney for a friend's wedding, with the pre-wedding celebrations centred around The Rocks. We chose the Shangri La for it's location as well as the views over the harbour and the Opera House. We were not disappointed with the quality of the service at check in, and the room (and the view) was wonderful. Great size room with nice decor and a modern bathroom with very good fixtures. The hotel is a 2 or 3 minute walk to The Rocks, with great shops and restaurants very close by. We would definitely stay at this hotel again and would recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing views,excellent food, good service”
Reviews.Author: Hoffbucks
Reviews.Content: Shangri-la was recommended to us by our UK travel agent. Trip was a 70th birthday present for my wife, so quality of the hotel was important, particularly as it poured with rain the whole of our stay! We were not disappointed - spacious room on the 32nd floor with staggering views of harbour and Opera House. We found the Horizon Club very useful and practical - particularly for checking in and out. Very civilised. The top-floor bar and restaurant were most enjoyable - particularly the early-dinner deal in the restaurant which is a real bargain. Breakfast service was always rapid and pleasant - buffet was first class. Only problem with this hotel is the steep access - I have a bad lung condition, so that steep hill is a bit of a problem. It's worth sneaking in via the shopping lobby to avoid those last few uphill yards to the main entrance!

Reviews.Title: “Great view overlooking Darling Harbour.”
Reviews.Author: Geoff F
Reviews.Content: The room was very spacious and the facilities were all we could ask for. We were taken aback by the view over Darling Harbour and the activeties of the ocean liners docked on the nearby wharf. Central to the Rocks and Circular Quay we had a great time exploring the local area. Would definately recommend as a top class 5 star hotel and will be staying there in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Okay but Horizon club nothing exceptional”
Reviews.Author: HY-5
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Shangri-la early February. We booked a Horizon Club room. The room itself was quite good - comparable with other hotels that we've stayed in. Did have to ask twice for our basket of fruit that was promised to be delivered, but otherwise services were great. The only let down we feel was the Horizon Club lounge. It has the acoustics of a school-hall, probably due to wooden flooring and high ceilings, so quite noisy. Not a very relaxing feel, with a lack of comfortable chairs/couches and merely little tables and chairs much like a cafe. Views are good from the Club Lounge, which overlooks the bridge and Opera House. Staff attentive with their drinks service. I'll give them that. Food on offer pretty average to be honest. Mini quiches that were warm and rubbery come to mind. The freshest thing on offer appeared to be my bread roll which I had with butter. Not the best at all that we have had. We decided to have our breakfast in the restaurant on 1st floor as our first introduction to the Horizon Lounge wasn't what we expected. Way more choice and selection than that of the Horizon Lounge. Definitely worth going to. If you were new to the whole Club Lounge experience you might find this really good, but if you have experienced other hotels Club Lounges you might be a bit disappointed with Shangri-la, like we have.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel with amazing harbour view”
Reviews.Author: Pete_Gill_Haslemere
Reviews.Content: We've stayed here a few times and on this occasion paid extra for a Grand Harbour View and 'grand' it most definately is - lie in bed and look out to the bridge on the left side, the Opera House on the right side and the 'liner of the day' in port in the middle - it doesn't get much better. The hotel's great as well, with lovely spacious light rooms, really comfortable beds and everything good you would expect from a Shangri La. We will go back and happily recommend this. Best to get a $6 taxi from Circular Key of Wynyard station if you have heavy luggage to avoid climbing the hill, but this is not a big deal.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel in the heart of the city”
Reviews.Author: 8nqDh62V
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at Shangr-La hotels in other cities in Asia and have never been disappointed. The only real negative with this hotel is its location on the top a hill known as "The Rocks" so steps or uphill walks are inevitable navigating to the waterfront and beyond. But there is an easy walk to the harbor that also has elevator assist to the elevated roadway below the hotel if you struggle with this sort of thing (we do not). I cannot think of a better hotel choice if you are in Sydney. The place deserves 5 stars. The room was Shangri-La for us and a welcome final stop before returning home the next day. Would return over and over again to this property.

Reviews.Title: “stunning view but uphill walk home”
Reviews.Author: MickandFee
Reviews.Content: harbour view was "wow". wonderful rooms with comfy beds. excellent quick service. only minus was the hotel is up hill from everywhere if you walk home (but still only a short walk). plenty of bars and restaurants close by. the whole city is a short walk, including the opera house.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury hotel with great views and location”
Reviews.Author: AliD78
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed my stay here. Rooms big and well appointed. Check in was efficient. Had harbour view room which had great views over the bridge and opera house. Breakfast was excellent. Would definitely stay again and would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Not what we were expecting”
Reviews.Author: Mr_Meldrew
Reviews.Content: The forecourt and reception are not as impressive as some other hotels in Sydney. Upon our arrival we were greeted by people opening car doors, taking our luggage from the car boot, addressing us by name and even showing us to reception. We thought that we were in for typical Asian Shangri-La service. We had booked a room with a harbour view and were told on arrival that one was available immediately on the 4th floor with a harbour and opera house view, we asked to see it. Well yes, we could see some water in Circular Quay! There was an identical room on the 15th floor that would be available later, we elected to wait for that, which had exactly the view that we had anticipated and thought that we had booked. We could not fault the room or its fittings, all one expects from Shangri-La. Thereafter we had no other contact with any member of staff except being woken at 8.40 in the morning to be asked if we wanted the room cleaned and then on another day, upon returning from a day out and appreciating the view asked if we wanted a "turn down" service at 6.30, having agreed, we did not realise that it involved closing the curtains and plunging the room into darkness! Overall this hotel is one for commercial visitors and business meetings and lacks the "Shangri-La Brand" experience that we have enjoyed at other of the group venues in Australia and particularly Asia.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing like Asian Shangri La”
Reviews.Author: Gables28
Reviews.Content: Bed was soft and uncomfortable luckily only stayed one night! Staff were not interested and quite honestly we were shocked after staying at the Hong Kong Kowloon sister hotel, could be a different chain.

Reviews.Title: “Good situation”
Reviews.Author: christine2008
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel in the Rocks area and is only a 10 minute walk to Circular Quay where all the ferries depart from although it is up a short steep hill. We had a harbour view where we had a superb view of the opera house and bridge and as we were on the 25th floor we didnt really feel we had to pay a large sum of money to climb the bridge for the views as we were almost as high. We had a standard room which was a decent size with a bath and a shower. We didnt have breakfast included in the price and we found the breakfast, dinner and drinks prices to be very expensive (as through all of Australia) though we are from the uk and the exchange rate is particularly bad at the moment. Beer is Â£6-Â£8 for less than a pint and a small glass of wine was the same price. Overall this is a nice hotel, mainly recommended for its views and situation but we stayed in the Bangkok Shangri-la 2 days before and that was far superior. There was free internet/computer use.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Sarah_Jane1981
Reviews.Content: The hotel was so beautiful and the staff were so friendly. Our room was spectacular and the view was amazing. We stayed for 4 nights and could have stayed longer.

Reviews.Title: “Lunch at the Shangri-La Sydney”
Reviews.Author: steam_driven_aussie
Reviews.Content: Had a bite to eat at the Shangri-lA in Sydney...it was magnificent!!!...wonderful service...delicious food..great value@!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Luxury in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Luxuryaddicted
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights during the weekend and we found Shangri-La hotel to be as excellent as usual. As we have been to Sydney several times we opted for the Executive Darling Harbour View Room. We checked-in in the early afternoon, the formalities were very fast and we found we were upgraded to the corner room on the 25th. floor. The room was very spacious, with a small lobby at the entrance' furnished with a couch and a flat screen TV, connected with the bedroom through a corridor where is located the bathroom. From the bedroom there is the partial view of Darling Harbour, while from the lobby we faced the high rise buildings behind the hotel. The suite was very clean and well attended, with free wifi available in the room and all the expected amenities. We found the service throughout the hotel to be very good and the fantastic location made the rest. The only service we used during our stay was the Altitude Bar with its breathtaking view over the whole Sydney Harbour. Overall an excellent stay whether you plan stay for business or leisure.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible service. Great rooms”
Reviews.Author: rrlondon500
Reviews.Content: What a dissapointed. Booked hotel via centurion travel fine hotels and resorts. At check in lady was rude and told me room was not ready till 4. It was 11 am.. When finally got room it was fab but no upgrade. Bar on top floor was SHOCKING. people in shorts and flit flops. Not shangrila. Went to lobby bar where we had ti BEG fir service. The bar lady was far to busy chatting. I noticed at least 3 other couples having to walk up to complain and ask ti be served. At breakfast staff did not seem to mind that a lady walked in in her dressing gown for breakfast. At check out an even ruder lady. I have called Amex centurion to make sure they dont let anyone stay here again. I just can't believe shangrila is associated with such bad service.

Reviews.Title: “My favorite Sydney CBD Hotel”
Reviews.Author: xaisywoman
Reviews.Content: I frequently travel to Sydney for business and have stayed in several high quality hotels - almost all of them in fact. I had the pleasure of staying at the Shangri-la last week (having stayed previously) and was not disappointed. It's the little touches that appeal to me - I stayed in a deluxe room with a Darling Harbour view - lovely room and spacious bathroom. I adore the amenities and the generous provision of them - some so called 4-5 star hotels do not even provide slippers (which I believe are hygenic & essential) - this hotel provides it all. The little box of complimentary chocolates was very nice, the room service food tasty and timely (I really appreciate the Asian cuisine) and the staff lovely. And it's not too far at all from the financial district if you need to be there for business. I will be back for certain.

Reviews.Title: “The most amazing view and a gorgeous suite”
Reviews.Author: CindyW_Texas_USA
Reviews.Content: We stayed in room 3112 - a gorgeous suite with a grand harbor view (both the bridge and the Opera House). This spacious suite was perfect as we were traveling with 2 others who wanted to be able to sit and chat with us - so this living room area with the view was PERFECT. The room came with access to the Horizon Club on 30th floor where you can have tea/coffee/drinks/snacks and eat breakfast (or you can eat at Cafe Mix buffet). The Horizon Club has multi-floor glass looking out over the Harbor. The bathroom was lovely and spacious. It is across the hall from the bedroom - which my husband likes as he often gets up before I do and this way he doesn't worry about waking me. When we arrived the bathroom sink wasn't draining well - we called and it was fixed in a snap! The TV sets (living room and bedroom) were of high quality with plenty of channels to surf. There was a DVD player in the living room which we used and enjoyed. The desk is comfortable and there was free wireless internet which was of high quality. The minibar and tea/coffee service was well stocked. Only wish was for a sink in this area as we had to walk down hall for water for kettle - but this was a VERY minor inconvenience. The bedroom had a wonderfully comfortable King bed. Bedroom included a larger than usual safe in the closet, robes, and plenty of drawer and closet space (and another closet in the hallway) and another desk and small sitting area. The service was excellent throughout the hotel. The food in the Horizon club was lovely. Drink service there in evening lovely. This is an expensive hotel - but it's worth it. And we felt the upgrade to the suite with access to the Horizon club was worth it. Most especially the living room space was wonderful for the quality time it allowed us to share with others. We sat and enjoyed each other and the most amazing views of the harbor. If you can afford it, it's worth the splurge. The only draw back to this hotel is that it is at the top of a steep hill (2 steep staircases). It's a bit hard on our knees to go up and down to the Circular Quay / Rocks area causing us not to do as much in the Rocks as we might have otherwise. A small problem. My suggestion to the hotel would be to consider a courtesy shuttle up and down the hill to the Rocks/Circular Quay area. On the plus side, being on top of the hill creates these magnificent views. Overall a first rate experience. Thanks to everyone at Shangri-La for making it a wonderful experience.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent staff, overpriced, average food”
Reviews.Author: traveller41Brisbane
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Shangri La and was impressed by the friendliness of the staff. They were all very professional and helpful. We got an upgrade on check in and my little one was given a stuffed toy as a welcome gift, which was a nice touch. There is a nice indoor pool and a large gym. My only complaint is the food - it was completely overpriced for what was on offer ($9.90 for a glass of fruit juice ??), breakfast buffet was ok, but pretty average. I sent some feedback to the hotel and never heard back.

Reviews.Title: “Gets better every time we go back!”
Reviews.Author: plugga_syd
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have stayed at the Shangri-La, Sydney four times now and each time we go back, everything about the hotel gets better! The rooms, facilities and staff are second to none. One of the most comfortable king beds we have had the pleasure of sleeping in. The rooms are very clean and best of all, very quiet. The breakfast buffet is great and the location and views are hard to beat. The Horizon Rooms, above floor 30 are well worth the extra cost. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding hotel”
Reviews.Author: pilabroch
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in a great part of town. We had excellent views from our high floor room. Outstanding breakfast buffet. Superbly comfortable beds and great service by a well trained attentive staff.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful view, but otherwise just OK”
Reviews.Author: cafeturco
Reviews.Content: This large high-rise hotel is located in the heart of the Rocks and Circular Quay. We chose a room on the 29th floor with a view of the harbor, which was outstanding. The room was large, clean and the staff attentive, but the bed was very uncomfortable (a "King" was really two twin badly-worn mattresses). Although the room was cool, the halls were very warm and humid. The buffet breakfast was crowded and very loud. A OK place to stay in the Sydney, but it is not very highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Elegance”
Reviews.Author: weightyghost
Reviews.Content: The only hotel you should consider in Sydney. It is a 5-star experience in every aspect, from the room and staff to its proximity to the harbor and The Rocks.

Reviews.Title: “It's ok.”
Reviews.Author: TravAgent87
Reviews.Content: As the title implies- it's ok. Compared to other Shangri-la properties; it's in need of a bit of an update. I personally think you can get alot more for your money. For instance the Quay West next door- the Quay Grand up the road or even the Four Seasons has a bit of an edge on this property. The rooms I found a little dated and extremely basic overall. All this said; I found the service polite and helpful. I thought the Grand Ballroom a little eerie but the Horizon Bar is Spectacular!!! It's good...but in my opinion, it needs some work.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location!”
Reviews.Author: Mona A
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for two nights in a suite with a fantastic view overlooking Harbour Bridge and the Opera House. The service was excellent and the Horizon Club with breakfast, five o'clock tea and drinks and canapees in the afternoon was great. Will absolutely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Understated service & great view”
Reviews.Author: Rp46
Reviews.Content: Can't be beat for views over Sydney harbour. Overall service is great but maybe not as attentive as other hotels like the Westin Sydney. Either way the consistent enjoyable experience and view will bring you back to it.

Reviews.Title: “Beautifully refurbished, fab location!”
Reviews.Author: kakil
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night at the end of January for my husband's birthday. It was a last minute booking so we were thrilled to get there and be assigned a lovely, spacious room overlooking Darling Harbour. The room was a great size for a hotel room; quite large I thought. The bathroom was magnificent as well ... not that you are hopefully going to spend too long in there on your stay!
