The lady that checked us in offered us a complimentary bottle of white, red or sparkling wine given that it was my husband's birthday which I thought was a lovely touch. We asked for sparkling but a white turned up and unforunately I think the request was lost somewhere in translation as it arrived many hours after we had checked in when we were about to leave to g out for dinner. Still a really kind gesture. Bar 34 can't be beaten for views in any other hotel in Sydney but the prices are steep and the service not great. It is an experience to be had though. A check out of 11am rounded off a lovely stay at this hotel. If you are looking for a litte indulgence ... look no further.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Rich_P11
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in September when travelling on our honeymoon. This was the hotel where we based the majority of our stay in Sydney. We were here for 5 nights and could not fault the place in any way. Check in was quick and easy, the receptionist was lovely and gave some advice on places that were a must to visit. Our room was huge and beautifully decorated. The cleanliness of the room was excellent and house keeping were brilliant. The free wifi was reliable and fast and room service was quick and to a high standard. The were a couple of people working the concierge desk, all of them massively helpfull. We booked a couple of trips on their recommendation and followed their advice on some restaurants, we were never disappointed. Altitude restaurant was brilliant and the views stunning. Could not recommend this hotel highly enough!

Reviews.Title: “Top class General Manager who sets a high standard in service excellence”
Reviews.Author: TropicalKwek
Reviews.Content: It was my second visit to the hotel in 3 months. The first visit was so impressive that I wanted to come back again the second time. Unfortunately, the arrival experience was a little disappointing on this visit for an Amex FHR member. I dropped an email to the GM, Franz Donhauser, who called me back within an hour to resolve the issues, even though he had already gone home (i.e. it was 9 pm) . The following day, all the problems were resolved to my utmost satisfaction and my remaining stay was most enjoyable! I will not go into detail about the fantastic hotel operations because there are already many reviews to that effect. What I would like to highlight here is the dedication and professionalism of the GM. In general, problems tend to occur once in a while even in top hotels. But they are not always resolved well by hoteliers. In this case, the problems were resolved fairly, sensibly and quickly by the GM and his management team. He made a difference to my stay at this hotel. I will not hesitate to return to Sydney Shangri-La again!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: ARedQueen
Reviews.Content: This is a terrific hotel - great room amazing views, lovely staff - if you are thinking of having a sneaky couple weekend away it well worth the money (unlike some of the other so-called 5 star hotels in sydney). The bar on the top floor is sensational - there is truely nothing in the world like it. Love it.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: elizabethmcLeeds
Reviews.Content: This is our 3 stay at this hotel. Location is great as we love been near the rocks with the beautiful views. We paid for a Horizon club room and should have had some kind of upgrade but sure if we did as the room was smaller than the one we stayed at last time. Club lounge is lovely but was unable to cope when it was near capacity. If you enjoy sunbathing after a day round the city, this probably isn't the hotel for you are there is only about 4 sunlounges on a very small terrace.We ate in the main restaurant for breakfast and twice for diner, all food and service was excellent. Staff were friendly enough. Service to our room was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but a little out of the way”
Reviews.Author: EDinoM
Reviews.Content: We had a great room with a nice view of the harbour. Only slight disappointment was that to get to it when walking you need to go up quite a steep though short hill with some steps which was difficult with a pram and an 18month old. We stayed at the Intercontinental the week later which we found more convenient for walking around sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: C O
Reviews.Content: Easy walking access to the Rocks, Harbor Bridge,the Opera House and the Botanical Garden, so you don't have to spend too much time in your hotel room. It was clean and nice contemporary design, just not outstanding. We did not have a harbor view this time, and that might have made a difference, although our view was nice. Breakfast buffet was very pricey, even for just the cold choice.

Reviews.Title: “TnH”
Reviews.Author: Helen P
Reviews.Content: Stayed here over the New Year 2011/12 but were disappointed in so many ways. The main restaurant was frantic at breakfast time and we felt that we left the hotel without anyone knowing that we had been there!

Reviews.Title: “Stayed 2 nights for a conference”
Reviews.Author: Polar_bear77
Reviews.Content: Nice rooms, lovely bathrooms. Restaurant forgot our breakfast order before conference, so time was limited to get it cooked. They resolved issue by letting us dine at the buffet for same price as what we ordered. Dinner was lovely, but felt a bit put out that the fact we were paying guests of the hotel a table could not be guaranteed. Being at the top of a steep hill for walking to and from can be tiresome too. We had great views of the Harbour Bridge.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Drea3
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Shangri-La Sydney with a friend. The staff were incredibly professional and helpful from the reception desk satff to the room service staff to the concierge staff and the amazingly wonderful Horizon Club staff (special mention to the extremely helpful Amy). From the second we arrived to the second we left everything was perfect. In fact I doubt I would book anywhere else on future visits to Sydney. The rooms are beautiful and has high quality fittings. The bed is very comfortable and the views are some of the best in Australia. I highly recommend booking a horizon club room. The extras were well worth the money from complimentary beer, wine and spirits between 6 and 8pm to other added bonuses during the day. We were also lucky enough to get an amazing upgrade! Couldn't recommend the Shangri-La more. (Oh and make sure you book a dinner at Aria restaurant while you are there!)

Reviews.Title: “Room with a view”
Reviews.Author: LyleH
Reviews.Content: This was our fourth year in a row staying at the Sydney Shangri-La and my last review of it pretty much still stands. We like the place overall and will probably keep coming back. The rooms (we had a Grand Harbour View Horizon Club Room this time) are very good sizes and have some of the best views in the world looking out over the famous Sydney icons of the Opera House and Harbour Bridge. When booking you need to make sure the room you book has the view you require. We have heard of people booking Darling Harbour view rooms thinking that this was Sydney Harbour. If you want the best views you need the North facing rooms or corners on the North side and need to be as high as possible. If you do decide to go for one of the rooms on one of the other sides then going for the Horizon Club means you can have breakfast, tea, coffee & soft drinks during the day and canapes and alcohol in the evening on the 30th floor with views over the Opera House, Bridge and harbour out to the Heads. We usually go to the main restaurant for breakfast as the choice is greater although the service is usually lacking and the majority of the staff don't seem to want to be there! It is a buffet style though so the service doesn't detract too much. The main time for the Horizon Club lounge is from 18:00 to 20:00 as this is when the canapes and alcoholic drinks are served as part of the package. The quality of the drinks is good with good Australian sparkling wine free flowing and as far as I know all other drinks you would expect. The canapes are however a little more hit and miss. Sometimes they are good and sometimes less so. Also the service at the busier times particularly can be lacking. There are some excellent members of staff such as Jerry and Melanie who are very attentive but there are also those that are not so good. We did have a little grumble to guest services one morning about turn down service and the service one night in the Horizon Club and on returning to our room at the end of the day were greeted with a bottle of sparkling wine and a box of chocolates. Sabina the Horizon Club manager who is also excellent, apologised for the slip in service when we next saw her. Despite a few slips generally we love staying here. The rooms, views, location and the good staff more than make up for any faults especially when they recognise those faults and will listen to what you say and try to make up for it. Hopefully we will be back later this year.

Reviews.Title: “great view”
Reviews.Author: Tess13
Reviews.Content: We had three nights here. It's in a great location, the rooms are well appointed and spacious. Very standard fancy hotel but very comfortable. They could do with some instructions on how to use the clock/radio/ipod dock. Very handy for Circular Quay and public transport. One of the most comfortable beds I've ever slept in.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious room with half an amazing view”
Reviews.Author: Diana265
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Shangri-La Hotel Sydney in mid December and was overall really happy with the room and the service. The concierge took my bag to my room with no fuss. My Deluxe Darling room was unusual, it had a little loungeroom with a large flatscreen tv, then a corridor down to the bathroom and then the bedroom. Everything was in excellent condition and very clean. A great bed and some good magazines to read. The view out the window was straight into about six apartments in the neighbouring building, but sitting on the wide windowsill gave me a stunning view out over Circular Quay, the Opera House and the harbour. The buffet breakfast the next morning was delicious and plentiful.

Reviews.Title: “Unsatisfactory Housekeeping”
Reviews.Author: Lisa B
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a stay at the Shangri-La in Sydney. We have stayed before and had a harbour bridge view room. This time we requested the same but as we were late checking in (6pm) there wasn't one available. However, we were on 16th floor and our room was impeccable. The decor was almost like new, we could smell the newness of the carpet when entering the room. Much better than our harbour bridge view room. It was disappointing however, on arrival, at 6pm, after travelling from work etc. to be told our room was not yet ready! NOT what we expected to hear! This was soon fixed, however, but it takes the edge off slightly. Then, something I have never experienced before while staying in a hotel, being disturbed at 8.40am by housekeeping ringing the doorbell, I answered, to be asked when could she come in to clean the room??!!! I viewed by opinion to the nice gentleman in check-out who, after consultation, gave me a small discount on my bill, but more importantly, that my comments should be filtered through to housekeeping that this should not have happened. The same happened further down the corridor at the room of our in-laws. It has not put me off coming back to the hotel, but I will be wary next time! Also, someone else has asked where can guests purchase the mattress toppers which are so comfortable? A web site or any information would be helpful. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Horizon Club Poor”
Reviews.Author: Joanne S
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at 5 shangri la hotels in the past 12 months this has to be the worst horizon club lounge we have been too. Dont get me wrong we love Shangri La Hotels and this hotel is nice, the views from our room are amazing. Just the Horizon Club Lounge Needs improvements, for example not enough space for the amount of people using it, each time I have been there had to ask for more plates, or cups, the dirty dishes are not collected very quickly. Not enough tables. We went at 6pm and was told maybe come back at 7pm went back and 7pm and told maybe come back in 30 minutes, we are travelling with two small children they are normally in bed at 7.30. There was an apple in the fruit bowl that was brown (my child bite into it and said this apple is yuck). I also found it very strange that the check in staff at the Horizon club also helped in the serving food and drink area. All other Shangri La we have stayed at had staff that just did the check in. One more thing we arrived at the hotel after 4pm and was told that our room was not ready! was not impressed at all. Had to wait for our room. Also mentioned to the staff that the blind in the bathroom needs a clean still dirty no one has cleaned it.

Reviews.Title: “Great location in the Rocks District”
Reviews.Author: RonBeijing
Reviews.Content: Service is great with professional, friendly staff. I found the rooms to be spacious but a little outdated and expected a more modern design from Shangri La, that said the location in the Rocks district cannot be baeten within walking distance to Circular Quay, the Opera House and of course the Harbour Bridge.

Reviews.Title: “Always good”
Reviews.Author: BenLeaver
Reviews.Content: I stay here often for business and always get looked after, the service is great, location perfect. Rooms are modern clean and have everything you need, very comfy beds, and depending on what side lure on, awesome views.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to sleep”
Reviews.Author: Agrego
Reviews.Content: On arrival the Shangri-La is very luxurious in appearance, ambiance and scent. It is very classy and the staff are quite friendly. Upon check in, all our booking information (excluding our names) was incorrect and they tried to charge us the booking which had already been pre-purchased. We had booked a darling harbour view. We were given a room on the 6th floor and had a lovely view of the toll booths for the Sydney Harbour Bridge. The room was clean, the air-conditioning was questionable and the bed was outstanding! So there were certainly pros AND cons. All in all it was a good 5 day holiday for us in Sydney- mostly for the fabulous location for travellers who plan on walking to most places like us. I cannot compliment their bedding enough! I have never slept so good in my life! We booked very last minute and as a result got and incredible deal. Probably would have not been as impressed if I had paid full price however.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Alan_S_391
Reviews.Content: Positioned above Circular Quay hotel is a fantastic location and provided you can climb the gradient up to the hotel well worth the walk, as the hotel is a tall building all rooms have great views and although we couldn't see the opera house our city view was stunning.It's well worth upgrading to the Horizon club floor as the bar has the perfect Sydney view, bridge and Opera house with the added bonus of free drinks and nibbles.The staff at all times were fantastic and our stay was really something special,gorgeous room with very big comfortable bed and huge bathrooom. I did the bridge climb with my son and we all took a sea plane ride both activities awesome but as well as seeing the stunning Sydney views you couldn't miss the hotel which is a prominent feature on the Sydney sky line .

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Pippa P
Reviews.Content: This is a truly fantastic hotel! Exactly what you would expect from a Shangri La Hotel! The views are amazing and it is really worth upgrading so you can enjoy the views of the Harbour Bridge and Opera House. The location is great as the Rocks is a great place for eating & drinking.

Reviews.Title: “Second Visit, getting quite fond of the place.”
Reviews.Author: RomaRose
Reviews.Content: I found the staff here charming. Lots went wrong, largely because some have poor English but they put things right with a good grace. You need to check everything. The Horizon Club is excellent value. Opera House views are sometimes only visible if you press your face up against the glass and look to the side. I didn't bother on my second visit. The view from the Club Lounge is wonderful. Breakfast there is nicer than Cafe Mix, I thought. They serve afternoon tea there now as well as breakfast and a light early supper, all included in Horizon Club room price and delicious as well.

Reviews.Title: “A world class view with exceptional service”
Reviews.Author: Clive B
Reviews.Content: We celebrated 10 years in business by taking a room on the 31st floor of this amazing hotel. Imagine our delight when we checked in and were told that our already amazing view had been upgraded to a suite. I have staying in a lot of really special hotels but this view really did take your breath away. Panoramic 180 degree view of the worlds most famous and iconic harbour with the Opera house to your right and the harbour bridge pretty much right in frot of youths was special. Coupled with a separate lounge a marble bathroom and a really comfy bed things were very special. A very James Bond experience. Top tip book a room above the 31 st floor because then your stay will include a high level restaurant for exclusive use by residents above the 30th floor. Only let down was the potentially marvellous bar 36 which was sometimes messy with slopped drinks. No real favours here for residents it's every man for himself. They should have a residents only part especially if you are staying above floor 30. Itdid not however spoil an otherwise excellent stay. Oh yes and anywhere that gives me a choice of pillow must be pretty good!

Reviews.Title: “Indifferent...”
Reviews.Author: flyzeki
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately the indifferent attitude of the staff spoil the experience of this hotel. I have stayed in other Shangri-la properties before but I certainly did not feel this one was up to scratch. Not all the have a full of the harbour by the way, we had a partial view of the opera house only. The location is obscure if you can't walk up a hill don't consider it bless you are using cabs all the time.

Reviews.Title: “Nice views”
Reviews.Author: AucklandStephen
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the shangri-la after a 12 night cruise. We chose this hotel as it wasn't far from the pier and therefore not far to carry the luggage. There is a steep hill to get to the hotel from The Rocks with minimal public transport. The hotel itself is great. The bathroom was one of the largest I have ever seen. The bed was very comfortable and the room was spacious. We had a view out onto Darling Harbour side with a glimpse of the bridge. The restaurant on the top floor has awesome views and fine food. Although the hotel is right beside the motorway, we could hardly hear the traffic.

Reviews.Title: “Room & view great but that was about it.”
Reviews.Author: Melissa A
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for my partner's birthday last Friday. The layout of the check-in desk/reception, concierge and luggage area is a mess. When checking in we had to dodge bags and people rushing past. The area is not big enough to have all those services together. The room was fantastic and the view amazing. We stayed in the deluxe Sydney Opera House view room. Next morning we went to the Cafe in the Hotel for the buffet breakfast and I had to ask the kitchen staff if they would be providing a hot breakfast. There were plenty of noodles, pastries etc but no bacon, eggs (scrambled), corn fritters or hash browns as advertised in the breakfast area. We then had to wait for 20mins before they refilled these areas. I would think for $42.00 a head food we would not be waiting on the buffet. Along with the loud music during breakfast this was not a pleasant experience. Check out was just as chaotic as check in the previous day. Will not be staying again. Overpriced.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: LauraJ94
Reviews.Content: Staying for three nights here on the 19th floor, we had a wonderful time. The veiw from our room looked out over the harbour and opera house. Situated between Circular Quey and Darling Harbour, the location couldn't be better. Check-in was a breeze and staff were always friendly. We frequently used the lobby lounge area and also the heated pool and spa. It was easy to walk down to the water each night and find somewhere to eat dinner. Our room was spacious and clean. Loved the marble bathroom! Parking is very expensive, but parking spaces are a luxury in that area anyway. I would absolutely stay here again when in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Stunning Views”
Reviews.Author: CiviCSingapore
Reviews.Content: Stayed there twice over a period of one month. Great rooms, ok service but great executive floor privileges on the Horizon floor.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent mix”
Reviews.Author: Brunoandirina
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel 4 nights. Nothing to complain about Very nice rooms with spectacular views. Rooms are very Spacious but the decoration is a little Old. Nice bar on the last floor And free wifi eveywhere in the hotel Location is also very good amid a little hill to climb.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, will definitely be returning”
Reviews.Author: LewieG
Reviews.Content: I would definitely recommend spending the extra money and staying in the Horizon Club rooms. The Horizon lounge was amazing with complimentary buffet breakfast as well as canapÃ©s and drinks in the evening. Unlike many complimentary beverage services the staff did not hesitate in giving you more drinks. Also the view is fantastic from the Horizon Lounge. The Blu Bar on 36 is great for a once off experience however the drinks were very expensive and the service was hit and miss. Room service proved to be a little slow and rather expensive. Overall the room was amazing being very spacious and fitted with all the luxury furnishings. The staff were incredibly helpful and nothing seemed like too much trouble. The location is fantastic being in a prime position in The Rocks district with many restaurants and bars within walking distance. Will definitely be returning on our next trip to Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “5 Star Luxury and 5 Star Views”
Reviews.Author: Cathy090911
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for arguably the best views of Sydney Harbour, right in the historical Rocks area of Sydney, in a luxurious room, this is the place for you. My husband and I stayed at the Shangri-La for birthday and we chose the Opera House view (where you could watch all the boats coming in and leaving Circular Quay, with the Opera House in the Background, and views out to the Heads. We also chose to have access to the Club Lounge where we were able to have soft drinks and afternoon tea during the day and drinks and canapes from 6-8pm at night with an even better view also taking in the Harbour Bridge. But make sure you get there at 2pm if you want the best choice of afternoon tea cakes and sweets as the selection is the best then and doesn't get replenished as often as it should (noticed several times during the day people arriving, looking disappointed at the selection and leaving. Beware the drinks (including spirits, beer & wine) and canapes from 6-8pm is very popular and you might not get a table if you arrive after 6.15pm. Our room was a great size with a separate sitting room and was one of the most comfortable 'hotel' beds we have ever slept in. The gym was also above average (large with lots of equipment, towels, cold water) and the indoor pool was also a good size for doing some laps. We ended up staying in the hotel for the duration of our stay drinking in the wonderful view and enjoying the luxury.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Room & Service”
Reviews.Author: adamsaintlouis
Reviews.Content: The Shangri-La has exceptional rooms (in the USA they would be AAA 5-Diamond quality). The bathrooms are huge as are the rooms themselves. Very modern, appear brand new, and using the latest hotel technologies. I also found the service to be top-notch. The staff were all very friendly and went out of their way to help when needed. The hotel is at the top of a hill....so frequent trips to the harbour mean climbing a large hill on return, but thats a small compliant for an otherwise perfect hotel. I would say that the hotel lobby is not impressive at all. Its not that its not nice, its just lacks any wow factor that 5-start hotels usually have. All that said, you can't go wrong with the Shangri-La Sydney!

Reviews.Title: “Poor service”
Reviews.Author: louisebuck
Reviews.Content: I arrived at 3.15pm to check in to my room (note check in time is 3pm) and was told my room was not ready, so they took me over to the lobby bar for a free glass of wine whilst I wait, I did ask at the time how long it would be and they said 10-15mins. 20 mins later still nothing so the front desk man came back and he still had no clue as to how long my room would be as he could not get hold of the room servicing department and I was told the reason for the delay was a late check out. I had dinner reservations at 6.30 as that was the only time available so was not happy that I had to wait for my room. I finally got in around 4pm. Whilst I don't mind a little delay I don't like being lied to about how long the delay is - if you don't know just say it. I wouldn't stay here again the level of service provided just does not live up to the cost of a room.

Reviews.Title: “Just lovely”
Reviews.Author: PnD86
Reviews.Content: Stayed here as a treat for our Silver Wedding Anniversary. Room was beautiful, spacious, tastefully furnished, fantastically comfortable bed and a view to die for. Service was friendly without being too much. Even received a complimentary bottle of bubbly and box of chocolates from the hotel to help us celebrate, lovely touch. The location is perfect - close walking distance to The Rocks and other key parts of Sydney although to be fair, most of Sydney are within easy walking distance. Too expensive for us ordinarily and so we ate out every day as a result although did treat ourselves to a meal there on our anniversary and have to say it was worth the money as the restaurant, food and service was spot-on. Sadly out of reach on our budget for a re-visit if we were to ever go back to Sydney again but if you can afford to treat yourselves, then stay here, you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Pure luxury! Absolutely loved it!”
Reviews.Author: sabreena0303
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the shangri-la for our wedding Anniversary weekend and it was great! The room was clean and very spacious with an amazing view of the Sydney harbour and the Rocks. Indoor pool and spa area was also very nice. Customer service, room service and food was also great. The contintental buffet breakfast offers an awesome range and everything is tasty! We spent most of our time lazing in our bathrobes in our room, ordering room service, watching movies and admiring the harbour views!! Absolutely loved it. Would definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “Chi Spa - The Perfect Experience”
Reviews.Author: Claire C
Reviews.Content: Ok, when I say perfect, I don't mean the 'perfect' of a neurotic, never satisfied customer looking to find fault. I mean, perfect in that the decor is beautiful, the staff are lovely and the products top notch. I had the Du Mai back massage and it really did the trick. The cardamon and jasmine in the massage oil was divine. The therapist paid careful attention to the form I filled out before my massage with respect to pressure and desired state (relaxed to energised - I chose somewhere in the middle and consequently received a very firm massage that challenged by tense muscles while also occasionally drifting off into a dream filled sleep). It's like a little piece of South East Asia has been picked up and placed in The Rocks, Sydney. I was not staying at the hotel but a 1 hour treatment meant that I also had free access to the pool, spa, gym and sauna afterwards. Bonus!

Reviews.Title: “Chi Spa Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Elena E
Reviews.Content: I have been to 5* spas all over the world, and chi spa is by far the best experience ive ever had! Perfect in every way! Chi spa makes shangri la sydney!

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful property --- pity about the service !”
Reviews.Author: BLUEWONDER1
Reviews.Content: First of all let me say that the Horizon Club Lounge and our room were breath-taking with the views they offered over Sydney Harbour Bridge and The Opera House --- location location location superb. It is just a pity that the service in the Horizon Club was unacceptable. I could list a number of issues where the service levels were way below Shangri-La standard eg.(a) we were involved in an accident in the hotel limousine from the airport to the hotel and this accident was not reported to the Shangri-La when I arrived at the hotel I informed the staff member in the Horizon Club Lounge and requested for a written report to be noted in the hotel system ---- I discovered the next morning that this was not done (b) service providing drinks for guests was slow and many times food and drink was not replaced quick enough (c) dress code in the Horizon Club as outlined by the hotel was clearly ignored and as a result many guests were allowed in the club with shorts, t-shirts and sandals. This practice is totally unfair for the guests who made an effort to dress accordingly. (d) Many evenings it was standing room only with many guests having to stand up because of insufficient seating arrangements. On a positive note the Cafe Mix Restaurant for breakfast was excellent and the staff unlike the Horizon Club Lounge very attentive and had an enthusiastic approach. One ray of sunshine in the Horizon Club Lounge was Jerry --- a real professional who was head and shoulders above the rest of the staff. Finally this Horizon Club Lounge is by far the worst experienced we have had in the last 5 years.

Reviews.Title: “Good”
Reviews.Author: perryw
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for just a night in early July, 2011 in a Deluxe Opera House City View King room, the idea being just to get a short break. I made the booking directly on the hotel website. Arrival Experience I parked the car and then caught a bus down George Street till I was just near the hotel entrance. I then discovered that it was quite difficult to walk up the hill and get to the hotel entrance. I hadnâ€™t really explored this part of Sydney much in the past so didnâ€™t really know that the hill would be quite that steep. I must have entered from a side entrance and not the main entrance. There was no help with the luggage offered. The reception was friendly enough, generally quite good with the attitude and I was welcomed as a Golden Circle member even though Iâ€™d just joined prior to making the booking and this was my first stay in a Shangri-La property. I was afforded an early check-in at around 11 am. I went to the lift and immediately there was an issue with the lift key-card not working but it worked in a different lift. The Room The room appeared on entry to be quite spacious but it wasnâ€™t really a room with much of a wow factor, the Shangri-La in Kuala Lumpur in Malaysia being a little more impressive. The room wasnâ€™t very complicated and I suppose aimed for a simpler design. The furniture was a little bit worn in places, the lounge set although nice looked a little cheap and perhaps more could have been expected for a hotel of this level. It was pleasing to note that the curtains were completely blackout. The bathroom was also nice and luxurious, probably the most immediately impressive feature of the room. It was quite a large bathroom compared to the small one at the Intercontinental in Sydney. The bed was quite nice and comfortable, a little on the softer side but recently, Iâ€™ve discovered that softer beds could probably provide a better sleep particularly if sleeping positioned on the side sometimes. There didnâ€™t seem to be too much complimentary mineral water provided in the room with just small bottles provided. It was pleasing to see the complimentary internet access in the room though, which was free of charge as in all Shangri-La properties. The room experienced a little elevator noise but it wasnâ€™t excessive by any means. My room overlooked the harbour and the expressway but it was high enough so that there was no noise pollution and the view of Circular Quay was quite impressive, although the view of the Opera House was not direct and there were buildings directly opposite. I have videos of the hotel room and functions on the link within my profile section. Location and Facilities The first thing to point out is the hotelâ€™s location on top of a hill which made the walk there quite difficult when returning and even more difficult with luggage, as I mentioned earlier. Generally, when looking at a map though, the hotel is located in the historic Rocks area of Sydney with plenty of historic sights nearby. Itâ€™s also close to Circular Quay and the Sydney Harbour and for a more solid shopping experience, I suppose the main shopping areas of George Street and Pitt Street would be only about 10 minutes walk away or even shorter by bus along George Street. The immediate area did seem to be very quiet and dark at night, as I took a walk around. There werenâ€™t too many places to eat but I managed to find an Indian restaurant nearby which was alright but a little pricey, perhaps suggesting that the Rocks area charges tourist-level prices in general. I managed to try out the pool and to have a look at the Jacuzzi, which were right next to each other. I expected both of them to be a little smarter as the pool was just adequate and heated but the Jacuzzi/hot tub was small and filled with children at the time. I might have been mistaken but I thought that with the amount of focus on the CHI spa concept at the Shangri La and on their website, they might have offered a jacuzzi experience of note but it didnâ€™t happen. The equivalent at the Shangri-La in Kuala Lumpur was much more impressive. There were plenty of lifts operating in the hotel so that was never an issue. The lobby was quite good and luxurious in its setting but not over the top, it was probably a little low-key by the standards of most luxury hotels and not on the same scale or level as the Shangri-La in Kuala Lumpur. Staff Service Apart from receiving no assistance with the luggage earlier in the day, the only time I called upon the staff was when I experienced a problem with the door lock later in the evening as it failed to lock; it didnâ€™t take long after a call to the helpdesk to sort the issue out but the staff member mentioned after I asked that the problem was quite common with the new door locks that they had put in place. Conclusion Overall, the hotel appeared to be quite solid in all aspects but I couldnâ€™t really say that it was exceptional and that would be my general assessment of the property hardware and service levels. NOTE: Videos of the hotel room and functions can be found on my hotels page, linked within my profile section.

Reviews.Title: “Grand Harbour View - Oh Yes !!!”
Reviews.Author: John C
Reviews.Content: We booked room to enjoy the New Year fireworks display and we got the perfect view from room 2309 with Harbour Bridge and Opera House in full view. See photo for testimony of what view we enjoyed. Hotel is within 5-10 minutes walk to Circular Quay for ferries to Darling Harbour or Manly, plus the many bus / train options. The hotel is slightly set back from Circular Quay so wasn't troubled by the crowds associated with New Year with good pubs close to the hotel. Rooms are good size with king size beds and also the large window ledge allows you to lounge with a pillow and just enjoy the harbour view. The window width is a good 4m wide as we could both sit in the window from each end in comfort. HD television in the room with docking station for ipad. Blu Horizon bar on the top floor is a let down, as the view is of the city over the botanical gardens not the harbour. Only from the top floor dining do you get a harbour view & then only a few tables allow a view while dining. We also found the horizon bar too busy at 5.30 to 7.00pm when it first opens & better to call for a nightcap but check on closing time as it closed at 12pm or 1am and wasn't really a late night bar. NOTE for anyone going for the new year, there are 2 lots of fireworks, first at 9pm (trial run / kids showing) then the real thing at midnight !!! Harts Bar (gastro pub) is adjacent to the hotel and the beer / stout / lager options are excellent and very reasonable priced food options. IF YOU WANT HARBOUR VIEWS OF THE BRIDGE & OPERA HOUSE - YOU'LL GET IT !!!!

Reviews.Title: “Marvelous location, large room, best view!”
Reviews.Author: Sheila S
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived, it seemed pure luxury. We were given a huge room with a phenomenal view of the Opera House! It was absolutely a memorable moment! In addition, our luxurious room was with new decors and carpets. The bathroom was huge and had good fittings and good toiletries. Breakfast provided everything you may want to eat, hot or cold. Like other Shangri-la hotels I stayed at in 5 other countries, hotel staff were professional, courteous, very polite and helpful. Wish we could have stayed longer.

Reviews.Title: “Best Views in all of Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Rugbimad
Reviews.Content: Our Room overlooked the brdige and the Opera house all through one window - it was excellent. Upstairs in the bar is another fantastic view - sipping a cocktail or choose from their excellent wines - the sun going down - bliss The staff go out of their way to help. There is a lady who sits at a desk by reception (between reception and the porters) who is bubbly, willing to help and very professional - i am sorry i have forgotten her name she deserves a mention - but you will know her! I would also like to say a big Thank you to the Porters - who were extremely helpful - little hints and tips - Very near the Rocks, if you take the tip from the porters. Go out the back and down the seps and your there! We went the long way around for 3 days!!!

Reviews.Title: “Except The Fireworks View, This Hotel Worths Nothing of Your Money Spent!!”
Reviews.Author: Neuilly-Shanghai
Reviews.Content: I have never seen a 5 stars hotel tring to tarnish their name so actively like Shangri-la Sydney. This hotel is far below the stardard of Shangri-la HK Pacific Place. We stayed at the Premier Grand Harbour View Room with 2 kids from 25th December till 3rd Jan 2012. We arrived at the hotel by their Limo pick-up around 12:00 noon. Understand it was peak season during new year, room not ready. We were simply told by front desk "oh, room will only be ready at 14:00". Guess what, the room got ready at 13:57. How accurate!! The hotel had zero intention to accomodate guests travelling with young kids. The houskeeping was the worst, I even wonder if they ever cleaned the room. The bathroom was basically not cleaned except taking away some towels without replacing hand towels for 3 days. The studying table and bedside tables were not even wiped from the day we checked in till departure. The room was left exactly the same shape everyday we left the room except taking away towels and put back pillows, nothing was done!! We left some garbage on the top of the trash bin on 31st Dec, they were not cleaned aways till the 1st Jan afternoon after one clean-up and 2 turn down bed service. Subsquenty, we had to take the trash bags and leave them in front of our door. If any of the hotel management still care about your review at tripadvisor, please go ahead and check your CCTV around 17;00-19:00 at room 1013. Call housekeeper? That's what we thought, eventually it took at least one hour for any request. The entire hotel had an attitude it was so normal due to peak season. The funnest story was that we requested to have a bucket of ice, after waiting for 2 hours, they called back and said it will charge AUD 10 for delivery fee due to peak season.I know internet, extra bed, and breakfast can be at extra charge in all hotels. But delivery fee AUD 10 for a bucket of ice for an AUD 1,000 room? Never heard of it. If you can afford to stay at Shangri-la on the Rocks, you absolutely can pay for Four Seasons next door.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing !!!”
Reviews.Author: lovetotravel2812
Reviews.Content: this hotel is just amazing !!! its seems like its new ...the location is perfect and the harbor view rooms are just beautiful ....the views are simply amazing ... the rooms are also very spacious ...during our stay in sydney..we stayed 2 nights here and 2 nights at the four seasons and this one is just 10 times better !!! we had an opera house room view one night and darling harbor view the other night ....both were just beautiful ... the location is also perfect....very close walk to the funky the rocks area ...and also to the harbor ... the service was great as well....only downside was a bit of wait at the reception at all times ! check in, check out, inquiries - you always had to wait 15-20 minutes and thats really not long but you just spoiled with everything else that it seems long =) Would definitely recommend and we will stay here again if we go back to sydeny

Reviews.Title: “Simply a wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: Lyrischer
Reviews.Content: This review is being written four months after our stay but the memories are very vivid and excellent. We stayed for our wedding anniversary, and from our first greeting at the desk, to dinner in Altitude to our departure; all service and standards were exemplary and showed what a great 5 star hotel ought to do. The rooms are immaculate and the location is terrific for scenic walks around Sydney's Rocks and Circular Quay area.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and concierge, some deficiencies elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: MusicalMinis
Reviews.Content: An ideal location situated on the Rocks with easy access to the Opera House and Harbour Bridge. In part the staff were excellent although Housekeeping was well below par and not what you would expect from a top starred hotel. The concierge was amongst the best we have come across. They were helpful and professional with great suggestions. We had booked an Opera House view room and asked for a high floor. At check in the reservation showed we had the 14th floor but this was then changed to the 8th and the room crossed out in front of us. The explanation given was this was that this was a provisional allocation and was always changed during the course of the day. We were not convinced but if this is the case their methodology needs to change. Other little matters of inefficiency were an absence of any staff in the spa and fitness centre and phones not being answered for housekeeping and the wake up call service. The view from the top floor bar is stunning but the service there was not brilliant either. A positive is the free wifi but it is questionable as to whether this compensates for some poor service. The Four Seasons is slightly better located and could be an alternative for next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great but noisy room with no sleep and slow service”
Reviews.Author: Msmithy
Reviews.Content: * Arrived to the room early which was great but wanted a Sydney Harbour view. Immediately rang reception who couldn't take the call and said would ring back. Never did so visited myself and changed the rooms at a premium cost. Had I ticked the right box online it would have only cost an extra $20 a night but blew out to $65. That's what I get for not being careful. *Free shoe shine which is nice. Rang up and was told they would come to get my shoes. 2 hours later they arrived quite late in the night. * Shoes didn't arrive next morning as promised at 8am and at 2pm still weren't there. I rang to find they didn't know which room the shoes came from and couldn't find them. They rang back and said they had found them and would send them up. 30 minutes later they arrived. Lucky I didn't need them that day anymore. Still had to wait around for a simple shoe shine. *Couldn't sleep. The lifts seems to echo into the room through walls and roof. Yes I tried putting a towel at the door and the noise seem to make it through other ways. Perhaps through the air conditioning. Very loud. Even guests visiting the room noticed the noise during the day. Even an airport hotel wouldn't have the nosies we had from the lifts. A lot like a plane taking off overhead and the roof off. Didn't sleep much and won't be staying here again which is a shame as the rooms are very nice and clean. But lack of sleep can kill a trip.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic firework view but the worst Shangri la we've been to. Try the 4 seasons instead.”
Reviews.Author: ScottAbroad_11
Reviews.Content: Lowlights: - Our room was ready when we arrived at 10:30, but the rollaway bed only arrived after 4pm and the cot only arrived after after 12 hours with an hourly check from me. Mid afternoon I inferred to buy one so my son would have somewhere to sleep, but was told it would be fixed in 45min, (the usual response). In the end he had to go to sleep on the floor in a $900 pet night room. - Room was dirty. - The Horizon club party finishes straight after the fireworks. In Scotland midnight is only just the beginning, also not what was expected for the price. - Pool is not worth using, tiny and too cold for kids, with over zealous a/c even I was cold quick when changing. - A/C in Horizon club was set to freeze, meaning a lot of people were cold. Staff would adjust it on request but that only lasted an hour. Highlights: - Horizon club has an amazing view (almost worth the $900 per night.) - Horizon staff attentive and friendly. Good wine and canapÃ©s were ok for 1 night but not to the same Standard as other Shangri La hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Shangri la definitely was Utopia”
Reviews.Author: R M
Reviews.Content: Wow, this was a great hotel. We booked a Darling Harbour room at a very reasonable rate for being in such a prime location and were very pleased to find that they put us in a room with a phenomenal view of the Opera House. The room smelled brand new, furniture was very nice and comfortable and the room size/floor plan was also excellent. They really thought of everything...in-wall electrical converters, great toiletries, lots of fluffy towels, and lots of little things that make life really easy. Pros: VERY comfortable bed, room decor, view, bathroom decor, housekeeping, restaurants and bars were excellent as was the service. Definitely visit Blu Bar on the top floor. Drinks are expensive but the views are worth it. Great location, but yes, as others have said, it's on a steep hill, but we needed to burn the extra calories! Cons: crowded pool, lots of noisy kids. And yeah, the elevators were a bit slow but didn't bother us much. We found the staff (housekeeping, reception, food service) to be very friendly and accommodating.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but too busy”
Reviews.Author: nimanoo
Reviews.Content: The room was really great. Staff were average except waiters for the buffet restaurant who did really well. This place is so busy with all functions happening inside that you thing you are in a shopping center. The wait for Breakfast and elevator was crazy during the weekend. People every where attending tea parties or wedding or coming for the restaurant or bar.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic but a bit of a walk to Circular Quay”
Reviews.Author: gan_zDublin_Ireland
Reviews.Content: Beautiful room with stunning view of the Opera House and Harbour Bridge. Breakfast was brilliant with a huge choice and extremely friendly and helpful staff. A large hotel but with a small-hotel charm because of the personal attention of the staff. We stepped out of the lift on the wrong floor where the business/executive lounge was located and children are not allowed. A member of staff invited us in, gave us drinks and offered to take photos of the family with the view as a backdrop. The only downside was the 15-20 minute walk to Circular Quay but I guess you can't have everything.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely disappointing hotel”
Reviews.Author: Colin604
Reviews.Content: Great view but not worth the frustration. Air conditioning hardly worked. Terrible, limited service. Unfortunately - it's a money grab. Management have no clue on how to run a so called "luxury" hotel.

Reviews.Title: “New Years Eve”
Reviews.Author: Twicks1
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in many Shangri-la Hotel's around the world and this is the most disappointing. We arrived about 10.30 in the morning after a night flight, having booked two Grand Harbour view rooms in the Horizon club for 4 nights over the New Year, we were informed that the rooms would be ready about 6pm that evening as we were being awkward because we wanted both rooms on the same floor "why does everyone want to be on the same floor?" was the response, possibly because at that time of the year most are travelling with their children, like us. It did not get any better over the days, we only had certain tables we could sit at in The Horizon Club as you are not allowed to make a two chair table into a three chair, to enter to bar even as a resident and even though it was not full you had to queue, and it closed at 11.30pm, if you wanted another drink you had to go to your room! We paid for the New Years eve dinner, one course took 90 minutes to arrive, the band stopped playing before Midnight, I could go on. If you want to go for next New Year I would not book the expensive dinner. Sydney is a great city but the staff at this hotel should not be too sure that people will always want to stay there. Worst Hotel I have ever stayed for the amount of money.

Reviews.Title: “This is my favourite hotel in Australia”
Reviews.Author: ClaireCtheworld
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in this hotel many times now and I am always impressed with the consistent high quality in customer service and room standard. I look forward to going there each time I go to Sydney. It has now become my hotel of choice in Sydney, and in fact, Australia. We are welcomed by the staff, and they have assisted in helping me make reservations at other Shangri-la Hotels too. I particularly enjoy the Horizon Lounge for its amazing view of Sydney Harbour, the bridge and the Opera House. The Blu Bar on Level 36 also has fantastic views. We enjoyed eating at Altitude Restaurant - they have a set menus on weekends and full al la carte the rest of the nights. Also, they listen to your feedback and are very good at communicating before and after your stay. I definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “It was alright...”
Reviews.Author: Elpam
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for 2 nights in the Deluxe Opera House City View Room (King) over the Xmas/NY break and we found it to be alright. We thought we'd get a decent view of the Opera House and the city but it was a bit disappointing, actually (for the amount of money paid). It was just 'alright'.. The swimming pool was also alright. It was small and the furniture a bit old and dirty. But the spa (next to the pool) was nice. The only thing good about this was doing the package BonusChoice, with a choice of overnight parking, credit towards a dinner or a spa treatment at the hotel's spa Chi, plus late check out at 4pm. The late check-out is awesome if you plan to use the swimming pool that day, sleep in or go out to the Rocks or Darling Harbour for breakfast before checking out. We picked the overnight parking which was handy. The location is good. We had dinner at the Opera House one night and we could comfortably walk back to the hotel from there at night time (even in my 3.5 inches heels! haha). The Four Seasons is closer though and we might stay there next time...just quietly.. haha..

Reviews.Title: “There is such a thing as Santa..”
Reviews.Author: travelliingaussie
Reviews.Content: After an excellent weekend at the Sydney Shangri La a few months ago with a friend, I was really looking forward to the 3 night stay I had booked with my partner over Christmas. I had booked an Executive Suite, and was exciting about staying in this room, with the great views and separate lounge and bed room. Upon check in, we were advised that because the hotel was so heavily booked, we were being upgraded - to the PRESIDENTIAL SUITE. The Presidential Suite takes up most of the harbour side of the 35th floor of the property. I could write pages about this enormous, luxurious suite, but let's just say, if this is the best hotel suite I ever get to stay in, I will die a very happy man. Once again the staff at the Shangri La were wonderful, and delivered more than I could ever expected in terms of customer service. A particular mention to Amy in the Horizon Club who's warm smile, generous hospitality and professional manner really helped make our stay even more special. The Sydney Shangri La is such an excellent property, it has really changed my perspective of Sydney and I look forward to many trips back there in 2012.

Reviews.Title: “Worst service in any hotel - ever!”
Reviews.Author: csap2999
Reviews.Content: This hotel is beautifully appointed, wonderfully situation and very poorly run. We stayed in a lovely suite overlooking the bridge and opera house and paid a very nice premium for our view. Our room is very, very expensive, especially over the Xmas/New Year period. The management of this hotel is ill equipped to run this hotell. On some days, our rooms were not made, hardly ever got a turn down service. Room service orders went unfulfilled or were very delayed, our car took forever to be brought up from the garage, our air conditioning wasn't working and it took them 2 days to get it fixed. Some (not all) of the concierge and guest services staff were rude and did not seem familiar with local areas and even hotel amenities. I would never stay here again and could not recommend it to anyone. If you have money to spend, you are better off spending it elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Good room and location.. Bad service!”
Reviews.Author: JinPatt
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 nights at Shangri-La Hotel Sydney in a Deluxe Harbour View room. The room was a good size with good quality fit-outs. The hotel is located in a good location, only a short walk to Sydney Opera House. However, we were not impress with the service considering the hotel is a five star. Staff were not friendly and not professional. Not a good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel of two half's - Good location, good service, good room”
Reviews.Author: grumpsandharry
Reviews.Content: The Shangri-La Sydney is in a good location for the CBD, Harbour and most things in Sydney. The Service is good, the parking is excellent and really competitive , the rooms are nice and all have reasonable views. If you want a great view pay for the high floors and if you want a relaxed breakfast DON'T go to the main restaurant, it's mayhem, we were shocked by the the poor quality of the food, service and the general mayhem, certainly not upto the 5 star rating.... on the plus side the manager did respond very well to our comments. Overall, a good place to stay for a few day's, eat out and if you can pay for a upper floor (above floor 30 has fab views and a very nice select breakfast venue with amazing views.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: MelMcV
Reviews.Content: We wanted to stay forever! This would have to be the best Hotel in Sydney - I have stayed at many! Beautiful views of the Harbour and the service was 5 star! We stayed in one of the suites and had a private check in/out and complimentary afternoon tea and evening drinks and canapes included. They managed to get in a quick dry clean of my husband suit for a function the next day - nothing was too much trouble. Would stay there agian for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Hope you like hills”
Reviews.Author: WaterArt
Reviews.Content: I know people who swear by this hotel for its 5 star luxury but I found it's slighly out of the way, have to walk up a steep hill on each return, location outweighed the water views.

Reviews.Title: “This is pure Five Star Luxury”
Reviews.Author: MarithaBrisbane
Reviews.Content: Be spoilt! Best views to Sydney harbour, Opera house, and the Heads. Fantastic location, awesome sky-bar,not to be missed. Wonderful spa and heated indoor pool. The rooms are spacious and luxurious, lifts ample and superfast to the 35th floor bar. service was great too

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel with the best view in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: bella_oes1
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed for our 10th wedding anniversary and had booked a Premier Grand View Room. The rates were very reasonable directly through the hotel, given the rooms have 270 degree views of the whole of Sydney Harbour and are 60m2 (very large by Sydney standards). We arrived at the hotel and the parking attendant was very friendly, reception where also very efficient and friendly (no big line ups which is one of my pet peeves). We were delighted to find we were upgraded to the next room level of Executive Grand Harbour Suite for our anniversary. It is so nice to get some level of recognition when you are staying for a special event. Unlike another Sydney hotel which actually provided below even a basic level of service on my recent birthday, the Shangri-la went out of their way to make us feel special which was really lovely. The room was absolutely amazing, with it's own foyer, 2nd toilet, huge entertaining/lounge area and cavernously big bedroom and bathroom with a huge soaking bath all of which had huge windows with sweeping views all around Sydney Harbour and the city. We were on the 9th floor and the views were amazing - you could gaze out over the Harbour bridge and Opera House from the lounge and watch the ferries coming and going and general activity below. The finishes in the hotel are top class. From the custom made carpet, to the room furnishings. It smelled lovely and fresh, like it had recently been refurbed. And we could have slept on the super comfy soft bed forever. The entertainment system was top class also with DVD players in both rooms and ipod player. The blinds were also remote controlled, so all little luxuries were thought of. We didn't get a chance to try the day spa but it looked really lovely with lots of treatments to try. The only thing that let the hotel down slightly was the in room service which was difficult to get through to (the morning we ordered brekkie at around 9.30am or so) after phoning 3 or 4 times we ended up ringing the concierge to help us with it. And it took 30+ minutes to turn up which seemed a bit excessive given it wasn't peak service time (I would think). Also we phoned to order an iron after the in room one went missing, and ended up phoning back 2 further times over the next 30 minutes as we were trying to make it out of the room in a reasonable time. It eventually turned up. The hotel is in a great position from which to explore Sydney on foot, if you are first time visitors. Circular Quay/The Rocks is only a 5 or 6 minute walk and Pitt Street Mall is only 10-12 minutes at most. Chinatown would be a further 5-6 minutes from there. The clientele in the hotel was a mix of business travelers and younger and older travelers-definitely up market. I would definitely recommend this hotel for any business travelers or holiday makers alike, and most definitely for anyone wanting to celebrate a special event (even if you live in Sydney - it is nice to appreciate the city's natural assets every now and then.

Reviews.Title: “Solid 5 star hotel - decor a little tacky - breakfast OK”
Reviews.Author: Indiana G
Reviews.Content: Loved staying here. The service was outstanding. The bed was large and comfortable. I did find the decor a little mass produced and tacky. For the price charged for these rooms I would expect something a little more special. I would book a room without breakfast if you can. It is pretty average - you can try the one at the Four Seasons down the road. We ate there one morning and it was GREAT!

Reviews.Title: “Elegant and Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: jset28
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel earlier in the year. I love this hotel! Very beautiful with nice spacious and comfortable rooms...and a great view! Just like the Four Seasons, this hotel is classic and beautiful, although possibly in need of a makeover soon. I wouldn't call it value for money as most Australian hotels seem too expensive for the value. However this definitely isn't my last time staying at the Shangri-La. Can't wait to go back :)

Reviews.Title: “Solid experience throughout”
Reviews.Author: zonteck
Reviews.Content: As everyone has mentioned, the location is quite amazing. Be sure to have dinner in the restaurant (altitude) for the full experience. The staff were lovely throughout. I'd suggest booking direct, so you can modify your booking as desired. The 'horizon club' is a worthwhile upgrade for the daily cooked breakfast & check in/ out upstairs.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a fabulous location”
Reviews.Author: tiredman_10
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel but what makes it extra special is the location. Sensational views of the harbour and bridge from the rooms and the top floor bar

Reviews.Title: “Top spot at top end of town.”
Reviews.Author: aruboy
Reviews.Content: My wife and I went to see Sade in Sydney on the 9th December and we stayed at the Shangri-La, Sydney. We had a very late check in just before mid night and were offered a late check out and up grade both welcome. Room a god size, bathroom spectacular with large bath. Welcome bowl of fruit Excellent blackout curtains and massive bed. All in all everything is done by this hotel to make the stay a pleasant memory. Our room had a view of the Sydney Harbour bridge. We did not eat at the hotel so I can not comment on the quality of the food. As you come to expect with a hotel of this standing the process from start to finish was flawless.

Reviews.Title: “Big but good”
Reviews.Author: YvesRince
Reviews.Content: Huge hotel, but very nice rooms, especially if you choose one with Harbour View on the Opera. Breakfast buffet was huge! The Bar has a great view over the city, from the restaurant on the 3?th floor you have a view on the Opera and Harbour Bridge. Magic. Friendly service. Valet Parking.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Hotel”
Reviews.Author: WStravel11
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel a number of times and on each occasion it has never failed to impress. The staff are efficient, pleasant and very helpful. The food is wonderful and should you have any requests, the staff are always willing to help or organise anything that you need. The rooms are massive, bright and very clean. Bathrooms are tastefully decorated and spacious. If you can afford it, book a room with a harbour/opera house view. It's fantastic and does add that extra special touch to your stay. After a hard day roaming about Sydney, its wonderful just to relax and look at all the wonderful things are are going on around the harbour. At night, the huge window to your room truly highlights the spectacular sites of this glorious city. The bar in the lobby is an excellent arena for that business meeting. There are many restaurants and pubs close by and being in the heart of The Rocks area in Sydney provides that extra little sense of adventure. The entrance to the hotel is hidden away which does remove a little from the glory of its magic, but the views and service certainly make up for it. A 5 star hotel in every sense.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great breakfast and wonderful staff, very professional.”
Reviews.Author: SuhaRio
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the horizon club floor which was so nice and the view of the opera house and the harbour bridge was spectacular The check in was so easy and the staff were so friendly & helpful. I was telling them about two restaurants that i wasn't able to confirm my reservation so they made the phone calls and they organize it for us. The bedroom was very clean. The bed was comfortable. We had a nice view over the opera house. The breakfast was so good and full of healthy options. The staff there had their nice touch on everything which made our stay so pleasant. The concierge was excellent he pointed out on the map all the attractions in the city. Also he helped booking for a show in the Royal Theatre. Definitely will go back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty tasty!”
Reviews.Author: TommoandRossy
Reviews.Content: Decided to treat the missus and I to a night here, it was our last night in Australia after a 10 day holiday and I'm so glad we cose to get decadent here. The rooms are absolutely massive, almost certainly the biggest standard room I've ever stayed in, also the bathroom and everything was beatifully, and tastefully decorated. I thought it was one of those places you couldn't go wrong with, and I was right - if anything it was better than my (always hopeful) expectation. Location is excellent, right between the Rocks and Darling Harbor which I found was the best part of Sydney. My only gripe was with getting around - Sydney's public transport is rubbish and overpriced, but I suppose there is nothing the Shangr-La can do about that. Lastly, the beds have to be slept in to be believed, absolutely tremendous. Go try!

Reviews.Title: “Everything about this hotel makes you feel like a VIP!”
Reviews.Author: Yecart2811
Reviews.Content: Treat yourself and stay here! It's absolutely a memorable moment! We only had one night here but I will be back for a longer stay! From the minute you arrive to the minute you leave, you're welcomed and treated with the utmost respect. Even the way they ask for the next person in line at checkout is so warm! Rooms are exquisite. You don't want for anything. The beds are simply heavenly! View is stunning and bench seats near windows are totally inviting! Everything is within walking distance here too.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel of choice.”
Reviews.Author: jayne2164
Reviews.Content: Frequent visitor to Sydney on business but never stayed at Shangri La before - big mistake. This will be my hotel of choice from now on. Huge Room opera house view, good location for visitors and close to CBD for business travellers. Ticks all the boxes in a city where hotels promise lots but don't always deliver. Slight irritation, requested 1.30 check out but front desk would not budge from 1pm. As I paid for a room the night before I arrived to ensure a room available at 8am would have thought they could go an extra 30 mins!

Reviews.Title: “Not Quite 5 Star”
Reviews.Author: seminole364
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel. The rooms are great- I had a corner room on the 9th floor with a great view of the bridge and the opera house. The room was well furnished and the bathroom was great. My only minor issue was that the minibar fridge didn't work although I didn't complain about this. The hotel falls down slightly on its service. For a hotel to be 5 star I believe that the service needs to be consistently excelent. Most of the time it was fine particularly in the Altitude restaurant and when dealing with the staff on the door. It fell down a bit for me on two occasions. Firstly, I wasn't shown to my room. Maybe it's common practice in Australia but I haven't experienced before. Secondly and more importantly it took over an hour for my bags to reach my room. The hotel didn't seem particularly busy at the time and I had to chase the porter team. My other concern was the price of incidentals. Possibly this is due to the strength of the Australian dollar but the room service menu and mini bar was vastly over-priced compared to anything I've seen elsewhere. Others have said that the Shangri La is a money making machine. I expect that to the case with any hotel but it's particularly true of this hotel. I would probably stay there again but I think I would look at other options first. I suspect that they will have to raise their game when the Park Hyatt reopens.

Reviews.Title: “Horizon Club worth the extra”
Reviews.Author: CoastersOnHols
Reviews.Content: The Shangri-La is an excellent well positioned hotel, only a few minutes stroll to the restaurants at the Rocks and the ferries and train at Circular Quay. We recently stayed for 5 nights in a Horizon Club, Opera House City View room on the 31st floor. The room was on the side of the hotel with good views of the Opera House and towards the botanical gardens. Our room was spacious, spotlessly clean and had additional luxuries such as bathrobes, fresh fruit and free bottled water replaced daily. The Horizon Club gives you a separate check in desk on the 30th floor and all day access to the club lounge which includes breakfast, afternoon tea and 2 hrs of drinks and canapÃ©s in the evening. You can help yourself to drinks in the evening, but we found there was usually no need to get up from our table as the staff ensured that our glasses were always topped up. Plus you get the fantastic views of the bridge and Opera House. It was certainly worth paying the extra for the additional benefits the Horizon Club provided. We dined once and had a very good meal in the Cafe Mix restaurant on the 1st floor. The prices were typical of a decent restaurant, so although it was not cheap it was certainly less expensive than some of the establishments surrounding Circular Quay. We also made use of the very good indoor pool which had lovely warm water and also the spa, gym and outdoor sundeck off the pool. As for the often mentioned hill up to the hotel, yes it is steep but itâ€™s also short. I could see it being a bit of a pain or problem for anyone who has difficulty walking up stairs or hills or for parents with pushchairs, but otherwise it shouldnâ€™t be too much of an issue.

Reviews.Title: “not in-line with other Shangri-La's”
Reviews.Author: hemi
Reviews.Content: Shangri-La's around the world has some things in common. The special scents they use in the lobby all over Asia and Canada and the Horrizon club has always some Asia fusion items. In Sydney neither were present. The restaurant on the top floor was great, pricy but worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful view, great location, don't upgrade to executive”
Reviews.Author: Will S
Reviews.Content: Attended at the Shangri-la Hotel in Sydney after having stayed at other Shangri-la hotels at other locations. You can't beat the view at this hotel of the beautiful Sydney Harbor and its location in the 'Rocks' with all the little shops, great restaurants and proximity to the ferries. The hotel is very highly priced and as result you would expect great service and accommodations. We opted to stay at the executive level and found that the executive level service was not worth the extra price. The service was not up to standard as their other locations. Executive level business lounge turned into a smorgasbord for small children with little supervision and control by on site staff. We have no problem with children but when you pay extra to stay at an executive level you would expect a business atmosphere. We advised the service manager and they offered a couple of free drinks to make us feel better which we declined. I would not pay the extra cost to upgrade at this hotel ever again and would recommend other less expensive hotels who strive to serve the executive business traveler and work to retain their business.

Reviews.Title: “The Real Deal Says - Even I Make A Mistake”
Reviews.Author: jimnick
Reviews.Content: That was the hardest statement to write. My earlier review trashed the Shangri-La for my experience. The hotel wrote me and said it was a lot of bad incidents and would I give them another chance. I was going back to Sydney to give a speech and said yes. I am sure that they knew that I was someone who they wanted to do good by. So they upgraded me to the Executive Floor which was nice. From there it went from nice to amazing. I would upgrade to this floor to live if I could. They start off by making this the center of your interaction with the hotel. If you need to check in, check out, boarding passes, order a car, concierge, directions anything they are extremely helpful and knowledgeable. In addition they seem to care. Every morning I came in they brought over a cup of coffee. Now this may seem so what but I drink just coffee and they had an epresso machine that could launch a missile if you wanted. Yet they knew I just wanted brewed coffee, not an americano just coffee. From there it was the same every time I was there. The food is excellent day and evening and the floor is just a great place to get work done quietly. The rooms are definitely better than what I experienced on the regular floors. The quality of the furnishings and the room size was just excellent on an international level. I assume the other rooms are also on an upgrade list but these were delightful. As I mentioned I rarely ever say I made a mistake but in this case this experience was so superior to the last it is like I was in two different hotels. Go for the service and the wonderful people and stay for the quality.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing and poor value for money”
Reviews.Author: HarryIzzy
Reviews.Content: On our last Sydney visit we stayed at the Intercontinental which was very good. Previous Shangri La experiences in Singapore and Penang had been satisfactory so we opted for a change this time on a visit with one of our adult sons. We spent three nights in the Sydney Shangri La in two rooms at a total cost of well over $3000.00. The rooms were very well appointed but that's where it ends. The hotel is devoid of any character and the whole ethos of the place seems based on ensuring that they get their money rather than look after their guests. Two examples; On arrival we found ourselves in a room on the 5th floor looking towards the harbour with a nasty view of the back of an industrial building rather than of the Opera House and the Harbour Bridge we had booked and were expecting although both were distantly visible. I raised the issue politely and was told that there was a better room on a higher floor but that I would have to pay extra which I agreed to do rather than get involved in a potentially adversarial discussion. I had the impression that my problem was one they experienced frequently as the patter seemed rather too well rehearsed. At breakfast the next day there was a problem as one of the rooms was aparently showing as breakfast included in the rate and the other was not. Instead of accepting that a simple administrative error had occurred which could be easily rectified later the lady in charge made a big issue of it which resulted in a long and totally unnecessary discussion albeit reasonably polite and civilised. We did not eat in the hotel again. Our strong impression was that the Shangri La in Sydney was simply a money making machine with no interest in the customers well being or satisfaction. It was very busy so perhaps they simply do not have to try very hard. Expensive nice rooms. Nothing else. Do not assume a great view as per the website impressions. We stayed at seven hotels on our three week trip from the UK in Canada, New Zealand, Sydney and Tasmania. This I am happy to say was our only disappointment. Air New Zealand business was fantastic by the way.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best”
Reviews.Author: Hotelcritic2129
Reviews.Content: Had great service, nice hospitable staff and clean comfortable room. What more can you ask? Would definately stay again. Although room service charges are very high.

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT STAY IN A GREAT HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: daddymike
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights for the price of 2 room & breakfast. From the moment we arrived it seemed pure luxury. We were in a King city view room which had limited views of the harbour and opera house, and had only just finished being refurbished with new decor and carpets. The bathroom was large and had good fittings and good toiletries. Breakfast provided everything you could want to eat hot or cold. The service was professional, courteous, and very polite by all the staff. Views from the cocktail bar on the 36th floor were amazing after dark. Wish we could have stayed longer.

Reviews.Title: “Very average and only 5 star because of views.”
Reviews.Author: ATLTravelsALot
Reviews.Content: Yes, the views are incredible from certain rooms - including my Premier room. However, the hotel itself is your typical, huge, behemoth of a structure that is cold, and void of any special character within the walls of the structure. Think Marriott Marquis in the heart of Times Square in NYC and you will get the picture. I'm probably not the one to provide a very fair comparison of what is nice and what is not because of my extensive travel all over the globe - I'm hard to please now because I've seen the best and worst - and to me I see a lot of very average when traveling - and the Shangri-La is very average to a non-tourist type travelor like myself. I can see where some who are tourists and travel a few times a year may like this atmosphere. Australia is a long distance for most so this would be a once in a lifetime adventure for many, I'm sure. Therefore, I suspect this is the reason for several very positive reviews. The hotel has all the basic services and it would be highly unlikely that a hotel of this size and turnover (most guests probably rarely return here - more like a once in a lifetime trip type place) will be able to provide true 5+-star services, accomodations, and amenities that a Mandarin Oriental type property provides. I have also stayed at the Four Seasons Sydney next door to Shangri-La, and while general service there is better, the massive tourist hotels in "The Rocks" area of Sydney at least in the same size category are all basically generic, large, high turnover offerings - not overly bad but certainly nothing extraordinary about them. Service at the Shangri-La is very spotty. Restaurants close early and are generally packed and terribly expensive. I spend a lot of money in hotels and don't mind spending money on room service and eating in the hotel restaurants, but this is one property that I have no problem with walking out for a nice meal given the outrageous (i.e. tourist rip-off) pricing! I went down to try the breakfast "buffet" and was "processed" like a herd of cattle into the restuarant - Vegas style type setup and offered the AUD $42 buffet. I politely declined and went down the street and had a nice Starbucks. I then walked around and realized there are tons of good, reasonably priced places to eat that the locals/office buildings take advantage of - only vulnerable tourists who are hungry and without many options being unfamiliar with the area would suffer through these mass production ordeals for eating in the hotel. The comments about the strenuous "walk up the hill" to reach the hotel should be heeded by people with any sort of disability or who don't want the trek - every time you go anywhere, you must encounter this steep hill. The other hotels of similar size and quality are actually "down the hill" so they are much more convenient from a pure assessibility perspective.
