On a positive note, aside from the room being overly cold (it was very damp/chilly/cold in Sydney so I'm not sure if they hotel even had the heat on), the bed was comfortable. Room furnishings were adequate and typical of large properties. The bathroom was o.k. - but the shower was one of those prefab type things that was not large enough to really utilize - whereas the separate bath was something I didn't even use. I'm sure this is personal preference though. Don't think of asking for anything out of the ordinary to disrupt staff routine. It's not their fault though because of the sheer number of people coming/going from this property. For example, when I called down because the room was too cold and the heat was not working, no one had come to check on it for ever 2 hours, so I called back down again - finally 3.5 hours after the first call someone came up from engineering and basically said the system was working normally despite the room being cold and no air coming out of the vents. I think the entire hotel is on some main system that does not allow some rooms to have heat while the others have A/C, perhaps. So yes, the views are incredible - but they are also incredible when you walk outside for free and see the Opera House and Harbour Bridge! Despite it being nice, this place is very, very average to me and in some respects bad due to the ripoff pricing and inability of the hotel to provide any level of personal service due to its sheer size. Nothing horrendous to report, but nothing extraordinary either - well, except the views which do make up for some of the negatives. Enjoy if you must, but don't hesitate to book at other similar properties in the immediate vicinity - for me, the next trip it will bascially come down to where I can get the best price and amenities at whatever 5-star property in this area is available.

Reviews.Title: “The Most Amazing View”
Reviews.Author: CalverleyRhino
Reviews.Content: What a fantastic hotel, top quality. We booked a room with a harbour view and wow, awesome ! The most amazing view of the harbour, opera house and the harbour bridge from our 30th floor room. This was a wonderful hotel to spend our Wedding Anniversary. We advised the hotel of this at the time of booking and waiting for us in the room was a bottle of sparkling wine and a box of chocolates. A really nice touch and a great way to enjoy the view and our first night in Sydney. The room was clean, spacious and the king sized bed was extremely comfy. This is a very well located hotel just a short walk to the harbour and Circular Quay. The hotel staff were very helpful and generally the overall service was excellent. A fantastic stay with an amazing view.

Reviews.Title: “ONE OF THE BEST”
Reviews.Author: RockyBubbles
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Shangri La Sydney for two nights recently and all I can say is "Excellent!" We stayed on the Horizon Club floor on the 30th floor what a great view from the Club Lounge. The staff in the Horizon Club were great, could not do enough for us. I will definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “The best rooms are splendid”
Reviews.Author: p9c
Reviews.Content: I've stayed a number of times at this hotel. Even the most basic rooms are good, and the better rooms are excellent, with wonderful views of Sydney's magnificant harbour and bridge. The staff a friendly and helpful. The location is great for the harbour end of Sydney city.

Reviews.Title: “Location is the best thing....”
Reviews.Author: PJchip
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel 3 different times over the last 4 years. The first time it was magical, the view of the Bridge and the Opera House, along with the Harbour, who could complain, even with just average service (just not attentive to detail). The 2nd time (2009) we woke up to the RED DUST storm over Sydney. Clearly the locals were not thrown and it was amazing to see but we were tourists and needed guidance and not much was given. We dealt with it. Last visit was 2011 and it seemed that all that average customer service has become the norm there, as fancy as it is, great location, (The Rocks!), when asked about dinner reservations and specifically wanting a place that the locals liked and not the list in the book, we seemed to be a bother. Our a/c went out and it took days for it to be repaired based on they didn't believe us when we said we heard the motor stop. When we asked to be moved since without the a/c the room was miserable, they said no and we spent two days of our stay just sweating it out. The day the a/c got fixed the repairman left the room door open as he went back and forth with his tools. Frustrating for us because anyone could have walked in to our room. We did complain but the reponse was pretty generic for a really un generic situation. Lastly, the elevators need upgrading desperately. You would wait for way too long for one to come and when it did the 15 people inside who also waited a long time to get one were not pleased. Made for really unpleasant rides. All were business trips of course and The Shangri-LA was not my choice, I would really read reviews before going back to see if there was any improvement before deciding to stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Not good”
Reviews.Author: Karis L
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights in early November as a family of four with two young children. We arrived later in the evening around 9pm after a 10+ hour flight. There was one woman at the check in desk and the concierge attendant. Without knowing that he was the concierge we approached the man to check in. He apathetically motioned to the check in woman who was helping another couple and then proceeded to stand there looking at his cufflinks. No greeting, nothing, just stood there like a muppet. We had two tired children and so we just stood there for ten minutes while she worked and he did, well, basically nothing. Not a great start. Asked for a higher floor room as we booked a harbour view, not granted. Requested a rollaway bed and then reconfirmed that request verbally before arrival. Upon entering our room, guess what? no bed. Called housekeeping, told it was 'on the way.' You would think that since they had a solid 6+ hours to get the room ready they could get the room ready, think again. Next, we called room service to order dinner. NO ANSWER. Tried again, NO ANSWER. Tried again and again and no one picked up. We let it ring about twenty times each call. (I have Never had this experience before in a hotel). Called downstairs to the "concierge" and guess what, NO ANSWER. hmm. Not sure what the point of the concierge is at this hotel. The bellman eventually brought up our luggage and we told him we wanted to order dinner but there was no answer. So he tried too, no answer. So then he dialed some other back number extension and finally got someone to take our order. Not a good start. Dinner came late and was wrong. We ordered an entree and a grilled cheese. The 'grilled cheese' came as two pieces of untoasted white bread with a slice of cheese. We managed to reach room service and had them try again. A mere half hour later we got a grilled cheese sandwhich... Sleep quality: Not good. Beds are comfy but the rooms, are NOISY. Not from adjacent guests, not from bridge or street traffic, but because there is a large modern elevator bank which is audible (swoosh, swoosh) all day, all night. We are not light sleepers but we could very plainly make this out whenever we were in the room, it is not soothing and sadly there is nothing the hotel can do to rectify this so far as we can tell. (earplugs) Location: Looks great and central on the map. The reality is that this hotel is up a huge 45 degree inclined hill. Maybe no big deal if you cab it everywhere and back, but a terrible place if you decide to go for a pedestrian stroll for dinner, sightseeing etc. There are tons of other well situated hotels in the area, you don't need to stay here. Lobby is attractive, clean and modern, at night with a boozy 20-30 something apres work crowd which did not bother us. There is however plenty of smoking right outside the bar-- which is conveniently located by the entrance to the hotel, which did bother us. The pool is humid with a dirty bathroom/spa nearby which actually had used towels strewn about on the floor as no one had cleaned up. Coulda, woulda, shoulda been a much better hotel. That is definitely not the case. Management needs to take a hospitality and management crash course.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and accessable”
Reviews.Author: elroy74
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Shangri-La for a business trip taken in early November 2011. Had a wonderful trip and very much enjoyed my stay in the hotel. It is located in a section of Sydney called "The Rocks". Very close to the Sydney Bridge and the Opera house. There are a lot of resturants and interesting sites, while being close to the business center of town, I was able to walk to the office every day. The rooms were very nice. I had a view of the bay and opera house from the 27th floor. The bed was very comfortable, the bathroom was clean, and the hotel itself was very well maintained. Only ate one meal there, a breakfast, but it was rather enjoyable. I would very much reccomend this hotel for business or travel. One warning, it is on a hill. I like to walk, so there was a little climbing, but well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel - great views & location”
Reviews.Author: hongkongeagle
Reviews.Content: Superbly located, clean, great service! We're on honeymoon so we upgraded to rooms on the top levels (30-35th floor, horizon rooms). It included access to the horizon clubhouse which provides complimentary afternoon tea and pre dinner drinks & appetizers and a separate breakfast area. A fantastic complimentary service. and it's all done in a room with one of the best views in all of Sydney. Our rooms is massive in size, with great views. Breakfast (the main hall) is too small to cater for the size of this hotel during peak breakfast time. Food queues are long, tables are very closely packed. OVERALL a great hotel if within your budget!

Reviews.Title: “Best Breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: travelholicaussie
Reviews.Content: Wonderful staff, great location. Perfect if you are doing the bridge climb as its very close. The breakfast buffet is absolutely delicious!

Reviews.Title: “Renee Coppin Hair Salon”
Reviews.Author: Jill F
Reviews.Content: I had highlights put in my hair at the Renee Coppin Hair Salon, on level 2 of the Sydney Shangri la hotel. The staff were all friendly, professional, and lots of fun! From the moment I entered the staff were all courteous and made me feel very welcome. I felt totally relaxed and pampered, which is always nice after a long day at work. Best of all, I ended up with amazing hair! The color was spot on, exactly the beachy highlights I was hoping for. I got home and my husband's jaw dropped and he said "wow, you look great' and at work the next day all the girls were raving about how fantastic it looked. I have had my hair done many times and I must say this is one of the best jobs I've ever had done. All in all it was a wonderful experience and I look forward to coming back again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Simon W
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel as we were in town to see Janet Jackson. Great location if you are going on a Bridge Climb as it is just down the road. Room had a great view of the Harbour. Make sure you book a table at the Altitude restaurant as it has the best view of Sydney Harbour, the bridge and Opera House. Had the best meal of my life there even if it was a bit expensive. Would recommend this hotel to anyone. Only downside is - if you walk a lot, it is at the top of a lot of hills in the rocks. Bonus is you walk across the bridge easily or do a bridge climb

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay!”
Reviews.Author: Calle77
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 7 nights and enjoyed every minute of it! Our room (On the 25th floor) was very nice and spacious and the view over the harbor and the Opera House was amazing. Plenty of space to put luggage and clothes. The room was clean and the bed was comfortable. Be sure to book your stay with breakfast included â€“ the breakfast buffet is amazing! WIFI is free â€“ a very nice feature! All staff we came into contact with, were smiling and accommodating. We tried the Blue Bar on 36 and the Altitude Restaurant (Both on the top floor). Both places have views out of this world and the food at Altitude was very nice. A lot of previous reviews mention the fact that the hotel is located on top of a very steep hill. ItÂ´s true that coming up from George Street, is a pretty steep climb, but we really didnÂ´t see this as a problem. If youÂ´re doing a Bridge Climb, taking the ferry boats (From Circular Quay), going to the Opera House and so on, the location is perfect. ThereÂ´s also several good restaurants in the area (And Surry Hills and other areas with even more good eateries, are just a short cab ride away). Will definitely recommend this hotel â€“ and would go back in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, top class hotel”
Reviews.Author: MaggieSomerset
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights. Good check in, staff efficient and welcoming. Requested room with view of harbour and that is exactly what we got. Brilliant. Spacious with very large (King) comfortable bed. Bathroom luxurious with plenty of soft fluffy white towels. Not cheap but well worth it. Easy to get to harbour and rest of city. Breakfast exellent. Staff friendly giving very good service. No noise in room. Good toiletries.

Reviews.Title: “Great business hotel, excellent location for a seminar”
Reviews.Author: michaelmckerlie
Reviews.Content: I attended a one day workshop in the meeting rooms and thought that the overall experience was excellent. Food and Beverage - tasty, fresh and very good Location - perfect, very easy to get to and gave me access to the rest of the city. Value - i did not pay for anything so I thought it was awesome value Facilities - high quality and well maintained Best - location and service and food and everything Worst - all good Go Again - Yup

Reviews.Title: “if you can, you should”
Reviews.Author: GoldCoastSaint
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sydney Shangri-La hotel in late October 2011. Fortunate to get an upgrade to a King room. The view great! The service great. The room greater ! Not a cheapie but worth the money !

Reviews.Title: “Great views, top service and wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: LizandTerry
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Shangri-la in Sydney now on 4 occasions for both work and pleasure and have been treated to great service, panoramic views of magnificent Sydney Harbour and a great location for walking Sydney which is a treat in itself. The hotel is located in the Rocks area so a short walk to the Sydney Botanical Gardens which skirt the harbor and the buzz of Circular Quay. The hotel offers classic Asian hospitality in the heart of Sydney... A real treat! LizandTerry Perth

Reviews.Title: “Amazing - one of the best”
Reviews.Author: Syddneeite
Reviews.Content: This hotel was absolutely amazing and did not disappoint in any way. The decor of the hotel is very high quality and well appointed. Although the lobby and entrance may not be as breathtaking as other hotels - this is made up for my the location and views from the rooms/restaurant. It is in a very great location and the views are breathtaking. Dinner at Altitude was great - very high quality food and not too expensive. Breakfast is also a treat - very good selection of everything from 15 juices, on the spot cooked pancakes and eggs any way you want. Also the usual pastries, cereals.. etc that you would expect. Not missing anything you could possibly want to breakfast - and from the attitude of the staff I'm sure if they didn't have something you felt like eating and you asked for it, you would find it on your table within a few minutes. The staff deserve a special mention. Every staff member is bright, friendly, professional and ready to serve you. Whether it is inquiring about your stay and your plans for the day (and making suggestions that will make it that bit more special); to the luggage already being in the room directly from the car boot without me even thinking about it. This is a top world class hotel. Not one thing can I suggest that they do better. For what it costs it is actually good value. Although it is at the expensive end of the accommodation scale - for the overall experience I have paid a lot more for a lot less before. It won't disappoint! Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jamie M
Reviews.Content: Hotel was gorgeous, we stayed in the Premier Grand Harbour View - beautiful views of the city!!! Room clean and spacious, and breakfast was great! We didn't have to wait long at all, considering it was busy!

Reviews.Title: “I could have eaten breakfast ALL day”
Reviews.Author: aleishamac
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Shangri-la for business in October and I wil admit if it was money being spent I wouldn't have been completely happy. The hotel has an excellent reputation. It's in an awesome location, central to the sights etc etc. When we checked in, we had a memorable conversation with the reception desk attendant who asked "If one member of your party was more important, or higher up than the other two?...because his room is considerably better than yours...' Good one. Embarrassing much? She was right of course. 'The important' member of our party had harbour views and we got to overlook the Harbour Bridge toll booth. Bonza. The room was comfortable. Bed nice, toiletries nice, complimentary chocolates etc. The second day I returned to my room at about 3pm and it hadn't been serviced. I made the bed...I wasn't that bothered...not great but not a deal breaker (they came by later, when I was at dinner). I used the Gym. It was pretty modern, lots of room...no windows, it felt a bit cavey but hey, you're there to run so who cares!? The breakfast is amazing. I could have stayed there all day. A LOT of options and lot's of nice little things. Service was also excellent. I was really looking forward to our stay at the Shangri-la...I think it would take a bit more convincing for me to return on my own coin though.

Reviews.Title: “5 stars all the way...”
Reviews.Author: taraandkate
Reviews.Content: From pulling up at valet parking to checking out in the morning, the Shangri-La gave 5 star service. The hair dryer keep over-heating and cutting out so we called housekeeping and within about 10 mins we had another delivered. The DVD player was also kept cutting out, but the engineer was in the room within 10 mins and had it fixed. Staff were very polite and friendly, particularly the staff at breakfast. The guy doing eggs to order was very polite (and made great poached eggs!). The pool is ample and the sun balcony, whilst noisy from the expressway below, was drenched in sun and had comfortable sun lounges. The room was large, bathroom was clean and the hotel provided little extras.. like hair ties as part of the amenities pack in the bathroom. The bath is big and deep and the bathroom is very stylish. The view was just amazing. My only compliant, I could hear the lifts go up and down all night.. it wasn't loud, but I am a light sleeper. I have been to Shangri-La before and I will go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant hotel in perfect spot.Great service.”
Reviews.Author: Pat16manchester
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in Oct 2011 and it was a fantastic experience. Nothing was too much trouble. Good support from all staff.I left my mobile phone charger in the room and only realised several days later when we were in Melbourne. I rang up, spoke to housekeeping and it was posted free of charge to our accomodation in Port Douglas.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely recommend it”
Reviews.Author: travel_bug7933
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Shangri-La for a weekend in September. The check-in process was smooth, however the staff member did not give me any information about the hotel such as where the hotel features (restaurants, pools, bars, etc) could be found, check out time, nearby attractions. A room wasn't available due to my early arrival so I was able to leave my luggage with the bell desk which was great, however, upon return, the bell desk could not find my luggage. The staff member thought it may have been already delivered to my room but when I went up, it was not there. It took them 30 minutes to locate it - not sure where it was but at least they found it in the end. The room is definitely delightful! I had a view of the Opera house which was stunning. The room is quite large and has a comfy couch and some window seats to appreciate the view. The bathroom was another highlight for me - it was huge, with a beautiful big bath, perfect shower, and huge vanity. There were also speakers in there so that if the TV is on, you can listen to it while in the bathroom. The only annoying thing about this feature is that you couldn't turn it off if you didn't want it on in the bathroom, you had to turn the TV off. Annoying if one person wants to watch tv while the other relaxes quietly in the bath. Check-out was also smooth. Service was very good. I did not eat at the restaurants or have room service as it was a bit too expensive for me. Would definitely recommend it for first time visitors to Sydney in order to appreciate the view, but if you've seen it all before, I'm sure there are other hotels more central to the CBD and Darling Harbour that don't have the plush views but still have the same high quality rooms.

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic hotel in a beautiful city”
Reviews.Author: BlueJayKent_England
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in September 2011. This is an excellent hotel- the staff were extremley friendly, including reception, the concierge and the restaurant staff. We were recommended of places to go, and how to get there when we checked in, they were very helpful. Our room was a deluxe opera house view room on the 19th floor, a fantastic view of circular quay and the opera house. The room had been newly renovated and looked stunning, there were lots of little touches like speakers in the bathroom and international plug sockets that made it special. In a great location, on the same road as the bridge climb office, beware there though you have to walk up a little steep hill to get there from George Street, the main street in Sydney. Breakfast buffet was amazing- the best we had in Australia. Only 2 bad things- there was a nail sticking out of our bathroom wall for some reason, which could have been dangerous if we hadn't have noticed. Also, we there was one small incident when we were queueing for breakfast, when we thought that preference was given to Chinese tourists. Other than that, it's an amazing hotel, better than Four seasons next door, as the reception staff are alot friendlier and warmer, the rooms are bigger, it's more catered to tourists (four seasons is more business catered we felt), and it's cheaper!!

Reviews.Title: “Horizan Club”
Reviews.Author: swoowar
Reviews.Content: We could not fault the hotel - we had a view of Darling harbour - but the best bit was being able to use the Horizan Club. We had managed to get a deal with Trail Finders for a room between the 30th and 35th floor. This meant we could use the Horizan Club on the 30th floor with fantastic views of both the bridge and the opera house. Every day they served afternoon tea and between 6:00 and 8:00pm were open for drinks and canapes. To watch the sun setting over the harbour with a glass of champagne or a gin and tonic and eating a very good selection of hot and cold canapes was a highlight of our trip to Sydney. The location is good as it is only a short walk to the Rocks and around Central Quey to the Opera house. Do take a taxi if you arrive by train from the airport as even though you can see the hotel it is a very steep walk.

Reviews.Title: “September in the Shangri-La Sydney”
Reviews.Author: stellastarstruck
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went on vacation to Sydney and stayed at the Shangri-La as part of our celebration for our 10th anniversary. We were on a package tour from Japan so weren't able to specify much about our room. We arrived early after an all night flight and our tour company told us we weren't able to check in until 3:00pm. My husband and I wandered the streets and harbour area of Sydney until we were basically asleep on our feet. I suggested going to the hotel and throwing ourselves on the mercy of the hotel to see if they'd let us into our room a little early. We arrived at the hotel and requested an early check-in. The clerk did some checking and probably some re-arranging and we were able to check in over an hour early. We weren't able to get a room with one bed, but we were happy to be allowed to check in early. (To be fair, our initial reservation wasn't for a one bed room.) Our room was very nice. The room was clean and comfortable. Our view was of the Sydney Opera House, and the surrounding area. It was great. The first evening we were at the hotel we went up to the bar on the 36th floor. We had a few problems reading the menu as it was so dark up there. I realise that everyone wants to see the view, but a little more light would be nice! Over the next few days a couple of problems developed with our room. My husband took a bath and when he let the water out, it came out a drain underneath the sink unit. The floor of the bathroom was flooding. It didn't cause our property any damage, but we couldn't let the water out without a flood. We notified the front desk and they promised to have maintenance look at it. A couple of days later, my husband took another bath and when he let the water out, the water came out of the drain underneath the sink again. It flooded again. The night before we checked out I noticed that the desk and the countertop on top of the fridge and room supplies was covered in dust. I was surprised. We had dinner at Cafe Mix on our last evening in Sydney and it was wonderful. It was a little pricey, but no worse than any of the other restaurants in Sydney we visited. The staff were pleasant and food was excellent. For me, I would stay at the Shangri-La again, if the opportunity arises.

Reviews.Title: “There's rooms, and then there's rooms ...”
Reviews.Author: Lisatait
Reviews.Content: We booked 2 nights in an Executive Harbour View Room. During our stay my husband was planning to spend a lot of time in the room, whilst I worked, so figured the upgrade was required. However, we got a room at the end of the corridor. We may have had the size, but the layout meant it was worthless!!!! Check what room you get allocated before you check in ... The location is perfect & I would give it another attempt next time.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: louisedunn
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a weekend recently. The location was fantastic, just a few minutes walk to circular Quay, not too far to everything else. The gym, pool etc was fantastic. It's worth paying a bit more to have access to the Horizon club, canapÃ©s and drinks every evening overlooking the opera house ! My only criticism was the staff were almost too attentive at breakfast ! They kept clearing our cups, plates when we hadn't finished !!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, Great Views”
Reviews.Author: busycitybreak
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in an excellent location on the Rocks with historic hotels and museums nearby. The views are amazing of the harbour and Opera House. Service is ok however the housekeeping is a little disappointing with the rooms not being cleaned too well. I also had issue with the spa and pool area not being clearned on a daily basis. Even when this was flagged to reception there was little improvement. The bar on the top floor offered great views and well worth a visit. On the whole I would question the 5 star rating for service but location wise it is well worth a visit. During our stay we visited the Australian Hotel just along the road where the pizzas are amazing. The hotel is a great central location to explore Sydney but be aware it is located on quite a steep hill.

Reviews.Title: “Great way to start off the honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: Travelbug36
Reviews.Content: Started my honeymoon off with a 5 day stay here and was not disappointed. The staff were all very helpful, our room was not ready after 24 hours of travelling but we could use the spa to have a shower and get cleaned up and reception said they would get our room ready as quickly as possible, which they did. We had a fantastic view of Darling harbour from our room, the room itself was extremely comfortable and we had a huge bathroom. The hotel has recently finished being refurbished so everything is very new, the room was very clean and modern. We had drinks every night either before going out or after getting back in the bar at the top of the hotel from where you get amazing views of the city, harbour bridge and the opera house. The manager of the bar made sure that we got a table in the lounge one evening so we could get the best views, this part of the bar is very much in demand and you are not guaranteed a table here but as it was our honeymoon they ensured we got a table. The hotel is ideally placed to explore the rocks area of sydney where there are lots of shops and restaraunts and it is not far to the opera house or bridge either. First class hotlel with first class service.

Reviews.Title: “A Good Overall Stay”
Reviews.Author: bestbet33
Reviews.Content: My flight from the states arrived early and we were at the hotel to check in by 8:30am. We had booked a room with two doubles on a club level with Oprah House view room through American Express Fine Hotels (a benefit for AmEx Platinum card holders). Upon checking in at their special desk for VIP check-in I was told that I was booked on a low-level room. Upon inquiry on why I was down-graded I was told that this was what was reserved by AmEx. Thankfully, upon showing my confirmation they were able to give me the room I booked. The agent even went up and showed us a couple of different options. The room we chose would be ready at 1pm. No problem there. The room had no-doubt the most spectacular view possible in Sydney. The room itself was nicely appointed with comfy beds and large bathroom. If I could, I would have stolen the shower head as it was one of the nicest I have ever experienced. I really enjoyed having free access to Wi-Fi and business center even though the Wi-Fi was very shotty and would often kick you off. The only real complaint I have is that a mini-bar attendant came by the room multiple times to do an inventory check. I felt as though it was my mom making sure I hadnâ€™t touched the alcohol cabinet. Why canâ€™t they just do this when the room is getting serviced? The club lounge had an average breakfast, but a really nice managerâ€™s reception in the evening. The staff was very friendly and happy to answer any questions you may have had. The package we had included a free breakfast in the main restaurant. The breakfast was excellent even though it was often hard to find someone to get coffee. We were glad the breakfast was included because it would of cost us $78 otherwise (making it the most expensive breakfast I have ever seen).The bar on the top floor in my opinion was way overrated. There was nothing special there other than the views and the expensive prices. The location, while very close to the Oprah House, Harbor Bridge, ferry station, The Rocks, and downtown, is up a very steep hill meaning that whenever you walk you should be prepared for a work-out. In conclusion, I would recommend this hotel to anyone! Just make sure you confirm your room-type if you booked though AmEx and put your door on DND unless you want to be bothered constantly by the mini-bar police.

Reviews.Title: “Great views & Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: sorchadeas
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as part of our honeymoon. They upgraded us upon check-in to a room with a opera & bridge view which was fantastic. The room was nice & luxuriously furnished. We also had champagne & chocolates upon arrival which was a nice touch. I also did a treatment in the spa & had afternoon tea which I would recommend. We also had dinner in the restaurant & got a table by the window- amazing views!! Also, had delicious cocktails in bar. It is expensive but worth it. Highly recommend a stay here.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: oggy55_11
Reviews.Content: just returned from Australia, Shangri- la was our first stop off stayed there for 5 nights.Beautiful hotel. Our room had stunning views of the opera house, veryl light and airy ,had all the mod cons,bed was large comfy. Central to everything . Only downside room sevice food was very expensive,but you are in the centre so lots of cheaper alternative places to eat. The blu bar on the top floor had spectacular views of sydney at night.we would recomend this hotel to all our friends excellent hotel

Reviews.Title: “Exclusive view, didn't want to leave the room!”
Reviews.Author: Leon_vermaak
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Room 2413 and enjoyed beautiful views of the opera house, bridge and working harbour from the luxury of our very well appointed room! The hotel is centrally situated and we walked all over central town and the harbour district. One for the memory bank!

Reviews.Title: “Not cheap but really great”
Reviews.Author: tulipberlin
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for a week for business. This is pure luxury. Everything is just a bit better than in usual business hotels. Of course this comes at a price but if you want to have a great stay, I would certainly recommend this place. Superb location, just minutes away from the opera house, the rocks etc. Free wifi in the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: bubblykiwi
Reviews.Content: My partner and I decided to treat ourselves to a couple of nights at the Shangri-La Sydney and it was worth every cent! We decided on a Horizon Club Suite. We didn't have the opera or harbour bridge views as we were on the wrong side of the building but the room was still amazing! The room was tidy and spacious. The bed was very comfortable and the addition of complimentary fruit and mineral water were a nice addition to the room. All staff we came across were very courteous and friendly. Because of the room we chose we had private check in and out on a different floor which was processed quickly and easily. It is situated up a hill but wasnt an issue for us. Blu Bar is amazing! Great drinks. Great view! Breakfast in the Horizon Club lounge was lovely as was the complimentary canapes and drinks each night between 6-8pm. All round great experience!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay at a lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: archangel19
Reviews.Content: My partner and I decided to celebrate our 2nd anniversary in style, so chose the Shangri La in Sydney. I'm so glad we did as the rooms were wonderful and luxurious. Luckily we had one of the refurbished rooms and it was spotlessly clean. We were able to check in early as they had a room available. We left our luggage and went out to lunch at the Fish market which is an experience in itself. You must go and check it out when you're in Sydney. When we returned, our luggage had been delivered to our room and there was also a bottle of bubbly and some chocolates as a compliment from the hotel. What a lovely touch! All the staff were very friendly and were happy to help with any query you had. I've read other reviews on this hotel and some have been quite negative, but I have to say, it looks like they have taken some of this comments on board and have made a significant improvement as I could not fault any of the staff I came across. The only issue I did have was their alternative to feathered bedding is not as good as other 4 or 5 star hotels I have stayed in. I hope they address this problem and take into consideration that not everyone can sleep with feathers and the replacement bedding should be of equal standard. Apart from this, we had an excellent stay and would highly recommend this hotel to everyone. If you are happy to spend a fair bit more, it is definitely worth the treat.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel would recommend”
Reviews.Author: confusedtraveller2
Reviews.Content: After a long flight we checked into our rooms and I can honestly say one of the highlights of the holiday was getting into that bed. The rooms have not long been redecorated and you can still smell that new carpet smell. Very good size. The hotel staff were friendly and we had no problems at all checking in and out. There is a nice bar at the top which give stunning views of the harbour. Drinks are pricey but worth it. Location is excellent, bit tricky to find initially when your sleep deprived but its behind the four seasons, looking up is the best way to find it. Very short walk from the train station but it is up a steep short hill and would say if you have walking difficulties dont stay here! Lots of choice for eating and drinking surrounding but would say unless your made of money to shop around as some of the restaurants on the harbour are on the pricey side. The Italian on the hill as you walk up was very nice. Overall not a budget option but a lovely hotel and worth the extra cost.

Reviews.Title: “In my top 3 Hotels in Sydney others being Observatory and Sheraton on the Park”
Reviews.Author: Hardiman_11
Reviews.Content: We have been to the Shangri-La in Sydney 4 times now ,twice celebrating my birthday,once for shopping and once on a conference. When I booked over the phone and told the girl that it was a special birthday celebration she was so nice and we got strawberries with cream , chocs and champagne, which we had while looking out at the fabulous view which was the Harbour Bridge and the Opera House. We enjoyed other parts of the hotel namely the swimming pool, massages, high tea on the top floor, drinks at the Altitude Bar watching the harbour activities. When I went with a conference the room wasnt as good but the service was great. The only downside of the hotel is the steep hill to gain access to the hotel. eg: If you want to visit the Rocks Markets which are quite good its an easy walk down but then if you have knee problems or you hate hills this is an effort to return to the hotel especially in Summer. The corner suites are the best and they usually give you a late checkout if you ask.

Reviews.Title: “Arrogance ruins excellent location and fittings - give it a miss”
Reviews.Author: HungryandHappy
Reviews.Content: Despite being in a prime location and having beautiful rooms and fittings, I still describe my stay as horrendous. I phoned prior to arriving, to request an early check-in, as I had flown to from London, was arriving in Sydney at 1030am and had to prepare for a Board Meeting being held at this hotel the next day. The front desk staff were most unhelpful - after repeatedly replying "but check-in is at 3pm" to all questions, eventually they requested a "priority clean", but they could not tell me when the room would be ready, and refused to call me when it was, telling me to "check back every hour or so". They did not offer any assistance or to store my bags, and I had to humiliatingly ask in front of everyone "can I shower at the health club" - as though this was a backpackers hostel rather than a 5 star hotel. The soap/ shampoo/ conditioner/ sanitary bags were not refilled on the second day. Overall, mostly due to its front desk staff, the hotel has a feel of arrogance rather than care for its guests

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful room, beautiful view!”
Reviews.Author: jaxf1
Reviews.Content: We stayed in an executive room on the 19th floor as part of our honeymoon trip and have to say that it was a fantastic end to our trip! The room had stunning views that could be enjoyed from the wide window seats, particularly nice to sit there and enjoy the champagne and chocs that were in our room! The room had a seating area with sofa and chair, large bed and gorgeous bathroom - if we hadn't wanted to explore Sydney as we had never been before, we would have been very content to stay in the room for the whole 2 days! The staff at the hotel were very friendly, approachable and efficient. The driver who picked us up at the airport was knowledgeable and took us on a quick tour to get our bearings. Very high praise indeed is reserved for the doormen - very funny and helpful, could have talked to them for ages!! The hotel is in a great location, a short walk to all the main sights and in a friendly, safe area. If ever in Sydney again, the Shangri-La will be where we stay!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: TravelDot26
Reviews.Content: Staff are extremely accommodating and when reception knew it was our honeymoon we had a gorgeous redecorated room and champagne and chocolates! Lovely service! Views from the room were amazing and from the Altitude bar even better! Breakfast was very nice with a choice of buffet or menu selection. Highly recommend this hotel, easy walk to The Rocks and very central to restaurants and pubs.

Reviews.Title: “Very Classy”
Reviews.Author: marvtommo
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the shangri-la Sydney for the first three nights on our recent honeymoon. The views over the opera house were absolutely stunning and the hotel and room facilities were fantastic. We were well looked after and i can certainly rate the breakfast buffet as one of the best i have experienced as they cover everthing to a n excellent standard. Also recommend the blu bar on 36 at night which gives one of the best views of the city sights at night.

Reviews.Title: “Quite excellent”
Reviews.Author: traveler4k
Reviews.Content: I stayed here towards the end of September through early October. Upon check in there were several "hiccups" but when it was brought to management's attention later during my stay, they could not be more enthusiastic to please. The service from then on was absolutely as would be expected and everything continued to be lovely. The room had a decent view. The breakfast at Cafe Mix was amazing and consisted of a variety of Asian, Aussie and American dishes. I went for their "Sydney Package" and had breakfast included. I would advise a traveler to do the same or eat there anyway as it is well worth it. The location was very good although I rarely left the hotel and cut my trip early. I would love to stay at this property again and get the "full experience" next time. I would recommend this hotel very highly and also advise that if a problem occurs, management really goes out of their way to make sure they are truly the best in Sydney. Lastly, if you use their transportation service, you will be taken to/from the airport with "white glove" service. That was a lovely unexpected surprise and reminded me of a car service I used in London. I had placed myself on a waitlist for the Park Hyatt and considered the Four Seasons. After experiencing what I did at this property, I would not even consider the competition at all. Bar none, this property has the potential to become my favorite hotel on earth and I look forward to a repeat visit when in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Really beautiful hotel :)”
Reviews.Author: kat_donovan_70
Reviews.Content: If you want a great hotel with a great location this is the place to be. The online reservation process was great. Every staff member we interacted with seemed genuinely friendly and professional.

Reviews.Title: “Disastrous honeymoon night!”
Reviews.Author: Angela P
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Shangri-La for our wedding night. We were very very disappointed in the stay, but particularly the way our complaint was handled afterwards! On checkout, due to the long list of complaints, we were asked to return on our anniversary for a complimentary stay (to make up for our bad experience). When I emailed recently to book this in, they said the only thing they could do was offer a discounted rate! Appalling, considering we found a needle in the armchair, the sparkling wine was warm, the ice was melted, wine glasses had to be requested (and then were mis-matched), tissue box was empty, choc coated cherries in the fridge were weeks past their expiry date, milk in the fridge was open and then we were billed for breakfast and late checkout when this had already been paid for! The view is the only thing we enjoyed! Definately won't be returning EVER again!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed Stay a very professional hotel”
Reviews.Author: trishymelbourne
Reviews.Content: I visited a few hotels over the week in Sydney, because of this my review in some ways reflects my experiences at the Shangri-La Hotel. with these other hotels - Observatory Hotel and Amora Hotel Jamieson. Foyer - I must admit when walking into the Observatory Hotel foyer we were immersed in the smell of flowers and inspired by the attention to detail for an entrance. Amora also had a pleasant foyer with some innovation. The Shangri-La's foyer? A tad boring. I think that they stopped trying to add the little touches that make a difference to an entrance. The flowers were boring and the foyer didn't have an atmosphere. However, just because the foyer didn't live up to our expectations didn't mean we didn't enjoy the Shangri-La. A real positive for the Shangri-La compared to the others is that you got a sense that this hotel was efficient and a well oiled machine. It felt like it was very well managed and serviced to the highest level. Our Executive Room was very roomy and clean. The bed extremely comfortable. Things we noticed: the carpet was very soft and excellent quality compared to other hotels. The staff were friendly and and helpful too. The tv offered some information about facilities at the hotel but there was no booklet to let a new traveller in on what the hotel had to offer which I felt I wanted to find out but I couldn't. The other hotels had this and it made it easier to explore the hotel and see what it offered their guests outside the room. We had dinner at the Altitude Restaurant. We enjoyed our meals, but was disappointing that a large part of the menu was game, fish and heavy meat dishes. We felt like something less heavy but there wasn't a lot of variety. We throughly enjoyed the buffet at Cafe Mix. Which overall was a real winner for us. The experience and food was very memorable and part of our room rate. This reason persuaded us to come back to the Shangri-La again. I do hope they put some life into their foyer though.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel- A few tips for getting around”
Reviews.Author: Tipsadvisor007
Reviews.Content: The Shangri-La essentially does have it all in terms of comfort, size of rooms, reasonable value- and charming service. The location is also excellent with a few tips re this. Having also stayed at the Four Seasons nearby earlier I can compare with that hotel. We stayed in September and the Sydney weather was lovely- the price of the Shangri-la and the Four Seasons at that time were comparable for the weekend ( The Four Seasons was more) and the rooms were much bigger at the Shangri -La so we went for this hotel to try it. We had a Harbour View room with a truely amazing view out over the Opera House all the way to the Harbour Heads and a good sized and nicely decorated bathroom with very pleasantly scented bath products. Don't forget to mention if you have a special event in your email to book because the hotel does seem to make the extra effort. It was a special occasion, so we requested a high floor-22nd floor it had a great view for no more cost- and we received a truely delicious little cake- great chocolate- some of the best I have tasted! The location is brilliant - in terms of being close to things but it is at the top of a small hill. This is good for the amazing views and if you go to breakfast at the rocks or the Harbour Bridge as it means you don't have to go up the hill to them- you are on the same level and cut across. However, if you go down to Circular Quay to the ferries and Opera House or to shop you do need to come back up. We found you can come up by using the Four Seasons lift to the third floor-still a public area and outside to the right and up one brick stair and we were at the Shangri La- a bit cheeky but very easy! The Shangri-La has a very nice bar at the top of the hotel with some spectacular night view to the Bridge and city from one end- perhaps get there a little early to get a good table down that side. We prefered the foyer of the Shangri La as is was more comfortable light and inimate with very nice lounges area with drinks and popular for what looked like a high tea with gorgeous little cakes - we enjoyed some tasy snacks there. The Four Seasons foyer is flashy but lacks some of the comfort. The pool area was indoors but quite nice- there was a terrace outdoors- and pleasantly warm compared to many pools we have been in. There is also a Day Spa on the same level- which we didn't have time to try. We had a wonderful romanic time in the immediate area- we tried a fairly inexprensive little bistro called Selah, reccommended by the concierge- he seemed to know his stuff- we double checked by Googling reviews and when we tried it the food and wine was genuinely good. We also found a nice harbour ferry trip- the more modern Cat ferry- trip out to Watsons Bay in the afternoon was an inexpensive way to get a nice tour of the pretty harbour side suburbs(without hitting the swells of the open sea as when you go to Manly Beach). The views back towards the city and bridge were spectacular and there was a nice large park there- you could almost take a picnic it was fabulous. There are also cute sandy little beaches at various ferry stops including there. There is a huge Doyles Seafood Restaurant that dominated the immediate pier (as well as fish and chippery) but there is no doubt the area is charming and the view back is stunning. We just love the harbour and central Sydney is a mix of sparkling water, big city views, green parks and gardens and pockets of preserved wilderness to the sea which is so pretty and unusual for a modern city- it is a delight just getting around! Have fun!!

Reviews.Title: “Fab! Beautiful Views”
Reviews.Author: corcors
Reviews.Content: Had the pleasure of staying here as a birthday treat. We stayed in one of the Grand Harbour View rooms. View of the Harbour Bridge and Opera house were fantastic. Room was very spacious. We had a few cocktails in Altitude bar which were very tasty! Overall very enjoyable

Reviews.Title: “a first class hotel that delivers excellent service”
Reviews.Author: MELTRAVELLER265
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel on a nunber of occassions and it is always an enjoyable experience. This visit we stayed in a newly refurbished room that was superb. The large immaculate bathroom, well stocked and the very comfortable bed makes this a very inviting room. Our only problem was water leaking from the air con system that was starting to drench the carpet. This problem was handled swiftly by caring staff. The assistant manager called and offered to move us to another room.This was not necessary but it did demonstrate again how well Shangri la staff handle problems when they occassionally occur. A great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, location, service and quality”
Reviews.Author: Elaine K
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel a little early and our room was not available however we were offered to stay in the lounge with complimentary snacks and beverages until it was ready. The room was great, location and view from the bar were fabulous. Would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Room, Central Location, and a Big Hill”
Reviews.Author: jcepk1
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in August in a Deluxe Opera-View room. It was a beautiful room and very well maintained. The beds were very comfortable and there was a very nice marble bathroom with separate shower and tub. The L'Occitane bath supplies were a nice touch. The view was great and especially nice to wake up to, but we didn't spend much time in the room. The hotel is in a nice central location close to Circular Quay and the Bridge Climb. Yes, it is also in the Rocks, but we were unimpressed with that area overall. Plus, the hotel really wasn't very central in the Rocks, but kind of on the fringe. The location of the hotel itself is a challenge. If you have any mobility issues, I would recommend you look elsewhere for a hotel unless you plan on taking cabs the whole time. I guess I underestimated the hill everyone talked about, but at the end of the day of walking all around the city, that hill made getting to the hotel a bit of a challenge even if with the shortcut entrance at the back of the hotel. We did take a few cabs and it was a bit odd because except for when we arrived from the airport, the cab drivers told us they weren't allowed to drop off right at the hotel pull around, but had to go a bit past the hotel to a taxi area. We found that a bit strange and inconvenient at times. Lastly, the hotel is so popular for after dinner drinks up on the top floor that returning to the hotel between 5:30-6:30 was often a challenge because the elevators were always full. I think they need to have a dedicated elevator just for those coming in for the bar/restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, but nothing special”
Reviews.Author: Yau Baby
Reviews.Content: First time I walked into my room, I thought I checked into a Holiday Inn or Novotel. The decor is so bland, common, boring. Yes, the place is adequate, bed comfortable, bathroom clean. But that's about as much as I can write about the place. Location is excellent though. Just 5 minutes' walk from the Rocks. But there are many other hotels that offer better value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back!!”
Reviews.Author: GingerLover15
Reviews.Content: We up graded to the Harbour View Room. It has the most break-taking view of both the Opera House and Harbour Bridge. It was well worth the price. The room is massive and so quite. It was hard to leave the room because the view was so stunning. You can not go wrong with this hotel. We can't wait to go back. Also, treat yourself to Altitude for supper. It was a meal I will remember for life.

Reviews.Title: “Top Class Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Peter O
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 nights at the Shangri La and had a room with with a fantastic view over the harbour and it was a delight to look out on the Sydney Harbour Bridge and the Opera House each morning. Every person at the hotel made it a pleasure to stay there. The only let down was the meal in the Altitude restaurane on the 36th floor. It did not live up to expectations and the quality of both food and wine was not up to the price or setting. Despie this I would reccomend the Shangri La as a hotel to stay at.

Reviews.Title: “Central location, great service, wonderful views!”
Reviews.Author: sns_chan
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 6 nights at the Shangri-la on honeymoon. The hotel staff were courteous, helpful and knowledgeable. The room was immaculate and spacious with a huge queen size bed. Our room had a view of the Opera House - we had a pay a bit more for that but well worth it! It was a lovely view to wake up to in the morning. I thought it was really nice that we were left a little bookmark when they come in for the evening turn-down service - a very nice touch! Generally very impressed with the hotel and would recommend to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best”
Reviews.Author: Naviance
Reviews.Content: This is one of my favorite hotels in the world! The magnificent views are simply stunning. Close to the Rocks and Circular Quay and just minutes from shopping precincts and public transport if required. Stroll to the Quay board a ferry and cruise across probably the worlds finest harbors. Large rooms panoramic vistas, fine dining, great cocktail lounge with beautiful evening skyline.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location - Ideal for exploring”
Reviews.Author: Frenchchelsea
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 nights at the hotel. This was our first trip to Australia so we had very high hopes and we were not disappointed. The rooms were very spacious and of a very high standard. We had a high floor with amazing views of the Harbour Bridge and Opera House. The location of the hotel makes it ideal for seeing the sights and accessing public transport. The hotel cocktail bar and Altitude restaurant are probably the best in the city and well worth visiting. Can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Room with a view”
Reviews.Author: john_charbonneau
Reviews.Content: My wife and I started our 3+ week holiday with one night at the Shangri-La to adjust to the time differences from Boston, MA. A very nice western facing room on 17th floor overlooking Darling harbor. Sunset over the harbor was a nice intro to Sydney. We finished our vacation with 3 nights and as a treat for us we stayed on a higher floor (27th) in a very spacious room with the Grand Harbor view. Magnificent! Staff was uniformly capable and pleasant. An earlier post mentioned the need for a ski lift to get to the reception area from the Circular Quai. I do think that if a traveler has some significant mobility issues then this location might be on the difficult side for easy movement w/o a vehicle. That aside I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel... magnificient view”
Reviews.Author: gugliada
Reviews.Content: i spent with my partner 5 nghts at the end of august 2011 in this hotel. the first night we had a corner room at 7th floor, which was ok, but we do ask to have a room at a higher floor... they gave us and to be honest: it was amazing!!! the view was for sure better... one of the best of my life we could see the opera house and the bridge from our bed. the service is very good with nice people at the front desk that actually are very helpful and charming. i was quite disappointed by the guy at the entrance... a man with moustache with a quite bad attitude and apparently looking just for tips from the guests. i can say that this is one of the best hotel i've ever been

Reviews.Title: “Lovely views”
Reviews.Author: cynnie50
Reviews.Content: Great location, and views, they let us check into our room early. All staff very friendly. It was our anniversary and they left sparkling wine and chocolates for us when we returned to our room. An extra comfortable chair would of been nice although I did spend most of my time sitting in the window looking at the view. Lovely bathroom with separate bath.

Reviews.Title: “A delightful weekend get away.”
Reviews.Author: Lindmill
Reviews.Content: My Partner and I recently stay at this magnificent hotel and were truly impressed with all features. The rooms are fresh and look over the Harbour! I love that we could lie in bed to watch the sunrise over the opera house. The staff were just fantastic and remembered our names if you visit the Horizon club Emily and Claire will look after you! The Shangri-La was a refreshing change from hotels we have stayed in the past. The only issue we came across is that the hotel does not have baby change table or a place to breast feed whilst you wait for your room. Although not an issue just any unexpected cost the valet parking is very expensive! We were charged $110 for the weekend, I recommend parking at a Wilson's parking lot on the next street especially if it's on a Saturday or Sunday because it's a flat rate of $15-$25.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Views and Service”
Reviews.Author: SalesVP
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this hotel with my wife and daughter as the first leg of our vacation. The hotel was top notch. The staff was very friendly and knowledgeable. The room had an amazing view of Sydney Harbour (Harbourview room). Easily the best view in the city for any hotel. You could see the entire Harbour (Opera House and Bridge). My daughter loved sitting in the window seat and watching the boats in Circular Quay. One thing that made this hotel extra special was that the restaurant staff was very friendly and doted on my 2 year old daughter. Not only did they have an ample amount of booster seats and high chairs for the many children we saw at the hotel, they also had cutlery, plates and cups for toddlers. You never see that in a hotel. The concierge lent us a stroller for the week we were there. This was a huge plus for us and allowed us to enjoy the city that much more. The guest services staff was very accommodating and helpful as well. We had breakfast included in our rate and the buffet breakfast was terrific. A wide variety of food. You don't need lunch after a breakfast like this. The bar and restaurant on the 36 floor of the hotel offer the best views in Sydney. A must at least once at sunset. The room is spacious and was recently updated. Best of all you can walk to everything in the city from this location. The Harbourview rooms cost a little more, but they are worth it. We loved our stay and will return to this hotel anytime we are in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our time, wonderful location, great service”
Reviews.Author: Sekok
Reviews.Content: We arrived at Shangri-La Sydney in the afternoon of August 29, 2011 after a 30 hours door-to-door no stop travel from home. Staff was very friendly and made it possible, just a few minutes after dropping off the taxi, that we could be refreshing in our room located on the 24th floor, featuring a stunning view over the Opera House. In the evening we had our first Aussie dinner at Altitude restaurant which is located on the top floor inside the hotel. The view over the skyline and the harbour is stunning (we had a table near the window booked in advance). Good service with many waiters attempting to satisfy your needs, seriously good food, affordable price and a reasonable selection of wines by the glass (a bit dizzy after the long trip, could'nt go for a full bottle...). The hotel location make it a very good choice if you plan to walk around the city. It is within walking distance from the Opera, the old Rocks quarter, the Botanic Garden, the Overseas Passenger Terminal (where further quite interesting restaurants are definitively worth a try), Darling Harbour, the maritime museum, the chinese garden. We stayed 4 nights and we definitively enjoyed our time at the hotel and slept well and in privacy. Room and bed size, comfort, furniture and appliances adequate to high standard business class city hotel. Two minor peculiarities: there was a single paper/waste bucket in the room (which, for our comfort, we moved it into the bathroom) and a fixed shower head in the bathroom (no telephone head) which required a bit of gym to reach all body parts...

Reviews.Title: “Worth Every Cent”
Reviews.Author: LJA_55
Reviews.Content: My wife & I recently stayed in a Harbour view room, I didn't quite understand why the harbour view rooms cost more at the time of booking. Once we walked through the door the all thoughts of price vanished, to be replaced with a spectacular view of beautiful Sydney Harbour, The Bridge and the Opera House. Just sitting in the window have a quite drink and soaking up that most special of views, was a truly amazing way to spend a 30th wedding anniversary. We had dinner at Horizons on level 36, the food, service and view where absolutely fantastic. I would recommend that everyone stays and eats here at least once. if it is not on your bucket list, it should be.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel with true 5 Star Service”
Reviews.Author: travelliingaussie
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure of staying at this property in a Horizon Darling Harbour view room last weekend. Overall the property is very luxurious with all the amenities you would expect from a 5 star hotel. The thing that really stands out though is the staff. I have never experienced such warm and generous hospitality in Australia, and for this reason, the Sydney Shangri La will be my first choice of hotel in Sydney from now on. The location is also brilliant with priceless views. L'Occitane amenities are a nice touch, and the gym and pool are both excellent. All in all, an excellent hotel and I can't wait to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fine but not fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Hilary L
Reviews.Content: This is a perfectly decent, well-appointed hotel but, from my experience, nothing special. I would stay again if on business but wouldn't splash out for a holiday. Good points - good location in the Rocks near Circular Quay; large rooms with good-sized bathrooms & comfy beds; decent views; neutral (though flirting with 'dull'), modern decor; got us a room ahead of check-in time when we arrived early. However, a few things let it down. The service wasn't great: although we did get a room early, we had to wait ages for them to do a 'housekeeping sign-off' and then watched the room key be passed to some chatting receptionists who did nothing with it (despite us sitting half-asleep right in front of them) - in the end my husband had to wait in line behind others to ask for it. Then they took us into the wrong room at first (thankfully no one was there but we could see their unpacked suitcases on the floor!) and when we went for a nap in the correct room, someone opened the door while we were asleep! Not reassuring. They did apologise and give us a bottle of wine, but we weren't impressed. Although our stay was generally comfortable, it was the small things that annoyed us - you just expect more from a 5-star hotel. One evening, when we needed to get a taxi, the doorman said, 'oh, yes' and then promptly went to deal with other people arriving, so we had to wait for 15 minutes and were late to our restaurant. Also, as it was our honeymoon, we were supposed to have some sparkling wine in our room, but this didn't arrive until our second night. It just didn't feel special - particularly after we'd been spoilt rotten in their sister hotel in Bangkok which was so much better in every way. We fell in love with Sydney - but not this hotel :(

Reviews.Title: “What a view!”
Reviews.Author: Taz42
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Shangri-La, Sydney in July, 2011. We received first-class service from the moment we arrived until we arrived at the airport on the day we were leaving. We had a corner room on the 27th floor, with a 260 degree view. We could see all the way from the Bridge down through the harbour, past the Opera House to the heads. We enjoyed every minute of our stay, including the food and service at both the restaurants ... and even room service was special. The room itself was newly renovated so everything was clean and fresh. We did not lack for anything. The concierge was able to answer all of our questions and help us out when we needed it. It was a fabulous finale for the end of our Australian vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Double charged my credit card”
Reviews.Author: lsk926
Reviews.Content: The room and staffs are alright. But they double charged my credit card... After I goes back to my home town, I figure out my credit card have charged more than expected. After 1 month of emailing, they finally get it refund... poor billing. messy But the view is stunning and comfort your soul but not your bank.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing to Complain”
Reviews.Author: Comfort_Seeker999
Reviews.Content: This is one of the few hotel rooms where I had absolutely nothing to complain about. The plug points were abundant, convenient and extremely usable for the bulky Mac adaptors (which many hotels do not accommodate). The towels were ALWAYS thick, big and luxurious - which is not necessarily the case for some 5-star hotels. The bed and pillows were great. The AC was easy to control. There was even a DVD player in the room, with the LCD TV. The bathtub was long and deep. Great L'Occitane amenities. Most importantly, all the staff were wonderful, polite and very accommodating. The location is also great with lots and lots of great restaurants in the area - but book ahead.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel but consider location carefully”
Reviews.Author: Admiral1059
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well up to the high standards we have met in other hotels in the Shangri La group. If you want to indulge, make sure you get a room with the Opera House view. From these you can see Circular Quay and down the Harbour towards the heads. We enjoy Sydney partly because much of the central shopping and business areas can be accessed easily on foot. Circular Quay is a useful hub for bus, rail and ferry. The Shangri La is located up a steep climb with steps and there appeas to be no easy access on foot. Booking on the web gives a lot of choice but be very careful about your selections and mak sure you book exactly the package you want. We bought a food add on for $100 but this was not shown clearly on the final account. The massage in the Spa was first rate and worked owonsers on my shoulders.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious comfort”
Reviews.Author: uktraveltips
Reviews.Content: Apologies for posting this review so late! The bed was very comfortable and enveloping (on the soft side) and the room felt both spacious and light, even months later we think fondly of that bed. Both times we stayed we had good views even on the Darling Harbour side. The bathroom is big and has a classic rather than modern design. The hotel has a presence about it, feels luxurious and homely and made us want to go back. The hotel is in a very good location, near the Rocks, Circular Quay and George Street but at night it is in a quiet vicinity as it is three blocks up the hill from the main streets. The hotel is almost opposite a set of steps which take you up on to the Harbour Bridge and a raised walkway which goes right round to the opposite side of Circular Quay both ways offering some wonderful views of the city. It is worth going up to the bar on the top floor, we also ate at the Altitude restaurant where the food was nice but didnâ€™t have the wow factor. The view is probably best around sunset rather than late at night as the bridge is usually not lit up. All in all, a great hotel in a great city.

Reviews.Title: “Not a Five Star Experience, but some good things. Overall a mixed Bag, expensive.”
Reviews.Author: ChetX5150
Reviews.Content: This hotel has five stars here on TripAdvisor, so we stopped here as part of our honeymoon. The location is fantastic and right on the harbor. The rooms like a nice Marriott, with a nicer bathroom. Mini-Bar did not cool. Not sure if this is a common thing, but room temperature and water is not good. Restaurant views are great at Altitude on the 36th floor. The multi-course meal was good, but not great. The views are spectacular. For our honeymoon, they managed to put us in a room with two singles and said they were over-booked and we could not get the queen or king we requested. For these reasons, these guys will never compete with a Four Seasons or Mandarin Oriental hotel. Room service was OK, but slow. It should be noted that the hotel has many views. If you stay here, get a true harbor view room of the bridge and Opera House. Otherwise, just have a meal at the restaurant--because the other views are not nearly as good. So to recap: Pros: Good Location, Great Views--especially from Altitude Restaurant (where we had great service and a view), rooms had lots of electrical outlets--good for the traveler. So-So: Rooms, Internet Speed, Warm Mini-Bar, iHome stereo in room was OK. Bathroom was above average, lots of marble, but only one sink. Nice size TV, lots of Rugby channels (if you are in to that, as an American, Rugby seems random and zany.) Cons: Expensive for what you get. Non-Harbor view rooms are weak. Service is lacking for this type of hotel. Room service was slower than expected. They market themselves as a Four Seasons caliber hotel, but they have a lot to learn about what that takes. Not a five-star property... maybe a 4-star if they can get service upgraded.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible”
Reviews.Author: Mike P
Reviews.Content: Stay away, check in counter need training and all staff. We have had numerous problem but no acknowledment from the management. The korean lady who checked us in need some serious customer service training!! din't smile at all and it felt like we are a burden. Not coming Back!!

Reviews.Title: “Not very generous for the price we paid”
Reviews.Author: gcsv
Reviews.Content: We paid for a room on level 20 with great views of the harbour on wotif for $340 (not cheap) we at leat expected maybe chocolates on arrival or a fruit platter or even complimentary drinks. There was absolutely nothing offered oh and breakfast was not included in that price. Sure you are located at The Rocks but a bit overpriced for what you get. The hotel was beautiful but $340 for one night room only is a bit of a rip off.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel stay ever.”
Reviews.Author: stephen p
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in many top class hotels on holiday travels but few, if any, come close to our stay, in this hotel, to say it was fabulous is an understatement. The staff, from the moment you enter, until leaving time were excellent. The room was spotless, and the views, from our room, were breathtaking. Based on the experience myself and my family had, If anybody can fault this hotel I would say they are very difficult to please. The stay was faultless. Would I recommend this hotel to anybody? In a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Cannot fault in anyway at all”
Reviews.Author: Kinnoda
Reviews.Content: Genuinely the best hotel that I have ever had the pleasure of staying at. From a free upgrade at 11 am check in to a suite, to charging my iPhone in the lobby as I had left the charger at home - free wireless internet access, a free bottle of water in the bathroom, immaculate fittings, a shower that I did not want to ever get out of; this hotel cannot be faulted in any way. Service was swift and was utterly fantastic. I have boasted about this stay to all of my friends and family back home in Adelaide and would stay again finances permitting.

Reviews.Title: “Just so you know”
Reviews.Author: Jess R
Reviews.Content: I'm writing this review not to be mean, but because I felt that I should warn some people about the payment system that Shangri-La don't make you aware of that really could of helped me decide if I wanted to stay there or not. I am just a student with not a lot of money and I had been saving up to go on a holiday. I live in Melbourne and we were going to sydney for our first stop for one night. I had given my credit card details to shangri-la when booking online. When we got to the hotel, upon arrival they said they needed a card (didn't really specify why, were vague and said "just incase", I assumed it was just to take the details down in case of emergency or damages like at many other hotels), I hadn't brought my credit card to Sydney so I handed over my visa debit card with all of my holiday savings on it. When we were checking out they said they needed the card again to charge me for my room. I thought this was weird, I'd given them credit card details when I had booked, and I had given them another card to take down details on arrival, I told the girl that I had already given them my card upon arrival and she said that they hadn't charged it for the room then and that they needed the card to charge me now. So unfortunately I had to use my savings to pay for the room that I thought my credit card that I left in Melbourne would of covered online- I had wished they would specify online that they needed a card in person and I would have brought my credit card. The worst part starts now - a couple days later my card starts getting rejected saying I don't have enough money in my account, this is weird to me because the room cost was only $290 and I knew I still had some savings for my holiday. I check my bank account and see shangri-la had taken the $290 but there was $390 held on my account and it didnt say what for. I called up my bank and they said shangri-la had put that money on hold! I called shangri-la straight away and asked them why this was the case. They said they "do it with everyone" they take it as security and we get it back within a week. I don't know why they don't mention this ANYWHERE or why they didnt just take the cost of the room out of the amount they had already taken upon arrival! So overall shangri-la had taken about $700 of my savings (suffice to say I didnt have enough left to have an enjoyable holiday at all). When I got back from my holiday I still hadn't received the $390 back I had to call NUMEROUS times managers were always busy and had to "call me back" one of them never did call me back. One of them said he would deal with the problem asap (at about 9am and I called at 9pm and found out that his fax to the bank saying to let my funds go back to me hadnt worked and he had just left it there!) Eventually after a week, I got the money back, but I tell you what, it seems like so much of a hassle for them to take the money out and put it back in, they even have to send a fax to the bank every time they authorise for everyones money to get put back in - what a nightmare! Bottom line - if I was told that they would take the amount of my room plus an extra hundred on arrival, and then the amount of my room on departure I would have definitely 100% gone somewhere else. That is not something I can afford and I'm sure a lot of you guys would want to know this info when planning your trip if you don't have unlimited money like me! During our stay the staff were very friendly, the food was nice, and the room was nice.

Reviews.Title: “A good hotel but not all we expected”
Reviews.Author: starstationearth
Reviews.Content: We arrived at this hotel on the morning following our first night due to an overnight flight so we could get into the room early on and catch up in our sleep but.....the hotel seemed to have the impression that we were a no show and scrambled around for a room for us! The receptionist seemed reluctant to take responsibility for the mix up ( all our rooms were pre-confirmed by travelbag) and was defensive, which did not go down well after a long flight down from Bangkok! Once in the room we were disappointed to find that the deluxe opera house view dvertised was actually an oblique view and the main expressway ran almost directly below the hotel! We were offered an upgrade to a suite at the front of the property if we were prepared to 120 Aus$, which we weren`t, so we stuck with the room and it all worked pretty well in the end. Be warned though, if you don`t do well with steep slopes this is probably NOT the hotel for you, the walk to George St and the Harbour is a killer!! Food in the hotel is pretty good and the rooms are fairly comfortable if there are 2 people, although the queen beds are a wee bit saggy in the middle. If there are 3 you need a rollaway, which is rather springy! Good TV channels kept the daughter happy and the separate bath and shower worked out well for 3 of us. There was a power cut in the city when we were there which trapped my wife and daughter in a lift for 90 minutes, so we were given free Alacarte evening meal with drinks to compensate for this inconvenience, which went down really well. The hotel couldnot do enough for us after this incident to be fair to them. A final word then, don`t be fooled by the website, the views are just not as good as they appear but it is in a good spot.
