Reviews.Title: “Insist on a harbour view”
Reviews.Author: RonKVA
Reviews.Content: I arrived in the early afternoon and was told that I could not be assigned a room until the prescribed check-in time, so I was shunted off to a waiting area for two hours with other early arrivers. Not a promising start, and then, although my travel agent had reserved a room with a harbour view, I was put in a large room on a low floor with a view only of a nearby freeway. I requested a change and was switched to a smaller but excellent room on a high floor with a great view of Sydney Harbour and the Opera House. Apart from the check-in hassle, I was quite happy with the Shangri-La. The room was clean and comfortable, and service was excellent. The concierge was especially helpful in confirming airport transfers both locally and in Darwin, my next stop. The restaurants appeared to be attractive but a bit pricey, so I took advantage of the ample nearby dining opportunities. I have mixed feelings about the hotel's location. On the one hand, it is close to The Rocks, the Circular Quay, shopping areas, restaurants, and other attractions. On the other hand, navigating the three blocks from George St. up to Cumberland St. requires an increasingly steep climb. Anyone with a heart condition or questionable physical fitness should take it very slowly.

Reviews.Title: “Great service - the best so far!”
Reviews.Author: ZKCanberra
Reviews.Content: We were in Sydney for one night last saturday and chose to stay Shangri La hotel. We were amazed! We stayed in one of the Horizon Club rooms, overlooking the Opera House, magnificent views. But the service was even better. Got checked in on 30th floor. Free food and drinks and breakfast! The people were very friendly and really smiling. Gave an extra ved free for my son. Hotel arranged a babysitter for us and that went really well. Will definitely go back probably for 2 nights!

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: jakye
Reviews.Content: We had a fantastic time - excellent service, quality and situation

Reviews.Title: “Can't fault it”
Reviews.Author: CBMelbourne
Reviews.Content: I was lucky enough to stay here for one night on a recent business trip. Upon check-in I received an upgrade, and found myself opening the door to a room with a picture perfect view of Sydney Harbour, the bridge and the Opera House. The room was finished to a high standard, although I have to say there was a slight oversight in that toilet roll was not on the holder, but tucked away in the vanity drawer. That's really the only flaw I could identify in the whole stay!! When I returned after being out in the evening, the bed had been turned down, curtains drawn, and slippers laid out for me. I ordered room service, which was efficient and tasty enough. Breakfast was well catered with options for every palate, though I think it was very pricey. The staff were efficient, courteous and professional at every encounter. I'd recommend anyone to stay here ... If you can get a room at your price point.

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievable view”
Reviews.Author: dvchent
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the upper portion of the Shangri-La, with a room overlooking the harbor and the Opera House. Service, amenities, and view were incredible. Being so close to The Rocks was added value.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel and service, shame about the walk up the steep hill to get to it!”
Reviews.Author: KarenUK_13
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through Amex fine hotels programme and upon arrival after the door men asked our name we were greeted by the guest relations member of staff and checked in straight away. We had booked 2 rooms and my husband and I were checking in the following day as we were spending the evening doing the roar and snore at the zoo. When we arrived the following day to check in we were again greeted by name and asked about our previous days activities. We were told at check in that we had been given a newly renovated room with harbour views. The rooms were spacious and well appointed, the window seat was nice when looking at the views. The only slight negative I would say about our room was that for a newly renovated room there were some details overlooked (tiles cracked in half on the bathroom wall or tiles missing from around the toilet, the in bathroom speaker not working) Also the shower was very dark due to the position it is placed. Service at the hotel was very good, staff were very polite and very helpful. Breakfast was included in our room rate and was good, although there was often a wait for eggs to be cooked or coffee to be delivered. We also ate at Alta restaurant and recieved excellent service as well as a wonderful meal. The same service was recieved in the bar next door. Turn down service was recieved each night with slippers placed by the bed and the fruit bowl replenished. We were dissapointed though not to recieved chocolates or bottled water at this time. One of the slight negatives about this hotel is the location. Although the views are amazing, the walk up the steep hill and steps at the end of a long day or evening was not welcoming. A further negative (one that we have not encountered when staying at any other Amex fine hotel that we have booked through Amex concierge) was that the bill had to be paid on the Amex card. This meant that I had to pay for my parents room and then sort out them paying us back. On our trip to Australia we stayed in 3 Amex fine hotels (plus we have stayed at several in the USA) and this was the only one we had to do this at. I would recommend this hotel as long as you don't mind the walk up the steep hill. Personally though I would probably not stay here again because of this. We recieved the same great service and good room at the Four Seasons which had a better location so would probably choose to stay there instead.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel”
Reviews.Author: DBManc
Reviews.Content: wonderful hotel with amazing staff... got upgraded to a $1000 dollar a night suite! thanks... amazing views also and great location

Reviews.Title: “Awsome, Fantastic, wow factor”
Reviews.Author: Blondeblueyes
Reviews.Content: We had two rooms on the 23rd floor of the Shangri-La hotel in Sydney. Fantastic hotel with views to die for especially if your choose the rooms on the sydney bridge/opera house side of darling harbour and the quay. With stunning views of Sydneyâ€™s spectacular Harbour, the Sydney Harbour Bridge and the world-famous Opera House, Apart from a superb location the hotel offers some of the cityâ€™s finest dining, including Altitude Restaurant, contemporary restaurant, and Blu Bar on 36, each offering its own spectacular views of the city from level 36. Time to get your best dresses out ladies if you want to dress to impress here. Word of warning...get up earlier for the breakfast as there is so much choice and the food is so good its not to be rushed. Very good value for money. As for the rooms. They are beautiful furnished with king size beds. GUESTROOM FEATURES â€¢ Complimentary broadband and WIFI Internet access â€¢ Large, triple glazed soundproofed windows â€¢ Marble bathroom with separate shower â€¢ Electronic safe â€¢ Satellite / cable TV and movie channels â€¢ Mini-bar â€¢ Pillow menu. The hotel is within easy walking distance of the city's main shopping areas, bars and resturants. This hotel has RECREATION FACILITIES â€¢ Health club â€¢ Indoor heated swimming pool â€¢ CHI, The Spa â€¢ Sauna â€¢ Sun deck. The Shangri-La Hotel is the perfect base to stay to discover sydney. We hired a personal tour guide for 3 days. He took us deep into the wildness of the Beautiful, Magical blue mountains where we had a picnic on the edge of the mountains. He grew up here as a young boy and the mountains was his playground so he knew every crook and cranny and all the best views and photo opportunities. Next was bondi beach where as a young man he rode the surf. Here you can see the famous beach with the surfers attempting to ride the waves. Next on the list the magnificent botanical gardens were just amazing and his knowledge of animals/plant life was astounding. There is so much to see and do in sydney so having a tour guide with such knowledge was worth every penny. This guy to us off the beaten track. To rain forests, waterfalls, and many many other wonderful sights. I for one would not hesitate to hire him again as 3 days was just not enough and l left wanting more.

Reviews.Title: “Just perfect”
Reviews.Author: ingaaustralia
Reviews.Content: we went for my husbands 80th birthday. On arrival we were given a room with the most breathtaking view of the habour. The room was spacious and very clean. The buffet breakfast had everything you could want to eat, We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “First Class!”
Reviews.Author: KTJ058
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the Shangi la. The first stay had a few "hiccups" which we were very disappointed about. (mainly attention to detail lacking see review last year!)) However, we were convinced to revisit the hotel and give it another chance and were so very glad we did. The hotel certainly lived up to its 5 star reputation.We booked a 2 night stay in an Horizon club room. From the moment we handed over our car keys for the car to be parked to the moment we left we felt welcomed and pampered. The views from our room were spectacular. I must admit that the beds and pillows at the Shangi La are the best I've ever experienced, I think I could have just stayed in bed all day looking out at the view and ordering room service!! However we did venture out to the restaurant and weren't disappointed. The sign of a very good hotel is to accept criticism and act upon it which the Shangri la certainly did! We have stayed in most of the 5 star hotels in Sydney and would rate the Shangri La as one of our favourites mainly due to its proactive nature towards its guests!

Reviews.Title: “Very Good if somewhat expensive hotel”
Reviews.Author: Joffaboy_66
Reviews.Content: Have stayed at Shangri-la on a few occasions for work and have found it to be an excellent hotel. Relatively large rooms, and depending on your room either a spectacular view of Sydney Harbour to the East, and toward Parramatta River if you are on the western side. If you are on the Western side there is the Cahill Expressway which feeds directly on to the Harbour Bridge so the traffic is quite heavy. No matter the double glazed windows works a treat. I was born and bred in Sydney (in Melbourne for over 20 years) but i have never seen a more spectacular view of the Eastern Harbour as i have seen from the bar on the 33rd or 34th floor. Absolutely breathtaking and worth visiting even if you are not staying at the hotel. Have only ever eaten at the bistro for dinner but the food is excellent (as is breakfast). there is also a relaxing piano par near reception. Centrally located right in the heart of the Rocks precinct, very close to Circular Quay. This makes it very convenient for Ferry travel to various locations around the harbour.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bowwow2gill
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the Shangri La. The service is second to none and the staff so friendly and attentive. I really wouldn't want to stay anywhere else when in Sydney. When it came to leaving I sat at the window for quite sometime just taking in the view of the Opera House and the city - I really didn't want to leave! It may be sometime before I am able to return to Sydney, (perhaps when the exchange rate is a little friendlier!), but when I do I will definitely staying at the Shangri La.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice....”
Reviews.Author: Flygirl7693
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for our anniversary. Our room was very nice but I wish I could have afforded the Opera/Harbour View room. We had the Darling Harbour View room, the view was OK but the other would have been more spectacular. I read all the reviews on Trip Advisor before I booked this hotel and I thought we might have been lucky enough to get an upgrade, but to no evail....Oh' well, better luck next time??? It was quite a climb from Circluar Quay with our luggage... we had to save our money so we could stay in this hotel, so we took the train from the airport instead of a taxi and walked everywhere we went. If nothing else, it was cheap and good exercise for us! Didn't feel as guilty indulging in that cocktail before dinner! I did enjoy the stay here, but I'm not sure I would stay again. I thought it would be amazing but at the end of the day it was just another hotel room and I really felt like I didn't belong there!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Views, Fantastic Service”
Reviews.Author: mad1one
Reviews.Content: Booked a bed and breakfast package - arrived early, checked in and reception organised for our bags to be delivered. We had made a booking for the Altitude restaurant and as it was a public holiday needed to check that as we were on standby for this that it was still available, this was confirmed and we requested a window table if possible again advised the hotel would do its best. In the time it took to check restaurant booking, our room was ready and we were given immediate access. Room was clean and spacious, bags delivered and request for an adaptor to charge an american mobile provided without fuss or delay. The views over Sydney Harbour were spectacular, as a Sydney sider this was saying something. Little noise if at all. Turn down service and bathrobes were an added nice touch which only added to the excellent service. Had drinks at Blu Bar again service and views superb. Altitude was amazing, they managed to find us a table with a window view, the food was great and the wine matching made it a very relaxed evening with us feeling that we were being looked after rather than merely dining in a restaurant. Breakfast was a huge buffet, great choice, however it was very busy and sometimes needed to wait for a table to come free or get the attention of staff. However in the scheme of things this was more a minor inconvenience rather than a complaint. Would definitely recommend this hotel if you have visitors to Sydney or if you have a special occasion to celebrate.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and we'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: MrsKrishnan
Reviews.Content: Go for a horizon room or horizon package to have the extra attention and the benefits that comes with it.

Reviews.Title: “The best views, very good infrastructure but not so great service”
Reviews.Author: Viajoefico
Reviews.Content: The best about the Shangri-La is the view from the bar and the restaurant at the top of the hotel. The building itself is pretty impressive and the location could hardly be better. Then, it seems not unusual to have to queue up for up to five minutes to be seated for breakfast, a luxury that more often than not you cannot afford when on a business trip. At the rush hours, you need to relax and be patient when waiting for an elevator... and you definitely want to use one to get to your room on 27th floor. The rates for services like breakfast and laundry are just outrageous, but you're there with your partners and you have to pay the 38 Aussies for your morning eggs. And you'd better have your own 3G modem or internet access will also take a heavy toll on your credit card. Could be amazing, but those little details make it average. Stay somewhere else and go to the bar for a beer when you get the chance.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel I have ever stayed at”
Reviews.Author: Jules_JW
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights following our wedding, including the wedding night in a premier deluxe room and it was not only huge but the service was impeccable. We also visited Altitude Restaurant and the cocktail bar next door, which has been a favourite of ours for many years. This hotel is in such a central location in The Rocks and has all the trimmings. If you can afford it - spend the money. You won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: himself_10
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel many times and thought I had best provide a review as it is in my opinion one of Sydney's best. The reception is always welcoming the staff have excellent memories and once you have been there a few times they recognise you accordingly even the porter at he front door. The rooms are very comfortable some with outstanding views of the harbour, opera house and circular quay. Breakfast is always good but in my view too expensive as is the restaurant on the top floor very expensive as are the drinks so eat and drink elsewhere. On one trip i sustained a fractured shoulder boarding a water taxi (avoid them at all costs they did not even care that I was injured as a result of their ineptitude) The hotel staff on the other hand showed very real concern and wanted to call paramedics which I declined but insisted that at least their first aid person look at me. They were very caring and packed me in ice packs until my car arrived to take me to the airport, they even provided a sling. On my most recent visit the place was in blackout upon arrival due to a power failure and no one could check in. To their credit they swung into action providing canapes and drinks while we waited in and around reception. Finally checked in they upgraded me to a suite and apologised profusely for the delay. There were staff everywhere even escorting you to the lift and the floor where you were booked into. This hotel is a standout and is world class from a location, staff and comfort perspective, again the only thing is food and drinks quality and price. But a few steps away you will find very good restaurants. They also seem to ensure that there are cabs close at hand on the rank and i have never waited more than a couple of minutes for one. Well done the management of this hotel i will continue to stay there when in Sydney. Himself 10

Reviews.Title: “The only place to stay in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Movinon42
Reviews.Content: This is by far the best hotel in Sydney and whilst it is 5 star it is worth every cent and I cannot explain just how good the view is from every room although I would request a bridge view if possible. I rec staying in the Horizan Club and the small extra cost is compensated by the free breakfeast in the morning and the drinks and canapes in the evening. This is a hotel that makes you feel welcome and the girls in the Horizan Club are fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: LondonKatelyn
Reviews.Content: Stayed in one of the Horizon rooms on 33rd floor, with amazing views. Seemed to be very high up as the hotel is on the top of a hill anyway. Thought that we got good value from this. Its in the older part of town with the quay etc easily walkable, As we had the additional breakfast included, we ate there and it was very nice pancakes cooked to order, lattes, and a great variety. Canapes and free wine in the evening was also great, as well as ability to pop in there during the day for coffee, cakes and soft drinks to refresh. This is the first hotel I have been in where the luggage arrives before you, when you have not been unduly delayed at the desk. I found all service to be faultless. The ladies in the horizon club lounge could not have been more helpful and accommodating. Pool area and 1st floor restaurant seem to be the only public parts of this hotel that overlook the toll road behind the hotel, so it doesn't bother at all. Pool has a jacuzzi next to it and small gym area. Chi spa looked lovely, but prices weren't advertised and we weren't there for long anyway. We found our room very suitable, with nice L'Occitane toiletries and it was clean with comfy big bed. Not sure about the other room types and have just read the review about refurbishment, but I would recommend this hotel for families stopping over. We had a lovely walk out around the bay to Mrs Macquiries chair, via the Opera House and Botanical gardens that we could virtually see from our room and got some shopping in too.

Reviews.Title: “Would definately stay again!”
Reviews.Author: Weddinghunter
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel! We stayed for our honeymoon and it was my birthday too, the hotel made me two birthday cakes!! Great location, big rooms, friendly staff and good facilities. The bed is the comfiest bed we have ever slept in!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: prlanger
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Shangri-La for the third time in 12 Months. I find this the best hotel for short stays in Sydney. Walking distance to all city attractions - Bridge, Rocks, Ferries, Botanical gardens. Some of the rooms are being reno'ed. Fantastic beds. Try and get a harbour room view room for the best views in Sydney. Blu bar on level 36 is great for a drink after dark to soak in the views of the harbour.

Reviews.Title: “Might return if they built a ski lift”
Reviews.Author: gilbertandjames
Reviews.Content: Room was clean, bed was super comfy (though too soft and too low - not everyone will like that), great views of the harbour and generally a pleasant stay. On our first day, we were told that the room that we had booked was not available and that they would switch us for the 2nd night. They did switch us on the 2nd night but without the promised compensation of an upgrade to club floor and breakfast. We just lived with it as the view was already great from the lower floor that we were given and didn't plan on having breakfast anyway, but I guess it's just not nice to promise something and then not give it. The 1st room was very old and it was difficult getting the shower completely shut off so that it wouldn't drip. The 2nd room that we stayed in was on a floor where rooms were being renovated so there was an awful paint smell in the common areas and renovation noise that started at 10am. This was a renovated room, but there was not much difference apart from the shower taps working better. The worst part of staying here though must be the location. While the proximity to The Rocks and Circular Quay is excellent, getting back to the hotel involves a steep climb up the hill. I can't imagine that I would stay here again unless they built a ski lift. The Four Seasons sits at the foot of that hill, so if you are unfit like me, you might want to stay there instead.

Reviews.Title: “Yep it was worth every dollar”
Reviews.Author: indecisive123
Reviews.Content: Had the pleasure of going to Sydney to see Sting at the Opera House in February and the luck to be able to go to The Shangri La. I stayed here with my Mum in a Deluxe Grand Harbour View Room and got exactly what I paid for, but be warned it's not cheap. We had fantastic views out of our window of both the Harbour Bridge and the Opera House. I spent most of my time sat on the window seat with a glass of wine watching all the activity on the Quays. It is worth booking with breakfast as nothing is cheap in Sydney and the breakfasts were plentyful. We also got room service one night after a very hot day up in the mountains and it was lovely as good as anything you would get in a restaurant. The staff were very friendly and helpful nothing was too much trouble. The spa is fantastic, we had a lovely massage and floated out afterwards. A warning for the faint hearted the walk back from the Harbour up to the Hotel is not an easy one, it's an uphill climb with plenty of steps thrown in for good measure and on a 41 degree day it was not an easy task especially with a Mum visiting from England who is used to temperatures in the minus's in February. Having said that there are many different walks back to the Hotel and some with some lovely surprises, like the archeological dig that explains exactly what was found there. And the delightful hidden pubs and restaurants en route.

Reviews.Title: “amazing”
Reviews.Author: rochellesutton
Reviews.Content: I LOVED this hotel! I stay in Sydney frequently and I try and stay at different hotels, but admit I have some faves. This is now top of the list. The service was amazing, the room was lovely, the bed was very comfortable the bathroom took my breath away, all round it was excellent. I also had drink in the bar and dinner at the resturant, everything was top class and staff everywhere were superb, I will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: DansanScotland
Reviews.Content: We had a great time here. The staff were all efficient, courteous and very helpful. Our room was large and had a great view and was very well looked after by house-keeping. The pool and gym were also large and well looked after. Cocktails on the 36th floor as the sun set over Sydney were spectacular. The only weak area was the food in the first floor restaurant where both the food and the service coudl be improved. The hotel is also up a hill from George Street so its location may not suit everyone. However, we loved it and hope to return.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely club lounge but poor welcome and online images deceiving”
Reviews.Author: bekky-boo
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for my birthday. We have stayed in most 5 star hotels in Sydney and I must say we were disappointed. We selected a Horizon Opera City View Room for this special occasion and were very happy with the canapes and drinks provided in the club lounge. The view was beautiful. Unfortunately the same could not be said for our arrival or room... On arrival I have never been to a 5 star hotel where you are not met by the concierge to help with bags, we had to lug out bags out of the taxi ourselves and then try and figure out how to get to the club room check in. This was not the welcome we expected. If looking at the website you will notice the view they show to advertise this room is a very clear one toward the opera house with the city off to one side. The only way we were able to see the opera house from our room was by sitting in the furthest corner of the window sill. Not exactly what we thought we had paid for. The other unfortunate and totally unacceptable element of our stay was when I took a knife to the fruit supplied in our room only to discover the apple was completely ROTTEN inside!! It smelt absolutely horrible. I am so glad I had not chosen to bite into this! When I then picked this up off the tray the base of the apple was completely rotten through and liquid had built up suggesting it had been there for a VERY long time. While the staff in the horizon club are lovely and some rooms do have fantastic views the lack of service on arrival, false advertising together with rotten fruit in their most expensive club rooms is unacceptable. I would choose to stay at the Observatory or even the Sheraton on the park over this place in a heartbeat. Although these places are not blessed with the same views, the amazing staff and well described rooms are far better value.

Reviews.Title: “Great views, but great beds”
Reviews.Author: weenjoyhotels
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Horizon Club levels. The suite was great, although for a suite of this type the lounge should be comfortable not like sitting in a church pew. The bed was great as were the pillows. We had room service for dinner, although the food was great, $37.00 plus service for a burger is a bit much!!!!! We do enjoy our stays at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “What a view!”
Reviews.Author: CSGclan
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in deluxe harbour view room in July with 8 yr old son in fold up bed. Massive room. Fabulous view of opera house and circular quay with harbour bridge and beyond. Enormous double bed, the comfiest of our trip. Very clean, well equipped room. Kettle and mini bar. No faults from us. Small indoor pool with separate jacuzzi and well equipped gym. Our package did not include breafast and at that price we did nt eat at all in hotel......but am sure it would live up to rest of standard of hotel. Very short walk to circular quay for all ferry options and opera house. Does mean you are not in vicinity of darling harbour tho so be prepared to travel to other destinations. Concierge was very helpful, but surpassed himself with hotel car back to airport.......pristine BMW with suited driver for less than the cost of a taxi!

Reviews.Title: “Feel like going back home.....”
Reviews.Author: SirGoldenCircle
Reviews.Content: stayed 2 nights in this property being a golden circle member, shang property is the priority choice of my stay in any of my overseas trip. this is my first time to sydney. arrived late afternoon at sydney airport, took a train to circular quay. Althought the hotel is walking distance from the train station, to my surprise, i need to drag my heavy lugguage up a 45 degrees hill before i can reach my hotel. after the tough climbing....finally......a grand hotel is waiting for my arrival. Super posh lobby, everything is perfect. "Welcome back sir".....greetings from the front desk makes me feel like i am back to my home sweet home. room was super huge, a small living area after the entrance of the room...follow by a huge and luxury bath room and then the bedroom. plenty of amenities, dvd player, 42inch LCD TV in HD, free internet........... conclusion, keep it up shangrila, i will be back next year.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good, not as good as other 5 star hotels”
Reviews.Author: Evianah
Reviews.Content: I found hairs in the shower, and the room did not seem as clean as other hotels I have stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, great views of the harbour”
Reviews.Author: plugga_syd
Reviews.Content: Staying at the Shangri-La, The Rocks in Sydney as a weekend away was well worth the premium price tag. We purchased a package that included valet parking, breakfast and a harbour view room. The room was spacious, immaculately clean and quiet. Best of all was the view of the harbour. The higher price of the harbour facing rooms is well worth it. Breakfast was great. Friendly and knowledgeable staff are only too willing to offer assistance.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel close to circular quay.”
Reviews.Author: Kim2268
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for a weekend away. Room was clean and Opera house view was very nice. Close to circular quay and only a short walk to the Sunday markets which was also worthwhile. Executive club included drinks & canapes/snacks late afternoon which was nice as pre dinner drinks before heading out. Probably a little over priced for what you get and for the size of the room, however to be expected I guess for location. Overall a pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Best Location, Wonderful Views”
Reviews.Author: OpalGirl04
Reviews.Content: To enjoy perfect views of Sydney Harbour and amazing cocktails at Blu Bar on level 36 you wont be disappointed if you stay here. The cocktails start at approx $20; even if you enjoy one cocktail/mocktail at a window seat before going out to dinner you will set the mood for a great night - very romantic. We made sure to be there at 5pm when they opened so that we could have a window seat. We booked a harbour view with a non smoking room and although not convinced our room had always been a non smoking room (it did seem to have a smoke smell linger) we loved our room with it's wonderful views. Great location with a short walk to the Rocks Markets (from the back of the hotel) and the Opera House. Shame we will probably have to wait only another 20 years of wedded bliss to enjoy such luxury again!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location, perfect service, fantastic room”
Reviews.Author: Geographyrocks
Reviews.Content: The Shangri La certainly lives up to its name. We had a wonderful four days serving as an ideal introduction to Sydney. The location over looking the harbour is perfect and the area around the Rocks is great for accessing bridge climb, circular Quay ferries, Opera House and Botanic gardens. We stayed on floor 32 with great views of the harbour. The rooms are spacious and extremely well appointed and the staff are so helpful. You cannot fail to have a great time in what must be one of the most beautiful cities in the world. It is worthwhile upgrading to a Horizon Club room which includes breakfast - Good quality and variety, and the views are spectacular.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious Rooms, lovely view”
Reviews.Author: aquablue21
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very conveniently situated in the Rocks area, close to the harbour and all its attractions. It is an easy walk to Sydney Harbour Bridge (either the Climb or simple walk along the pedestrian path) both of which offer terrific views of the harbour. Staff were friendly and helpful. My husband and I enjoyed visiting the archaeological dig a few doors down near the YHA for an intriguing glimpse into the past. In the hotel we had an excellent view of Darling Harbour, across to Balmain.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended especially for first time Sydney visitors”
Reviews.Author: ZachT
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at the Shangri-La on two separate occasions in a week span. The first stay was actually my first visit to Sydney. I picked this hotel because of its location to the major sights and reviews. The hotel does not disappoint. My only complaint was a potential noise problem with the room during my first stay. Even though we booked a Imperial Club room, we ended up in room 2910 which is the floor below the Club. Our room was actually directly underneath the main foot traffic area of the Club, and you could easily hear the noise from dress shoes, chairs being pulled out, etc. The more frequent noise was in the evening hours, especially on the weekend, when the Club was being used most. We were not in our room much during the day and evening hours so this did not bother us. However, you should avoid this room and those in the immediate proximity if daytime/evening quietness is a must. This is my only complaint. I got the impression that if we had complained to the hotel, they would have quickly accommodated us. On the flip side, this room had a tremendous view of the Sydney Harbour including the Harbour Bridge, Rocks, ferries, and Opera House. Apparently, the actual Club rooms don't have such a direct view because the Club itself has a multi-floor atrium occupying the space. Overall, the hotel rooms are quite spacious for a large city, and include all the amenities you could possibly need. Wireless internet is even included. If you can, spring for an Imperial Club room. There are great food presentations throughout the day as well as non-alcoholic and alcoholic drinks. The Club is well staffed with very professional and courteous people. The Club has a dramatic, towering view over Sydney Harbour including the Bridge, ferry area, Rocks, and the Opera House. There is a private check-in/check-out service within the Club which is nice when the downstairs lobby gets busy. This was a great place to grab breakfast in the morning, and to relax after a long day of sight seeing or for pre-dinner cocktails. During the first stay, as mentioned, we did not have a "Club room" even though we had Club access. On the second stay, we did have a "Club room" located on the same floor as the Club entrance - the 30th floor. We had a great side view of part of the Harbour including the Opera House. There are some minor differences in the rooms such as upgraded amenities (espresso coffee and bathroom amenities). Otherwise, both rooms were equally comfortable. It is the amenities in the actual Club which make the higher price worth it. For a first time visiter, the location of the hotel to all of the major Harbour sights was priceless. We could easily walk to the Harbour Bridge, all of the pubs, shops, and restaurants in the Rocks district, the ferries, and the Opera House. Darling Harbour is an easy 10 minute walk. All of the hotel staff were extremely friendly and helpful. I would highly recommend this hotel, especially for those looking for an upscale hotel within walking distance to the major sights. I would certainly return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel and I definitely felt the luxury....will go back!!!”
Reviews.Author: nitawil
Reviews.Content: I traveled to Australia to visit family in Mildura, but I decided to stop over in Sydney for 4 days. My uncle reserved an Opera house view room for me, and I loved it! It was amazing to wake up each morning and look out my window to see the sun rising over the famous Sydney opera house. My room was very spacious and beautiful. The king bed was very comfortable, and I had no problems falling to sleep. Housekeeping did an excellent job of cleaning and restocking my room. For turn down service, a bookmark with a bit of wisdom was left on my pillow. The service was great and the concierge gave me very helpful tips about things to do in the area, places to eat, and how to get around to the places I was interested in going. Also, he gave me pointers on the order of doing things since some places close earlier than others. I ate at the restaurant in the lobby only one morning, but the blueberry muffin I had was delicious. Service in the restaurant was great too. I didn't encounter any problems during my stay. They even provided me with an adapter after mine shorted out. Very nice hotel...great place to stay when you are in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “A little bit disappointing for a Shangri la”
Reviews.Author: lvetravelling
Reviews.Content: We stayed there as a family and after a very long flight with two small children were given the wrong room with no cots nor extra beds. We were asked to go for a walk and come back in 3 hours so that a room could be ready (it was not easy with a 2 and 4 year old who just wanted to sleep...). When we came back, the matter was still not resolved so things had to be escalated to the person in charge who gave us a small suite for the family. This was a disappointing experience as the request for extra beds was done months in advance and written on the reservation room. In general, the hotel is ok but not on the top range of the Shangri la we have been to.... It is also on top of a hill in Sydney so not easy to go to if you have a stroller and kids.

Reviews.Title: “Harbour View Room - Two Thumbs Up”
Reviews.Author: lem0nade99
Reviews.Content: The view of the Harbour and Opera House were absolutely fantastic. We loved everything about this hotel, the bed was comfortable and the bathroom was top notch. The valet were extremely helpful and had our car ready when requested. This hotel was also within walking distance to the Harbour, Aquarium and Botanic Gardens.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel choice with great service”
Reviews.Author: brettnwau
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a weekend. If it fits in the budget book a harbour view or Opera house view room as they have the best views and also in the Horizon Club as these are all located on the highest floors and take advantage of the views of Sydney Harbour. Upon check in at the Horizon Club at approximately 4.00pm we had to wait close to forty-five minute wait for our room to be available. This was the only issue we had and we were well looked after in the Horizon Club during that time. Staff were friendly and attentive and went out of their way to assist and everything went smoothly. We ate in the Altitude restaurant (see separate review) and did not use the other facilities. Wireless internet is available for no charge throughout the hotel. The hotel is well located in the Rocks area and close by to a large number of tourist sites. Although rates are quite high, the staff provide good service and the hotel is well located with comfortable and well furnished rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in convenient location."”
Reviews.Author: VancouverCanadian
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two nights July 8th and 9th. I took advantage of the private driver to and from the airport which was just a little more expensive than taking a cab. For service, I would give this hotel my highest recommendation. I booked the Horizon Grand Harbour View Room. I was met at the door by Lo, I think her name was, who was very pleasant and I was told that I was being upgraded. Well, they didn't have any rooms left that were nicer than what I have booked, but there was a bottle of sparkling wine in my room and there was a significant discount off the original booking price. My room was on the 34th floor and had a wonderful view of both the harbour bridge and the Sydney Opera House. The windows were filthy but there was a card explaining that the windows were currently being cleaned. Fair enough. I loved the room itself, especially the window seat and the stunning view. Totally worth the splurge! I would concur with previous reviews that recommend going for the Horizon Club room. Good buffet breakfast and pre-dinner canapes as well. Location is easily accessible to the CBD, the Rocks and Circular Quay.

Reviews.Title: “Get a harbour view room!”
Reviews.Author: montysbestmate
Reviews.Content: If you get the chance get a higher floor harbour view room not a low floor motorway toll booth room! Room servicing is a little random and I had to ask housekeeping to service my room at 10 pm! Good helpful and charming reception and concierge staff. Overpriced and pretentious restaurant but usual for a so called 4* hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing - not up to Shangri-La standard”
Reviews.Author: wockinwod
Reviews.Content: Had a weekend stay at a very heavily booked Shangri-La Sydney at a Horizon Club Opera House City View Room. Check-in was fine and they noted that my Jade membership was not in the system. Received various other extras from booking through Amex Fine Hotels & Resorts, except the room upgrade as they were fully booked. No hassle with that as I still believe you cannot rely on getting the upgrade. Biggest disappointment was the view from the room. Although it is described as an "Opera House City View", certainly our view was of the city and you needed to get right up to the window to see the Opera House to the left. I have to say the room description is a bit mis-leading - think they should swap the name around. If you want the harbour view, book a Grand Harbour View Room. The room itself was fine - stock standard five star style hotel fittings - very inoffensive. The bathroom is a great size with a separate bath and shower and lovely L'Occitane toiletries. The bed itself was very comfortable and resulted in a great night's sleep. The Horizon Club has a fantastic view but is looking a little bland and tired. Food offering at breakfast was adequate for a club flooe but the scrambled eggs were very powdery. Coffee was decent and good attention from the staff. Also visited during afternoon tea and was presented with a lacklustre selection of food which half way through started to look a little sparse! Thankfully the evening cocktails and canapes is a whole different experience. There is a great range of red and white wines on offer as well as spirits. The food is pretty good and refreshed often. The staff were wonderful and engaging making sure that drinks were topped up. We did try "The Mix" on level 1 for breakfast and it was very busy and crowded. Although a wider selection than the Club, it was not that different. I felt a bit sorry for the egg chef who was overrun with orders - perhaps two should be there on a busy weekend. It was a bit too noisy for us not helped by the fact it was school holidays. Also had dinner at Altitude 36 which was a delight. They have a four or seven course dinner menu on the weekends which is good value and more than enough food. There is also a great wine list. The service was both attentive whilst being unobtrusive and the view was once again, wonderful. Having stayed at other Shangri-La properties I was incredibly underwhelmed by the general ambiance of the hotel and some of the attitude of the staff. They did not handle a couple of the other issues we faced very well and there was no attempt at service recovery, so a bit disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “amazing view and gorgeous hotel”
Reviews.Author: tanchar
Reviews.Content: we were lucky enough to have 2 free rooms for one night thru frequent flier miles. unfortunatley, we only got to enjoy it for a short stay, from 5 pm til 10 am, due to our flights. The hotel lobby is beautiful, and check in was a breeze. Our room, on the 16th floor, had a perfect view of the opera house. could have just sat in the window and looked out for the room for hours. the room was beautiful and the bathroom amazing.we did go up for a drink on the top floor. it was the most expensive drinks and coffee we have ever had, but the view was worth it! we found the prices for meals at the hotel very high, and went down the street to get some snacks. we were just too tired from travelling to venture out for dinner that night, and besides, hated to leave the room! walked down to the harbour the next morning, and wished we had another day in sydney. its a beautiful big city, but the harbour front area has a compact, small city feel. did not get to tour the opera house, but hope to get back to sydney, and more of australia, in the futre. would highly recommend the hotel if you have the money, or the frequent flier points, to stay there. also, the free wifi internet was a welcome treat after paying everywhere else we went.

Reviews.Title: “Check your Credit Card Statement!!!!”
Reviews.Author: andersoncolin1
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on our honeymoon, it is a nice hotel but the service was lacking on the front desk. The room was clean and the view was good. The major downside is that i settled the bill prior to departure by cash and once we returned back to the UK, they had charged part of this ammount to our credit card. I have been back a week sent 3 emails to both the hotel and Head office and still not had a response. Needless to say im very annoyed at there lack of service and will never be staying there again. I would advise anyone to think twice before leaving a Credit Card imprint with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “It was ok. Windows are dirty”
Reviews.Author: garyfong
Reviews.Content: I had a nice room facing the Opera House and the Bridge. Hard to see through it because the windows were pretty dirty. The room is sparse with decorations, but the property itself is nice with a great location. Concierge was GREAT - super knowledgeable and fast-thinkers. FREE INTERNET this is a huge plus in this competitive market.

Reviews.Title: “Faultless”
Reviews.Author: Nikross
Reviews.Content: My partner & I spent a night in a premier grand harbour view room, to celebrate our anniversary. The whole experience was perfect, the room & the view were worth paying extra for. Highly recommend for a special occasion/celebration.

Reviews.Title: “not my Shangri-la...”
Reviews.Author: stevenbkk
Reviews.Content: More of an upscale business hotel than a traditionally excellent Shangri-La. Great location, great breakfast, great views from my room. Average room, average service at front desk. Poor lobby design as well as poor management of flow of traffic. Place feels well below 4-stars at arrival and check-in. Dinner was average. Breakfast was the saviour for hotel experience. For the price could be much better.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel - great location”
Reviews.Author: rachel1372
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Shangri-la for two weeks during a work trip to Sydney. I took my small family along for the company... so partly work, partly pleasure. The hotel was really clean, modern, with good service and a great location, surrounded by many fabulous restaurants and bars, all within a 5-10 minute walk to the hotel. We had a large room with two beds - not quite singles but smaller than doubles - so it wasn't possible to actually sleep with my spouse. We were on business rates though and that was all that was left apparently. The view was decent, towards Darling Harbour.... I can imagine the other side of the hotel must have had stunning views towards Sydney Harbour. The hotel is located on the top of a very steep hill. Be warned, you can take the lift down a floor past the lobby and go out of an exit which alleviates you needing to walk up a (seemingly) 90 degree incline. We only realised this on our last few days - pushing our 2 year old up that hill in the push chair is probably the only reason I didn't gain weight during the visit! The hotel didn't have much of a vibe when we were there. It would have been nice to have something going on to make it feel like a place you wanted to relax after work. The top floor bar was rather spectacular and I've been told the views are better than the Four Seasons. Having said that, the cocktails were great, the food was rather poor. I wouldn't recommend eating there. I'd recommend the Shangri-la. The people were great, and it really is a rather attractive property. It is perfect for business. P.S. There are some great restaurants in the area - Pony, The Wine Odyssey, Wildfire... just to name a few....esp if you are on expenses. Sydney prices are not for the faint hearted!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic but expensive”
Reviews.Author: aussieloz88
Reviews.Content: This hotel in undoubtedly fantastic. The views are breathtaking, and the rooms are huge, well decorated and very clean. Staff are great. Cocktail bar is very nice and well worth a visit. However if you want to go any where prepare to do a bit of a walk as it is not exactly close to many of Sydney's attractions other then the bridge, opera house etc. It is also very pricey.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for great view”
Reviews.Author: June_198030
Reviews.Content: We had a room facing the opera house and it was great. The only problem we had was the service. Few staff were great but some were rude.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing staff and amazing view”
Reviews.Author: gardkarlsen
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay at Shangri-La in Sydney as it looked like it had a good location and as we are Golden Circle Jade members. We took a taxi into the hotel from the airport and in the lobby area there was a long line of people waiting to check in and out. But we asked one of the staff and we were sent to the horizon lounge on level 30 were we got a great welcome by the lovely Emily. There was a line of people waiting there as well but at least there we could sit down after a long flight and relax while waiting for the check in. And what a view there is from the Horizon lounge on the 30th floor! I think this must be one of the best locations and views in Sydney as we had a great view to Sydney Harbor Bridge and the opera house from the lounge. We enjoyed some coffee and juice in the lounge while Emily checked us in and I got room 3417. I booked this online and I had to pay 305 AUD for the room â€“ as we were booking my colleague got the last room on the Horizon level (executive level) but when we checked in I got a complimentary upgrade to Horizon level. It was also possible for me to pay to get access to the horizon lounge but as I where there with a colleague it was sufficient that he had access. My room was located on the 34th floor and it looked good at first glance. A hallway lead into the room and the bathroom and wardrobe was to the left. The room had a soft and light brownish carpet and the main item in the room was of course the bed with a golden bedspread. There were two chairs with a small table and on one of the walls there was a desk for working and a small desk that contained some fruits that I got and underneath was a small fridge. The wardrobe contained hangers, a safe and a robe. The bathroom was old school with yellowish tiles and patterns on the floor. But there was both a shower corner and a bathtub and the amenities included shaving kit, toothbrush, emery boards, bath salt etc etc. The shampoo and shower gel was very nice and I enjoyed them during my stay. The best part of the room was maybe the incredible view. Located on the 34th floor I had a view towards the harbor including the opera house and I could see the sun rise every morning â€“ just incredible. The location of the hotel was pretty good at least for me as I was working in the city center. And from the hotel it is only a couple of minutes walk to â€œThe rocksâ€� area and down to the harbor. We used the lounge quite a lot as we were working there after the regular work hours. The staff in the lounge on the 30th floor was just great â€“ we experienced service that we normally just experience in Asian countries. A bit thank you to Emily, Jasmine, Jerry, Alexis and so on for being so generous to us. At night there is complimentary drinks and snacks from 6 to 8 and it is always a bit tempting to have some â€“ the stuff they had to eat was quite delicious so be careful to not eat too much if you want to enjoy a dinner later on. They were also very, very generous with the drinks and they had various wines to offer â€“ but a word of advice to the staff: you should be careful calling the Australian sparkling wine for Champagne ;-). We also had breakfast in the lounge and they had a small selection of stuff that you need for breakfast there. We had to leave the hotel early one morning to fly back home and we left at 5.30 AM. When we came to the lobby they said that we could get the hotel car to take us for 50 AUD in a big BMW X6 â€“ we used this offer as it was the same that we paid the taxi when going from the airport to the hotel. But there are always some things that can be improved. The lounge is located on the 30th floor and stretches up to 34th floor. Iâ€™m not sure if this was the problem but it was more or less always freezing in the lounge and we were sitting around with jackets on. We told the staff several times but as it was central heating there was not much they could do about it. The lifts were also a bit moody â€“ some would read the cards to get to my level and some would not, some would indicate when arriving at a floor and some not. And I did not get the small things that I'm entitled to as a Jade member but it didn't really matter - I was just happy with the room upgrade. All in all this was a great hotel experience. The rooms might be a bit too old school for me but they seemed to be in good condition. I also enjoyed the view, the complimentary wi-fi in the room and lounge and the incredible staff in the lounge. Travels would be so much fun if all hotels were like this.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional experience... will definitely be repeated!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Vickie60
Reviews.Content: This really is "the best of the best". From the ultimate location of the Hotel, the friendly and professional manner of all the staff, and the impeccable detail of the hotel features and services this was a truly memorable stay. The value of "The Horizon Club" was well worth it and I cannot recommend this indulgence high enough. "Perfect in every way"!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: ducky80
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 days as part of our honeymoon and we are so glad we chose this hotel. The location is perfect as it is only a 5 minute walk from Circular Quay. We also walked to Darling Harbour during the day which took about 20 minutes. There is a taxi rank directly outside the front entrance of the hotel if you dont want to walk at night. We had breakfast included in our stay. The breakfast was excellent. There was a great selection of breads, hams and cheeses, fruits, cerals and hot food. There was also omelettes made to order. You eat as much as you wanted. The staff here were excellent and after one day didnt even need to ask if you wanted tea or coffee and brought your preference from the day before. One issue with the breakfast is the fact that there are alot of business people here who think they are better than you. One morning we were seated at the window and we both got up to get our food. When we returned a woman and her dining partner had uprooted from their table and planted themselves in our seats even though our coffee was sitting there. Obviously the window table was not available when they came down. The staff were busy trying to get a table ready for us and kept apologising. This was not their fault...just 2 ignorant people who think they are above normal human beings. The staff at breakfast are excellent. The room we had was excellent. We had a great view over Circular Quay and the Opera House. The room was spacious and the The Bathroom was huge with a bath and a walk in shower. We even had a bottle of sparkling wine left in our room the first 2 nights of our stay. We used the spa one of the days. We just went for a quick swim and then spent 20 mins in the jacuzzi. There was people using the gym and this looked adequately equipped. The spa was very clean. I also used the sauna. My only complaint here would be that the sauna is not communal. My wife and I could not use it together. I had to access teh sauna through the mens changing room. I guess the females have their own also. We went for a drink to the Blu bar on the 36th floor. This is a must if even for one drink. We were lucky to get a seat at the window. The view is amazing. The setting is very fancy and modern, however the price for drink is very reasonable for Sydney which we found to be a very expensive city. We both had cocktails then I had a beer and the wife had a glass of champagne before we had to leave for dinner reservations. One complaint I would have would be the attitude of the member of staff who checked us out. After having excellent service all week from everyone...when we checked out I felt we were just discarded. As if there is no need for effort now as we are leaving. This was dissappointing. But we really enjoyed our stay and really reccommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great view of opera house and circle quay - Helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Stulev
Reviews.Content: we were of 13th floor (about half way to top) gave us great view of the opera house and circular quay - great location 2 blocks from George and 3 from Pitt Streets, buses trains and ferries - Rocks district just down the road - Large comfortable room helpful staff and good restaurant buffet a bet expensive as are most restaurants in Australia but great food. Free internet and WIFI

Reviews.Title: “Picture Perfect”
Reviews.Author: jason_kk_chua
Reviews.Content: Stayed 19/06/11. Requested a grand harbor view to take pictures of the opera house and Sydney harbor bridge. Thank you to the management for finding a room. The position of the hotel allows wonderful pictures to be taken of Sydney harbor. More importantly, waking up in the morning to watch the sunrise with my partner was truly an experience. Priceless!! Cons: Could not find Ipod dock.

Reviews.Title: “Pictures don't lie, great rooms and view”
Reviews.Author: Tracy33
Reviews.Content: This was a business reward trip. It was full of trips to the Blue Mountains, exploring, kangaroos, beach trips, and finding the true oldest bar in Sydney. We also had an amazing evening at the Opera House among other places. As far as the hotel, very clean and well maintained. The bed was very comfortable after a long flight and a bad bed our first night. The bathroom is just amazing. I don't know if I would have picked tbis out myself due to the cost, but it's worth the money. Wish we would splurged our first night when we had to pay for our room! I would go back, but luckily it was a memory that will last a lifetime. Great bars and restaurants there too and in walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular Horizon Club”
Reviews.Author: york_701
Reviews.Content: The best thing about the Shangri-La was the spectacular Horizon Club and the charming staff. What an amazing view of Sydney spread out below, and a great place for an evening drink. The staff we encountered throughout the hotel were all polished and efficient. We arrived at 9am after an overnight flight and were delighted to find that our room was ready. The room had a wonderful easterly view across the Opera House out to the heads but was quite small and looked really dated. The bathroom is particularly ordinary. However, I would stay here again for the service, and the amazing views from the Club.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fantastic hotel- will be back again and again”
Reviews.Author: megpowis
Reviews.Content: The staff at the Shangri La make the visit. They are all polite, professional, well presented and can't do enough to help you. The room we had was fabulous with harbour views, separate lounge and a huge bathroom with a view over the harbour as well. It was quite an experience to have a bath whilst watching the commuters in their cars below! The room was probably due for a refurb as the furniture had some obvious wear and tear but the presentation was immaculate and the cleanliness could not have been improved upon so it was not an issue at all. The only annoying thiing was the "executive check in" we had to go up to florr 30 to check in which is fine but you should be able to check in at the main desk too! Also worth a mention is the excellent concierge service- we had a very good experience at a restaurant sourced by the concierge on duty. Last but by no means least was the breakfast, this has to be quite possibly the best breakfast I've ever had! I ate enough to last me all day!

Reviews.Title: “an absolute must”
Reviews.Author: MarkL4
Reviews.Content: After travelling from Melbourne to Sydney in a campervan for 10 days, we decided that we would treat ourselves to a bit of luxury before our flight back to UK. We stayed at the Shangri-La for 3 nights and from start to finish was the most amazing experience we have ever had. The staff could not have been more helpful, the restaurants were incredible (I would personally recommend the Buffet in the Altitude restaurant, which was out of this world!). The room was massive and the views were just the best we could have wished for. I would reccomend this hotel to anyone who like luxury. The location was also 5*!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Vivich
Reviews.Content: One of the best hotel I've ever did. My sister and I went there for Christmas, and the staff was full of attention for their guests. The room we choose had the most beautiful view of the Sydney Harbour Bridge and the Opera House. It was very clean and very comfortable as well. It is a real 5 star hotel and we spend a very good stay and I highly recommand it.

Reviews.Title: “Superb location - super hotel and staff.”
Reviews.Author: countryweekender
Reviews.Content: Another child-free weekend away for this couple. This time to celebrate our 13th wedding anniversary - so two nights this time! Bliss! Checked into a Horizon Club Opera House view room. Lovely being up so high - great sized room, luxurious furnishings - everything felt clean, new and up to date. No tired decor or need of an update here. One of our favourite rooms out of the 5 stars we've stayed in Sydney so far. Little bit disappointed in the atmosphere at the Horizon Club - it doesn't have the exclusive feeling of the Sheraton's club. It was a very busy weekend at the Shangri-la and they only just coped in the Horizon Club, food kept running out, but staff maintained their friendly demeanour throughout. The Shangri-la staff really do deserve a special mention - I'm not sure who trained them, but they did a superlative job. They're not only friendly, but informative, smiley, professional and mostly very attractive looking! Only one trip up in our stay - we asked our concierge to find us a Japanese restaurant open for lunch on Saturday - I asked him to check on Sake Bar and Restaurant, which he did and said it was closed. We walked past it after lunching at Doyles, and it was open after all! We had lunch at Sake the next day and it was delicious (as was lunch at Doyles by the way). Back to the Shangri-la - I mustn't forget the breakfast - absolutely first rate. Fresh eggs benedict cooked on demand! Plus fresh pancakes cooked to order. Again, it was extremely busy - but they managed admirably. Go for drinks at the Blu bar - best view in Sydney and excellent cocktails. This is the kind of hotel you don't have to leave... and we hardly did. We will continue on our quest to find Sydney's best luxury hotel - but this would have to be in our top 3 so far. TBC....

Reviews.Title: “Two words - "the view"”
Reviews.Author: kerwei
Reviews.Content: I'll be honest... there is only one perfectly good reason why you would stay at the Shang - the view. My wife and I took out the Premier Grand Harbour View Room for our wedding weekend. We live in Sydney so I'll stick my neck out and say that harbour views wise - hands down the best. Better than Park Hyatt and edges the Four Seasons Hotel. Don't get me wrong. The hotel's great. Clean, professional. Only problem is, save for the view, the rooms are pretty much standard fare. I personally think the "Shang" designs are a little dated (in particular, the bathrooms). Seen one, seen them all (having said that, it is a chain). In short, if you are thinking views of the harbour, stay here. If that is not important, there are better value options.

Reviews.Title: “Horizon club room â€“ well worth the extra money”
Reviews.Author: Mr_and_Mrs_Flowers
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on our honeymoon, in an Horizontal Club room over looking the Opera house and harbour. The room was serviced twice a day. We also got a free bottle of wine and chocolates to celebrate being on our honeymoon from the hotel. Room was very large with a huge bathroom to match. Horizon Club room is well worth the extra money with access to a specific club room for breakfast and cocktail hour (2 hours). The Staff at this hotel were so amazing we can not thank them enough for all their help though our stay going above and beyond the standard we have seen in other hotels. Horizon club staff member Alexis recommend so many places for us to visit during our stay we are so glad we followed her advise to see the best places. Definitely a five star hotel!

Reviews.Title: “loved everything”
Reviews.Author: stagcoop
Reviews.Content: had 5 nights in a club horizon king room, well worth every penny, rooms very spacious, huge bed so comfortable, extremely quiet couldnt here anyone else. great views of the harbour, staff in the club lounge excellent nothing to much trouble, we had breakfast there every morning sat up there for 2 hours just looking at the amazing harbour and then at night drinks and nibbles and more views of the opera house and bridge, and no rain which was great, weather was perfect. gym is huge,lots of equipment, but freezing cold, my husband loved the sauna. staff all very friendly, helpful and very professional. we had dinner at altitude and it was fantastic got a table by the window the waiter was excellent he knew his stuff, not pushy at all just very well trained and professional, coming from w.a. where its rare to find a waiter thats so obviously well trained. we stayed there and ate and drank and gazed at the view of twinkling lights on the harbour for 4 hours,it was very special. the buffet breakfast we had one morning downstairs and it was also first class heaps of choice and all staff very nice. so 5 star. so shangri la. paid $325.00 per night. bargain!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “The most outstanding hotel I have stayed in within Australia”
Reviews.Author: Peak_Performer
Reviews.Content: Wow, what a hotel. From the marble finished bathroom, to large TV screens, to extra comfy bed, the Hotel Shangri La in Sydney is an amazing hotel. This hotel is situated near Circular Quay and the Rocks and is adequate location for getting around town. The view from my room was directly looking onto the Harbour bridge, but looking past that, it was a nice view of parts of the harbour. Definately would stay her again when in Sydney Parking was a little steep at $50 night (valet only available - no self park)

Reviews.Title: “The perfect location”
Reviews.Author: dschwarzbrott
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had a lovely 3 day stay at the Shangri La. The location was fantastic...only 10 minutes to Circular Quay, where you want to be to take advantage of ferries, trains, buses, etc. We took the ferry from there to Taronga Zoo and had a wonderful full day there. As others have pointed out, be aware that there is a very steep hill to manage on your walk back from the Quay. Good exercise, but you have to be able to walk uphill! You can cut off the last portion of the hill by entering the back door of the hotel. We were very impressed with the beautiful marble bathroom with a rain showerhead, full tub and hair dryer with diffuser. Converters and adaptors are available from housekeeping. Also, from housekeeping, you can request any type of pillow, including an anti-snore pillow which worked out just great! King size bed was extremely comfortable and luxurious. Hotel features a business lounge area where there are four computers available for use with free wifi access--a real plus! One tip--there is a wonderful little restaurant called Brew which is very good and inexpensive for breakfast. Located only 2 blocks away down hill and make right on Harrington St. then 1/2 block down on right. Only 5 minute walk to Bridge Climb. That was the best event that we did while in Sydney. If you are not afraid of heights, don't miss the Bridge Climb!! Hotel staff was extremely friendly and helpful, especially the Concierge. We loved our stay at the Shangri La. It is a bit pricey, but well worth it .

Reviews.Title: “Definately the best hotel room in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Ramon58
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Shangri-la Sydney for 4 nights in a grand harbour view room. We shopped around and finally decided to pay the rate due to the view and location. It was 100% worth it! The view of Sydney was spectacular, with harbour bridge on one side and the opera house on the other, with nearly floor to ceiling windows on two walls, absolutely stunning. You feel like you are part of the city and can see every angle of its beauty. The hotel management was superior and professional and extremely attentive to all our requests. We had one dinner at Altitude Restaurant and the John Dory was superb! We had requested a window table and got it, with floor to ceiling windows and views that are unbeatable for Sydney. We would never choose another hotel to stay in, and we can honestly say that if you are going to Sydney for holiday, this is the optimal place to stay. The room we stayed in was sumptuous in furnishings, amenities, etc. and there is a great pool and jacuzzi and gym. Internet in the lobby lounge was fast, free and also fast and free in the room. This was a great find!

Reviews.Title: “Conveyor Belt.”
Reviews.Author: MisterBen
Reviews.Content: After a gruelling 24 hours flying to get there, we were given a room we had not asked for, which had a cot in it, had not been serviced, was dirty, and had 1/2 an opened bottle of wine lying around - with no view of the harbour, bridge and opera house that we had booked. Staff took ages to fix the room, and when asked for a replacement bottle of wine, they failed to get back to us and said they would drop one off the next morning so we said don't bother (as we wanted a drink before going to bed that first night). After some repetitive complaining to the so called manager, they put us in the correct room but no apology offered for the messy arrival. Views were good. Breakfast was OK, service pretty much non-existent, got more service from the bell staff - they at least said hello to their guests... Food in restaurant on top floor was great, but spolied on our last night by the head waiter who decided to argue over a bill when asked/challenged that he had actiually got wrong - he was persisitent in being a complete TW*T in front of everyone present - so we just walked away in the end (over a difference of $12). Not five star and nothing special - just another conveyor belt hotel for people who are stupid enough to stay there, yawn. There's a much better hotel just opposite / next door as I found out when I got there.... at least I know for next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience...I love It”
Reviews.Author: rajruhil
Reviews.Content: This is in the heart of the city near opera house. If You want a room with a view, you're not going get better than this ultramodern hotel with a touch of Asia. It's just a 5-minute walk from Circular Quay. Try to book a room on the 21th floor or above: From here, Sydney beauty and its harbor are laid out at your feet, with ferries buzzing around below you like bathtub toys. All rooms are fully furnished and rely on the views perhaps more than the decoration to impress. The top five room floors, from level 29 to 34, have use of the Horizon Club lounge. This supplies breakfast and evening canapÃ©s. The trendy CafÃ© Mix, on level one, serves breakfasts and has a good lunch and dinner buffet with Contemporary and Asian-style meals (including Japanese). Also here is The Rocks Teppanyaki restaurant, which serves good Japanese cuisine. The stylish Altitude restaurant and Blue Horizon Bar (both on the 36th floor) have panoramic harbor bridge views. The associated historic Harts Pub, at street level, offers a lunchtime Aussie barbecue in the beer garden Tuesdays to Fridays. I rate this one of the best experience while in Sydney...

Reviews.Title: “The only place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Stuweb
Reviews.Content: We love this hotel. The view, the room, the service! What more can I say. Thank you for another great night away

Reviews.Title: “Towering over Sydney”
Reviews.Author: tripstyler
Reviews.Content: Quite literally, the Shangri-la towers over Sydney, especially if you eat at the bar, lounge or restaurant on the hotel's 36th floor! I wasn't sure what to expect at the Shangri-la, thinking it would be a typical 5-star with tired 'hotel style', but I was wrong, and my stay was wonderful from check-in to check-out. The amenities at the hotel are plentiful and the design is tasteful. We arrived tired and got placed into a gorgeous harbor-view {of opera house and bridge} room on the 18th floor. The bedrooms and bathrooms are spacious, and the hotel staff are gracious and kind. It was the perfect way to end 3 weeks in Australia; on a high note. What to know - rooms are bigger than average {for int'l hotels} - complimentary wifi {not common in sydney} - great mix of low-key and be-seen restaurants and bars on premises, however, the hotel is also located in the Rocks area of Sydney, a great area with lots of restaurants - the manley pavilion and bondi iceberg, both 30-mins away, are great destination places to eat if you want to get out of town - walkable to/from circular quay train strop {7-10 mins} if you have carry-on luggage, bigger luggage will require a taxi

Reviews.Title: “A high quality experience”
Reviews.Author: MarkDip
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Shangri La for a combined birthday and anniversary treat on one the deals offered. It included valet parking, complimentary champagne and buffet breakfast. Grand harbour view was mesmerising at dusk, viewedfrom the comfortable armchairs. Rooms comfortable and clean. Breakfast was terrific. Well done to Shangri La for offering free wireless internet to it's guests, I'm always disappointed that other hotels in Sydney (and Australia) don't provide this as standard. Overall, an enjoyable and memorable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel -- Definitely worth the money :)”
Reviews.Author: southerntraveler1989
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Sydney for the last 5 days of my Australian adventure. By the time I got there, I had enough of traveling -- 30 days, 8 flights, over 3000 kms driving etc..... I unpacked my bags, had a great view (22nd floor -- yes it cost more but, boy, was it worth it!!!), and great location. The only downside was that you had to walk up Essex Street to get there when you were walking back from the Quay area. :) But at least it keeps you in shape. This was less than a 15 minute walk from the Opera House and 10 minutes from the Quay. I had a 9:55 bridge climb and it took less than 5 minutes to get there. The bed was super comfortable. The internet was free. The shower was powerful and the bathroom clean. I couldn't have asked for a better ending to my Aussie adventure. Also the bar on the top floor was great. If you can't stay here definitely check it out.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: sfergo
Reviews.Content: I always try to find something to complain about in these things but I found no faults. Everything was perfect, the staff were very helpful and friendly and the breakfast (although expensive...in other hotels the hot food buffet is $35) was delicious. The view was great as well. I think this is the quietest hotel room I have stayed at in Sydney. I heard some rumbling from the heating but ear plugs took care of that. I only heard guests talking loudly at around 8 and usually I hear the TV or something but not here. So I will definitely stay here again next time I make plans to stay in Sydney. Oh and the free WI FI was great, lots of hotels make you pay to use the Internet. So that was another nice surprise.

Reviews.Title: “Great upscale hotel in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: Beth395
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Shangri La for 4 nights on the last leg of our Australian adventure. We arrived and checked in early without problem. Our luggage was delivered to our room by the bellman. King room on the 10th floor facing "Darling Harbour" which really overlooked the highway and tollbooths to the Sydney Harbour Bridge. BUT, if you look beyond that you can see the water. Oh well not every room can have a great view and we did not pay for a harbor view, just a standard room. Plently of viewing was done from places all around Sydney, and not worth it to us to pay more for the room. Room: King bed, but this was definitely 2 mattresses pushed together. They were plush and comfy, but I could feel a bit of the divide in the middle (a dip!). Two sitting chairs and small table, desk and desk chair, large flat screen tv. Bathroom was amazing! Large sink, soaking tub, glass stall shower. Service: Concierge was helpful with directions to restaurants, shops, etc. Turn down service nightly in the rooms - yeah baby! Slippers and robes! Not chocolates but a Shangri La bookmark left on your pillow. Location: An excellent location in The Rocks, despite that hill! There are hills everywhere really, no way to avoid it. A little tough when you are done for the night and on your way back is all. We did cab it from the Opera house to the Shang one night for $10 (in the rain). Very convenient to the BridgeClimb center, a short walk down to Circular Quay. Blu Bar on 36th Floor: Upscale, expensive drinks, but excellent views! Had to wait a few minutes for a table to open up but there is a standing bar area if no lounge tables are available. Overall: Great location, great service! Highly reccomend! You are in Sydney - go for it!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and spectacular views”
Reviews.Author: Inverugie
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel for two days on the 13-15th of May 2011. We found the staff at the reservation area to be very helpful and also gave us an upgrade which was rather unexpected. The room was large and we had a view of the Opera House and the Harbor Bridge. The only thing was that the room was a little "tired" otherwise we were very happy with what we were given. We also found that the meals and drinks were rather expensive so we ventured to eat somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in an amazing location”
Reviews.Author: MsVictoria
Reviews.Content: On arrival we were greeted very warmly and were given a free upgrade to a full harbour view as I was celebrating my 40th B'day while I was there.
