The room was spacious, clean, the beds were super comfortable, the bathroom was large and had a bath and separate shower and the view was amazing. The hotel has free wifi everywhere, the gym was well equipped but there were a couple of machines that were not working. The swimming pool, jacuzzi, sauna and changing rooms were immaculate and all towels and toiletries provided. On the day of my B'day the hotel sent up a cake which was to die for and very much appreciated. The breakfasts were very good with so much choice and variety. The eggs benedict was a particular fave. All the staff were friendly and very helpful. I thoroughly enjoyed my stay and would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “picture perfect view”
Reviews.Author: jules8556
Reviews.Content: First off the review below is well off my experience. I stayed yesterday for my birthday and mothers day and our experience was fabulous we couldn't wait to tell our family and friends about our stay. We had a corner room on the 26th floor room 2613. When I saw the number 13, I was a little shaken but when we walked down the hall of our room we just couldn't believe our eyes the view was everything I hoped for and more we could see both the Harbour Bridge and the Opera House and all the way up and down the harbour. Yes it is beside a freeway as the previous reviewer stated and up a hill but at no time did I hear any noise inside the hotel and we swam in the pool (indoor)which is directly beside the so called freeway and ate breakfast beside the expressway still no outside noise. Yes it is up a hill but I am overweight and 55 and didn't mind the walk because as the hotel is up that same hill is the reason we had such a superb view. People from all over the world hope they will be able to see those views when they come to Sydney we live here and have dreamed of that view and yesterday we got it. Our package was on first inspection very expensive but we wanted something special so we took a package that cost A$578 Premier Grand Harbour View Celebration but it came with breakfast, valet parking, Moet Champagne and $150 food and beverage pack we sipped champagne over a couple of hours in our room had cocktails and a plate of olives and fetta in the bar on the 36th floor whilst listening to a three piece band. We then went down to our room to enjoy the night views and order a romantic room service meal of lamb cutlets (delicious)with more wine from the mini bar served yes beside the window and yes those views. I don't know the level of the other reviewers room but the hotel web site is quite truthful our room was exactly how it was pictured it was spotless the bathroom the same I had a relaxing bath as well as a shower during our stay without problem I don't know if our room has been renovated I don't really believe so as the bathroom was quite conservative. All the staff we interacted with where friendly and helpful we have just returned from Asia in March and we both agreed that this stay although very short was really enjoyable and no long travelling when we broke down all the cost we realised our room only cost around $200 after all the extras were taken out a bargain really for a five star hotel. I am going to recommend this hotel to others just choose the room type carefully there a a number that have Circular quay harbour views and they differ in prices. There is a big difference between Darling harbour and Circular Quay I have now stayed a both quay views are worth the extra.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious comfort, great views, great location; recommended!”
Reviews.Author: galtons
Reviews.Content: The Shangri-La is located in The Rocks, a good tourist area, where one can walk to and along the harbour easily (10 minutes to Circular Quay) and can also walk into the city main shopping centre near Town Hall in 15 minutes. We had a King Opera view room; as the name implies the view is of the Opera House and Circular Quay and the eastern suburbs harbour but note that this is not a view of the harbour bridge and the north shore. As others have commented, the decor of the walls and carpet are a bit old fashioned but everything else is of modern, 5 star standard - the room is very spacious and is extremely well appointed, as is the large, marble bathroom. Couldn't hear any noise from any other rooms or from the streets nearby and had a magnificent sleep in a really comfortable bed. The lobby area is very extensive and welcoming and includes some quiet outdoor space as well as some complimentary internet access computers. There is a large gym and a medium size indoor pool with some outdoor lounge chairs next to the pool. One can really enjoy the facilities of this hotel. One of the best restaurants in Sydney is on the 36th floor of the hotel, Altitude, and it is highly recommended for the great food but also because you can enjoy what I believe would be just about the best views in Sydney. Only the front facing rooms of the hotel would also have this completely stunning view (if booking, these would be the "grand harbour" rooms). There are lots of touristy shops and cafes nearby if you walk down the stairs out the back of the hotel from the lower ground floor, worth a wander but most of the cafes are ordinary; it is worth making your way to the Fine Food Store inside The Rocks shopping centre; less than 10 minutes walk from the Shangri-La for an excellent breakfast or lunch and great coffee. Final tip; ask the concierge to direct you to the Observatory Point garden (less than 10 minutes walk from the hotel but not as easy to get to as you have to through a subway under the highway but it is highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Look at who gave it a 5 - they are plants with only a few reviews”
Reviews.Author: jimnick
Reviews.Content: This is a 3.5 star hotel not 5 even after the rehab, Stayed in a rehabbed room, upgraded because I joined their club. This is one of fhe more expensive hotels in town so you expect a great experience. Take a look at my review of the Bangkok JW that is a 5 star hotel. First 1/2 of the hotel rooms overlook a 12 lane highway, a dock and the water in the background. The highway sound comes in especially at night and I was on the 12th floor. The other side looks over a 4 lane road. The old infrastructure does not work even with the cosmetic changes. I have lots of examples here are a few - I complained 3 times to have the heat turned on. I slept with 2 blankets and the robe on to keep warm each of the three nights. Every time it was fixed it switched back to AC only. The shower head fell down so it was at shoulder height. They fixed it twice never stayed up. They charged $165 for checking in early at 10Am which I will dispute. The hotel is a steep hike from anywhere since it is surrounded by highways. The people that have only 2 reviews on this hotel are obvious plants. It is a hike a rough one to anything to do including a nice restaurant, a ferry etc. Why would you stay here versus the Intercontinentel or the Hyatt on the Park. My client booked this hotel - never again. Back to the very good Intercon.

Reviews.Title: “Top view and top concierge”
Reviews.Author: HKasyouare
Reviews.Content: LOCATION: Easy to find by car. A short walk to the Rocksâ€™ entertainment zone. HOTEL: A very good hotel, clean, though a bit dated. Spacious and bright rooms with great views of the Sydney Opera House and the Harbour Bridge. The front desk staff is capable than most top hotels in Australia, but it still has a long way to go compared with its Bangkok counterpart. Check-in is surprisingly slow. The Head Concierge is definitely one of the most competent concierges I have ever met. He is fast, efficient, extremely professional and his advices are very accurate. CONCLUSION: The hotel is centrally located, but it needs a renovation. Rooms facing the Sydney Harbour have fantastic views. In the end what makes this hotel special is its Head Concierge. When you do not have much time to plan your trip, it really does help to get good advice from a competent concierge.

Reviews.Title: “Sensational Views”
Reviews.Author: Max357
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Shangri-la Hotel last year for our anniversery. Was a beautitul hotel, magnificent picture perfect views you could just take home and hang on your wall. Nice and modern luxury, immacuatley clean. You really pay for what you get. Also the bar is a great place to have a cocktail or two

Reviews.Title: “A Five Star Experience”
Reviews.Author: Dianna_04
Reviews.Content: Our two nights staying in a Premier Grand Harbour View Room met all our expectations. We were warmly welcomed at 10.00 am by the reception staff and were fortunate that our room was ready then. Our room on the 12th floor was exactly as the hotel web site had depicted in photographs; it was large and beautifully appointed. One small improvement would be to provide a small dining table with comfortable dining chairs that would make for a better dining experience when ordering in room service. The bed has a luxuriously thick duvet and no top sheet. As this makes for very hot sleeping we did ask for a top sheet and light blanket which came quickly. Ensure you set aside an hour or so to enjoy a cocktail at the Blu Bar On 36 during your stay. The night time views of Sydney Harbour including the Bridge, Opera House etc are mesmorising. It is a small bar and is very popular so try to arrive a little before opening time which is 5.00 pm to ensure you get a table. We have stayed in several Shangri- La hotels and we have never been disappointed with our stays at any of them.

Reviews.Title: “Does the shangri-la understand the meaning 5 stars?”
Reviews.Author: freyaNsw
Reviews.Content: We haven't even been able to stay at this hotel we've been trying to book a suite and a room for New years eve for over 3 weeks, the customer service at this hotel is appalling at first we were speaking to someone at the hotel who then stopped replying for an unknown reason. We have called the hotel only for them to promise to call back which still hasn't happened and the last straw is we even went to the effort to try and book at the hotel which we called ahead to check if that was alright when we arrived the guest relations staff were busy doing who knows what the entire time we were there, we finally got hold of someone at the front desk who seemed to have no idea what new years eve was. all in all the feel of the place was more on a 4 star average or a 1999 5 star service seems more like a serviced apartment i.e almost non existent the shangri la will not be getting out business in the near future and im amazed how this hotel is rated ahead of the four seasons which is where we usually stay in terms of decor and service the four seasons is miles ahead

Reviews.Title: “shabby, ordinary and overpriced for 5 stars!”
Reviews.Author: HWWT
Reviews.Content: After havig staid in this hotel quite some years ago, I had expected the quality to be the same, and to be deserving of 5 stars rating, and 5 star prices. Alas, it was not so. The room was shabby and worn looking, and, the view over the expressway, with having to crook your neck to see the harbour/opera house, was underwhelming. But, the timeless marble bathroom was relatively spacious, and, the bed (king) had a feather topper, so was like sleeping on a cloud - but, we were near the lifts, so there was mechanical noise all night, like aliens landing! The buffet dinner at Cafe was ordinary, compared to other seafood buffets we've eaten at in hotels in Sydney. Over priced. Had better in suburban clubs. Room service the next night, and, there was no menu in the room. Rang for one, and it took 20 mins to arrive. Made slelection, only to recieve a call 20 minutes later to say that our menu was an old one. Waited another 20 mins for updated version, which was a far more disappointing version. Like pubfood, but at gourmet prices. Decided it would be too long to wait for ordered food, and dressed for a repeat of the ordinary buffet, which was even more ordinary the second night around? All up a disappointing weekend, and, won't ever go there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fading beauty”
Reviews.Author: AusWineDine
Reviews.Content: Booking Pretty easy. I did it all online. I did try at one stage to chat online to a consultant to ask about the hotel and was informed that I would need to talk to the hotel about that (I asked if valet parking was available). I later confirmed the valet parking was available but that necessitated a phone call to the hotel. Arrival Welcomed warmly by driveway staff - offered to take small bags to room, asked if I needed any assistance. Guest Services where helpful in getting me up to the Horizon level for check in. I had elected to go with the Horizan club rooms given they are: a/ higher in the building ie unobstructed views b/ free cocktail hour c/ choice of where to have breakfast d/ free broadband Check in was welcoming and smooth, welcoming me back (I was a return guest) and offering a drink before doing the paperwork (its these little touches that help make you feel cared for). The Room Easy to access, well laid out. The welcoming note was a nice touch (even if it is a form letter someone still has to sign it and address it). As was the fruit and water. The view goes without saying was great. This did make me wonder why the curtains had been closed when I came in â€“ keep out the afternoon sun, to heighten the surprise, I cannot really say. The desk arrangement is good but as in many hotels I found that the network cable only just reached around to my network connection. Given how cheap these cables are I am always amazed by this. The television was good if a little small for a room of this size and not widescreen (though the channels on it were set that way). The Bed. This is the sort of bed that makes you just want to stay in it. Comfortable, luxuriant, crisp sheets (but not hospital like) comfortable and inviting. The turn down service just adds that little extra once again. The bathroom was good size and well stocked with a nice deep bath for those who want to soak away the troubles of the world. The product supplied was of good quality and covered men and women â€“ the razor was appreciated given airlines do not like any bladed item to be carried. On the downside, the room has seen better days and is starting to show some wear and tear. When leaving I asked about this and was told they are about to undergo a refit. As usual the downside was the prices for anything in the mini bar no matter how well stocked it is. For example a soft drink at $4.50 is far too expensive, especially given I could go to the Horizon club and have as many as I wanted for free. The other downside was the lifts that take a long time to come. It seems they service all floors and have not been split to reduce times. Also I noticed a lot of staff taking these lifts so I gather that either there is no staff lifts or they are even slower.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel - Beds very uncomfortable, disappointing.”
Reviews.Author: HappyHoliday2011
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Shangri-La for our Wedding Anniversary, we had a standard room, which was lovely. Being a cheaper room we didn't get a great view..of the tolls on the bridge, but this wasn't a problem. The hotel was clean & well fitted out - what you would expect from a 5 star hotel. Although the bath was very small. We had cocktails at the bar - be warned get there early or you wont get a seat - there is not preference for Hotel guests & you can't book - you just need to wait there. My main issue was the bed - it was two singles pushed together, the linen was lovely however the mattress was past it's use by date with a great dip in the middle, I hardly got any sleep, very disappointing for a 5 star hotel & not what I expected. I didn't complain but should have - I was just too tired after getting no sleep. I'd try them again - but would check the beds first.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and good service”
Reviews.Author: Corolinkuk
Reviews.Content: Location is so comfortable from the hotel you can walk everywhere in town. Service was quite good, staff was very responsive and detailed oriented during the reservation via email process, they provided a 'recommendation sheet' of suggestions/trips for around town--all were great advice, the staff was very helpful--let us store luggage, even fixed my hiking boot. Rooms were large, very clean, wi fi (2 networks), a bit over heated, though. We will come back and stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely and Pleasent but not the best”
Reviews.Author: hay_renay
Reviews.Content: Check in was fast and easy, they allowed us to check in 1 hour earlier which is always a nice gesture. I stayed for one night with my hubby in a Opera View Room. Although the view was gorgeous, you had to sit on the ledge of the window to appreciate it, it wasnt how I expected to be-I thought we would be able to sit in bed/at the table and watch the boats pass by. We went to Blu Bar on 36 for drinks before the theatre, I had a Strawberry Daiquiri, it was beautiful with a sugar rim....a drink I thought I would have again! After the theatre we returned to the bar for more drinks, we waited and waited where they ask you to wait-the staff all would just walk past, none even said hello. We did get there at 11pm (closing time is 12am) however I would expect staff to still acknowledge you. When we were shown to our table we ordered our drinks. After 30 minutes the bill arrived-hang on....we havent even our drinks yet! The waitress then came over to advise one of the parties could not have their requested drink as they had no mint. When our drinks arrived my Strawberry daiquiri was melted, there was no sugar rim, it was very disappointing. Although the view is gorgeous, I would never go here again. The 24 hour room service menu is just a breakfast selection, no chips or wedges etc. I wanted to take a picture of the pool and I was told I couldnt, which is disappointing. The staff at reception are very pleasent however upon checking out I was even ased if I had enjoyed my stay :( The beds are comfty, however my favourite place to stay is still the Harbourview Hotel in North Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, with friendly & efficient staff and located in a great location"”
Reviews.Author: Klinsi18
Reviews.Content: Overall a great hotel for the price we paid (bagged a bargain on Expedia). Genuinely friendly staff whom all greeted us and even asked us about our day and offered their recommendation on what to do and where to eat. Check in was fast (albeit it was 1am in the morning). We were upgraded to a room on a higher floor (level 17) which was slightly quieter than the room we had on level 12. Rooms are clean and appear to be maintained well or perhaps the hotel was refurbished recently. We ordered room service for breakfast which costs $50 ($44 + $6 delivery charge), came within 30 mins as promised and tasted great & was sufficient portions to feed two people. Would recommend if you don't want to leave your room. Valet parking available for $47 per night which we paid for and was happy with speed of service. Hotel located in The Rocks area so it is quiet and a bit far from the more populated tourist hotspots. My new husband and I thoroughly enjoyed our stay and would return. Thanks Shangri-La Hotel for a great experience!

Reviews.Title: “Great views of Harbour bridge and Opera house”
Reviews.Author: mike_tedders
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Sydney, and my wife's birthday, so we splurged on a premier grand harbour view room. The views are amazing - although expensive, overall we felt it was value for money. Other than the great views, the hotel seemed ok, sometimes had to wait quite a while for the lifts. We used the gym which was good, but not the pool, which looked small and fairly busy. The breakfast buffet was excellent, but very pricy.

Reviews.Title: “Magical SHangri La”
Reviews.Author: Atreides77
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights, and I must say we just love the Shangri La, the location, the rooms everything. We stayed in a Horizon Club Premier Grand Harbour View Suite and would do that again when we return to Sydney. The views are the best in Sydney, the bathrooms are out of this world. The pool area and spa tub was neat and clean and very relaxing.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for the Sydney visitor”
Reviews.Author: rosie7585
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Shangri La for 1 night and stayed at this hotel because of its close proximity to the bridge climb which is why we went to Sydney. The location of the hotel to where you start for the bridge climb is very close and took less than a 5 minute easy walk. The hotel is also very close the many sights of The Rocks, Circular Quay and the city of Sydney. The hotel gave us an upgrade as it was my husbands birthday to a room on level 29 which gave us spectacular views of the Bridge, Opera House and Circular Quay. The hotel had also organised a cake for him in the room which was a nice touch. We dined in Cafe Mix and although it wasnt great, it was adequate although quite expensive but Sydney food is more expensive anyway. The hotel was very clean and the staff were friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury & Location”
Reviews.Author: Nairina
Reviews.Content: having pre-booked a trip to Sydney before realising I was expecting, I decided to splurge on a hotel with a view so that I could enjoy the beautiful city without having to venture out into it when I felt under the weather! And I could not have chosen better. Could only get a harbour view on one night having booked late but it was great value via wotif and the harbour vista was spectacular both at day and night. Room was well appointed, quiet, comfortable bed, plenty of pillows, inobtrusive and cheery service. 11am check out much appreciated (and we were late twice without any mention of it - hate those hotels that ring you one minute past the deadline and ask where you are!). Only draw backs were very poor showers (distinct lack of water pressure and fluctuating temperature which was not good for someone whose blood pressure is up and down at the moment!) and over priced room service - would love to have eaten in with that view but the prices were way overs rather than just a little. And just a small thing, the design of the corner harbour view room was a tad disappointing with a wall in the middle of the two windows so that from the bed or couch you could see the opera house or the bridge, not both at the same time. But standing in front of the window had a definite wow factor and we'd have no hesitation in returning. Oh and great location, rocks, circular quay and cbd all within strolling distance - although be wary of you have any trouble walking as the return to the hotel is a bit steep (it is the Rocks after all).

Reviews.Title: “Real soft beds”
Reviews.Author: NishiNippon
Reviews.Content: Arrived early on a Saturday morning and was directed upstairs to the Horizon Club Lounge floor. Check in was a breeze and my room was available straight away. Seeing the Opera House from my 35th floor room was amazing. Found the room to be spacious and the bed was so soft. Buffet breakfast the next morning was good and check out was just as easy as checking in. Only downside about the hotel would be the elevators. They just seemed a bit slow to become available, but in the scheme of things it is a minor issue.

Reviews.Title: “Not what I was expecting - terrible service!”
Reviews.Author: Melbourne_Female
Reviews.Content: I go to Sydney usually about once a month. I've been trying different 4 and 5 star hotels to see which one I want to give my regular business to. I'd heard great things about The Shangri-La and was hoping it would live up to the Shangri-La property in Singapore. Big mistake. Despite requesting a non-smoking room, I was given a smoking one. It STANK! OMG...how disgusting. I was told that was all they had available and what was I to say?? The room was a good size, but starting to look a little chipped and dated. It wasn't terrible, but just little things I noticed. The bathroom was fabulous! Lovely deep bath and a large separate shower with plenty of shelves for all those bottles and things you need while bathing. Very nice. Unfortunately, the curtains hadn't been as well designed as the bathroom and I found a lot of light came in through the top and bottom. Not a good night's sleep. The gym in the property is good and better than a lot of other ones in the 4 and 5 star properties around town. Definitely recommend that. The most disappointing part of my say was the service. It was a real let down. At about 8.30pm, I realised I'd run out of teabags and sugar in the room. I called and requested more of each. About half an hour went by and nothing. So I called again. Yes, they would bring them up I was told. Another 20 mins went by and I called yet AGAIN, only to be told they were 5 mins away. Yet another 20 mins went by and I was told "They are 2 mins away!" Finally, a further 17 mins later (I'd given up at this point!) there was a knock on the door and my teabags and sugar was delivered. I realise that Saturday nights can be busy in a hotel, but almost an hour and a half for teabags and sugar???? Really??? Unfortunately, I have another booking at this hotel in a Horizon Club room next month. If I hadn't pre-booked and paid, I'd be taking my custom somewhere else. There better be a marked improvement, or I will never return. Spend your money on the Sheraton on the Park instead - far superior.

Reviews.Title: “The best view in Sydney.”
Reviews.Author: Mitch007
Reviews.Content: After months of planning I picked the Shangri-La in Sydney as the place to take my girlfriend on a suprise 11 year anniversary. Little did she know that behind the scenes I'd been scheming. A HUGE thanks to Guest Services for their assistance in making it all happen to! I went to the hotel weeks beforehand and Guest Services talked me through the various rooms and showed me what the rooms where like, and recommended the Horizon Club Deluxe Harbour View Room. At $800+ the room isn't cheap, but for a special one night occassion (in this case proposing to my now fiancee), it was worth it. Staff at the hotel from the general staff to those on the Horizon Club levels were fantastic, friendly and helpful. Guest services organised a turn down service and the ring to be left in the room whilst we were out at dinner. Best of all she said yes :), so the Shangri-La holds a special place in my heart. The views are stunning. Second to none and the huge windows and harbour facing bed mean you sleep with the blinds open, taking in the beauty of Sydney Harbour. The room is spotless, and bathroom is huge and lined with Le-Occitane essentials. A bottle of wine welcomed us, and the bed was one of the best I've slept in at a hotel. It was like sleeping on a cloud. I've stayed at many places in Sydney, quite a few high end 5 star places, and the Shangri-La definitely stands up there with the best in all areas. If you have the money, spend the extra on the Horizon Club because the canapes and drinks, and breakfast is worth the extra money. Thank you for making my stay memorable Shangri-La, we will be back I'm certain of that.

Reviews.Title: “Five Star”
Reviews.Author: kat44007
Reviews.Content: Stayed here as part of a package tour of Australia. The tour company must have known this to be the best hotel in Sydney. Location, food, staff, rooms etc have all be recommended before and I cannot agree more. Stayed on a bed and breakfast option. Only complaint (it you can call it a complaint) was that the food was so great at breakfast that I did not stay long enough to try all the variations. Would love to go back

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: CFLDI
Reviews.Content: This hotel is well worth the money; fantastic views, but also excellent, non-0ntrusive service. We also ate very well at the restaurant on the top floor, and the bar has great views. I'd stay there again anytime.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC, BEAUTIFUL, SPECTACULAR”
Reviews.Author: LondonLissy
Reviews.Content: Beautiful location, beautiful rooms with the comfiest beds, most luxurious cushions and comfiest dressing gowns ever. The rooms were large with beautiful views over the river and was within a walk of the harbour (5 mins away). The staff were helpful and kind whilst the entire decor of the hotel was just breathtaking. We stayed in the executive floor and therefore we got a pre-dinner small snack buffet every night. It was beautiful. Sushi, small quiches and fruit. Once we even just had it for dinner because it was such nice food. There was a gym on the lower floors with a lovely swimming. We never tried the restaurants in the hotel itself but everything else was perfect. I can't floor it. They even had mints everywhere for you to take on your way out. Small thing; from the harbour to the hotel you had to walk up a rather sharp hill but it was only about 3 minutes of the journey :D

Reviews.Title: “excellent location.”
Reviews.Author: imeeldaa
Reviews.Content: Shangri-La's location can not be any better. We walked everywhere from our hotel. It was super easy to get to ferry terminal or take hop on-off bus or just take a nice relaxing walk to the Opera house and Harbor bridge and to the Botanical Garden. The view from our room was amazing: we had a full view of Harbor bridge and Opera house.

Reviews.Title: “PREMIER GRAND HARBOUR VIEW ,SPECTACULAR , FIRST CLASS”
Reviews.Author: nelQld
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is first class , cleanliness , staff , location, views, all exceeded our expectations. The premier Grand harbour view rooms are worth every cent , along with the Horizon club floor access , i would STRONGLY recommend this to all travellers. We dined in Altitude Restaurant with a fantastic menu & prices very good also. If i had to find a slight negative it would be the Doof Doof music in the Blu bar where we had a drink on Friday evening. ( Music really more for the younger set )

Reviews.Title: “You gotta love the view, and the staff. A 5* stay. Shame about that hill.”
Reviews.Author: MartyFreo
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel.. Terrible taxi drop off area, very drab and dreary. Like most 5 star hotels these days, it's the hotel within a hotel that must be experienced. You need Club level accesses to get the real deal - standard rooms are ok but nothing really special. I agree with other posters at the bar/restaurant on 31 is great but a little low brow and they, ignoring their own dress code, do let literally anyone in. My wife got very dressed up for dinner and then we had a group arrive in jeans and t-shirts. We love t-shirts too, but it can put a bit of a downer on the special occasion twist of the evening when that happens.. So, have a dress code, or don't. We loved our stay here but I just hated that hill climb every day. I am staying at the Intercontinental next weekend for three nights, so I will be actively comparing levels of service and attention to 5 star details. Martin m.Gwyn@Murdoch.edu.au

Reviews.Title: “Never let down with Shangri-La”
Reviews.Author: caroleek
Reviews.Content: We spent three luxurious nights at the Sydney Shangri-La at the end of our trip to Australia. The room was large, immaculate and full of goodies. The bed was unbelievably comfortable and this is the sort of hotel that you never want to leave. The Horizon Club is just well worth the extra money, with a yummy breakfast every morning, afternoon tea if you wish as well as the 'Happy Two Hours' with as much as you can eat and drink. The staff are discreet but friendly and always willing to accommodate your needs. Can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic views, shame about the hill!”
Reviews.Author: Alex_and_Katie
Reviews.Content: We stopped in Sydney for 3 nights of our honeymoon and unfortunately had bad weather the whole time! Internally the hotel is stunning! We are not normally luxurious hotel travellers but wanted to enjoy a little indulgence whilst in Australia. When we checked in we were greeted as newly wed's which was nice that they had notice and were then advised that we had received a double room upgrade. The views were something we could only dream of! Our window was about 15ft long looking straight out over the harbour (i think we were on about the 15th floor) . I think we slept with the curtains open most nights as it was beautiful falling asleep looking out over the Harbour Bridge and Opera House. Being critical, I would have to say that the hotel is up a steep hill which if you travel in to circular quay by train from the airport isnt the easiest walks to get luggage to the hotel. We opted for room service one night as the rain would have drowned us walking to any local restaurants - unfortunately the service was extremely poor here and we had to chase our food on 2 occasions. By the time it arrived we were past eating! When we mentioned this at check out they removed it from our bill without question but staying in such a prestigious hotel I would have expected far better service at the time. I would definitely stay again although this was a spend outside of our normal budget.

Reviews.Title: “Top class hotel in excellent position”
Reviews.Author: IanHYarm
Reviews.Content: Typical Shangri-La excellence in a superbly situated hotel in the Rocks area of Sydney. We stayed in a Horizon club room which was well worth the extra cost. The room was spacious and had a view of Circlar Quay and the Opera House. Our welcome was warm and the service was excellent throughout - the concierge desk was particularly helpful. The views from the Horizon club lounge were stunning, and the same view is achieved from the cocktail bar and the Altitude restaurant on the top floor. The food in Altitude is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Best romantic getaway in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Eddwina
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at many of the top hotels in Sydney for romantic getaways and this is our new favourite. From arrival to departure great all round service. Room was tastefully decorated and the marble bathroom spotless. Spacious bath and great amenities too. Liked the L'Occitaine products and the toothbrush came in handy, thanks. We had a view over Circular Quay and Opera House and the Cahill Expressway. I was glad to be on 31st floor as I think it would have been quite noisy from traffic otherwise. We chose Club Horizon and loved the club lounge with free drinks, nibbles etc. Very peaceful apart from the fact that it was blowing a gale outside and there was a high pitched whining noise coming from the window, probably due to a missing seal or something. Might want to get that fixed as it was quite unpleasant. Our favourite part of the stay was probably the breakfast buffet in cafe downstairs and the lovely Blu Bar for views. The location is perfect - close to Circular Quay and Rocks and easy to find somewhere to eat. The best thing about this hotel is location, followed by comfortable room and impeccable service. Oh, and free wifi was a rare treat. We'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Worth it for the view”
Reviews.Author: londonneil71
Reviews.Content: We deliberately booked here for the harbour view and it didn't disappoint. The rooms facing the harbour offer an amazing view of the bridge and Opera House. The hotel is a good hotel with friendly staff and a level of service that is very good considering it is an enormous hotel. It would be very easy for staff to be more dissmissive because there are so many guests but they did a very good job at making us feel welcome. Breakfast is a mixed bag! The quality of the self service breakfast is very good but the environment has all the charm of a motorway service station. It is because it is such a large hotel and there are so many people to get through breakfast in a relatively small area. It is a bit chaotic and the staff weren't always too clear whether or not there was a table available and they didn't have time to be attentive. But I wasn't here for the breakfast and overall it was a very good couple of nights.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel in the right place - great staff. Book Horizon floors.”
Reviews.Author: dougskeggs
Reviews.Content: i have been visiting sydney on business and pleasure for 7 years and have stayed at the shangri la each time. what is noticeable is the same staff stay for a long time. the service is excellent in all respects from all the staff i have had contact with over the years, its perfect for the shopping areas and circular key for the excursions and ferries. i would reccomend you book the Horizon rooms on floor 30 and above. the views and wonderful if you ask for an opera house view. plus other benefits on the web site,. its worth the extra. the cocktail bar on the top floor has wonderful views. Sabina Zabetian the horizon club manager is a credit to the Shangri la group of hotels Friendly ,warm and efficient and certainly a very good manager any hotel would like to have as part of thier team, dougskeggs@aol.com

Reviews.Title: “Deluxe hotel with views of Circular Quay”
Reviews.Author: BabyBoomerCumbria
Reviews.Content: Stayed her four nights in February. Very luxurious and spacious room with a superb view of the harbour - it looked down right onto Circular Quay. We didn't eat in the hotel, but dozens of restaurants were within walking distance. The only thing to be cautious of is the very steep appraoch to the hotel if you are on foot. It's quite a climb and I would not recommend it if you are not fit and mobile. You would need to get a taxi. The only large hotel we stayed in in five weeks touring Australia which had free internet access in all rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location and views”
Reviews.Author: ChristineWirral
Reviews.Content: We had a 5 night stay in February in a deluxe opera house room. Good sized room, nice decor, large bathroom and view of the Opera House was good. Only problems we encountered were the tv was very temperamental and the shower temperature never remained constant, but these were minor, rather than major niggles.The staff at the hotel were wonderful and we had a lovely stay here, excellent location for the harbour and the city and I would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay but room for improvement”
Reviews.Author: paultry
Reviews.Content: Liked: All staff encountered were very pleasant; a good size gym with relatively new equipments (touch screen control panels for treadmills etc); free in-room broadband; quiet room; comfortable bed. Not so good (minor points only): difficult to get through to room service department sometimes; no IPod docking station; no additional pillow selections (e.g. firm/soft etc). Overall a good stay though.

Reviews.Title: “The best of all first impression ever!!!”
Reviews.Author: LorieNakasenh
Reviews.Content: I stayed here last weekend Feb 26th 2011 for my 26th Bday and wow what can i say. Now Ive always wanted to stay at Shangri-la hotel Sydney but had never gotten around to it. But wow what can I say, besides WOW WOW WOW. Now i had originally booked an Executive Suite and upon checkin in at the main lobby I was advised by the front office that i had a private check in on level 30 and the person also added "you have a really nice suite". Made my way up to level 30 and waited to the private lounge area. I was approach by staff and was told that I had a complimentary upgrade to the Royal Suite which happened to be the best and biggest suite out of all the rooms in the hotel. During that time I thought it was the second best suite after the presidential suite but only a few days later after I had checked out, went on the website and notice it was the best suite in the hotel. Even before ever staying at the hotel, I had always had high expectations of Shangri-la and this has definitely surpass all expectations. Shangri-la indeed delivers high service and makes their guest feels very important and cared for. From the concierge, chauffer, front desk and room service. This was a birthday i will never forget as i was hosting a dinner for 10 at Shangri-la Sydney restaurant "Altitude" and there the staff was professional and yet very friendly and helpful. Yes i was very lucky in the complimentary upgrade but even if I wasnt upgraded I still think my stay at the Shangri-la in the Executive Suite would of been just as good as the people there actually go out of their way to make u feel welcome. Shangri-la Sydney delivers first class service, even when I ordered 2 candles for my birthday cake that was done in no time. Shangri-la will always be my number 1 5star hotel in Sydney, they have the best views, suites and people who work for them in comparison to other 5 star hotels Ive stayed at. Once again, thank you for this fantastic stay. I will be back in June.

Reviews.Title: “I will NEVER recommend this hotel or return AGAIN”
Reviews.Author: ZAKO003
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Shangri La Sydney for the first time and was very very disappointed with the service and the amount of money i payed for something i got.. i have always wanted to stay at this hotel, and was shocked in the way i was treated and looked after. I would not recommend this to anyone for the amount of money i payed and service i received. It should be giving 100% service and comfort. I have stayed at four seasons hotel and payed less and got a better treatment. will never return to SHANGRI LA...

Reviews.Title: “Don't Waste your money”
Reviews.Author: macappin
Reviews.Content: I had the misfortune to stay at the Shangri-La for 7 nights in mid February. I should have realised that something was wrong when I secured a 20% discount. Check-in at 10pm was very slow. The single receptionist spent 30 minutes with a guest and then did not even apologise for the delay. The room on the 12th floor with the view of the Opera house was OK. It was a bit shabby and not entirely clean. Certainly not to luxury hotel standards. The bathroom floor was not cleaned during the whole of our 7 days stay, thank goodness they provided slippers. The sheets were appalling they were too small for the bed so they rumpled & creased easily which did not make for comfortable sleeping. Complaints were met with a smile but nothing changed. Room service was a joke I tried twice unable to get through I left a message as requested. The first time it took 1 hour & 10 min before I got a call back by which time I had given up. The second time we left the room after 50 mins to eat out. The Shangri-La has a fancy restaurant called Altitude on the 36 floor. The view is good if you are at the window but the food is expensive and pretentious. They also ignore their own dress code. I donâ€™t enjoy dining with parties wearing dirty denims a graffiti t-shirt and a hoody safe to say his companion was dressed to kill. Maybe he was a very minor celebrity. I enjoy staying at luxury hotels and I have sampled a number of Shangri-La hotels around the world. This one will not be forgotten and what a relief to arrive at the Mandarin Oriental and be treated as a welcome guest.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but let itself down with poor airconditioning and bad breakfasts”
Reviews.Author: skylarkriver
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights in early February 2011 and had the unfortunate timing to arrive when a heatwave struck. You expect a five star hotel to have decent air conditioning in a first world city known for hot weather, but the system is archaic and has little control over the temperature (either cool or warm and low, medium high are the only controls). Needless to say when 42.2 degrees struck on the third day, the hotel room was not cool enough, it felt like half air conditioning at best. This meant less than satisfactory sleep, and discomfort in the room. I enjoy free breakfast as a Jade member of the Shangri La hotels loyalty program, though we didn't eat breakfast on the first or second morning. On the last day we did venture down, and as I have been disapppointed before was not expecting much. I was not disappointed. It is chaos in the breakfast room, and food is boring, stale looking and the fruit is all cheap quality and tastless. The juices are all cheap and sugary, nothing fresh. The price, about 35 AUD ++ is high. It really is a waste of time to eat breakfast in the hotel, you better wander down to a cafe in town or even to McDonalds, as it will surely be tastier and fresher. The hotel rooms are tired and dated, but comfy. The view was nice (opera house, upgraded due to card).. This hotel could use a renovation job - would recommend they close it for thelve months and turn it really upmarket, to true Shangri La standards, and then they could charge a premium as the location is quite favoured by both business people and tourists. The staff are helpful and the service is generally good (breakfast service excluded) The pool, although indoor, is nice. The gym, although a bit cramped, is good. Woudl stay here again but not in high summer.

Reviews.Title: “Best trip ever. Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: redbicyclette
Reviews.Content: Our travel agent recommended another hotel, but after looking at Tripadvisor I'm glad we chose the Shangri-La Hotel. The lobby was very nice. The rooms were very big especially for Sydney. The bathroom was also large. It had a large tub and a shower on the other side.We were on the 16th floor with a view of the Opera House. It was great looking out the window at night to the lighted city,Opera House and Bridge. A taxi driver that used to work there said the best rooms are 13 and 7.They have a corner view. The pool is inside and heated. There is also a hot tub. This worked out great for our kids. The location is also good. It's in the Rocks. Everything is in walking distance. Opera House,Bridge,Circular Quay.We also got breakfast with our room. This worked out well because our kids were getting up at 6am because of the time change. We could go straight to breakfast. They had a variety of food for everyone. Also a great bonus was free Wi-Fi!! Overall great experiance!

Reviews.Title: “Always a wonderful experience.”
Reviews.Author: AdrianDavid
Reviews.Content: My family and I have stayed at the Shangri La Sydney on numerous occasions. Sabina at Lvl 30 check in is always a delight to deal with and if you read this Franz, she is a wonderful ambassador for your hotel. On one occasion we decided to extend our stay during the traditionally busy weekend period and she moved heaven and earth to make our extension possible. The executive lounge is well equipped and stocked with delightful food and beverages. Cafe Mix on Lvl 1 serves all the usual fare to a very high standard. Then there is Altitude on Lvl 36 with undeniably the best views available in Sydney. Overall one of the best hotel experiences available in the Sydney C.B.D.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, Wonderful staff, just the little things let it down”
Reviews.Author: jp0069
Reviews.Content: I have written 2 reviews about this hotel as i truly love it. I find the staff so amazingly friendly, always helpful and a genuine pleasure to liaise with. It has a view to die for, and if you are able to get a Harbour View room then theres not alot more you could want. One thing i do love about this hotel is that 2 out of the 3 times we have stayed we have gotten straight off a cruise ship at 9am in the morning and both those times the room has been ready. So rare to be able to get a room that early but Shangri La always accommodates. An added bonus is the new huge LCD TV screens. They are massive!!! This reason alone will have us coming back. Regrettably there were 2 things that let it down slightly this time. 1 was the stained bedhead. It was truly disgusting. We are talking about a bed head covered in what i counted to be 8 large stains. I did report it and the staff were gracious in their response but the point being is that at $400 a night, this should not have been an issue. I wouldn't expect this from a 3 star hotel let alone a 5 star. The other although minor point is the room service service charge of $6 every time you order. Now i have stayed at alot of 5 star hotels, more so in Victoria, i have not come across this before and am quite certain last we stayed here that this service charge didnt apply. I just think after paying $64 for 2 hamburgers and chips, why is it necessary to add on another $6 charge. Other than that, this hotel makes you feel special and our experience shows that they will go out of their way to look after you. A handy hint for people booking in advance. I had originally booked a harbour view room at $470 a night, every day i would check their website and noticed the rate dropping. I just cancelled the booking and rebooked. It went from $470 to $450 then to $400 over 2 weeks, so just because you have a rate locked in, keep checking the site. You may be surprised. Anyway, of course we will return, i just hope the hotel can be a little more proactive in keeping those bedheads clean

Reviews.Title: “Great views, but tired and dated room”
Reviews.Author: kzw4nc
Reviews.Content: Paid $AU545 per night for Horizon Premier Grand Harbour View Room. Room had great views of Sydney harbour. Room was very dated and and worn out. For example: * fabric bed headboard covered in greasy hair stains! Definitely felt someone had used the room before you. * Paint was badly chipped around skirting boards. * Toilet seat very loose; shower would drip. Mould in shower grouting. Bathroom sink drained very slowly (blocked?). * Very few power outlets for camera/photos/laptops recharging, while using the iron or electric water jug. * Not enough tea bags. Above notes supplied to hotel, but no feedback after 2 months. Also 'free' wireless internet was very poorly performing. Was best to just plug laptop into hotel internet cable. Horizon club lounge food was fairly boring. Keep on hitting knees on the coffee table, which was placed in the middle of the room thoroughfare. Room was not as big as indicated, as most space was taken up with a long passageway from the door to the room. Overall not great value.

Reviews.Title: “Breathtaking and memorable - the Bridge, the Opera House and the Service !”
Reviews.Author: astronomer07
Reviews.Content: My wife and I treated ourselves to a stay in this brilliantly run Hotel in Sydney on our first visit to friends and relatives in Australia. We were not disappointed ! From our Bed on the 29h Floor we looked at THAT Bridge and THE Opera House. Awesome !! For the Staff, even though their Soccer Team was not doing too well in our Home Country of South Africa, nothing was too much trouble. They treated us like we were special. We begged them to let us stay again on our last night before catching the homeward Plane in July, and they again came up trumps even though we hadn't booked. Terry and Elizabeth Leaver

Reviews.Title: “Second time round was better than the first”
Reviews.Author: TravellingLuv
Reviews.Content: This is my second stay at this hotel and overall an excellent experience. It is really a very very good hotel. I really rate this hotel at 4.5 currently because of one small observation about the Lobby Lounge which I will get into later. But I rated this hotel at 4 previously, so now with my 5, I guess it averages out! Overall - Okay, I booked during what looked like an extremely busy weekend. When I arrived there were a lot of people checking in. I did not get a room straight away as it was before check in time, but that was ok, I still managed to get into my room before check in time. Staff are very friendly, especially the bell captains and concierge. Room - I got a city side room this time (not like the spectacular grand harbour view before), but the view is fine. Rooms are clean, everything in working order and quite luxuriously appointed. Also the rooms are quite large. Still LOVE the fast FREE internet access. Housekeeping was prompt. In room dining - Room service food quality was good and service prompt. Food was fresh and tasty. Blu Bar and Altitude - Excellent! The views from up there are truly amazing. Blu Bar was crowded even at opening time, but service was good. We had an early dinner at Altitude and the food was lovely. Restaurant staff are excellent. The restaurant does not have many tables, so it provides a nice quiet intimate atmosphere and you can't beat the view. We had the set 4 course meal. Started with the oysters (superb), rabbit terrine (not my thing but glad I tried it), steak (very nice) and the cheese platter. Lobby Lounge - While the service was friendly, I think it is slightly understaffed. Just an observation. Went there twice. Chi Spa - Fantastic. Very relaxing. I didn't go back to Cafe Mix or the gym this time, so I can't comment whether there were any improvements. Other - The Shangri-La management is extremely responsive to any comments you have on the hotel. Very impressed. This hotel has made it to my short list of hotels that I am willing to stay at in Sydney. Will definitely be a return customer.

Reviews.Title: “Great location....”
Reviews.Author: Blaze14
Reviews.Content: The Shangi La Sydney is located in the Rocks area and close to Circular Quay for all the ferries. Steps from Cumberland St are close by which you access the bridge on foot. This Shangri La is not the best one out of the ones we have visited on this trip which included Singapore and Hong Kong, but the views from it are stunning, you will not be disappointed. We will stay here again definately.

Reviews.Title: “First Class”
Reviews.Author: keenscarlet
Reviews.Content: Great service from start to end. Really friendly and helpful concierge. Best breakfast selection, quality and service ever received. Awesome harbour views. Couldn't fault it.

Reviews.Title: “Oh ...how fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: kceesse
Reviews.Content: Central location very close to the Rock and 10 minutes walk from city center shopping... Check Friendly staff members and knowledgeable concierge team members.. check Modern, beautiful and contemporary decor with new furniture and warm lighting.. check Fabulous harborviews with stunning views of the Opera House.. check Large fitness center and medium sized pool with sun deck and service.. check Nicely appointed bathrooms with separate tubs and nice bathroom amenities.. check Turn down service nightly.. check Complimentary internet access which was very fast (a standard for this chain) ... check Efficient porter service that brought your bags to your room even before you entered... check What more can you ask for? I would highly recommend this hotel.. absolutely.

Reviews.Title: “Can I go to sleep now.”
Reviews.Author: Wheresmypants
Reviews.Content: Overall it has been a good stay so far. Hotel is clean and facilities are good. And location is fantastic. But I'm writing this review while I'm sitting in bed half way tQhrough my week long stay at 11:15pm at night after being woken up by hotel staff. Our room phone rung 3 times and stopped at 10:30pm which was too quick for me to wake up gather my senses and answer. I went back to bed. 10 minutes later the phone rang again this time with a staff member asking me about a shoe shine I never requested at 10:40pm!. I told him politely he has the wrong room. I went to bed again. 10 minutes after that there's a knock on the door at 10:50pm which I had to answer in my underwear even WITH the do not disturb light on. I DON'T HAVE ANY SHOES TO SHINE PEOPLE!!! Im really not the type of person that likes to complain but ---OMG!!!--- 11.00pm I'm not even finished writing this review and they phoned again!!! That's 4 times now. I have an early morning appointment and would really like to get some sleep. I just called reception so hopefully they will go away. Keep posted for part 2 of my review later on in the week to see if I actually got to bed.

Reviews.Title: “World class hotel with incredible views and fabulous location.”
Reviews.Author: Donna6229
Reviews.Content: Wanted a hotel centrally located with a great view of Sydney Harbor and the Opera House. This hotel had both. Luxurious hotel with first class amenities. Sydney is a very expensive city to visit and this hotel was no exception, but everything was first class. The room was simply, but elegantly appointed with a great view of the Harbor. The view from the Blu Bar was incredible, but drinks were very expensive. Service was great and staff was very efficient. Location was the best part-we could walk to the Quay with great shops and restaurants, the Opera House and the ferries and buses. Bought a pass for $40 allowing us to unlimited rides on buses, ferries and trains. Biondi and Manley Beaches were awesome. Would go back in a minute!

Reviews.Title: “A Nice Long Weekend”
Reviews.Author: iac0n
Reviews.Content: The Shangri-La sits in a very nice location near the Harbour. The room was very big with a nice bed and large bathroom. While I wasn't in a harbour view room the view was quite nice anyway. The lifts are a bit slow but over all everything here was what I hoped. I didn't like the uphill walk getting back here from circular quay but this is Sydney, hills come with the landscape.

Reviews.Title: “so good booked a return visit”
Reviews.Author: derekrawlins
Reviews.Content: have just returned from another 19 days horizon club visit to the shangri-la over christmas and new year ,did not think that they could improve on our first visit but they did,took some friends to the altitude restaurant and surely there cannot be a better eating experience in sydney.i refer to my review of last year. i must mention the staff of the horizon club,absolutely top drawer,so friendly, helpful, very proffessional,the one sadness for us were that we felt some guests did not show the staff the respect they deserve,we are asked when we go to the restaurant for canapes to dress smart casual,no shorts etc.etc. on one night i sat there looking at guests in shorts and sandals tracksuit and trainers,jeans and vest,in fact most guests look as though they had just come off the beach,bearing in mind that the staff look fantastic,work hard to make us feel very comfortable i think the least we can do is look as though we have bothered to have a wash and put on a clean shirt. such was the amount we enjoyed our visit we have rebooked another stay over christmas and new year. cannot wait

Reviews.Title: “Top class service and views”
Reviews.Author: austravelth
Reviews.Content: What a heat hotel. Nothing is a problem to this hotel's well training staff. Large and clean rooms with great views. Huge bathroom and thick white towels. So much better than Syd Harbour Marriott. A class act which is so much

Reviews.Title: “Sydney's Best”
Reviews.Author: 300nitesayear
Reviews.Content: This hotel clearly outshines the competition (Four Seasons next door is a Motel 6 by comparison) with great rooms, health club, food (in particular, one of the best breakfast buffets you'll find), free wireless (that's fast) and an up-to-date TV with HD and multiple stations. It's only a 5 minute walk to the Wharfs and to CBD and the typical view of the water is outstanding. If your budget can afford it book a Horizon Room with access to their lounge on the 31st floor along with private check-in/out. Staff are wonderfully friendly and attentive which as most travellers realize are often in short supply at Australian Hotels. Quay and Four Seasons are across the street but having stayed at those 2 over the years I'd strongly recommend you choose the Shangri-La! btw--if you are a beach lover, Manly beach is only a 30 minute ferry away.

Reviews.Title: “Truly 5-Star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DnG_2009
Reviews.Content: Had the pleasure of staying at the Shangri-la in Sydney, it is a beautiful hotel and lives upto what you would expect from a 5star hotel. Have stayed in a few 5star hotels in sydney however in my opinion the Shagri-la is definately the nicest out of them. The rooms are extremely spacious, we had stunning views of the opera house and the sydney harbour bridge. the rooms were clean and comfortable as you would expect, I had no problems sleeping the beds were very comfortable. Service was fantastic as well, extremely helpful staff who were more than happy to assist. Also had drinks and dinner at the bar/resturaunt which i would highly recommend, the views while dining are amazing and sure to impress even if you have been to sydney a million times. Overall it is simply a stunning hotel compared to other 5star hotels in sydney, it will definately be my choice next time i am in sydney and will recommend highly to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning hotel in the heart of Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Sydney_Traveller81
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Shangri-La Sydney and found it to be a truely 5 star hotel. I stayed in the Horzion Club rooms and like the previous reviewer my room was near the lift however I didnt hear it at all and I'm a light sleeper. The Horizon club is a lovely add on, we were able to check in and have afternoon tea at the same time as well as a drink before dinner. I found the waiters to be pleasent and attentive. The view from the club is gorgeous but so is the view from most of the Horizon Club guest rooms! You are very close to Circular Quay and some great restaurants. We walked to Aria and found the walk was very easy. The breakfast was excellent, you could order whatever eggs you liked, they had plenty of variety and the waiters were all pleasent. My husband used the Day Spa and found that to be very lovely. Beds are huge and comfortable and I enjoyed the sun deck on the second floor (previous review said there wasn't one however it is small but it's still a sundeck). The person that hands you the towels took time to chat to us and was very friendly. I'd stay here again in a heart beat, great service, great location, good food and definitely worth paying for the club room if you can get a good deal. For the price we paid we felt we got our money's worth. I would recommend this hotel to couples, familys and anyone who likes the finer things in life!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel - amazing treat!”
Reviews.Author: pinksparkle33
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights in a Grand Harbour View room on the 25th floor, the view was just amazing! The bridge and the opera house directly infront of our window! We went for a drink in the cocktail bar on the 36th floor which was fun, although if you've gone to the Sydney tower to check out the views then it isn't essential to do the bar. If you walk from the subway train to the hotel it is a hike up lots of steps, but it only takes 5-7 mins and only bothered us when we had to lug the cases up there! The room and bathroom was very clean and tidy. The guys outside the hotel who organise the taxi's etc are very helpful and great to chat to for suggestions of what to do in the city. Everywhere is walkable from this hotel and I would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular Hotel - Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: OzML
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Shangri-La Sydney for one night last week while in Sydney on business at short notice. I stayed in a Horizon Club King room with Darling Harbour view, which was on level 33. The entire experience was exceptional, from the valet parking through to check in, through to the exquisitely presented room. Having stayed at a range of 5 star properties in Sydney (Intercontinental, Marriot Sydney Harbour, Sebel Pier One, Amora), I found this hotel to be in a class of its own above those properties. From the friendliness of the staff, the presentation of the room, the turndown service, the room amenities, the speed of the lifts to the triple glazed windows very effectively shutting out outside noise, every aspect of my stay was first class. The hotel offers free cable internet in the rooms, another added benefit for the business traveller. The only negative aspects of this hotel (which are quite minor)- it is a bit of a climb to get there from The Rocks, so after a tiring day it may be better to get a taxi back there, and the entrance / foyer does seem to face in a strange direction, and the hotel now levies at 1.5% credit card payment surcharge. It has long been a gripe of mine that while hotels enjoy more benefits of credit card use than most other industries (booking guarantees, pre-authorisations, charging for no-shows, charging for late charges, avoiding large cash transactions), the industry has been one of the most bullish industries in Australia to introduce credit card surcharges, and that most major groups have magically chosen exactly the same percentage to surcharge. I was sufficiently impressed by my stay here that I will actively seek out this hotel again when in Sydney in future - it really was head and shoulders above most others.

Reviews.Title: “Most enjoyable with fantastic views!”
Reviews.Author: jjumpstart
Reviews.Content: We booked a Deluxe Grand Harbour View room and it totally lived up to our expectations. Larger than the average hotel room - nicely furnished â€“ very quiet (we heard absolutely no external noise), quiet efficient air conditioning â€“ a large bathroom with bath and separate shower recess â€“ a very comfortable king sized bed â€“ and two large picture windows with fantastic views of the harbour bridge and the opera house (did I mention the room was spotlessly clean?). They were kind enough to let us check in early (at 11.30am), and the formalities were completed in almost record time. Although the hotel is huge, at no time did we feel it was crowded or impersonal. We had several drinks at the top floor bar and the service was outstanding. The view from there was even better than from our room, but do afford the staff the courtesy of asking if they have a vacant window table and donâ€™t just barge in as some people did (they were then politely asked to vacate their commandeered table as it had already been allocated). The tariff and valet parking fees whilst expensive were about what I expected for the quality and level of service provided. We had no problem with the drink prices â€¦ and the large bowl of complimentary nuts in the bar was very tasty (we did have to ask for them). But, there's no way I can justify paying $44 each for a buffet breakfast ... we went elsewhere for breakfast ! Overall, recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Treat yourself and your partner”
Reviews.Author: FearGlic
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights in early January in a harbour room view - good spacious room with great view of the the harbour , bridge and opera house . We couldn't see the harbour from the bed so might be worth checking if your room bed would . Nice gym, pool and sauna to chill at the end of a day sightseeing , rooftop bar worth a visit , breakfast included in deal which was a pleasure in itself . Staff were very helpful and attentive . Easy access to reataurants and bars in the Rocks, short walk to Circular Quay for ferries , buses and George Streeet which is one of city's shopping arteries. Recommend Pony and Fish on the rocks restaurants nearby for nice food and athmosphere . 5 min walk to the bridge. Hotel is on a hill so a climb via steps but very manageable , unless you are very out of shape. Hotel is pricey but so are most things in Sydney - we felt it was worth it - and it was a great way to wind up a 3 week stay in Australia.

Reviews.Title: “Huge Rooms, Amazing Location and Staff”
Reviews.Author: glennmichael
Reviews.Content: We arrived at Shangri La on Christmas Eve and stayed through Jan 2. It was a long stay so we did a lot of research to make sure we were picking the right hotel. Shangri La is in an amazing area. Yes, we know people complain about the hill but it really isn't a big deal. Most of the time we were in taxis so they dropped us right at the hotel. There was a taxi stand right outside the main entrance so we never had to wait for one. The Concierge was more than helpful in informing us of restaurants open on Christmas Day, tour recommendations and more. You never felt like you were bugging anyone with your questions and they were happy to help. Even when we checked out the lady at the reception remembered us. The room was huge. We had a little living room, a hallway, large bathroom with separate showed (which we liked), and a bedroom. The living room was a little odd as it didn't have a tv or any reason to stay in it. Lots of windows allowed the light to shine through and to see the great harbours. The rooms were so quiet too. We tried out the pool a few nights. It was indoor so no matter what the weather was you could go swimming. The hotel has a convenience store less than a block away as well as easy access to Circular Quay and The Rocks. We did the BridgeClimb one morning and it was right down the street. Less than 10 minutes and we were there. Being in a hotel as large as Shangri La I thought it could get loud but it never did. The hotel was worth the premium cost. We felt at home and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Wedding Anniversary ... with the Kids!”
Reviews.Author: floridonkers
Reviews.Content: We wanted to celebrate our Anniversary with a night away ...no babysitters so took our 3 kids (ages 4,3 and 8 months!) I have wanted to stay at Shangri-La for years and I was very happy with our night away. We had a corner harbour view suite and the views are exceptional. The room was very well appointed and the bed extremely comfortable. There was a huge marble bathroom (with ample room for the baby's portacot!) . There was also an extra toilet off the main entrance which is a nice touch. Because of the suite, we were automatically given access to the Horizon Lounge on level 30. Good breakfast up there, as well as canapes and drinks. The staff, especially on the Horizon level were very friendly & great with our kids. We actually had breakfast downstairs in Cafe Mix which was a pretty good breakfast - it is great that they have a chef to cook everyone's eggs just as they like them. The pool is lovely, nothing fancy but well heated and with a spa. Things that could be improved: 1. the Shangri-la number that I called to make the reservation: the woman on the other end of the phone while very helpful had an inferior grasp of the English language. This made the booking process quite frustrating. In the end, she still got my email address wrong despite dictating it multiple times to her and I had to call the following day to get this rectified when no confirmation email arrived. The next day, there was another woman on line who was no better at English. I think an international hotel needs to think about hiring those more proficient at English - it was hard enough for a native speaker to understand what was being said. 2. I rang down to concierge to inform them I had a friend coming to the hotel and to enquire what the procedure was to get them access to our floor. The response of the concierge bordered on rude and patronising ( i think he was busy, but no excuse). He said, "there are SO many people in the lobby and over 3 different desks. There is no way we know who YOUR friend is." ...blah blah in a very impatient tone & he missed the point of what I was asking. But overall, a lovely stay. It is a massive hotel, so you don't go for the boutique feel, but we had a lot of fun and the staff were generally lovely and very accommodating. We would go again.

Reviews.Title: “Dropped standard”
Reviews.Author: Aussiepol65
Reviews.Content: This was the hotel we held our wedding reception at in 2003. We had fallen in love with the place from a previous trip. Great location, although if you don't like climbing hills even the short walk from "The Rocks" will challenge you. The hotel itself seems to have undergone some rearranging, and not entirely for the better. The views are still there, incomparable anywhere else I have stayed in Sydney (This is my home town, so I haven't stayed in many) but the rooms seems to be suffering a bit from age. Our TV was an old 19" tube set, not what I expect from a 5 star hotel at this price. Either way, you will enjoy your stay. Worth paying for the harbour view.

Reviews.Title: “Large impersonal hotel that does things rather well.”
Reviews.Author: Jeb
Reviews.Content: Our experience did not start off well. Reservations were a nightmare, losing information eand charging the credit card twice. We complained, and from then on were treated brilliantly. Personal check-in, upgraded room, free bottle of bubbly. The management genuinely seemed to want to make ammends. On arrival check in went well (one manager tried to be a little too helpful and should have just let her competent staff get on with it rather than interfering!) and the room was a great. Large, clean and (due to upgrade) views of bridge and opera house from the bed! Service was top notch: reception, concierge, room service and maid service. Importantly all the staff spoke English well (so often not the case) and so requests were understood. As an indicator of the quality of service we mentioned that the mattress was too soft for us and was there anything they could do - yup, they could and swapped our mattress for a firmer on (pillows too). Room service meal was very good, the cocktail bar at the top was also first class, and the spa was great with professional staff. Couple of downsides: while the hotel is very centrally located near circular quay, it is up a short, but quite steep hill. Walking to c/quay is easy, walking back the hill is just a touch annoying. Secondly, on our second morning (bearing in mind we went for long lie ins without the kids) an arriving cruise ship woke us at 7ish sounding its horn! Obviously it is not a small, personalised, hotel where every guest is greeted by name and individual preferences are noted. It is the opposite end of that scale. But, it still was a high-end hotel, that ran smoothly and delivered to a high standard! Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: daye910
Reviews.Content: Location of the hotel is very convenient, just a few mins. walk from the bus terminal and ferry ride. not to mention the fantastic view from our room over looking harbour brige and opera house. Although nothing spectacular about the hotel, but you can still feel the warmth service that is distinctly shangri la. hotel staff are very helpful especially the concierge since we did not book a package, he suggested places for us to go and how to get there. we purchased a 3 day bus ticket that gets you to the different spots in sydney, it was very convenient and cheaper. Our room is very nice, i liked the bathroom and the shower area. I will definitely come back.

Reviews.Title: “Woooooooooooooowwwwwwwwww!”
Reviews.Author: Tonyquattro
Reviews.Content: Best hotel I've ever stayed in! We stayed here for a week and every day we were blown away with this hotel. It gives you everything you wil ever need. Great location, but up a very, very, very, very steep hill, and I mean very steep. But who cares, as when you get to the hotel it's great. One thing you must do, it's worth ever penny.........get a room with a "bridge and opera house view". Every morning we woke up and had our breakfast looking at one of the most iconing views in the world (look at the picture). Book this hotel, it's amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Polished.. with warmth”
Reviews.Author: mdl2702
Reviews.Content: Stayed 8 days over Christmas at the SSL then a further last minute 3 days. Booked Horizon Club room. Good location for all the places you wish to go in Sydney. Greeted very warmly by Guest services on ground floor and by passed regular check in queues to be taken to Horizon Club (30th floor) for a much nicer check in with Emily. Early check-in that had been requested did not happen, had to wait in Horizon Club for 2 hours whilst previous guests checked out - no problem. Room 3113 was commented on by many staff as one of the best and it certainly was. Simply stunning views over Harbour Bridge and Opera House - incredible experince as you lie in bed whether at night or in the morning. Room was fine - only comment is no iPod docking station - however the room was well presented and spacious. Tip: the Hoizon Club complimentary breakfast is very good - so in hindsight you probably do not need to book a 'with breakfast' inclusive rate. However the buffet at the Cafe Mix on 1st floor is very very good (and should be for AUS$44 a head!). Other points: No outdoor pool - but hey, you have Bondi beach 20 mins down the road! Too much chlorine in the pool for my liking. Good gym. Don't forget to ask for beach towels each day if you are heading out (they dont mention this). Valet parking is worth doing if you use your car more than once per day. Free wifi - but a really poor signal. Why is it in the 21st century major hotels cant get WiFi right - they either charge the earth or its really poor. Needs fixing, quick! Lifts: dont work very well. there are 6 but its seems that really only 2 are working at one time. The defining thing about this hotel is the people - if you make a little effort to chat, you get the very nicest, friendliest and most professional service that you could ask for. It's there, but you need to make 'friends' to find it. Exceptional people all round, special names include: Lo, Emily, Kimberley, Hugo, Troy, Yukari, Sabina , Phil and John - lets face it, there is not much to distingush one business 5 star from another these days except the people - and the SSL has those people.

Reviews.Title: “our favourite hotel”
Reviews.Author: ZapCatcher
Reviews.Content: It is by far our favourite Sydney hotel. Its where luxury meets comfortability. See beautiful views of the harbour; eat breakfast at the largest buffet I have ever seen at CafÃ© Mix. Have dinner at Altitude, which is quite reasonably priced for the quality of the food, wine and service. Visit the top level bar for an after dinner beverage. All thisâ€¦with impeccable service. A truly fantastic hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Views In The World”
Reviews.Author: LyleH
Reviews.Content: This was the third time we have stayed at the Shangri-La Sydney and obviously wouldn't have gone back if we didn't like it. Having got married in Sydney Nov 2007 and spent our anniversary there in 2008 we wanted to go back for Christmas and New Year. We had booked a little late which meant we had to change rooms halfway through our stay. The first 5 nights we had in an executive grand harbour view suite which we had had when we got married. These rooms are on the corner of the hotel and come with a small hallway with a w/c, a lounge with views over the majority of the harbour, a large bedroom with dual aspect views from the harbour bridge to the heads from one side and Darling Harbour to Parramatta the other side, a large bathroom with shower and bath and separate w/c with views over Darling Harbour. The second 5 nights we had in a deluxe grand harbour view room. These are large rooms with great views to the North overlooking the Bridge, Opera House and most of the harbour. We also enjoyed the Horizon Club while we were there. This basically means you get access to the 30th floor club lounge at any time where you can have breakfast, soft drinks throughout the day and then alcoholic beverages and canapes in the evening. You can also check in and out there which is a bit more intimate than reception. For us it is the Horizon Club that makes this place a must for us when we visit Sydney. The staff are generally excellent and sitting in the window looking over the Bridge and Opera House with endless sparkling wine for a couple of hours in the evening before going out to dinner is great.
