There are several members of staff that we think deserve a mention. Sabina (Horizon Club Manager), Lin, Jerry and Melanie (Horizon Club) and Ashley (Front Office Manager). I won't go into detail but Sabina and Ashley sorted out a problem we had and were both extremely helpful with a few other things, Melanie was the most attentive member of staff in the Horizon Club always serving with a smile and Jerry is someone who is essential to a good hotel. He knows everything. He has been working at the hotel for a very long time and as such is very good at looking after you and being able to give advice on anything Sydney from where to go for dinner to which beaches are good at what times. He is also very attentive during service and makes sure glasses are topped up right until the end! Basically our likes are: Location- Right in the heart of things in the Rocks although a steep climb from George Street. Great views. The rooms- well presented and a very good size. Great views if you pick the right rooms. Horizon Club- Some excellent staff, great sparkling wine, great views. Dislikes: The canapes in the Horizon Club are not always great. The service at breakfast downstairs is usually lacking with most of the staff seemingly not particularly happy to be there. Breakfast food quality is sometimes a little lacking downstairs. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome! :)”
Reviews.Author: jokjok
Reviews.Content: We arrived early in the morning, around 8am and they allowed us to check-in that early (check-in times normally around 2pm). Got a free bottle of wine (a nice one of that). And allowed a FREE late check-out. ooops! and FREE BUFFET Brekky too! =) Nice aye? Looking forward to doing it again!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Traveler14698
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two nights in December of 2010 for a convention. Overall, I had a great experience. It is a luxury hotel in a fantastic location with beautiful views. Yes, it is expensive, but it delivers. I have only one complaint regarding check-in (see below). Pros: - location: great location next to the Rocks and a stone's throw from the Sydney Opera House. The Harbor bridge, the Kiribilli area just to the north and the downtown are all extremely close (walking distance). If you have time, take half an hour to an hour to get to the beaches (anywhere between Bondi and Coogee is gold). It just doesn't get any better. - rooms: plush, comfortable, large. Beautiful views. Free fast wi-fi in the room (complimentary, I believe). A pre-printed jogging map with different routes provided in every room. Great fitness center on premises with a fairly large pool on-site as well. - service: overall, wonderful. Super friendly, fast, informative. The concierge helped me out a lot. Cons: - check-in. This is my main gripe. Most international flights get in between 6am and 8am. I got in on the 6am flight and was at the hotel at 7am. I was informed that the hotel was fully booked, so I would have to wait 6-7 hours for a room. After 30+ hours of travel, I did not enjoy spending a few hours in the lobby (until my laptop & phone died; no juice in the electric plugs in the lobby) and then a few more hours wandering the streets of Sydney (about 10 mile walk). I came back around 1pm and was told again the room was not ready. I mentioned that I have been waiting since 7am. After a call to housekeeping I found out the room had been ready for 4 hours and was checked in right away. I understand the hotel is often fully booked. But there has got to be a better way to make international travelers feel welcome. There was at least a few dozen people in the same convention with the same problem. One solution could be charging guests for guaranteed early check-in (for a fee of, say, 1/2 the nightly room rate). Or at least providing a small shower room on premises (perhaps next to the toilets in the lobby floor) - a place to quickly clean up and change. - The fitness center closes at 9pm. I would prefer it closed later (perhaps 11pm-midnight) so I could get my workout in after dinner / when jet lagged. Overall, I had a great stay. Except for the check-in experience, everything was smooth, the service was friendly and fast. I would definitely stay here again. Wonderful hotel!

Reviews.Title: “good hotel, excellent views, big rooms. no complaints.”
Reviews.Author: atulsodhi
Reviews.Content: top class business hotel. great location. good size rooms. all the facilities that could be required for a business trip. expensive though.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and beautiful view”
Reviews.Author: Lord_Gin
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Shangri-la for just one night, but I wished I had been able to stay longer. The hotel is very nice, clean and well maintained, and the staff are friendly and helpful. The rooms are ample and light, and the bathrooms are very good. I found it a bit expensive, but that is probably true for almost everything else in Australia these days. The breakfast was excellent, and I was lucky as I had plenty of time and could relax and take it at a slow pace. The hotel also has a good gym and swiming pool, with clean and functional changing rooms. If you visit, don't forget to go to the bar at the penthouse, where you will see the most incredible views of Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect, all the usual Sharngri-La attributes you come to expect.”
Reviews.Author: Mankster
Reviews.Content: I pushed the boat out a little on this trip and stayed at the Shangrila (Normally stay in Darling Harbour) having stayed at other Shangri-La Hotels in Asia. Service, rooms and locations are great. View I got over looking the Opera house was top notch. We only had breaffast the one morning and the spread was varied and sumptous. If you need a high end hotel in Sydney you wont go wrong with this branch of the Shangri-La - It has all the virtues you come to expect.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic room with a fantastic view”
Reviews.Author: fivelaws
Reviews.Content: My stay was booked online at lunchtime on the day after a very late change of plans. Iâ€™ve not previously stayed at the Shangri-La, Sydney because itâ€™s slightly outside the normal price range my company allows, but the ultra-late booking gave me some leeway to book a city-view room for a not unreasonable $250 AUD. (Â£180). At reception, they offered me a free upgrade to harbour view room, which I obviously took. Room 2310 was HUGE, with x2 Queen beds and an enormous bathroom which had both a large bath and a separate large shower cubicle. The bed was lovely as was the shower, but the star of the show was the view out of the window, which Iâ€™ve posted on this review. Only bad thing about the location â€“ as another reviewer noted, itâ€™s at the top of a hill and is quite a trek up from Circular quay. But well worth it. Would I stay here again? YES! x100.

Reviews.Title: “delicious”
Reviews.Author: agent_anonymous
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel...or maybe I just went crazy for the food here. Best hotel breakfast I've had in Sydney, Best lunch I've had in Sydney and the best dinner I've had in Sydney!! Comfy rooms, great views, friendly staff...my only complaint would be the wait time for the lifts - not much they can really do about it but it always took an unusually long time for the lifts to arrive.

Reviews.Title: “Very accommodating, brilliant service, true five star hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Gycentral
Reviews.Content: The Shangri-La was in a great location and is extremely well serviced. Valet parking, professional porters and very helpful client liaisons. Our room had a great view and one of the best king sized beds I have ever slept on. Nice high tech features, a gorgeous bathroom and, while extra, the buffet dinner and breakfast were really remarkable. My only gripe is that for the price, another $49 for overnight parking is a bit too steep.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel ever”
Reviews.Author: Manded
Reviews.Content: Fabolous service and location. I had a great view of Opera House and enjoy a lot my room!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable, good location”
Reviews.Author: bgAlaska
Reviews.Content: Rooms were comfortable, bed, pillows- great! Good location to walk everywhere in Sydney. If I had to complain about anything it would be the shower, a bit low pressure and the water temperature shifted from hotter to colder while showering. The hotels cafe had a great breakfast buffet, and we ate the seafood buffet one evening and that was excellent too.

Reviews.Title: “Immaculate Hotel”
Reviews.Author: marklife
Reviews.Content: I am presently at the Shangri-La Hotel and I had to write a review about how fabulous this hotel is! The beds are absolutely a dream to sleep in and I love the breakfast buffet here as well. I have a great view of the Harbor Bridge and the Opera House and I feel that the location can't be beat! There is a great teppanyaki restaurant as well off property which is literally 20 footsteps away! I recommend staying here in a heartbeat...

Reviews.Title: “Everything was brilliant”
Reviews.Author: saschlet
Reviews.Content: Great location, wonderful breakfast buffet, helpful staff. This place has it all!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic View”
Reviews.Author: Breamo
Reviews.Content: We were there for 1 night and were put into a room on the high floor that take into spectacular view of both the harbour bridge and opera house. The room is clean and has an LCD TV. Our package include free internet access and buffet breakfast. On arrival, car is promptly attended to by valet parking. Check in is efficient and no wait. When we got to the room on the 27th floor, it is spectacular view. The room has a king bed and bed is firm and nice with lots of pillows to choose from. Buffet breakfast was good. Service was attentive despite it was busy. Checking out is efficient and car collected and we are on the way. Check out our photo for the outside view from our room.

Reviews.Title: “Deluxe Grand Harbourview Room a disappointment - after a special request”
Reviews.Author: jenny2222
Reviews.Content: It was my husbands 50th birthday, so way back in July I booked a Deluxe Grand Harbour view Room online in a Celebrations Package, which also included breakfast for 2, a bottle of champagne, and a $150 dinner voucher. I looked carefully at the photographs online of the rooms, so that I could choose a really lovely one for our special celebration. I also notified the hotel by email that it was an important occasion for us, and to do their best in allocating us a nice room. Imagine my disappointment then, when our Deluxe Grand Harbour View Room, which was supposed to have a luxurious view over the Opera House, Harbour, Quay and Harbour Bridge, ...faced north-nor west, and had a cracking view over the CAHILL EXPRESSWAY! Yes, you could see the South Pylon of the bridge. Yes,...if you sat on the window ledge and peered around the corner, you could see the quay and opera house. The bed didn't even face the right way to get the view from the window. You had to be sitting on the ledge. I was very disappointed in room 1308. 13th Floor. I had asked previously if we could have a nice room, on a high floor. I didn't want an upgrade, I just wanted it to be similar to the photo. Nice. Was it? No. It must have been the worst of their so-called Deluxe Grand Harbour View Rooms, on the lowest floor. I even range to check that it was the right kind of room, and to ask if we could change but were given a resounding 'no', due to the hotel being filled to capacity. How early do you have to book? and who do you have to be? to be able to book a room, and get what we paid for and what the website advertises? It was ONLY a 50th Birthday afterall. If the package deal rooms are nothing like the pictures, then they should say so. Since we couldn't change, we tried to enjoy it. The full view could only be enjoyed by sitting on the ledge, or in the single chair in the corner, since the view faced a different way to the window. From the bed (where at least we could sit together as there was only one chair) you could only see the old buildings on the south side of the harbour bridge and a bit of highway. mmm.... not exactly Grand Deluxe anything. the carpet was dingy, and the room quite small. It's design, as I said, seemed wrong, the bed facing away from the view in the window. The phone was on the blink. I had to make 3 calls, and all three had the recipients saying they couldn't hear me and I had to ring back a few times until I got them. It was very frustrating. I noticed no one said 'you have a brummy phone, I'll send someone up to replace it. ' Not even the concierge. The bathroom was huge, and lush, and the amenities and toiletries very nice. But you don't sleep in the bathroom. The prime reason for choosing this hotel was the view and the room. It did not impress. The champagne that came with the package was lovely, and the breakfast in the Cafe Mix the next morning really great. They have the BEST pancakes in the universe in that place...however, they rarely seemed to have them out, twice I had to ask the cook/chef to make some. (yes I went back for seconds, yum!) The egg cook was very inattentive, and kept mucking up the poached eggs. It was also VERY busy, and the queue after us really long. Be at breakfast by 9am on a sunday if you want a table, we got one just in time, others after us had to wait a long long time. We had drinks at Blu Bar. why is that Bar so small????? It took 30 mins of our 40 to get the drink. Too small for the amount of people who want to visit. But a nice view if you can get a seat. We had dinner on the Saturday night at Altitude, what great staff! They, at least, listened to my birthday request 4mths earlier, and we got a lovely table by a window with a view to die for. We were surprised by the weird menu, which we did not realise was not a regular a la carte. It was a set 4-5 course (but not degustation) menu, for a set price. I prefer a la carte. The food was quite good. The scallop tortellini was divine, the mulloway with squid ink a bit weird for my taste - I didn't think wilted greens (tasted like spinach) went very well with fish and weird black sauce. The service was sensational, the attention perfect. The view of things lovely and we even got fireworks off the opera house (maybe someones wedding?). The bed was divine. The beautiful pillow top and lovely down pillows are just heavenly. I wish I could have brought it home! Checkout was fairly fast, and as I have mentioned to the hotel, but with no satisfactory resolution, we did NOT get Qantas Frequent Flyer points for our stay. The package, apparently did not qualify. The Altitude restaurant DID qualify, as it was not part of the package, but since we were told to put it on our tab, it disqualified us from QFF points there too. Stingy, tricky, and just a bit dodgy I reckon. Overall the breakfast and the comfy bed was the best part of it. We are not that rich that I would risk so much money again ($660 for the package) on such a low floor room that did not match the photos. Next time I'll try the Four Seasons.

Reviews.Title: “Big Disappointment”
Reviews.Author: pebble-7
Reviews.Content: We arrived here from the Shangri-la in Bangkok and what a disappointment it was. The room was tired looking with a cigarette burn in the curtain and dressing gowns which had seen better days, however the view of the Opera House was stunning. The front desk staff and concierge were pleasant and helpful. In Cafe Mix the service left a lot to be desired and the menu was limited. As a previous reviewer has stated it is often difficult to get tea and coffee at breakfast and often buffet items needed to be replenished. In the evening the menu was very limited and again salad items were missing. The service here was not what we expected from a hotel of the Shangri-la's standards. Overall this was a big disappointment for us and if we visited Sydney again we would stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel couldn't be better”
Reviews.Author: Likesthebest
Reviews.Content: The hotel was first rate. Make sure to stay on floors 30 through 34. Great location, walking distance to many delicious restaurants. The only down side was their restaurant, Altitude.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: tricia7531
Reviews.Content: the shang ri la is an excellant hotel worth its 5 stars from the time we arrived untill the time we left 7 days later the service was of a very high standard all staff were very polite and helpful felt very at home the concierge was very helpful and gave us a few tips and the receiption staff were very friendly and efficient the only down side was the hilly climb but it was worth it would i go back oh yes would i recommend the hotel oh yes

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is just not good enough”
Reviews.Author: PortlandPlace
Reviews.Content: The hotel seems tired and dowdy and is surrounded by highway and construction noise. We had come from the Shangri La Tokyo where service was gracious (if a little excessive) and the room was stylish with fast WiFi and beautiful bathrooms. Here the rooms are old and scuffed, with dull white wallpaper and old grout in the bathrooms. Budget is not the issue for me so much as quality - this is not good enough.

Reviews.Title: “Is this really a Shangri-La - oh and can we have our Moomin back?”
Reviews.Author: WineSnobLondon
Reviews.Content: OK, lets get this into context. We've stayed at Shangri-La's in Thailand, Malaysia and Singapore. We swear by the brand and recommend it above all others. I rate the Shangri-La Singapore way above Raffles. But this? Here's a crash course in how to damage your corporate image - you whack up a tower block in Sydney and hope no one will spot the fact that you've recreated a three star budget outlet and stuck a posh logo on the top to make it look OK from a distance. Where do you start? The rooms. Lets get one thing straight. You can't sleep in a bathroom. OK, you can make it look good but if it's adjoined to a dimly lit prison cell, you won't fool anyone. The drab walls, dubious "art work" and frayed carpet are a big no-no if you want to be five star. The bed. This deserves its own star billing. I'm not sure which garage sale it came from but the way it sagged and wallowed could only imply it had played a supporting role in the conception of Luciano Pavarotti's hitherto undiscovered love child. My wife slept on the join (yes, King Size means two singles gaffa-taped together) as it was the firmest place above floor height! Guilty until proven innocent. OK, so I'm used to a mini bar tariff. I'm also used to prices so exorbitant they could feature in a remake of the "Merchant of Venice". Where I start to lose it though, is when you're given a price list for the little jotting pad, the guest services directory and the (I presume at the price gold leafed, calf-hide bound) entertainment guide cover. Does their typical guest swipe anything that isn't nailed down? Room 2406. This gets its own accolade for the gushing noise that rushes through it day and night. Traffic? No. Wind? possibly. Air con? who knows. Lift mechanics? By the third day we assumed this to be the case. Avoid at all costs! And the ultimate crime? They lost or stole our Moomin. A Moomin is a small furry creature from Finland. It is (or was), yellow, about 20cm tall and although only worth about AUD10, was of great personal value. In years of travel throughout the world nothing - NOTHING - has ever gone missing from a hotel room. But in spite of repeated enquiries I suspect the funny furry creature has been skinned barbecued and served up with a slice of emu pate. Don't get me wrong - there were some good points, Jimmy the doorman was excellent and Troy the concierge most helpful. But taken as a whole, I have to ask how long before Shangri-La ditch this one and sell it on to Best Western or Formula 1. It certainly doesn't do justice to such a premium brand.

Reviews.Title: “The Shangri-La rocks in The Rocks!”
Reviews.Author: sagelilac
Reviews.Content: We spent our first three days in Sydney at the Shangri-la hotel as we had rented in an apartment in Potts Point for the rest of our vacation, and we ended up wishing we had stayed at the hotel for the whole time. Our experience was one of the best from the first greeting we received the second we entered the lobby to the time we got into the taxi. We had reserved the previous night of the morning we arrived from our transatlantic flight into Sydney, and check-in was a breeze. We loved the turndown service, the spacious and luxurious bathroom, "the strong shower jet was one of the best I've ever had", the huge bathtub. The spacious room with expansive and most spectacular views of the bridge, the opera house and the harbour, the bedding was so comfortable that we slept unremarkably well. The concierge was fantastic and very kind. I needed a three-prong electrical adapter for my laptop and I was immediately accomodated although he had to make an extra trip to find the correct one I needed, it was no issue at all. The free internet was an absolute plus since hotels ususally charge an expensive fee for internet service. We really liked the location in The Rocks, it's a little bit uphill but I personally did not mind it since I got my workout there. We chose not eat breakfast at the hotel because we thought it was too pricy but Sydney is an expensive city and it cost about the same outside if not more. I am so happy we made the decision to say at the Shangri-la and your staff with the impeccable service ensured it was worthwhile for us. Will definitely stay there next time I come to Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Possibly the best hotel i've ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: siax
Reviews.Content: Amazing location and views - esp from the bar and restaurant on the 36th floor. Well worth splashing out on (drinks not cheap at the bar, but the restaurant food was excellent and not too expensive comparatively). Service was fantastic, v helpful staff - altho i'm still slightly unnerved by the nightly "turn down" service. Great gym and pool. All in all, an amazing hotel. Stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Room with a View!”
Reviews.Author: ALS514
Reviews.Content: We had the opportunity to travel to Sydney last May to visit our son who was studying abroad at the University of Sydney. We narrowed our search for a hotel to The Rocks area of Sydney due to the proximity to Circular Quay, the Harbour Bridge, the Opera House, restaurants and historic appeal of the area. We could not have been more pleased with our stay at the Shangri La Hotel. Our room was spacious and clean with stylish furnishings and overlooked the famed Opera House. My husband appreciated having internet access and the concierge was most helpful with securing day trips to the Hunter Valley and the Blue Mountains. The breakfast buffet in Cafe Mix was pricey but delicious with a variety of breakfast entrees from which to choose. The Blu Bar on the 36th floor boasts an incredible view of the Harbour Bridge and Opera House at nightime. If we are ever fortunate enough to travel back to this beautiful country, we would gladly stay at the Shangri La again!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel brilliant views”
Reviews.Author: JIRAB
Reviews.Content: Spacious room, very well appointed, terrific views over Darling Harbour, which might have been better had I asked for the Bridge and the Opera House, but great anyway. There were five free Internet PCs in the lobby, pretty good but at these prices I'd hope on a follow up visit to see that many per floor. Very close to the centre of everything but If you are walking get used to the walk up hill from the harbour, otherwise very well positioned and a pleasure to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, shame about the bar”
Reviews.Author: maxnz80
Reviews.Content: my friends and i stayed in the Shangri - La in mid September. All in all its a very nice hotel in a great location and most of the staff are very helpful. Katie working at reception was particularly helpful. She upgraded our room when there was a problem with the booking system, she also had plenty of advice about local bars and places of interest. She was brilliant with all our questions and as she is one of the first people you will meet on checking into the hotel, acts as a great public face for the venue. Our only fault with the hotel was the bar on the 36th floor. The staff behind the bar were very slow in serving people and my friends and i were waiting at the bar for over half an hour one evening and were repeatedly ignored. When we complained to reception they advised us that they had complaints before and provided us with complimentary wine and cocktails via room service. All in all i really liked the Shangri-La and would recommend it to other travellers based on the comfort, location and service. You would be better off going to a local bar though if you fancy a night out.

Reviews.Title: “Attention to Detail Lacking”
Reviews.Author: KTJ058
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for a Saturday and Sunday night in September. We booked a room for 3 adults as we were bringing our disabled adult daughter with us. On booking in, the lady at reception indeed noted that we were staying 2 nights with 3 guests. She then asked if we wanted another bed put in the room! We asked how many beds were there already in the room and she answered, one king bed. Did she expect the 3 of us to share a bed!!! Anyway we insisted that we needed another bed. Shortly after getting to our room the bed appeared. We then asked for an extra towel as a third person had not been catered for (Even though we had booked in advance for 3 people). Some time later extra towels and toiletries arrived. I decided to make us all a cup of coffee only to find 2 cups and NO coffee with only enough milk for 2. Another call to housekeeping. Coffee and milk arrived. I made the coffee to discover only 1 sugar sachet....I should have taken an inventory of everything at the beginning. So as not to harrass housekeeping again we drank our coffee with sweetener (which was provided). I decided to get my daughter organised for bed to discover that they hadn't delivered any pillows to go with the extra bed!!! Yet another call to housekeeping. I thought this was supposed to be a 5 star hotel!!!!! Similar dramas happened at dinner..... the restaurant was extremely busy and the staff were run off their feet. We were seated at a table designed for 2 a tight squeeze at the best of times but more so for us as we did have a wheelchair to accomodate too! It would have been easier all round if they had told us that the restaurant was booked out and they couldn't accomodate us. We had items of cutlery missing, and one waiter left an awful smell of body odour every time he went past...not pleasant when we were trying to eat. Breakfast was similiar to dinner, we were shown to a table for 2 with only cultery etc for 2 people but assured that another setting would appear, which didn't happen until I had to ask again some time later. We were not offered coffee or tea or told how the buffet worked etc and had to find a waiter to ask how we go about getting tea and coffee. There were no glasses for the juice, several of the juice jugs were empty, and no museli until a few of us asked. The list goes on. I have never experienced such terrible attention to detail and poor customer service at any 5 star hotel I have ever stayed in before. in spite of all of this the room was lovely. We booked again for dinner on the Sunday night (I know that was foolish) but it was much quieter and we had a lovely meal served to us at a table catering for 4 people , with cutlery intact Yay! Service was great but again bowls of salad at the salad bar were sitting there empty and we had to ask if there was any more, to which they immediately responded. We shouldn't have to ask, the bowls should just be regularly filled. This was our first and will be our last stay at the Shangri La.. In all honesty this comedy of errors probably wouldn't happen again, and may well be a one off but I wouldn't risk staying here again. Weekends away are too precious to be ruined as this one was.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, depends on the room”
Reviews.Author: chaifairy
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a couple nights and had a great room with Opera House view. The bed was gorgeous and comfy; the room was nice and quiet for sleeping in and we had plenty of space. Staff were friendly and helpful and the 36 floor bar has great views over the city. Unfortunately, due to flight cancellations, we ended up back at the Shangr-La for one more night. We were allocated a different room, this time overlooking the main highway (which they didn't tell us). It was pretty noisy, the bed was a little uncomfortable and we really didn't enjoy it as much as the previous room. Had we not had such a great room the first time, I would have been really disappointed as it's certainly not cheap to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely but needs small improvements”
Reviews.Author: TravellingLuv
Reviews.Content: The stay at the Shangri-la started off on the great note with an upgrade to a harbour view room. The view from this room is incredible, I was smack dab infront of the Harbour bridge and opera house. Can't be faulted. Also they offer FREE wireless internet in the rooms! It is one of the few hotels that offer that. In this day and age I find it mind boggling that hotels charges upwards of $30 a day for internet access. The location of the hotel is a little out of the way. It's a nice walk, but can be a little spooky for a single girl walking back from the Rocks at night, as there are a lot of quiet alleyways. I did quite a quick dash one night to get back to the hotel quickly because it was really dark. Some people might have difficulty walking back to the hotel because it is an uphill climb, but I loved it. The slight seclusion of the hotel also meant that it was quiet, which is very important to me. The main complaints were not with the room but with the facilities. The gym is quite basic, and certainly nothing like some of the other Shangri-la gyms that I have been to. The other complaint is to do with the restaurant. The service staff seemed a little out of their element as I had to request for things several times. The restaurant was about half full. The bread I got at the start was stale. And the quality of the meal was really average for the price. I expected better for a hotel of this calibre. But not really an issue as the Rocks is a short walk away with some brilliant restaurants. But the hotel and rooms are gorgeous. Would definitely stay here again depending on the rate.

Reviews.Title: “Worst night's sleep for a long time”
Reviews.Author: menzie2
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, great location, good staff, comfortable beds but make sure you ask for a quite room. I had one close to the liftwell which was unbelievably noisy and woke me several times a night for the three nights I was there. I even was disturbed by the noise when I tried sleeping with my iPod on. It wasn't just me - I heard someone at breakfast at another table complaining about the lift noise too. Until then I had thought the hotel must have been located next to train tracks because that was what it sounded like to me. All in all very expensive for such a bad nights sleep.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best views of Sydney Harbour”
Reviews.Author: really-wanna-holiday
Reviews.Content: The Shangi-La is excellent. Our room was on the 29th floor and had one of the most amazing views of Sydney Harbour (bridge and Opera House). We found the check-in staff to be very polite, they were accomodating with a delivery of a dress that we were expecting (i.e. as we were at the pool, they wizzed it straight up to the room and hung it in the closet, and left a message to tell us it was there - great service). The pool & spa (indoors), gym and sauna are excellent. I really wished I had bought my gym shoes so I could sneak in a workout on the treadmill and exercise bike! There is also an outdoor terrace for lounging/sunbaking (does not have much of a view) and unfortunately I could not use it as August in Sydney is rather chilly. If I were visiting in summer, I would have definitely checked it out. The only downer on the service was that they did not inform my husband and I that breakfast would only be served until 10.30am. We found this out when we presented ourselves at Cafe Mix at 10.25am! They were kind enough to accomodate us, but we really did have to race around the buffet as they closed it around us. Ordinarily, I would say it was our fault for not checking the breakfast times.... but this is a 5 star hotel, and I'm expecting (and paying for) top 5 star service. The breakfast though was delicious and there was a great range. Suggested improvement to the hotel would be to have Ipod speakers. Many hotels offer ipod speakers these days, its nice to play a bit of your own music, rather than relying on the TV. My most recent trip to this hotel was for leisure, but I should mention that I have visited this hotel for several day-time conferences. I have found the conference rooms to be excellent, with very responsive staff. I have also had lunch in Cafe Mix and the buffet selection was excellent (with my colleagues agreeing). All in all, an excellent hotel. I would not hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and views, but soft beds and pricy”
Reviews.Author: BC96
Reviews.Content: Most recently we stayed in the Hotel in Sydney for over a week. It has a magnificant location in The Rocks, very close to Circular Quay with train, bus and ferries. They have great staff, fantastic view of Opera House and Harbour Bridge, and rooms are very large (over 40 Mts square). You also get free internet, which is great. We found the bed very uncomfortable as the mattress is very soft, and in general, the hotel is pricy to stay at. Parking is a killer everywhere in the CBD (around 50-60 AUD/day). Tip: Get a 7 day MyMulti3 pass giving you access to public Busses, Trains as well as Ferries. Only AUD 57 for 7 days !

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Value - Top Service”
Reviews.Author: StarNvigator
Reviews.Content: From the moment we stepped out of the taxi we were greeted by friendly staff, eager to assist and lead us to reception. We felt a bit special :-) We were able to check in early and were pleasantly surprised when we were upgraded to a harbour view room. Reception asked if we required a roll-away bed for our 5 year old. As there was an extra charge we declined, given the bed was king-sized. The view from our room was wonderful, including the harbour bridge and opera house. After visiting the Guylian chocolate cafe a short stroll away (we highly recommend their hot chocolate - best ever!), and doing a spot of shopping, we returned to our room to find an extra bed made up for our little man. We were not charged for this and it made our stay all the more enjoyable. The hotel has a good sized gym and indoor swimming pool/jacuzzi/sauna. A real treat! The staff were helpful and obliging at all times. Kudos to management. This is a top notch, good value hotel in a great location! And i I don't dole out reviews like this lightly! We would definately stay at the Shangri-La in Sydney again.

Reviews.Title: “Love it every time!”
Reviews.Author: styletravela
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I have stayed at the Shangri-La Sydney 5 times and love it every time. From it's perfect Rocks location to amazing cocktails and incredible service from everybody. I can not recommend this place highly enough. For what ever occasion you may have in Sydney the Shangri-La is the perfect place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely outstanding service”
Reviews.Author: green_garnet
Reviews.Content: Two friends and I spent 3 weeks at the Shangri-la in Sydney. We were overwhelmed by the high quality of service, particularly in The Horizon Club. I highly recommend staying on the Horizon Club levels for excellent value and outstanding service. Sabina and her excellent staff handled every request and/or problem with aplomb and grace. They were attentive and professional and also friendly and charming. I look forward to seeing them again, next trip to Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: loves2travel16
Reviews.Content: The Shangrila is a stunning hotel located within close vicinity to the Circular Quay water Front. It provides amazing views of Sydneyâ€™s famous Landmarks The Opera House and The Harbour Bridge. It is also within walking distance to many different restaurants and bars positioned around the harbour. I would definitely class this hotel as a five star, due to the excellent service and facilities provided. The beds are extremely comfy and the room is generally decorated to a high standard with cream carpets and a flatscreen tv. The bathroom comes complete with a huge tub, a large shower and his and her basins. The staff are also very friendly and more than willing to help out. Each room receives turn down service in the evening, which was a nice touch. They provided guests with slippers and free bottles of water. The hotel also has gym and spa facilities and a reasonable size pool. In general this is a great hotel, due to its location, quality of service and wonderful views. The only downside is the hotel is positioned up a steep hill, requiring guests to walk up numerous steep steps.

Reviews.Title: “enjoyed experiance so much decided to return for and do it all over again”
Reviews.Author: derekrawlins
Reviews.Content: my wife and i stayed here for two weeks to see in the new year.taking full advantage of the horizon club facilities .all staff without exception were first class we used the altitude restaurant a couple of times and were very impressed with all the staff. they obviously knew what the customer wants and their knowledge of the food and wine list was second to none.they gave the impression that they enjoyed what they were doing. the views were brilliant,altogether a wonderful experiance. we read with interest the criticism of the walk from circular quay to the hotel.but this is a very small price to pay for the view. my wife and i never return to the same place we always try to find somewhere new.but after last years holiday we decided that we must do it again,thought about another hotel.but because this year we will be in sydney for 19 nights the thought of knowing what we would have been missing by not choosing the shangri la would was not worth it. if we were to make a criticism it would be despite the fact that the rooms are large compared to most ,not much storage space for a two to three week stay,the bedside cabinets could do with a couple of extra drawers without compromising the space of the rooms.and my wife feels that a full length mirror would be useful

Reviews.Title: “Best Business Hotel in Sydney - Bar None”
Reviews.Author: Isabela_Rijeng
Reviews.Content: I am from the Malaysia Public Service Commission, have stayed here for the duration of 8 nights with another 3 colleagues on one of our business trip. We have also booked the seminar room to be used to conduct interview for our international students who are studying in Sydney. Room and seminar room is booked via a travel agent. When i travel, I have always put a greater emphasis on customer service, better than amenities in rooms etc. From the first day we stepped in i was not dissapointed, i have been greatly impressed by the efficiency of the staff, especially the Customer Service Officer and Event Coordinator - Sarah Barleh. Check in was hassle free where everything is done immediately and we were in our room at no time. The deluxe rooms we had, impressive with complete amenities, I was happy to receive a personal note from the GM himself with fruit basket. And received a complimentary champagne on the 3rd day no less! Service staff were extremely friendly and helpful, everyone is right there when we are in need. I especially loved the personal touch - having a bookmark on my bed every night after housekeeping. However, strange enough, on the 3rd or the 4th day, the bookmarks were not seen anywhere. It must have been taken away, pity, I would love to have it as a souvenir..Concierge was very knowledgable, we had no problem in asking him for directions, place of interests etc. My only dissatisfaction was the variety of breakfast, basically I got the same type of breakfast for the whole 8 days. There was no variety, so it was pretty boring to eat the same breakfast everyday. F&B staff were really friendly, so thumbs up to them too! But what impressed me most was the event organization. We had LIONS International Seminar ongoing at the same week and the hotel was seen to be quite busy at that time but hay, in no way did Sarah and her dedicated team ignored us. We had a change of event in the last minute and she immediately arranged it for our convenience. She will come to me, everyday without fail to ask if everything is ok, do i need anything etc. If she is not around, another staff will be there to assist us (Eugene, Bonnie - if i still remember her name) Congratulations to GM of ShangriLa Sydney for having such a dedicated team. I will certainly be staying here again in the future and i sincerely hope that you will maintain the same level of friendliness and excellent customer service, on par with your motto - Guests are treated like a family at home. We went to Hilton Brisbane 3 days after that but to be honest, no hotel is on par with yours. Keep it up and I will certainly recommend it to other government agencies in Malaysia, to come stay at your hotel, and experience a first class service, that one feels right at home :)

Reviews.Title: “Blissful accommodations and exceptional service that surpassed expectations!”
Reviews.Author: AussieDiva
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights in at the Shangri-La overlooking Sydney harbour - one of, if not THE best harbours in the world. We had booked a luxury king opera room and were upgraded to an expanded harbour view room - WOW! Staff were truly exceptional at every level from porters, front desk, housekeeping and restaurant employees - they go out of their way to make you feel very welcome and special. I would have no hesitation staying there again. The Altitude Bar is a must see place to visit even if not staying at the hotel. Great place to enjoy a cocktail at the end of the day with expansive views of Sydney Harbour. A nice touch was the hotel providing computers with internet access at no charge. Breakfast - served in Cafe Mix - offered a comprehensive selection and busy.

Reviews.Title: “Best 5 star I've stayed at!!”
Reviews.Author: DJ_Mizit
Reviews.Content: Room Clean, spacious, excellent value for money, beyond excellent service. Spacious bathroom with choice of bath tub and shower - really lovely vanity set up. Cloud fluffy king sized bed with view of harbour to die for, spacious room, large tv with custom welcome message, complimentary buffet included (great food selection) and excellent facilities. Pool and spa was excellent - I even got the hot stone massage. Staff All very friendly and helpful - you are acknowledged/greeted everywhere you go in the hotel. Check in was very quick, very efficient and very professional - there was a lot of people lining up but didn't take long at all to be attended to. My colleage called room service and asked for emergency nail polish remover and they arrived with a women's vanity pack which included lady products, nail polish remover, emergency stockings, make up remover and provided at no extra cost. Hotel provides morning room service and afternoon "down" service which prepares your room for the evenings (yes that means staff actually untuck your sheets!! Yes thats right!!). On check out, staff even helped me with my luggage to the cab (not a service hotels usually provide anymore) I can't fault staff and their professionalism at all - just excellent!! Location is ok for us, not in the city but close enough - a bit of a hike up hill though.

Reviews.Title: “Much improved ...”
Reviews.Author: marduk1
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nights at the Shangri-La as a follow up to previous visits. Spacious room with comfortable bed and great view over Sydney Harbour. Breakfast buffet excellent, gym fair to good, pool a little on the small side but OK for laps. Bedding and room decor seems to have been updated. Overall, a very good business hotel. The only drawback being that it is a steep, uphill back from the main city area.

Reviews.Title: “Very poor and need a real rethink on quality and service output”
Reviews.Author: quirky76
Reviews.Content: I've stayed and eaten in many shangri la's around the world but this was very poor. I ate in the cafe restaurant, service was very poor, whilst they have nice staff it lacked management and organisation of a world class hotel chain. I was served a chicken cesear salad with pork and a poached egg on it when I pointed out it was pork not chicken they took it back and just removed the pork and placed re-cooked chicken on it and ohhh a new poached egg ........?!! Ive never had a poached egg on a cesear salad. My starter of 3 scallops took 30 mins which was nice but the restaurant was empty..... ?! When I eventually got served and asked for the bill and the manager came to see me - she offered me a complementary banana so I wasn't hungry as I didn't eat the salad. I took time to fill in a complaint card and gave it to guest relations who wasn't interested as she was gossiping to another employee, when I tried to discuss it with her she just said thanks for filling in the card .......,, Really not good at all and unusual by shangri la standards

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay(s)”
Reviews.Author: Papaleadfoot
Reviews.Content: Awaiting a cruise we were there a few days; traveled in country; & back to the hotel. Good location; friendly staff; super lounge. Can't find a fault.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel,great staff in the heart of Sydney.”
Reviews.Author: tuthxpert
Reviews.Content: Safety.... my top priority whenever i travel,had a great time staying here at Shang Sydney, no hassles,all request in my file were all followed and they even give me my room immediately when i arrived at 8am. Besides the view of 1409,this room had a spectacular view which i really requested, all the staff from top to bottom are very friendly...they keep me company since they all know im alone... so to start with ... Hugo of the concierge...who parked the car and even carried my huge luggages,didnt accept my tip but gave me a warm smile and much wider smile when i called him by name. Nabin of blu horizon bar at the 36th flr. he make sure cosmo is alright and assisted me to those stunning views of the bar (skyline) make sure i got all the photos i wanted. Nick of the hobby shop... lovely opal in a reasonable price and the shirt too. and last from the frontdesk -Erin... who did a great job definitley no hassles in checking in and checking out,she definitely understands that everything is on file so no repetitive questions that other hotels do esp to a regular guest....i know 100% safety is also their priority... so it always makes me happy when hotel staffs go extra mile and do everything for their guests. there is no amount of price can ever pay for a safe and stress-free stay anywhere in the world.

Reviews.Title: “Great location...Well appointed hotel..greta restaurant”
Reviews.Author: gringottsgoblin
Reviews.Content: Really good location on the rocks in Sydney with great views of the bridge and opera house. My room was on the wrong side overlooking the highway,but was quiet, roomy, very comfortable, clean and everything you need with a large and well stocked bathroom. The restaurant on the 36th floor Altitude 36 is great. Wonderful views and good food. Quite expensive but not "toe-curlingly" so..Good hotel and i would have no problem recommending it

Reviews.Title: “A View to Die For!”
Reviews.Author: GBR007
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Shangri-La for four nights towards the end of a two week visit to Australia (business and pleasure!). I booked via Trailfinders and they got me a room with a harbour view affording stunning / unmissable and unforgettable views of the busy harbour and opera house. Lots of excellent things about this hotel: Good (very good) gym and spa / sauna (although rowing machine needs upgrading!) Terrific views of Sydney (day and night) from the bar on the 36th floor Superb breakfasts with excellent service from beginning to end Efficient and friendly concierge This was a great place to stay and the location in The Rocks area is hard to beat! Just a couple of minutes walk away from Circular Quay for trains and ferries.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful view of Sydney, clean and modern”
Reviews.Author: crazylobster
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Shangri La just 2 nights ago for an anniversary, and although I live in Sydney staying here doesn't feel like it! Before the arrangements I felt that it might be boring to stay in Sydney for our celebration but my partner and I have travelled to a fair few places and thought, why not save our money and try out a hotel without flying overseas? Well I'm glad we made a good choice, we stayed in the Deluxe Grand Harbour view room and it was very spacious and clean. Clean bathrooms are a must for me, and the bathroom was nicely lit up with a shower, bathtub and a huge mirror and scales! I didn't find the scales useful as I'm no athlete! But nonetheless I wasn't disappointed by anything major, in terms of the room itself. The staff were average, not superb but not impolite, not efficient but not slow.. I had my main meal outside of the hotel but I did have a buffet breakfast in the hotel the next morning. Personally I love a huge breakfast and I LOVE breakfast buffets!! However I was let down by the lack of variety they offered. Of course they had the staples such as hash browns, eggs, toast, cereal and some asian styled congee but their pastry section was small and overall it was defintely lacking. I also love a good selection of fresh juices and coffees but once again they did not have much variety. One good tip for those who can't live without facebook is they have free Wi-fi internet in all rooms.. I deliberately didn't bring my laptop as I didn't want to be online when I could be enjoying the stunning views of the Sydney Harbour bridge and the Opera house!! My package included 2 free drinks at the Altitude bar, but my partner and I stayed in the room and had a few beers instead. Warning, the mini bar is very expensive. Chocolate bars were 8AUD and a bottle of Fiji water is 9AUD, so not worth it!! The beers were also a little bit of a rip-off.. and the fridge didn't really seem to be cold enough? So unless your extremely lazy or extremely hungry, buy your snacks outside instead and save your money!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Short Break”
Reviews.Author: theferra
Reviews.Content: Recently had a two night stay at Shangri La Hotel with my daughter and another mum and daughter. Both our rooms had amazing opera house and harbour views which you never get tired of. Rooms were a good size and kept clean. We had pre dinner cocktails at the Blu Bar which has jaw dropping, spectacular Sydney views. Well worth the price of a cocktail, which incidently were particularly good, the girls were so impressed. The hotel is perfectly placed for strolling around the Rocks, Circular Quay or Opera House as well as retail therapy . We would definitely make this our regular city escape. The only negative was that we did not get into our room until 4.30 pm. but received a late check out.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Wumme96
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights at the Shangri La in Sydney. A great Hotel (like most Shangri La), with great views on the opera house and harbour. The Sky bar is amazing, like everything else in this hotel. Very good place to be, especially as the ferry terminal and shopping districts are very close to the hotel, only a couple of minutes to walk

Reviews.Title: “Gold Coast to Sydney-”
Reviews.Author: majorcharlie
Reviews.Content: Awesome hotel, we had a great time, the staff were very helpful and friendly. The room was clean and tidy and we had fantastic views over the Opera house and the Sydney harbour bridge. Location was great easy walking distance to the wharf and also all the shops. We had dinner at the Altitude resturant which is fine dining at it's best. If you can have a bad time at this hotel then toughen up and ask for what you want.

Reviews.Title: “LOVELY Stay”
Reviews.Author: 0418jan
Reviews.Content: The concierge was very helpful (Colin) prior , in regards to airport transfers and costs etc. The private check in was good...Horizon Club. We stayed in the Presedential Suite for 3 nights. The concierge on the first night was overly busy, where it was apparent his patience was highly tested. But he wasn't that good at hiding his annoyance with me...Jason. Too busy to keep answering my questions..type of thing. Which he was. But what can i do about it. We had Buffet breakfast every morning, and we had a corner of our table without a lie...7 plates piled(2 adults 2 children) Dinner was the same Sat night I started putting our plates on the clean table next to us from then on. The last day was the only meal there where the waiter(male) was on the ball with the table clearing. The Mon night, no buffet,the chef was extremely accomodating to my husbands and children's requests not on the menu...and the food was great.He came out to us to make sure he understood what we wanted.Nice guy. Housekeeping was inconsistent. As each day went on, we got less cleaned/done/replenished. That was disappointing and surprising for where i was and thr room i had. One day i was out a few hours, my husband asleep leaving my 4 year old to entertain himself.....he gave the housekeeping staff $20.....and she took it. I asked my son where the "red " money was, he told me the lady did a good job cleaning my mess. Actually less than the lady yesterday,and this one got a tip. There was $70 on the table, thanks goodness he didn't give her the $50. Overall it was a lovely stay....just the housekeeping thing and knowingly irritating the concierge. And disposinf our plates every buffet meal we had (3 out of 4)But all staff helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay, possible scam after paying”
Reviews.Author: ericclaus
Reviews.Content: Rooms good (we were on the 18th floor), fitness centre good, buffet breakfast good, but when we paid they said that they couldn't release the deposit on our credit card for 48 hours. The booking was worth about $2300 and they took $3700 off my credit card to confirm the room. That is not great: $200 / room / night for how much we might drink out of the mini bar but not that bad. The bad part was that in every other hotel I have stayed in when you pay the bill the debit amount on the credit card is erased immediately. At the Shangri-La they said we would have to wait 48 hours to get our own money back. That is just not right. They couldn't explain why that was the case and when we said "in every other hotel we have been to this never happens. They acted like that was our tough luck. When a business does this I lose trust and that makes me doubt whether I want to stay there again even though the other parts of the time there were very good.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel was a big, fat, dirty, overrated disappointment.”
Reviews.Author: upsticksandleft
Reviews.Content: We paid a small fortune to stay at this hotel for four nights and our room was dirty (stains of 'gunk' on the walls), poorly/cheaply furnished, overlooking a motorway - harbour in distance, rooms not serviced properly, unfriendly staff who were extremely unhelpful, and even smarmy in some instances. Location of this hotel was great but that is where the attributes stop. Oh and there's also a lovely heritage pub right nearby. I read the reviews that say this hotel was a great experience for some travellers and I must confess, it strikes me that these travellers can't have stayed in many decent hotels. Would not recommend (are you joking), would not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “a great weekend”
Reviews.Author: scotto_10
Reviews.Content: We booked a grand harbour room (#2012) for our wedding anniversary weekend. Check in was smooth, the room was HUGE, the bed was a proper king and not two singles, and the view was superb. Parking, cocktail bar and breakfast were included and were well worth it. The room staff were also very effecient, maybe too efficent at times. We were 'testing' the bed out when someone knocked on the door and let themselves in. I didnt expect to need the privacy light to be on at 4pm ! As a Sydneysider, I cant think of any hotel that offers what this one does. stay elsewhere if you want, its your loss !

Reviews.Title: “A 5 Star experience”
Reviews.Author: Kilkerran
Reviews.Content: Having read earlier reviews we were somewhat apprehensive, but from the moment we arrived until we left 19 days later you would have to be super critical to find fault with any aspect of this hotel. We were celebrating our 50th wedding anniversary and although we arrived at around 7am, we were given a temporary room by the Customer Services Manager to shower and freshen up until the Premier Grand Harbour view room we had booked was vacated and prepared. Less tahn 2 hours later our room was ready and wow! what a room and what a view, this must rate as one of the worlds most spectacular views from a hotel room, and we have stayed in many all over the world.The decor was fine and a great bathroom and daily cleaning of a high standard. The bed was fantastic and the most comfortable bed we have ever experienced, and the room was really quiet despite its location in a city nera to road and rail, in fact the only noise was from the ferries who always seemed to sound their horns on departure. Our deal included breakfast in Cafe Mix and this was a very good buffet, plenty of choice and generally not too busy, with eggs freshly prepared to your requirements. The concierge Colin had recently received a best concierge award and from the way he looked after us for our entire stay, it was obvious why he had won the award. The Customer Services Manager Losalini Menon kept a watchful eye on us throughout and on our wedding anniversary arranged a special treat of a delicious handmade chocolate cake, some handmade chocolates and a lovely bottle of wine for which we were most grateful. The hotel General Manager also made himself known to us , and we spoke to him on several occasions right up to the day we left and he also treated us to a bottle of wine in the Altitude Restaurant on our anniversary, where we had an excellent dinner prepared yet again by an award winning chef. Every member of staff we came into contact with ( and in nearly 3 weeks this was many ) , all where friendly, helpful and courteous. The hotel is also well located near to Circular Quay for the ferries, buses and railway andif it was not for the boredom of a 22 hour flight to get there we would most certainly return. Truly a 5 star hotel and 5 star experience . Well done Shangri-la Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Magnificent View and Location”
Reviews.Author: anevinos
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in a few 4 and 5 star hotels, and this one is definitely one of the best. We received a free room upgrade to get a view of Opera House and Harbour Bridge from the tenth floor. The bed was enormous, and very comfortable; and the bathroom was nearly as big as the bedroom! I had a massage at the spa while we were there, which is one of the best I'd ever had. The staff were excellent; friendly and helpful. We had valet parking and breakfast included in our room cost (good value, considering); and the breakfast was delicious. The hotel is well located in the Rocks area, with an easy walk to just about anywhere. Great place, we would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A great view and location”
Reviews.Author: TJBPRC
Reviews.Content: This is a high class hotel and it is worth paying extra to get a room with a view of the bridge and opera house.

Reviews.Title: “Ask for a renovated room.”
Reviews.Author: aussie1961
Reviews.Content: I should have read the earlier tripadvisor reviews warning that the older rooms are not up to scratch. Just stayed two nights in a king harbour view that was in dire need of a renovation. Carpets could have been vacuumed a little more carefully, old televisions and all beige. Did not get a chance to see one of the renovated rooms but must suggest that these older rooms are NOT worth the money. 45.00 a day for parking is a bit steep considering the high room rate. Position and views however are excellent for first time visitors to Sydney and the staff are very polite.

Reviews.Title: “Well located high quality hotel in the best city in the world”
Reviews.Author: TravelloverLondon
Reviews.Content: The Shangri-La in Sydney is well located a short walk from Circular Quay. Reception staff were helpful and our room was available immediately on check in (fairly early in the morning). The room was of a reasonable size, very clean and well presented. There was a good size bathroom. The room had large windows with lovely views over the harbour (we had a Darling Harbour view which was still spectacular). The swimming pool area was quite disappointing, small and overlooking a main road. We did not really have time to sit by the pool but if we had been staying longer this would have been disappointing (particularly when the temperatures exceeded 40 at times). We ate at the Altitude restaurant. The views from here were amazing and the food was of a very high quality. Staff were attentive but not intrusive.

Reviews.Title: “Good Business 5*”
Reviews.Author: lukmi
Reviews.Content: Nothing to fault this hotel for. Great location, steps from Circular Quay. Great views of the harbour from some rooms. The room we were given had the biggest bathroom and bathtub. Overall we were satisfied, though we only stayed one night.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel and wonderful service”
Reviews.Author: Skymyst
Reviews.Content: Having recently stayed at the Shangri-La Hotel, May 5 to 8 and then May 21 to 23, I can confirm this is a wonderful hotel to stay at, we found the staff friendly and helpful, our first room was on the 24th floor and we have lovely views of the Sydney Harbor Bridge and the Opera House, it was lovely to sit on the window seat in the room and just watch the passing parade of boats. The bathroom was lovely and I loved the big fluffy towels, so luxurious. As it was a special occasion for us we had cocktails in the Blu bar and then dinner at the Altitude restaurant again, could not fault anything from the service to the food, yes, it was expensive but it was your above average restaurant and I loved the way the Chief came out to serve the meal and explain what you were having, you could tell he just loved the work he was doing and in pleasing people with their meals. We also ate in the restaurant on the 1st floor we did not eat buffet style as we prefer al a carte, again no problems with the meals, one night I had the fillet steak which was cooked to perfection and Iâ€™m very fussy about my fillet steak. I also used the gym and the swimming pool, I thought the gym equipment was really good and first class and well set out and the pool was also very nice. On our return on the 21st again everyone was very friendly and helpful, they were trying to get us on the 29th floor, we had arrive very early at 10.30 due to the ships arrival and the room was not ready, but we were not expecting it to be, so we had a nice coffee and Danish in the coffee bar, got on the â€˜freeâ€™ internet to let family and friends know we were back on dry land, as both myself had my husband had come down with bad head colds we really just wanted to go to a room, so at 1pm they got us on the 26th floor where a room was ready. Again no issues with anything and would not hesitate in recommending the Shangri-La hotel. Just a note I did put in for Golden Circle membership and have not yet received my permanent membership card?

Reviews.Title: “Still gorgeous”
Reviews.Author: BecandB
Reviews.Content: It had been about 5 years since I last stayed at the Sydney Shangri La hotel. They have done renovations since I last stayed which made an already attactive hotel even better. The key highlights are: amazing beds, well designed rooms with a sense of luxury and space but a cosy feel at the same time, friendly and efficient staff. The horizon club is a wonderful service for business travellers. There are no real negatives - for leisure travellers the location is very quite but not necessarily the most convenient location for entertainment. Regardless - this is deservedly 5 star and I would gladly recommend the hotel to all travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing dining experience”
Reviews.Author: matsinsyd
Reviews.Content: Went to eat the buffet tonight on the 1st floor. Seemed quiet, only 20 or so seated, no one would serve me....to seat me, then waiting for dishes to be cleared and get a water took too long. The food was very ordinary and quite sparse...apparently there was an Indonesian food festival....it just meant that normal items that you would like to eat - eg tomato in a salad, or hot pasta, were missing. Walked around and around looking for something to eat....not appealing at all. Deserts were dry. The price for this....$68! Hotel is nice, staff are generally friendly, but the food is average. Not Shangri-la standard.

Reviews.Title: “expensive but worth it”
Reviews.Author: seekmp
Reviews.Content: my partner and i stayed at the shangri la for a treat for the night. i had high expectations being a sydney local and they were well met. the room was standard hotel size but very nicely decorated etc but the view was amazing. we had a harbour bridge/ opera house room which was a bit more pricey but really worth it. the service was also very good. everyone was very helpful and courteus. the only problem we had was that we wanted to eat at altitude resteraunt but it had been booked out 2 weeks before, so if u want to eat there book well in advance. Had some drinks at the bar, bit of a wait to get a good seat but still worth it. thought it was a bit of a shame the pool and spa area was on a low level with no view but all in all as your waking up in bed looking at the sun rising on the bridge and opera house it all seems unimportant! the valet parking service was also excellent. but beware that it costs $45 and that is the only option if u need parking.

Reviews.Title: “I wish I could stay a little longer...”
Reviews.Author: swimmerwestcoast
Reviews.Content: Situated in the Rocks near tons of excellent restaurants and interesting pubs to visit. Staff were friendly, knowledgeable and extremely helpful. Hotel was buzzing with international guests across the weekend. We had a buffet breakfast included in our rate which was very good. On the Sunday it was difficult to get anything like an omelet cooked, I guess everyone was having a late morning. The view from the cocktail lounge on the 36th floor is amazing and well worth the wait to get in (while waiting we were able to have a drink in the lounge next door. You can see the Opera House and the Bridge; quite a different perspective and great for long exposure photos if you can get close to window.

Reviews.Title: “The Shangri-La Sydney â€“ â€œThe Tale of Two Hotelsâ€�”
Reviews.Author: JBond214
Reviews.Content: Iâ€™ll start with the conclusion first: Horizon Club high-floor rooms at the Shangri-La are newly renovated and worthy (with some reservation) of being called a 5-star room. The non-Horizon Club rooms, even those in higher room categories are a disgrace, clearly have not been renovated or updated in the last ten years, and would barely rank as 2.5-stars. Given the disparity between rooms at the same hotel, you can see why I call the Shangri-La a â€œTale of Two Hotels.â€� Those people who get a newly renovated room should be pleased. Those that get stuck with the older non-renovated rooms will be sorely disappointed. We arrived at the Shangri-La on a Saturday night, looking forward to staying in a â€˜realâ€™ five star hotel after nearly two weeks of touring in New Zealand. We had booked â€œa Grand Deluxe Harbor View Roomâ€� nearly a year in advance, specifically requesting a high floor room. Upon check-in, I noticed the room we were offered was only on the fifth floor (of this nearly 40-story hotel). Given the low floor, I was worried the view would be obstructed and asked the clerk to provide us with a room on a higher floor. He said the hotel was full, and that the room on the fifth floor was the only â€œGrand Deluxe Harbor View Room.â€� But not to worry, the view would be unobstructed. With some reservation, we went to room, opened the door were ABSOLUTELY SHOCKED and SORELY DISAPPOINTED with what greeted us. The ceiling was falling down where water had leaked from above, and the ceiling was moldy (see picture). The chair was threadbare (see picture). The TV was a big tube TV straight from the 1980s (see picture). The room overlooked the roadway, and the windows were so dirty and obstructed that we could barely make out the Opera House and Harbor Bridge. The windows were so dirty I initially thought they were fogged (like after steam from a shower)â€”no, they were just very dirty. Given its sad state, this room was neither â€œGrandâ€� nor â€œDeluxe.â€� Nor, given the dirt-covered windows did it have a â€œHarbor View.â€� Do not be misled, as I was, into thinking that a â€œGrand Deluxe Roomâ€� will be â€œGrandâ€� or â€œDeluxe.â€� (I can only be fearful of what state a non-â€œGrand Deluxeâ€� room at this hotel would be like, since this one was so sorry). I immediately called down and after speaking with the front desk, the manager agreed to show us two other rooms (funny that the clerk checking us in failed to mention these other clearly available rooms). The front desk quickly sent a clerk who took us to see two other rooms. The first was on the 16th floor and was not much better than the first. The second was a Horizon Club room on the 34th floor with only a â€œpartial harbor view.â€� Walking into the Horizon Club room, we wondered if we were in the same hotel. The difference was night and day. To their credit, the hotel should be commended for sending a staff member to escort us to see two other rooms. The Horizon Club room was clean, well-appointed and had clearly been renovated recently. The TV was modern, the window was clean, and the furnishings were not worn threadbare. While this room had only a â€œpartial harbor viewâ€� we could see the Opera House (though not the Harbor Bridge). Even this room had some details that were a bit off for a hotel that bills itself as five-star. For example, there were hotels in the wall that had not been correctly patched (see photo). These minor detail issues aside, this room was so much better than the first that there was little room for complaint. We had dinner in the Altitude Restaurant on the top floor of the Shangri-La. The views were absolutely stunning and the food was top-notch. Be forewarned, youâ€™ll need reservations well in advance. Whether staying at the Shangri-La (or elsewhere) you should stop in to Altitude for dinner. The views alone are worth it. Before dinner, we went to the bar on the top of the hotel and had a drink. Unlike the view at Altitude, the barâ€™s view is nothing to write home about. In sum: If you can get a newly renovated room on a high floor (even with only a partial view) youâ€™ll be happy. If you get stuck with an old non-renovated room, youâ€™ll be sorely disappointed. And do NOT be misled into thinking that a â€œGrand Deluxeâ€� room promises to be â€œgrandâ€� or â€œdeluxe.â€�

Reviews.Title: “Room starting to show some wear and tear ... and need some TLC”
Reviews.Author: ShibaInus
Reviews.Content: Haven't been back to to the Shangri-La Hotel, Sydney in quite a few years and had the pleasure of staying there this week. It is still a wonderful hotel with good ambiance. However the room we stayed in was tried. Scratches & stains on the woodwork, small chips in the door frame paintwork. Faded stains from spills on the carpet. Amenities were right up to standard and the bed very comfortable. Overall the during the stay our experience was good.

Reviews.Title: “Large room and good service”
Reviews.Author: Thierrydsmt
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights at this nice, modern hotel in the Rocks. We were pleased with the size of the room and the great view of the Sydney Opera House. This is the second time we have stayed at a Shangri La property (Bangkok was the first) and once again the service was very good. Nice, welcoming people both at check in and at the concierge. Free access to the internet and plenty of computers available. Sydney is an expensive city but this hotel is a decent value. The inside pool is not bad either.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Pearls63
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a short break in Sydney to celebrate our 20th wedding anniversary. Whilst there we stayed at the Shangri-La. I had requested a room on a higher flloor if one was available. On check-in we were advised that we had received a room upgrade. We were given a Harbour View suite on the 32nd floor which was truly beautiful, and we were given a gift of champagne and chocolates. We have stayed in a number of hotels around the world and this was one of the best. The staff were extremely skilled and delightfully friendly, from the concierge with his helpful directions to the doormen arranging taxis and luggage. Our Room service/housekeeping request was very promptly attended to, and coming home in the evening to a room prepared for the night was a sweet surprise. We will return and we would recommend the hotel without hesitation as very well situated and absolutely a 5 star experience.

Reviews.Title: “Top class hotel that looks after...”
Reviews.Author: Mfoggy
Reviews.Content: Top class hotel that looks after everything. Attention to detail is superb.

Reviews.Title: “First Class, But You Pay For It”
Reviews.Author: Lattebud
Reviews.Content: My partner was invited to speak at a conference being held at the Shangri-La hotel. The conference sponsor paid for our room, so we received one of the lower end rooms. But, the room was well equipped, clean, incredibly large, bright, very comfortable, and ranks among the best we've experienced. The conference was held in public rooms. All these rooms were comfortable (including climate control), well equipped (working audio-visual), and there was always a hotel staff person available to take care of any small issues. The free internet in the room, WiFi throughout the public areas, and terminals in the lobby were much appreciated. The meals provided for the conference attendees were top notch. So, what was wrong? Cocktails, room service, and other extras were about 30% higher than other hotels in the area. Also, the hotel is close to the bridge, but other attractions (e.g. Botanical Gardens) are quite a hike. But, Sydney is a great walking city!!

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended: The perfect introduction to Sydney”
Reviews.Author: timothyg
Reviews.Content: I'd never been to Sydney, so read a lot of TripAdvisor reviews of several sites. I don't spend much time in my hotel room, but the right hotel can influence my reaction to the entire city, so I try to choose carefully. Generally don't like big hotel chains, but the Shangri-La sounded good and had a great rate. When I arrived, I felt a great sense of relief that I'd made the right choice. The staffers were extremely friendly and the room was big and, most important, quiet. As a bonus, it had a great view. The location was perfect, within walking distance of some great sight-seeing attractions at The Rock, close to ferries to other areas, and there were some terrific restaurants nearby.

Reviews.Title: “good views, nice location, overpriced.”
Reviews.Author: travelingmike167
Reviews.Content: Hotel has a great location in the Rocks, very close to most of the tourist destinations. The harbor views are great if your willing to pay the premium to get them. I booked a room for three nights, april 23-26th (fri-mon). On booking I requested a king bed, but on check in was told that only twin beds were available in the rate I had booked at. Offered me to upgrade to a better view room with a king bed for $40 more per night. As I really prefer a larger bed I asked about the club rooms as a option. This would be a better view, king bed, breakfast, and use of horizon club. This was $80 more per night and figured I'd give it a shot. Room was fairly large and nicely appointed, but nothing special especially for a 5 star establishment. Bathroom was large with separate shower and large soaking tub. Room included internet (all rooms do here) but only wired in the room. Wifi was available in public spaces only. I was in room 3417, which did have great views of the opera house and harbor. Bed was very disappointing as it was two twins connected together and was easy to tell by lying on the bed. I realize that this may be common practice, but again my initial purpose for upgrading was for a king bed. Whatever they used to connect the bed made it very uncomfortable to sleep across this area and I ended up huddled up on on side or the other. Horizon club was nice. They had drinks and appetizers from 4-6pm nightly, and you could have breakfast there in the morning (limited menu from buffet downstairs). There was newspapers, wifi, and non-alcoholic drinks available throughout the day. Staff here was very friendly and helpful with some good places to get some pictures. I ate breakfast at the buffet each morning since it had a wider selection than the club, including made to order eggs, omelets, and pancakes. Food was the same every day including fruit, yogurt, bread selection, cheese, meat tray, cereal, juices, egg station, bacon, ham, hash brown wedges, miso, chinese noodles, & roasted tomatoes. Food was good quality, but not overly exciting. If you don't like your eggs runny, you really need to make this clear when ordering made to order eggs. Twice in three days I ordered 2 eggs over medium and got runny whites. Not really a problem in that they remade them to my liking, but still a service issue. Plus, if you pay for the buffet it was $38. Gym was decent with several cardio machines and weight center. Pool was small, supposedly heated, but was too cold for my liking. All in all a very nice hotel with good views if your willing to pay for the upgrades. Unless breakfast is included in your room rate I would eat elsewhere. Remember, that they do include internet in the room rates when making comparisons. I enjoyed my stay here, but calling this a five star hotel seems like a bit of a stretch.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: frshnts
Reviews.Content: Beautiful very upscale hotel with magnificent views of Sydney Harbor the bridge and the Opera house. Much like the Shangri-La we stayed in Cairns earlier in our trip the hotel was clean very modern with a top notch staff. A short walk to the harbor and opera house with many many places to eat drink and shop along the way. The rooms are fantastic well appointed and quite large. This is a true five star hotel and one of the nicest in the Rocks area.
