The Horizon Club on the private floor was quite nice well staffed, and considering the price of local restaurants a very good bargain at $40 dollars a day per person. You can eat and drink 3 times a day in the club if you want to and I would suggest having breakfast in the downstairs restaurant which is included in the price of the Horizon Club. My only complaint with the Club was that they tended to have the same food every day for both afternoon tea and dinner.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel spoiled by reservation issues”
Reviews.Author: vissi87
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Shangri-La Sydney for 1 night in February. We had booked a twin bedded Deluxe Grand Harbour View room for the night and this was confirmed on booking. When we arrived at the hotel, we were informed that there was no twin bedded rooms available despite our confirmation and we were told to return later while they sorted something out. Upon returning, we were told by the man at the desk that there was a twin bedded room available for us but it was still occupied and it would be at least 2 hours before we could check in. He also mentioned that there was a king room he could move us into immediately. I asked if we could check into this room and then relocate into the twin room when it became available. He informed me that would be fine and that he would let us know when it would be possible to move. After spending a couple of hours in this room with no word from reception I rang and asked them when we would be moving into the twin room. They had not heard anything about it and proceeded to me they did not have any twin rooms available. After explaining our situation they eventually told me that the best they could do for us was to move us into a larger king room with a rollaway bed on a higher floor and with a better view. We accepted their offer though we thought it was strange how the twin bedded room promised to us earlier had simply disappeared. We wondered if it was actually reserved for us in the first place. Once we had relocated to the new room 2 bottles of champagne had been brought up to make up for the inconvenience. Though we were very annoyed by these problems which spoiled our first day in Sydney, our stay at the Shangri-La was pleasant from then onwards. The hotel itself is beautiful, the room was gorgeous with an amazing view of the harbour, the bed was extremely comfortable and breakfast was nice. The only minor problem with the hotel is its location on a hill, which is a steep climb to the top (though the views from the rooms are worth it). I recommend you take a shortcut through the lobby of the Four Seasons hotel to avoid most of the uphill walk. Overall a decent hotel stay tarnished by an error in the hotel's booking system.

Reviews.Title: “Top Quality Hotel - Great Views (but get the right room!)”
Reviews.Author: poppydoodlesdad
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Shangri-La while stranded in Australia due to the effects of the Icelandic volcano. This is a top quality hotel with the service and amenities you'd expect at this price point. The one advantage the Shangri-La has over many similar hotels in Sydney is uninterrupted views of the Opera House and Harbour Bridge. However, you do need to get the right room! Rooms with a "harbour view" may in fact be overlooking Darling Harbour, not the bridge or opera house. We were able to up grade from one of these rooms for a very reasonable rate but it is worth checking as this is what sets this hotel above the others. Has a great bar at the top of the building offering fantastic night views and in all other respects the hotel was excellent. Large comfortable room, beds, bathroom etc. Food was very good, if expensive - both of which you might expect in a hotel of this kind. Service was excellent and staff helpful and polite. Does have a lot of business users and meetings / conventions but these are not a problem for the leisure traveler. Pricey but excellent quality.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced & lacking attention to detail.”
Reviews.Author: 40girl
Reviews.Content: I am staying in Sydney with work for a month. My 40th birthday was last week. Before I came up I researched many Sydney hotels and read countless reviews. I wanted a special hotel for a special birthday. My boyfriend flew up from Melbourne to spend the weekend with me. When I booked, I told the person on the phone it was my 40th & I booked a horizon club room (for the view & extras) she said they would arrange something special for me during my stay. I arrived and was given a card to get me to the 3oth floor, I was not personally escorted there as was indicated on the website & I carried my own bag. I checked in, no problems, staff were friendly. I got to my room & was disappointed with the view, the opera house was obscured by the corner of the building! I was annoyed to be paying $500 a night. I asked if I could change rooms, this request was taken care of efficiently & I got a better view. I opened the mini bar to find a bottle of water opened & half gone, the ice tray broken, & many items on the minibar list not even there! I had to call to ask for the promised birthday "treat". I then got a phone call & the pen did not work! Also there was only 1 bathrobe in the closet! Again I would have had to call to get another for my boyfriend! The hotels saving grace is location. Great views from the horizon club, but uncomfortably hot in the morning, even the staff were hot! It didn't ruin my weekend, but many aspects of the hotel lacked the polish that you would expect from a good hotel. I certainly won't recommend it for a special occasion to my friends. I saw many brides there on the weekend so I hope they had better quality rooms than we did.

Reviews.Title: “Disapointed”
Reviews.Author: PedrinhoLondon
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently stayed for four nights at the Shangri-la hotel, Sydney Australia and found the accomadation and service far below the service offered by other Shangri-la hotels. The room was small and decorated sparcely, while the bathroom was far from lavish, Considering the prices charged it was quite a let down particularly when we had just arrived from Hong Kong were we stayed at the Island Shangri-la which provided unsurpassed service and accomadation that was large and extremely well appointed. Service at the Shangri-la Sydney was also generally slow. Its a disservice to the Shanri-la brand and the expectation of customers that depend on the brand.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel ... you get what you pay for!”
Reviews.Author: LadyofHaig
Reviews.Content: My husband booked a Harbour View Suite for our 25th Wedding Anniversary on one of the Club floors, he is a member of Shangri la's Prestige Dining Club so we receive a discount on rooms and other incentives. On arrival at reception we were told to go straight to the 30th floor to check -in where we were informed much to our delight that we had been upgraded to the Ambassador's Suite on the 35th floor. On entering the suite we found a bottle of "bubbles" fresh fruit and some chocolates. The suite has views over the inner harbour from the bedroom and lounge and city views over Darling Harbour from the office. The bed as others have already noted was really comfortable and that is coming from a very restless sleeper. Being on one of the club floors entitles you to go to the Club Lounge located on the 30th floor were they serve food and drinks as part of your room cost, great views from here as well out over the Opera House and Harbour Brigde. We had a wonderful stay and are very grateful for the pampering. We have stayed here previously on a lower floor for a previous anniversary and besides the lounge with grand entrance and extra toilet and vanity, the other room was much the same with views over both the inner harbour and city. On checking out we were pleased that this was also done on the 30th floor as returning down to the main reception there were queues of people waiting to check out, everyone including us had left it to the last minute, the staff must hate the 11am rush! Like I said you get what you pay for, don't expect the best room at the cheapest rate, this applies anywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay ~ Fabulous View!”
Reviews.Author: rr77uk
Reviews.Content: When we arrived at the hotel we were delighted to be given an upgrade at no extra charge. Our room was on the 16th floor and we had the most fabulous view of both the Opera House and the Bridge. Our room was very spacious, very comfortable and had everything you could wish for. Breakfasts were good with a lovely selection and staff friendly and helpful. We had a wonderful stay and hope to come back again.

Reviews.Title: “Great locations and rooms but mediocre service”
Reviews.Author: travelforever12
Reviews.Content: One thing my husband and I must have is a clean hotel and Shangri-La. The rooms and bathrooms were very clean. The view was amazing from our room and lounge. We felt the service could have been better from the receptionist from the lounge and the concierge. They always seemed annoyed to help us even if they weren't doing anything such as checking personal emails and facebook pages. The concierge even refused to call a restaurant to make reservations. I would recommend this hotel because of the great amenities and cleanliness but the staff def needs to be friendlier.

Reviews.Title: “Shambolic Shangri-La”
Reviews.Author: Harbourbridge
Reviews.Content: Recent 2 night stay on an Easter package with our 5 year old son. Problems right from the start. 45 minute wait to check into our room. Then on getting to room - no rollaway bed or bathrobe/slippers for my son as per our package (despite delay at check-in). So phone Housekeeping and I am told would get bed within 30 minutes - asked if bed could be put in room after 6:30pm as we were dining at Altitude at that time. Assured would get bathrobe/slippers at same time. At 4:30 pm a knock on the door, two men with bed - am told they did not get message from housekeeping. They do up bed and leave. No bathrobe/slippers anywhere in sight - so call Housekeeping again! Within the first 2 hours of checking into the hotel I ask myself -should it be such hard work to get exactly what one has paid for in a 5 star establishment? This thoroughly spoiled what was supposed to be a fun Easter weekend for my son and a relaxing break for me. If it couldn't get worse, when I presented myself to Chi-Spa for my massage the next day - I was told they had no record of my booking and was turned away without any suitable explanation. When I came up to my room and found my email confirmation, I rang down to the spa again to see if they could find my booking. Was fobbed off my the reception staff with alternative times (none of which were suitable) and no explanation was offered. I had read the previous reviews about this hotel which mention dated rooms, old fashioned TVs, etc - but all this could be overlooked if the service had not been lacking. Needless to say, I was bitterly disappointed as I had been looking forward to this break and had high expectations after my flawless experience at The Shangri-La, Bangkok in 2001. On a positive, the weather held so we had a stunning harbour view from our 12th floor room, they allowed us a slightly later check-out and my son enjoyed his Easter Chocolate workshop! Next time I will stay at home and save my cents, rather than put myself through a 'stay-cation' that leaves me needing another holiday!

Reviews.Title: “Great location - great views of a great city.”
Reviews.Author: CraigT54
Reviews.Content: We spent a week at the Shangri-La Hotel and enjoyed our accommodations and location. Located just a short walk from Circular Quay it's easy to access the rest of Sydney's big city venues. From our room we had a view of the Opera House and the harbor activity. Other rooms have views of the Sydney Harbor Bridge and other water views. We especially appreciated the closeness to The Rocks area where we enjoyed the weekend markets and the older style architecture. The Opera house is a short walk as well and we took in a play plus the tour. Around the nearby Circular Quay are numerous shops and restaurants. From souvenir shops to fine apparel, this location took care of the shoppers in our group. A short jaunt away from the Circular Quay area puts you in downtown Sydney with its fine dining and shopping. We walked everywhere, even over to Darling Harbor where we took in the Aquarium. If you like modern city architecture along with a flavor of the old city, this is the place to be. The rooms were comfortable and well appointed. While it was very expensive to eat at the hotel we were privileged to have breakfast included in our tour package. We did our dining in the area. You can grab a quick lunch time bite along the Circular Quay or there is a nice little burger stand just a few blocks away in the Rocks. Don't forget to checkout the dinner experience on the tallship, the Swan. That was a special evening event. Unique Qualities: Conveniently located to the Circular Quay for area transportation by ferry, the Opera House, the Rocks area of historical Sydney and a short walk to downtown Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “All depends which view you get”
Reviews.Author: CrouchyLondon
Reviews.Content: What people think of this hotel lagrely seems to depend on which side their room is on and so which view. If it's of the bridge and opera house then it's lovely, if your view is on the other sides then it's an average city hotel, just about 4 star but not 5. We came on trip of a lifetime family trip, and in fact are still here as I write. We and perhaps our travel agent made the mistake of seeing "harbour view" on the booking and thinking that meant opera house etc, but it's Darling Harbour which is is just frustrating when you know that on the other side is one of the world's top views. It needs to be made clearer what a Darling Harbour view means, as apart from a bit of an average harbour the view is mainly of a 10 lane motorway, even from the 14th floor. Limited chance of being moved, although we have asked. Other gripes, this is/was a smoking room, still has that air freshener smell. Lifts rumble constanly, there internal noise insulation is inadequate. There don't seem to be nearly enough staff here, especially compared to the amazing levels of service at the Kowloon Shangri La where we stayed en route. Phones are answered slowly, room tea bags aren't replaced, no complimentary fruit even though we're members of some Shangri La club that gives you that. So all in all it's fine but nothing special, and disappointing if you're on a once in a lifetime trip and the view is the point of booking this hotel. The best thing about it is the Rocks location.

Reviews.Title: “Really wanted this to be perfect”
Reviews.Author: Antsuz78
Reviews.Content: We checked into this hotel for a 2 night visit to Sydney just to see the sights we hadn't seen in 15 years. The location of the hotel is perfect, a short walk to The Rocks, Circular Quay, Opera House and great photos of the bridge. It was difficult to find in the car so suggest you have a Satnav or computer handy to look up directions. The staff were lovely, and on check in I was offered either a corner suite on the 12th floor or a standard room on the 27th. I chose the suite and it was beautiful - had a separate loungeroom, HUGE bathroom and really large bedroom. The bed was comfy and there was free wireless internet. I was so excited and as I had a long hot shower I was thinking how I just couldn't fault this hotel. That night as we turned the TV off for bed, I realised the major downfall: traffic noise, so irritating and just ruined this beautiful hotel. I had the most disturbed sleep ever, and by 6am the traffic was really starting to hum, every truck, siren was heard clearly. Also, the slamming doors inside the hotel seemed to make the room shake. The breakfast was okay, but for the $38 fee they charge if it's not included I would eat elsewhere - a lot of the food was getting cold, and every morning they would put out a tray of strawberries that went before you could get one, which they didn't replenish. Also the muffins and pastries always tasted kind of stale. I was disappointed, and if sleep is important to you, maybe a higher floor would help, or if you can afford it choose a harbour view room which is away from the highway noise.

Reviews.Title: “absolutely sensational - in all respects”
Reviews.Author: susiesnowflake
Reviews.Content: Fabulous staff, wonderful views, beautiful room and amenities, great ambience - just a sensational hotel and a wonderful location to enjoy the best city in Australia!! Room service and food wonderful. Rarely do I actually enjoy a business hotel stay but this was different. They do luxury very well here - thank goodness I was a guest of an international group visiting Australia as I think it is $$$$$, but don't get me wrong - well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Don't miss the view from the Bar...”
Reviews.Author: JudiStL
Reviews.Content: Shangri-La Hotel has the best view of the Sydney Harbour Bridge and Opera House. If you want to see the bridge from the top, this is it. Save the $200 pp to cross the bridge and go above on the top to see the bridge and a tremendous view of Sydney. Expensive drinks, but worth it for the view and photos.

Reviews.Title: “a great location with some of the best views of Opera house and bridge, great loc”
Reviews.Author: TodgeProvence_France
Reviews.Content: We had high expectations! Had decided to push the boat out and book a Club room overlooking Opera house for 5 nights. Slightly disappointed by lack of welcome and there was no accompaniment to Club floor or suite as described in there list of features. We did mention this mid stay in questionaire and noted the increased attentiveness thereafter. In all other ways we were happy, spacious comfortable suite with great view, nice bathroom although shower was weak.The view from Club lounge is stunning over bridge & harbour. Breakfast was ample , we enjoyed apperos in Club lounge although men must wear long trousers (no three quarter lengths) although bizarrely Jeans seemed to be acceptable! The hotel is in a great location for Circular quay and the Rocks which we really enjoyed.

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat the location or the view!”
Reviews.Author: Saudade_tjrs
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a week as part of a corporate incentive trip, and had a fabulous time. Of particular quality were: 1) Breakfasts at the Mix. These were filling enough to get us through most of the day, and we especially loved the individual French press coffee pots and/or espresso drinks; 2) The VIEW! We weren't on a particularly high floor, but had the luck of a Harbour/Opera House view. How tremendous is having that icon in clear sight 24/7? Wow! 3) Super comfortable bed. We slept so well! Service at the hotel was cordial and helpful. Overall, as in much of Sydney, the staff seems very young, but they answered all our touristy-type questions graciously. I'm not sure, given my stays at other 5-class hotels, that this hotel has quite the features or seamless service that some of those others do, but still feel quite comfortable ranking it very highly as a 4-star hotel. I can't fault management for this and don't believe, in looking at average room rates, that they're trying for that uber-gloss, greet-you-by-name-at-the-door category. I would most gladly stay here again, even on my own dime :-). Go to Sydney and have a comfortable stay at the Shangi-La, right in the heart of the Rocks. Climbing all those surrounding stairs will help you justify all the good food you can find in the area!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: fisherontour
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay immensely. Our spacious room on 23rd floor gave us magnificent views of the bridge, harbour, opera house and the Pacific Ocean in the far distance. The bed and pillows were very comfortable. The hotel is ideally located in the Rocks to visit most of the central attractions. A short walk down some steps brings you to the quay. We tended to walk everywhere from the hotel, but as Circular Quay is a transport hub, it is an easy matter to take buses, trains and ferries to all parts of the city and beyond. Yes, this hotel is pricey, but bearing in mind that it is very comfortable and excellently located in one of the most desirable and beautiful cities on the planet, then the cost represents fair value. We recommend The Ghost walking tour (tickets from Rocks visitor centre), BridgeClimb (just down the street from the hotel), catching a performance at the opera house (we saw America) and watching the fruit bats fly out from the botanic gardens at sunset.

Reviews.Title: “Great view, good location”
Reviews.Author: Yug3
Reviews.Content: I booked a room using an on-line booking web site. As I was travelling with my teenage son (to do the Bridge Climb) I rang the hotel the next day to confirm that we had a twin and not a double. The reservations staff were at first a little confused as to the room type I had booked (Opera House view not a Darling Harbour view) but got their message straight and we ended up with the room type as expected. The view from the 28th floor was nothing short of magnificent and the beds and pillows were very comfortable and clean. The downsides on the room were: - the lingering smell of tobacco from long since past smokers who must have stayed in the room; - what must be paper thin walls that allowed arguments from the hallway, arguments from the room next door and the all kinds of sounds of running water from above and below to permeate our room at night. We didn't order any food service or eat in the hotel restaurants. I made the mistake of asking well meaning staff what good restaurants were nearby... their tastes are obviously different to mine and if your are looking for a special meal in Sydney I recommend you do not go anywhere near "City Extra" at Circular Quay or "Pancakes At the Rocks". The location is good but you must like steps if you stay in this hotel. Although Circular Quay is only 5 minutes away, the hotek is in The Rocks area and everything is up or down a hill. So beware if you have a pram or require any walking assistance. Finally... the spa in the gym is good but my bathers still have a strange smell that needs a second wash.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly adequate, just not as absolutely fantastic as I had hoped.....”
Reviews.Author: Ratbag
Reviews.Content: We stayed here because we had been advised that the Shangri-La brand was realy really good, and as we were in Sydney only for about 20 hours we wanted to have good views and a good location, both of which we had. Check-in was pleasant and efficient and the concierge was really helpful as I'd left my sweater on the plane so he phoned Air NZ and I picked it up the next day from the airport! Good recommendation for dinner too! The room however was slightly disappointing; we had paid quite a lot for a room that was supopsed to have a panoramic view of the Opera House & Harbour; it wa fine but not just as awesome as I had hoped. What was disappointing was the guest handbook which detailed the charges thatwould be added to your account if for example you tool a fancy to the dressing gown/phone book/note pad etc. I completely understand that there is a lot of petty thieving from hotels, but it just left a bit of a bad taste to be perfectly honest. Less forgivable was the damp towel left in the bathroom from the previous guest. Apart from this the bathroom was huge and beautiful. We had cocktails in the bar before going out. There is a bit of a dress code thing going on, so my husband had to go & put trousers on but then we were shown to a window seat where we could see a great view of the harbour & surrounds as the sun set, absolutely awesome! The breakfast was superlative; huge variety of different food and worth the high price if you like brekky as I do, so I definitely got my $36 worth! There is a really gorgeous swimming pool as well as a fitness centre, used the pool and that was a great way to start the day. Check out/cab ordering was absolutely painless. I'm really not quite sure why the Shangri-La didn't float my boat; possibly becuse I knew it was the end of our marathon trip and our next sleep would be courtesy of the airplane (flat bed but still not what you really want). I'm sure that everyone apart from the most picky would find this a very pleasant place; I think I just wasn't keen on Sydney per se......

Reviews.Title: “Expensive and a few negatives but the view is spectacular.”
Reviews.Author: JustOneThing
Reviews.Content: We're Sydney-siders so we've seen all the sights of our wonderful city but when some friends from Brisbane were staying in Sydney overnight, ready to board the Queen Victoria for a cruise, what better place to show off Sydney than Altitude Restaurant. This was our second stay at the Shangri-La and even with the Shangri-La Dining Club discount, the rooms were still pretty expensive for what you get. We're used to the value at Traders in KL but this is Sydney. Anyway, we were upgraded to a Harbour View room which was nothing special but of course, there was the view, even from the 11th floor it was pretty impressive. Our only complaint this stay was that we'd checked in at 3pm and after a hectic day, missed lunch and expected we'd be able to grab a snack at the hotel cafe or coffee shop. We were stunned to learn there was nowhere in the hotel where you could get a snack or even a sandwich unless you ordered room service and were willing to pay the exorbitant prices. The only thing on offer in the Lounge was coffee and cakes. The hotel staff suggested we try the pizzas at the Australia Hotel a couple of hundred metres down Cumberland Street. Excellent pizzas by the way and the passing parade in this part of town is always interesting. Dinner at Altitude was spectacular as expected and our guests marveled at the fabulous view. Other reviewers have mentioned that Sydney Shangri-La could take some tips from some of the Asian 5 star hotels and we can only agree. On recent trips to Asia EVERY hotel had free wi-fi in the rooms. Not free here. The Shangri-La is good, not great, it is very expensive, the view is spectacular, the location excellent, the Altitude Restaurant amazing and the staff generally pleasant and friendly. But it could do better.

Reviews.Title: “5 Star Views 3 Star Service”
Reviews.Author: AJMBournemouth
Reviews.Content: We had booked (and paid for) a Deluxe Grand Harbour View room. It was worth paying for too as the view was fabulous! Room 1810 was spacious and had the most comfortable beds we have ever slept in and a large marble bathroom with bath and seperate shower cubicle. However management please note that: 3 small drawers are not enough and a miserly 6 coat hangers in the wardrobe is beyond forgiveness - it took 2 phone calls to get any more plus my welcome basket of fruit never arrived. The bathroom looked great but the soaps were of medium quality and there was no bidet or fexible shower hose only a fixed one ( so American ugh!). But the views made it worth it ! Breakfast in the first floor restaurant was terribly let down by the gross inefficiency of some staff with a very long wait to be seated, having to ask for coffee, running out of food and long waits for simple things like fried eggs. There are no good little cafes nearby and Mc Donalds is a 10 minute walk away in Circular Quays and a steep uphill walk on the way back, so my advice is to get to breakfast early . This was a really shame as it put us off having the buffet dinner there until the last night and we then wished we could have had dinner there every night. The choice and quality at dinner were excellent. So the hotel is great for views and has all the faclities such as business centre, free internet, swimming pool and a helpful and informative porter service but the restaurant service needs an upgrade. Having said that service in general in Sydney restaurants was not that great with orders being forgotten and everything so slow.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, service not the usual Shangri-La standard”
Reviews.Author: SeeingIsBelieving007
Reviews.Content: Shangri-La Sydney is a good hotel but not sure if it's worthy of 5 stars. Location is fabulous, close to the harbour and the attractions of the Rocks and the city centre. Views of the harbour are to die for, paritcularly from the bar upstairs. Hard to pinpoint one paricular things, but the service here is not what you would expect from a 5 star hotel. There are often inadequate staff on duty, staff are too busy to be polite...they don't go the extra distance to make your stay enjoyable, which is the difference between a 4 and 5 star hotel. Rooms are comfortable and we slept well, but the hotel is popular with hens nights in particular which brings the tone down a little.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay for New Years Eve celebration in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: RamblinAtlanta
Reviews.Content: I stay 7 nights at the Shangri La Hotel in a Horizon Club Opera House view room during the festive period between Christmas and January 3, 2010. I loved it. The staff in the Horizon Club lounge was superb as was the concierge team downstairs in the main lobby. My room was beautiful with a gorgeous bathroom. The Horizon Club lounge was extremely nice with the best view in Sydney over the Harbour Bridge, the Opera House and beyond. The breakfast, all day snacks, tea, cocktails and canapes available in the lounge were extremely good and very convenient. The gym was the best hotel gym I have seen anywhere and I used it many times during my stay. The Bar at the top of the hotel has one of the best views ever for a bar! The hotel's location is great for getting around as it is very near to Circular Quay with all of its ferries and buses. Also, the hotel is just down the street from the entrance to BridgeClimb - Sydney Harbour Bridge for those who want to do that, which I did. In addition, it is located at the southern end of The Rocks. I would stay at the Shangri La Hotel any time I am in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: caesar52
Reviews.Content: Had an awesome stay at the Shangri-La Sydney! Hotel and room was comfortable and elegant and I particularly loved the bathroom. We were upgraded to an room on the 18th floor with an Opera House view and I alreaady got a great deal on the room rate as it was. The bed was soo comfortable and to die for, even better than Marriott and Westin beds. Plate of fresh fruit upon arrival. Free internet and bottled water was a huge plus, most other competitors nickel and dime you for these things. Great location to access Harbour Bridge, Opera House, Circular Quay, and George St as well as Rocks Restaurants. Like others have mentioned, be prepared to get some exercise walking up the hill on Essex. This didn't really bother us since we are active and fit but for others it might be a problem. The staff at the hotel was great, very nice and helpful and I never once found them arrogant or pretentious. We didn't eat at the restaurant but the menu looked delicious. We did go the the bar for drinks and it is a must see for amazing views and is a great place to get a drink and watch the sunset before going out for the evening. Last call is a bit early though, so it might be too late for after dinner drinks. The only thing I would mention is that for a hotel of this caliber I would expect a larger, flat screen HDTV. We didn't really watch TV though so it wasn't a problem. I will definitely look to staying at other Shangri-La properties in the future.

Reviews.Title: “best location for Sydney”
Reviews.Author: catozzo123
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is practically in one of the best spots of Sydney, the view from the rooms is wonderful (if u get a city view room), 5 minutes walk and you are at Opera House or in the same town in the City Centre shopping malls, i did not try the restaurants so i cannot rate them. Service is Ok - Rooms are clean and properly equipped - the position is GREAT. A little Over Priced but these are the prices in Sydney for this standard. Definetly will be my choice next trip to Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular location and views over the...”
Reviews.Author: Globaladventure
Reviews.Content: Spectacular location and views over the harbour, bridge and Opera House. Beyond that, a pretty average experience. Very much a large, group hotel, so you become a number. Shangri La took it over from Westin and have done some light refurbishment, but the hotel still remains a standard, corporate experience. The Club Lounge offering is Spartan, so not worth the supplement. There is a lounge bar on the top floor which looks like a couple of chairs have been thrown into an empty room. Room Service was patchy (and considering Sydney is known got it's cuisine - this was a let down) and overall, the service was friendly, but not memorable. There is a nice pool and the gym is OK. A colleague had a spa treatment, which he did not rave about. Looks like Shangri La are interested in milking the profit, rather than creating something special (which they are supposed to be known for)

Reviews.Title: “Needs freshening up”
Reviews.Author: marduk1
Reviews.Content: Stayed here several times over the last five years as it is close to the company I visit. All the services you'd expect from a 5-star hotel but has needs refurbishment. Not Sydney's top hotel and nowhere near the standard of the Singapore Shangri-La.

Reviews.Title: “Oppulance”
Reviews.Author: GoneTravelling2010
Reviews.Content: By far the best hotel in Sydney! We stayed in a harbour view room & upon arrival champagne & chocolate dipped strawberries were waiting. When we returned from dinner our bed had been turned down & fluffy robes & slippers were laid out. Very impressed with the service provided by reception & overall cleanliness of both the bedroom & bathroom. Would not hessitate to stay in this world class hotel again. Thank you for an unforgetable stay!!

Reviews.Title: “Faultless again...”
Reviews.Author: Magpiesnest
Reviews.Content: Iâ€™ve stayed here five times now and each time it seems to be getting busier so obviously the word is spreading about how good this Hotel is. I was unable to get on the Club levels this time so experienced breakfast in the main breakfast room for the first time and a very pleasant experience it was â€“ an excellent hot buffet and plenty of cereals and fruit if thatâ€™s more your style. The rooms are a good size and if itâ€™s your first trip to Sydney then a Grand Harbour Room is a must for you â€“ get as high as possible. If not available get Harbour or Opera House views. I normally find something to grumble about but the Shangri La has beaten me again. The staff are always friendly, efficient and helpful, the food is great and the rooms are fabulous with gorgeous views â€“ what more could you want? Iâ€™ve now stayed in five Sydney hotels â€“ The Radisson Plaza, Observatory, Sheraton on the Park, Four seasons and Shangri La. The Shangri La is the best followed by the Four Seasons and Observatory with the other two way behind.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: steveessex2
Reviews.Content: This was our first time in Sydney so I splashed out a bit and paid for a horizon club room with a view of the Harbour Bridge and the Opera House. The view from our room was stunning and was all I could ask for. As others have said the hotel is on a bit of a hill so if you come back up Essex Street be prepared for a climb, but if you walk up Cumberland Street from the Rocks it isnt as bad. Personally I had no problems with any part of the service I received and would happily stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “you call that service?”
Reviews.Author: Thomas19811
Reviews.Content: i have misplaced my sunnies in the altitude bar and rang in the next day and was told i will be contacted, this never happend. i rang in again to be told the same thing by Garth from switch, never happend. i send an email through the website but had no response in 2 weeks, it just seems that nobody cares about this. i am truly disappointed that a simple thing as this can not be followed up and i have to take it public to get a response.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location..Nice view of the harbour as well as Opera”
Reviews.Author: Pravinpednekar
Reviews.Content: Arrogant staff... Good club on the topmost floor..

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Location - Best Views - Perfect Honeymoon Location”
Reviews.Author: JJ_Cairns
Reviews.Content: This was an amazing hotel and perfect for our honeymoon. We stayed in the Horizon Club and were totally blown away when we walked into our room. The panoramic views over the harbour, including the bridge and opera house, were awesome! The pillows on the bed were the most comfortable we have ever had. The staff were so friendly and just took care of everything, from returning our hire car to arranging our airport transfer. The Rocks were so close and everything we wanted to see and do was all within walking distance. We can't wait to go back ... just need an excuse to go to Sydney ...

Reviews.Title: “the best view in the world”
Reviews.Author: AlitNorthamptonUK
Reviews.Content: This is the second time we have stayed at this hotel. We just knew we would not be disapponted. Our room was huge, a wonderfully massive bed over looking the Harbour Bridge and Opera House - we woke each morning early just to watch the sun rise over the Opera House or the sea mist drifting in. One wall is glass so the views are unrestricted. Ate in the top floor restaurant on night but had difficulty booking a table as it is so popular. the breakfasts are also fantastic, there is nothing more you could want. The concierge was fantastic and helped us with checking in online for our onward flights, recommending restaurants and booking other places for us to eat. It is an expensive place to stay but totally worth it.

Reviews.Title: “great views of the harbor in the rocks area”
Reviews.Author: bruindan2000
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the shangri-la sydney for 3 nights as part of our honeymoon to australia. the hotel staff presented us with a very nice spa basket and a bottle of champagne to congratulate us on our wedding. a very nice touch to our stay as the staff was excellent in making our time in sydney awesome. we got a deluxe harbor view room. the view of the opera house and harbor bridge were simply amazing from our window. our room package came with a daily breakfast buffet. the breakfast buffet was decent the first day, but the second and third times started to get a bit old as the items did not change much. the juice selection was awesome though. i would only recommend eating the breakfast buffet only if your room rate comes with it. otherwise it is too pricey as there are other option outside of the hotel. the room itself is spacious and comfortable and the room amenities are typical to what you would find in a luxurious, high end hotel with an awesome bed and nice bath products. my only complaint, and it is a trivial one, is that the tv was an old box. the other hotels we stayed at all had newer lcd or plasma tvs. but that really shouldn't be a deal breaker for the hotel. the shangri-la is located in the rocks area. my only complaint about the location would be the steep hills and stairs you have to walk/climb through to get to and from the hotel. the rocks area is also a very touristy area. if you absolutely need to stay next to the harbor, the shangri-la is a great option. my wife wanted the views of the opera house and bridge from the room. however, if you want to be closer to the city action with more restaurant options, i would recommend staying closer to the darling harbour area. we stayed at the westin sydney on our last night in australia and found it to be a better location to eat and experience the sydney city life. from the shangri-la, the opera house, ferry terminals, and the center of the rocks area is a 10 minute walk. darling harbor and chinatown is about a 30-40 minute walk. in summary, i would recommend the shangri-la if you want to be in the rocks/sydney harbor area. however, in the evening, the rocks area does not offer much for entertainment and dining options as the city center does. also, if you don't get a harbor view room, then i would also consider staying somewhere that offers more value for your money. we wanted views of the opera house and bridge from our room, and consequently paid for it and had no regrets as the views of australia's iconic symbols were inspiring.

Reviews.Title: “really nice...”
Reviews.Author: blooh
Reviews.Content: It was my first time to stay at a Shangrila hotel and it was great. We booked several nights at the hotel the first three we did through wotif. We booked a darling harbour room but was given a wonderful upgrade to a deluxe harbour view room (2710) which was absolutely stunning! the room was huge! personally i think it has the best view of the bridge and the opera house (we also booked a premiere grand harbour view room which was okay, granted we were at a lower floor). i don't really recommend booking a horizon club room, i've seen better club rooms at other hotels (marco polo for example). but the staff were really nice and really gracious except for an odd persistent knocking by someone delivering the paper the day we were supposed to check out asking if we were checking out that day. what the what?!? i was like sleeping in (sure i didn't switch on the privacy button) but come on, if someone isn't answering in the first couple of minutes, give it up dude! anyway, it was still a nice stay and would absolutely recommend the hotel. and the steep hill thing is quite true but go ahead and take a cab, it's absolutely worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommend this Hotel to Everyone”
Reviews.Author: ilovetotravel02
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the "Shangri La, Sydney" - January 9th to 11th. It was a celebration of our 30th Wedding Anniversary and was very special. We booked a Horizon Club Deluxe Harbour View Room. When we arrived - to our suprise, we were upgraded to a suite on the 33rd floor with just the most magnificent views of North Sydney, Luna Park, The Harbour Bridge, Circular Quay, The Opera House and all the way along the Harbour to the Heads. I love Sydney and the Harbour and this was a wonderful view that we just sat and looked for ages. HINT...If you are looking for a room with a view, let the booking staff know when you make the booking, as I read in some of the other blogs some people were not happy. If you want a particular room with a view - it stands to reason that in a big city you will not get a view on the 3rd to 10th floor if other buildings are in the way. The food was fresh and delicious. All the staff were so friendly and we were extremely satisfied with the service from all we came in contact with. When we departed from the hotel a taxi service was promptly arranged and we were whisked off to Wharf 8 to join our cruise ship without any fuss. Thankyou to all for a most memorable time when we stayed with you. We highly recommend your hotel to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Asian elegance a few blocks up from the harbour”
Reviews.Author: London_Travellers_09
Reviews.Content: We opted for an Opera House and Bridge view room and the view made our stay at the hotel. I would recommend booking this type of room. On the plus side, the hotel is very well located a few blocks from the harbour and all its attractions. If you are walking, note that it's a steep 5 minutes up the road from the harbour and the 4 seasons is a block closer to the harbour. The room was spacious and clean and plushly furnished. The bathroom was modern. There was free internet in the lobby. The fitness centre was adequate and the pool, while not large, was also adequate. On the downside, the hotel seemed overrun with tourists and the atmosphere in the "all you can eat" breakfast room was like London during the January sales. So, it's a bit cramped for the numbers the hotel was catering for. The staff in the breakfast room were, however, charming and helpful and proactively attentive to guests' needs. Due to the atmosphere we chose to eat here only once. Other than this, we have no criticisms and, though on the expensive side, the hotel was good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Best views in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: EugeneL3
Reviews.Content: Always try to stay at the Shangri La in Sydney. Most of the suites overlook the harbour bridge and opera house, and it is a must for the first time visitor to Sydney. Service is exceptional. The bathroom has got magnificent views out to the Blue Mountains. Some of the suites are in neeed of a refurbishment, but who looks at the room with views like that!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic views, service, food and location.”
Reviews.Author: Brian60London
Reviews.Content: My wife and I chose Shangri-La, Sydney to experience New Year in warm weather. The Altitude Restaurant on the 36th floor was the perfect place to do this. Expensive but worth it and arranged by e-mail with EmmaSue who was most helpful. There was a problem in that our hotel booking had not got through to the hotel (from our travel agent) but the intervention of Paul at the front desk calmly and efficiently sorted us out on the busiest day of the year. Many thanks again Paul. The view from the restaurant and indeed our room was incredible and the location of the hotel ideal for the bridge, opera house, circular quay and shops. A truly memorable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel - can we live here?”
Reviews.Author: LouDrewG
Reviews.Content: We booked two nights at the Shangri-La Sydney on the 9th-10th January 2010 to celebrate my wife's birthday, and catch a musical in Sydney. Originally, I booked the Emerald City package, but after discussing upgrade options with the check-in staff, we decided to upgrade to an Opera House view room on the Horizon Club floors. The reception staff were brilliant, they went through the cost of the package we had originally booked, and worked out the cost difference of staying on the club floor (only worked out to be around $20 extra a night, really worth it). We did have a couple of problems getting to our room, the first set of keys the reception staff gave us wouldn't allow us to select the floor we were staying on (30th) in the elevator. I went back to the reception area, where they replaced the keys and escorted us to the elevator to check the new keys. The new keys also didn't work, so the reception staff borrowed a key from another staff member, and used that to select our floor on the elevator panel. They were wallking away from the elevator as I asked "so how do we fix this problem so we can get to/from our room?". The reply was that we should go to the Horizon Club reception area on our floor and get new keys. Although this did work, it would have been much better service for the staff member to accompany us to the floor and ensure that the new keys issued by the Horizon Club worked for us. It's a minor point, but management of the hotel may want to provide some guidance to their reception staff on these sort of issues. Our room was marvelous, and lived up to all of our expectations. The view of the opera house was excellent. We were in room 3017, and had a good side view to the opera house and out over Sydney Harbour toward the headlands. We were rather close to the apartment towers next door, and I image the rooms further towards the back of the hotel (3018 onwards) would suffer with the view of the apartment complex next door - although we were very happy with the view from our room. The ammenities in the room were excellent, and we spent a good hour delighting ourselves with all the thoughtful little touches in the room. The last hotels I have experienced which are so considerate of the needs of their guests are the Shangri-La and Le Meridian hotels in Singapore, and the Sydney Shangri-La was of a similar standard. The bathroom was large and elegant, with an excellent selection of toiletries, including (to the delight of my wife) bath salts and makeup remover. We had afternoon tea and pre-dinner canopes in the Horizon Club lounge, and the quality of food and drinks was excellent. The staff were numerous and very attentive. The views from the lounge are amazing with five story high windows. We also had breakfast both mornings in the lounge, and the quality was also excellent. Particularly early in the morning (before 8am), the lounge was wonderfully quiet - things got a little hectic around 9am during breakfast, but there were plenty of staff around and they were always checking if we needed anything. I have to make a special mention of the bedding in the Horizon Club rooms. We both had two of the best nights sleep we have every had thanks to the wonderful mattress toppers (which I believe are goose or duck feather) which you just sink into. I would love to know if it's possible to purchase these mattress toppers, or which company supplies the Shangri-La with these. We would also like to mention the excellent service we received from the valet staff. We had left a charger for our camera in the car, and Michael from the valet staff was more than happy to escort us to our car so we could retrieve the charger. He also collected our bags from our room, and was professional, friendly and courteous at all times - everything that staff at a five star hotel should be. Thanks to the Shangri-La Sydney for a wonderful stay, and we will be back soon!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic view of sydney harbour”
Reviews.Author: CLCass
Reviews.Content: The view of the harbour including the harbour bridge and opera house are amazing!!!!! Make sure you get the buffet breakfast included (if you aren't one of those people who only has a coffee in the morning) because there is such a large assortment to choose from you are going to really enjoy the experience of sampling different breakfast delights. Also, every staff member we dealt with was friendly and very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing - over priced”
Reviews.Author: TRAVELCHICK48
Reviews.Content: Having read many reviews on the Shangri La we decided to bust the budget and booked a Deluxe Opera House View room for three nights including New Years Eve. The first room we were given was on a smoking floor and was really unpleasant, we didn't request a smoking room and were not asked if we would like one. We were made very aware that it was New year and that most of the rooms were booked out. We were given the exact same room on the floor above (716 I think). Yes we had a view of the Opera House, but it was not like the view you see on the website for the Deluxe Opera House View Room. We looked out over a highway and were surrounded by tower blocks, the view was sideways on and really disappointing. Having already complained once, I did not have the energy to present myself at reception again to go through another argument. The room was in need of an overhaul, the carpet was very tired and grubby. The bathroom while large and well appointed was also a bit tired looking. The public areas are very smart and clearly have been re-vamped in recent years. As I said we were prepared to blow the budget for a special occasion and really wanted to be close by the waterfront for the celebrations. We are familiar with Sydney and know the rocks area quite well, so were very pleased with the location of the hotel. This hotel failed to deliver on so many fronts, staff are very cool and unfriendly, in very short supply at peak times like check out, when we had the misfortune of getting to the desk at the same time as a coach party was trying to check out. We didn't use any of the services of the hotel as I didn't want to give them a single dollar more having paid an arm and a leg for a really mediocre room. Having said that I made a local call and was charged $7.52 for the privelege. The only other Shangri La hotel I have stayed in was in Penang where we had the most delightful stay, this is what I was expecting in Sydney and didn't get. Management need to shape up if they are going to continue to represent this chain in such a wonderful city.

Reviews.Title: “Would not stay there again”
Reviews.Author: Jenny236
Reviews.Content: Very hot and humid, we changed rooms three times and every room had the same problem, insufficient AC. The breakfast buffet is terrible. Overall, would not recommend this hotel, definitely not a five star quality.

Reviews.Title: “Another Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SimonSouthampton
Reviews.Content: We were returning to Sydney 2 years after last visiting and wanted a quality hotel in the heart of the city. We decided to go with one of the big names down near the front and read various revies on this site. We have stayed at the Shangri-la Singapore and decied to go for this one in Sydney. Having booked and then reading some of the reviews on this site was a little concerned that it might not live up to expectations. Horizon Club Grand Harbour Deluxe Room. We arrived at Sydney Airport and caught the train to Circular Quays, 10 min walk pulling suitcases, yes steps are a little daunting but managable. You can use the pleasent rear entrance to the hotel which we found later. Went to the desk and were then shown to the 30th Floor for our private check in at the Horizon Club. Horizion Club duty manager very pleasent, unfortunatley room not quite ready so she offered us tea and coffee in the lounge. Room ready within about 5 mins. The trip to Oz is to celebrate a special birthday for my wife, and having emailed the hotel we were delighted to find they had made a cake for her and put it on the side in our room, a small touch but very much appreciated. Room was large and clean, with a huge bathroom with both shower and bath, very well equipped with toiletries etc. The main room has all you would expect including safe, tea coffee, minibar, DVD Player TV etc, and a view to die for. With the big window seats you could sit and watch the scene 33 floors below for hours. Room was very quiet no exterior or corridor noise. Room cleaned as required. Horizon Club Lounge, provided a very good tea and coffee service in the afternoon. After 6 it changes to a drinks and cannopies with very attentive staff. Breakfast in the Mix Cafe on the first floor is included, and had a great selection of Cooked and Continental style breakfasts. The noodles were very nice. Eggs are cooked as you want them and they can do omletes or pancackes. Location has been an issue raised with the hotel. Yes the steps can be quite steep but we found if you walked around circular key to under the bridge there is a smaller flight of steps and then a much gentler hill to the hotel. You also pass to nice pubs, the Glenmore and the Australian Hotel, The Australian was our prefered choice, excellent range of beers and great Pizzas.

Reviews.Title: “Class”
Reviews.Author: Drumadd
Reviews.Content: From the second we walked into this hotel, we were greeted and looked after with dedicated personal attention. Escorted to our room we enjoyed a luxurious 48hrs at the end of a Canberra Business Trip. Hotel offered Moet & Chandon inclusive along with all of the finese and detail of a high quality 5* hotel overlooking Sydney Opera House and the harbour, in sight of the Harbour Bridge on the edge of the famous Rocks Old Sydney area.

Reviews.Title: “Lacking in 5 star service”
Reviews.Author: DottyUK
Reviews.Content: As we don't expect to spend many New Year's Eves in Sydney we decided to treat ourselves to an Opera House View room for 4 nights at the end of a month long trip down under. It cost us an arm and a leg and we were expecting something "special" from this hotel to end our trip. The positives were:- Friendly welcoming receptionist and room ready at 1pm which was great. Very helpful concierge (when you could get through on the phone) Good clean room. Large bathroom with lovely deep bath and separate shower. Lots of products refilled daily. Great view of the Opera House. 4 x free internet PC's in lobby. Great location by the rocks and harbour. Excellent spacious gym. Lots of CV equipment. The Disappointments were:- We waited so long for an order of food in the lobby bar that never arrived that we had to cancel the order and go elsewhere. It was NYE afternoon and understandably busy but we didn't expect to be paying $32 each for a burger and wait over 45 minutes in a hotel of this calibre. Went to a pub 5 minutes up the road and got our food within 10 minutes - and a lot cheaper!! Not impressed! Housekeeping tried to service our room sometime before 9.20am on the third morning, which seemed rather early. Because we were still in our room and had the privacy light on they left a card under the door telling us to phone housekeeping if we wanted our room serviced. When we tried to phone several time noone answered. We eventually had to leave a message. This seemed to be an unreasonably early time to try and service a room and surely the onus should be on the housekeeper to return later and not for us to request the room to be serviced. Poor! There was hardly ever any staff at Guest Services in the lobby. Eventually when there was I waited 10 minutes to speak to a nice lady called Minnie and feed back the 2 experiences above. She wrote everything down and told me that there wasn't a manager about (why not?) but that she would speak to one later about our issues. We never heard anything back from anyone during or after our stay. No explanation or apology from the management - nothing. Seems that it is was a total waste of time feeding this back and that the management aren't interested. Really disappointed with this. Overall the Shangri La is a smart hotel to stay in and we did really enjoy our stay in Sydney. However, the hotel wasn't as "special" as we expected it to be and therefore didn't seem worth the extortionate amount of money we paid to stay there. In hindsight I think we were simply paying extra for the great location and view.

Reviews.Title: “fabulous opera house view - beware poss double charging”
Reviews.Author: explore_&_indulge
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights in the Deluxe Grand Harbour View room, which overlooks the Opera House and Sydney harbour Bridge. The view is spectacular, both day and night. The room very spacious and clean. The hotel is at the top of the Rocks, so a bit of a climb if walking, and handy to the Rocks Markets at the weekend. The choc coated strawberries at the market were delicious for chocolate fiends. Breakfast at the Art Gallery at Circular Quay a 5 min walk away is very good, and can sit outside with a view of the opera house. The price was worth it for the large room, fabulous view and proximity to the Rocks. A couple of negatives - Shangri-La took a security swipe of my debit card on arrival "for security purposes" but failed to mention their practice is to actually put a $ hold on the card account (in our case = 3 nights accom booked + $100 per day for expenses). Then failed to take the hold off when they processed payment on departure. Effectively double billing until I noticed on my statement. Also at 10am sharp on the morning of departure the room card was de-activated (so when returned from breakfast at 10.10am we no longer had access to our room and needed to line up at reception to get it re-instated to get luggage and then line up again to check out). Staff are professional and polite but a bit rote.

Reviews.Title: “Shaved hairs in the bed!”
Reviews.Author: RnR_Report
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for the first time to celebrate my husband's birthday and booked a Horizon deluxe grand harbour view room. Room had a spectacular view of the harbour; furniture a little weary but acceptable; large bathroom; the bed did look a bit wrinkled and untidy (not the usual 5 star presentation) - but overall an agreeable start to our stay. It went downhill after our first night in the bed - we both woke up feeling itchy all over! Initially we were worried about bedbugs, but on close inspection of the sheets, we found short hair shavings all over the sheet! I complained to housekeeping - and while they were responsive in promising to change the sheets (which they supposedly do every day anyway) - I got the odd impression that this was nothing new for them - the level of concern was surprisingly relaxed. And the only apology we received was a housekeeping maid knocking at our door after the room had been made up to ask us if we were happy - nothing was offered as a token of apology for our unpleasant experience e.g. a stiff drink!!! So much for the hair in the bed - we moved on and were looking forward to a celebratory dinner at Altitude - which had a very unpleasant start - more info is provided in my separate review of this restaurant. Some aspects of this hotel have merit - the view is great - but unfortunately the hair in the bed experience makes us very reluctant to return nor to recommend it. For the same tariff, stay at Quay Grand or the Observatory.

Reviews.Title: “Merry Christmas at the Shangra-La”
Reviews.Author: DownunderSugarglider
Reviews.Content: I was looking for somewhere nice as a Christmas treat and after comparing all the sydney hotels choose the Shangra La - and honestly we were not dissappointed. A beautiful elegant hotel. One of the attractions is the HUGE rooms - really spacious, with giant king size beds. Even the marble bathroom is HUGE. OK - so the stats. Mini bar, robes, slippers, comp shoe shine, newspapers WIRELESS INTERNET (woo hoo!). TV has many cable channels (but not the new digital ones). Toiletries are Shangra La branded and all lavender scented - shower gel, shampoo, conditioner, lotion, toothbrushes, etc. Towels are a decent size and good quality. Showerhead is GREAT ! good pressure. I found a foam pillow in the cupboard (I HATE feather pillows which every hotel in the world supplies) and we took the doona out of the bag. The bed was really soft. I think it had a sheepskin mattress protector. I don't know if it was meant to be really soft or if it was way past it's prime but I found it unusual. The air conditioning worked very well - got the temp right very quickly and easily. We had a Harbour View room and were looking directly at the the Harbour Bridge and up and down the harbour. (admittedly good views of the toll booths too - so I just looked the other way - at the Opera House). So I was WAY happy with the view - which is what we primarily wanted. And the other thing we noticed - it was so quiet. No hearing the neighbours, other TV's, trolleys in the hallway - nothing. Valet parking worked as it should. check in and out was smooth (although no express check out). We couldn't get into Altitude Restaurant for Christmas night dinner - fully booked. So we went to the Four Seasons - which was half empty and the meal wasn't great - so Sydneysiders must think that Altitude does something right. Had breakfast the next morning at Cafe Mix buffet - which was very thorough: some chinese and japanese items such as congee, miso etc as well as the usual sausage, bacon, toast station, pastry station, fruit station (including mango and cherries!) cereals, meats and cheeses, yoghurt, and a man doing the egg thing. I had poached but the majority were ordering omlettes - it all was quite good quality and very good service. We stayed here as a treat and to see that harbour view and were very happy! I'd recommend the Shangra La for anyone after that quintessential sydney experience.

Reviews.Title: “best harbor and opera house view in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Nes1745
Reviews.Content: great location, staff is very attentive and helpful, price of breakfast is a bit steep (AU$38), no jacuzzi, only indoor pool, furniture a little dated, old TVs in rooms, could use a little facelift, but otherwise exceptional property, has better views than Four Seasons which is one block away down a hill, not recommended for people who have difficulty walking, recommend you get he grand deluxe view room including harbor - sensational - it is like a postcard, great bed and linens, spacious bathroom with great water pressure for separate shower, nice towels, large room with comfortable sitting area and desk

Reviews.Title: “Let down by the little things”
Reviews.Author: JeremyAustralia
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Sydney Shangri-La several times over the last 15 months, each time choosing to stay in Horizon Club rooms for the extra service and amenities. We had developed a strong preference for this hotel, and hadn't been disappointed until now. When we need to travel to Sydney for a wedding, I immediately booked a Horizon Club room at the Shangri-La, opting for the Horizon Deluxe Grand Harbour View room. The room itself was lovely and the view from level 32 was spectacular. The problem was the little things. As regular Horizon Club guests, we have come to expect certain standards of the Horizon Club. This time, the in-room amenities (including tea and toiletries) was of a lower standard than usual, and when we asked for better quality tea, we were sent more of the same tea. The supplied toiletries were the standard hotel toiletries, rather than the more special ones usually found in Horizon Club rooms. We went to the Horizon Club lounge for afternoon tea, only to find that there was virtually no food available, and very difficult to get hot drinks (there were no tea pots and the coffee machine was malfunctioning). We asked the duty manager, who to her credit, immediately tried to rectify the problems, but the result remained the same. Then that evening, we found the bed too soft. This resulted in both my fiance and I sinking into the mattress (separately) and hardly being able to see or get close to each other. Not the ideal situation for a romantic evening. Whilst the room was lovely and the service was excellent, the little things that were inconsistent based on past experiences and therefore failed to meet expectations, really marred our stay and our impression of Shangri-La hotels. Hotel management needs to ensure that the consistently high standards are maintained for the premium prices that are charged.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, memorable visit”
Reviews.Author: CharlieButterworth
Reviews.Content: A short walk from the city centre, overlooking the other harbour hotels, the Shangri-La has the most astonishing views. All bedrooms overlook the harbour, but the views inside the hotel are excellent too. The hotel entrance is not for the claustrophobic and is a bit of a let down, but the service and facilities is everything one would expect from the Shangri-La Hotel Group. Six stars!

Reviews.Title: “One major thing lets it down”
Reviews.Author: ukquilter
Reviews.Content: We are currently in room 2513 which is a premier harbor view. That view is indeed fantastc and mesmerising as it changes constantly. The room is very well appointed with furnishings and spacious. We particularly appreciated the provision of a kettle. However, one thing lets it down badly. The air conditioning is negligable. The control has a thermostat and a fan speed of low medium and high. However, with the fan on high and the thermostant on teh lowest setting there is hardly any fresh air into the room. If you sit at one particular spot on the bottom corner of the bed or stand on tiptoe and put your hand near the grill there is a sligh draft and that is it. The engineer who came to look at it for us indicated that it was working to its maximum, that all rooms were different and that we would have got a better airflow if we had had a smaller (cheaper) room! His advice was to keep the curtains shut at all times which make sense when we are out but surely for the price we paid for this room in one of the hottest countries in the world we ought to be able to cool the room and look at the view?!. Like all hotels the windows are sealed for fire purposes so the room is stuffy and it is not even the hottest temperatures Sydney gets. Very disappointing from this class of hotel in which the room should be a pleasant refuge after a hot day of sightseeing not something to be endured. The swimming pool on the other hand is delightfully cool.

Reviews.Title: “3am vacuuming - but otherwise a lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: KTJMelbourne
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for business over the last week. It is a lovely hotel, the staff are unfailingly polite, and friendly. The gym facilities are great - although get busy very quickly. However. I was awoken on my first morning around 315am by the noise of vacuuming - called reception to get it stopped which it was. This then happened on 2 further nights even after I complained (and received a bottle of red and some handmade chocs by way of apology). When I checked out the manager charged for only 3 nights instead of 4. Fair enough - but issue still wasn't resolved as it kept happening. I guess the only thing I would say is refuse any room on the 4th floor - the other floors are dedicated bedroom floors so you shouldn't have any issues. I would stay there again - but on a floor over 10 (not sure whether that would fall into my companies room rate or not)!!

Reviews.Title: “Expensive but worth a try”
Reviews.Author: loveluxury1
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights in November whilst on a 4 week holiday travelling east coast Australia. We have stayed in the HK Shangri La and both their Malaysian properties. If I was to compare them to the Shangri La Sydney I would only rate it average... it does not have the same feel or slick service that the far east resorts do. We stayed in a deluxe grand harbour view at about Â£220 per night and the view made it worth it. Overlooking the bridge and opera house was simply stunning. There were 3 things that stopped me giving the hotel 5 out of 5... 1- when we arrived we had to bring our own cases into the hotel to reception- not what you expect at a top 5* resort. 2- the windows in the room could have done with a cleaning on the outside. 3- we ordered room service and the food came with things that were not detailed on the menu. Aside from those 3 things, the views are what make this hotel. We also went for drinks at the bar on the top floor which was pretty poor... we had better views from our room. The location is central but does involve a steep-ish climb. If we return to Sydney we may try the Four Seasons or the Westin but the Shangri-La would still be in with a chance.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOTEL - UNBEATABLE VIEWS”
Reviews.Author: BRIMS121
Reviews.Content: Wow â€“ what a superb hotel this is â€“ whilst travelling from the UK, we stayed here twice on the â€˜Occasions packageâ€™ and both stays were superb. Indeed we were upgraded on the first stay to a Deluxe Grand Harbour view room with an amazing view of Sydney harbour. This hotel lives up to its 5 star rating and would highly recommend. Plus Points Good sized rooms Unbeatable views Great levels of Service Good Facilities

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Newiegirl09
Reviews.Content: For our anniversary, my husband and I bought tickets to the theatre and we thought we would treat ourselves to a 5 star experience at the Shangri La Hotel . We decided on the Darling Harbour room where we were looking forward to "Enjoy panoramic views over Millers Point, Darling Harbour, Walsh and Lavender Bays and west through to the Blue Mountains." However the view from our room was very different to this and it was definately not worth the over $400 price tag. For a hotel that promotes its views as an asset I was extremely disappointed and the view we saw could be seen from any hotel along any freeway. We kept the curtains closed to actually block it out. I definately don't feel that this room was value for money and there are other hotels that are cheaper with better views.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: krissiebird
Reviews.Content: We loved the room on the 28th floor with the most fantastic view over the Harbour. Sitting on the window seat early one morning, we watched as a large cruise ship passed the Opera House and sailed under the Bridge. The staff were all very polite and helpful, even the housekeeping staff we passed in the corridor on our way out each morning,greeted us and wished us a pleasant day. We had dinner at the Altitude restaurant and were impressed by the food and the service. I would advise making a reservation if you want to eat here, we hadn't but were lucky to get the last table. I was very impressed by our waiter and do wish I could remember his name for a special mention as he was most attentive but not obtrusive. It was a great evening. The service at breakfast was not as good. It was small things like plates not being cleared, running out of fresh mushrooms for omelettes, waiting ages for butter to come from somewhere and also for coffee refills! The location in the historic Rocks district makes it very convenient for Circular Key, bars, restaurantsand shopping but it is hilly with lots of steps to negotiate. No problem for us, it compensated for the extra kilojoules consumed, but it could be for those less active/mobile. We enjoyed our stay at this hotel and will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Park Your Car Here - your bill will overshadow any good memories you had of the hotel”
Reviews.Author: makuva
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very nice and in a very good location (although it is extremely difficult to get to the first time both walking and driving but you eventually find your way). The bar on the top of the hotel has great views and fun (but super expensive) mixed drinks. All of the good memories of this hotel though were completely overshadowed by the outrageous parking bill we received upon check out. We had rented a car for the few days we were in town to go visit the Blue Mountains and take other day trips. I know valet parking at hotels is expensive but over $40US a day is OUTRAGEOUS! Plus the girl at the check out could point to nowhere that this rate was stated in writing, leading me to believe she could have made it up on the spot. I don't know what other hotels in Sydney charge for parking but to me this was over the top.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: SoeradjR
Reviews.Content: The Shangri-La is an amazing hotel with great staff. The location in Sydney is excellent: great views and lots of things to do in the neighbourhood! I can recommend this hotel to everyone who wants to relax, be in the heart of Sydney and dont mind to pay a little extra.

Reviews.Title: “Shangri-La Hotel Bar”
Reviews.Author: newhite
Reviews.Content: Offers a magnificent view of the city! Cocktails are pricey at $20 a piece, but the location makes it worth the money!

Reviews.Title: “Not my idea of Shangri La”
Reviews.Author: tonytelecom
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in three other Shangri La hotels. Vancouver,Singapore and Kowloon. All are 5 star rated and deservedly so. But, the Shangri La in Sydney was a real let down. Firstly it does not have the feel of the others that I have stayed in. The hotel lobby looks like you have wandered into a Holiday Inn. To be fair, I could accept that if everything else was to 5 star expectation. Unfortunatly the hotel looks very tired and is in desperate need of refurbishment. The same has to be said of the rooms. Shabby fixtures and fittings and an old box type tv are not in my opinion up to the mark. The bars and restaurants also leave much to be desired. We came back to the hotel one evening and thought we would have a nightcap in the bar on the 36th floor and enjoy the view of the harbour. I thought that there was a problem with the elevator because we could not get it to access to the required floor. Upon enquiring, we were told that the bar was now closed. It was 10.30 pm. I asked what time did it normaly close, to be told if the lift wont take you there, thats how you know it is shut. So where is the residents bar then I asked ?.There wasent one, came the answer. Only room service. The next morning I had already decided that I would not be coming back to this hotel. But with a full working day ahead we thought it would be a good idea to have a meeting over breakfast at the restaurant on the 2nd floor. Upon entering the room I thought this is nice enough. However, as we turned the corner, to my astonishnent I could see that all the guests had been herded into one small area. It reminded me of Pontins. The breakfast was a choice of continental buffet or full breakfast buffet including make your own toast. The final 5 star service was when I asked for more milk the waitress went over to a table that a guest had just left and put the half empty jug of milk from his table onto ours. I think all the above is acceptable if your paying Â£75.00 a night, but not if its over Â£400.00 Just very poor compared to the other hotels in this chain.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: yaya41
Reviews.Content: The Shangri la hotel in the Rocks is a very beautiful place to stay! I went there with my husband for a 2 weeks vacation and i was really happy about the service and the location. It is just few steps away from circular quay and right in the heart of the historial district "the Rocks". It has a magnificient view of the Opera Hous and, even though it is not cheap, it is totally worth it!! The staff is friendly and absolutely efficient, the room was clean and well kept and it is just a 5 stars hotel where you can feel the comfort and the luxury. Unlike other hotels in Sydney we did not have any troubles with the elevators....Even though the hotel is very big you rarely have to wait for long. I reccomend this hotel to whoever wants to have a great stay in Sydney and is illing to spend a little more!!!

Reviews.Title: “Stay here for the views, not anything else”
Reviews.Author: psychantenna
Reviews.Content: The shangri-la is exquisitely placed in terms of views of sydney harbour and opera house. Knowing this, I think they probably pay less attention to service and quality of service. Food was alright, but very expensive. Facilities are on par with other hotels but nothing outstanding. Service is varied - excellent in some respects (e.g., the valet guys) but ordinary in relation to food and beverage. Overall, they put in a good show but you wonder if you have truly got the luxury experience you paid for. That being said, the location in Sydney does set this place apart from similarly priced equivalents.

Reviews.Title: “Love this hotel to bits!”
Reviews.Author: mhyalene
Reviews.Content: July 09 was my second stay at Shangrila, thanks to my bf who always surprises me. This hotel is just magnificent in many ways, would recommend to anybody (although, I don't know how much it costs lol). Upon arrival at Shangrila, you are greeted by the concierge and the lovely people at the reception. We couldn't check in as we were a bit early so we left our bags with them and my boyfriend surprised me with our Bridge Climb experience (that experience was awesome to say the least). When we came back from the bridge, we went up to level 34 or 36 for canapes. The room had really nice furnishings, the ambience was really nice, the canapes were yummy and the view of the sydney harbour bridge and opera house was so mezmerising! We checked in for our room and because I had already stayed there once before, I thought I knew what to expect of what the room had looked like. To my surprise, it was much more better! The room was more spacious and the view was first class. It was very clean and felt a lot like home.
