The only minor thing that I was dissapointed about was the old tv.. an LCD/Plasma tv upgrade is definitely overdue, then the hotel would have been 100% perfect! But I suppose you wouldn't need a tv with that view of the harbour. Breakfast had a huge range of choices from cereals, fruits, hot food, salads, muffins and many others. It was breakfast fit for a queen! I defnitely didn't want to leave this hotel and would definitely have a third and more visits!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel but needs to improve on service”
Reviews.Author: Kim_QLD_09
Reviews.Content: I booked a Horizon Club room at the Shangri-La Sydney for the last night of our honeymoon as a surprise to my new husband. We had previously stayed at another hotel (which provided fantastic service) in the city at the beginnning of our honeymoon, we then went on a cruise and again received fantastic service so my expectations may have been high however when boking into a place with rather high price tags you do expect good service. Upon arrival to the hotel we were told that our room was not yet available as we had arrived a few hours early so it was suggested that we go for a walk or do some shopping which was exactly what we done, we totally understood that we had a arived early and would rather wait for a nice room than be put in whichever room was free. Upon return to the hotel we were advised that the room was ready and Ã­ts down the hall'. I proceeded to ask where the closest place for a drink would be and we were given a few local options which was great however when I asked if there was anywhere inhouse I was told 'yes, the bar is suppose to open at 3 but its a bit hit & miss'..... we thought this to be very unprofessional ... nothing else at all about the hotel or facilities was explained to us. I was rather upset at this point that I had not stuck with the previous Hotel we had stayed with at the start of the trip which had treated their guests with respect - rather than making guests feel (possibly because we are a young couple) like they arent good enough to be their like I was now feeling. So we decided to go for another walk beacuse I really just did not feel comfortable at this hotel. Upon return we did have a few pieces of fresh fruit and a letter in our room which outlined the inclusions when booking a Horizon Club room. This letter was helpfull however it would be better for this information to be passed on upon checkin rather than leaving guests feeling lost for the first few hours of their stay. We proceeded to the Horizon Club Lounge for drinks and we were impressed with the service and range of drinks offered - this made us feel a little more comfortable. We did not take advantage of the buffet breakfast included for Club rooms as we had an early checkout so I can not make comment on this. Overall this hotel has fantastic rooms, beautiful bathrooms and the views are amazing however the service and explanation of services offered are less than what one would expect for a Hotel of this price.

Reviews.Title: “Shangri-La is Outstanding!”
Reviews.Author: lamorris99
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Sydney around 10am - the staff informed us that our room wasn't ready, but they went to great lengths to get it ready as quickly as possible. Check-in wasn't until 3pm, but we were in our room before 1pm. We got personalized service when the check-in agent walked our room keys over to us in the lobby area. Once in our room we were blown away by the outstanding view! We had booked a Premier Grand Harbor View room, and it was the perfect view of the bridge and Opera House. We did pay a pretty penny for this room, but I think it was worth it. The room is angled and very cool, hard to explain but it was just awesome. The bathroom was large and had a nice sized shower and separate bath tub. We got high speed internet included in our room rate, but nothing else. We didn't eat in any of the restaurants, the price tags were pretty hefty! I guess they expect you to not think the meals are expensive when you've paid $400 a night for your room. If you walk down the street that the Shangri-La is on (towards the bridge) there is a restaurant/bar called the Australian Heritage Hotel...awesome pizza and loads of beer selections. We had a kangaroo pizza and it was pretty outstanding. The hotel is in a nice spot for views, and just a short walk to Circular Quay and the ferry boats. I would definitely recommend this hotel to those of you who love a good view, and desire excellent service.

Reviews.Title: “Great Views of Harbour and Opera House”
Reviews.Author: ShirTuck2001
Reviews.Content: Views are great, location is great. Quick walk to the The Rocks, Harbour Climb, shopping, and cafes. The rooms are adequate as is the executive lounge with internet access.

Reviews.Title: “Hospitality- Well located”
Reviews.Author: blackbmer
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed 2 nights at the Shangri-La Hotel. We made our reservation after reading reviews from different sources. We were NOT disappointed. We were able to check-in early since our room was ready. (we truly appreciated that especially after 20 hours in the air). Our room was located on the 31st floor with a view on the harbour and the Opera House. The room was well appointed. The marble bathroom was large and beautiful (a deep bath and glass shower). The king size bed was very comfortable and the bed sheets and duvet cover were soft and light (Egyptian cotton for sure). The staff on the 30th floor where we checked-in was kind, polite, courteous, well-mannered and very helpful. (Horizon Club) The Horizon lounge (31st floor) is well kept and has the most beautiful view of the harbour, bridge and Sydney Opera House. You feel welcome to serve yourself for a soda, juice or drink and indulge in one of their pastries, muffins or fruit. We stopped every day for a snack and coffee or drink. I strongly suggest to include the breakfast in your rate. The full breakfast (buffet style)is served on the 1st floor. The variety of food will please the most difficult tourists. If you want a fresh omelette, or have your eggs prepared to your taste, a chef will make it in front of you. There's plenty and the presentation is clean and inviting. The staff is attentive and courteous. In some reviews, you can read about a steep hill to reach the hotel. Yes it is true. If you reserve a room in a hotel in the Rock area, you will realize that is not flat. From the harbour to the business section it's hilly. From one street to the next sometimes you are facing steps. It's a good exercise! There's a shortcut you can take but still the area is not flat. All attractions are easily accessible from the hotel (Opera House, ferries, shopping, bridge, train, historic sites) If ever we come back to Sydney, no doubt in our minds, we will stay at the Shangri-La Hotel. It may be expensive but worth every penny. Blackbmer,CANADA

Reviews.Title: “BLISSFUL HEAVEN TO STAY, GREAT AMENITIES AND GORGEOUS VIEWS FROM ROOM ...”
Reviews.Author: CHLOEGIRL10
Reviews.Content: We both loved our hotel experience at the Shangri-La Hotel in Sydney, and we would definitely love to stay again some day. The staff were friendly, courteous and very helpful. We loved the room we stayed in, gorgeous corner room with views over the harbour, the bed was so soft and comfortable and the bathroom was a pleasure to ensure we enjoyed the whole wonderful experience. We dined in the restaurant which was another experience in itself - the view was magnificent although we would have loved a room by the window to truly savour every moment of our anniversary celebration. The location is just by the Sydney Harbour Bridge and walking distance to many sightseeing spots, good cheap pub dining close to the hotel, close to the harbour and the shopping malls. The quiet convenient location, wonderful staff and service ensure that we will back again.

Reviews.Title: “OK hotel but some room for improvement”
Reviews.Author: hudsonfamilly
Reviews.Content: we loved the location of this hotel but were a bit surprized by the attitude of the staff perhaps the boys cutt offs were the issue but we were staying in their top floor so this should not have been a problem. Hong kong Shang beats it hands down although the view from the restaurent is amazing. Laundry bill is not good!

Reviews.Title: “A notch lower than Excellent”
Reviews.Author: ThunderBay17
Reviews.Content: Our Horizon Club room was fabulous. However, a couple of 'quirks or irregularities' is keeping me from giving it 5 out of 5 star rating. First of all, we asked for a possible upgrade to a harbour view. The desk staff were a bit cold and unyielding to our request even though it was guaranteed we were returning the following week. The service within the Horizon Club was great. We enjoyed relaxing with a drink and hor d'ourves before dinner. One thing to note. There is a Rockpool restaurant and a Rockpool Bar and Grill where they specialize in steak overlooking the harbour. Don't make the mistake we made.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel, great stay!!”
Reviews.Author: Rennas
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Shangri-La hotel for a work conference a few weeks ago. From the moment we arrived, I was very happy with the service and also the atmosphere of this wonderful hotel. My work colleague and I stayed in a corner room and it was a nice surprise to stay in such a beautiful room!! The bed was the comfiest I had ever slept in, and the pillows were to die for!!! Loved the window seats where we spent some of our time just relaxing, taking in the view. Staff were all friendly, especially in Cafe Mix, where we had a lovely waitress Bonnie attend our table. She was lovely and very caring and attentive!!! The staff in the Altitude bar on the top floor were very friendly, I did think that $7.50 for a glass of lemonade was a bit excessive though. But the view was breathtaking. Our room was attended to twice daily, each time we arrived back during our day, the room was clean, bed was made, bins were emptied, towels changed, shoes put in the wardrobe and they even put the ironing board away each day for us, which I didn't expect! The housekeeping staff would step aside in the corridors as you passed and said hello, even the chef at Cafe Mix asked how my day was going! At the end of the stay when we checked out, my work colleague thought she lost her phone and went to ask if anyone had handed it in. One of the staff members escorted her back to the room we stayed in to see if it was left in there and even offered to ring her number to see if they could hear it ringing. Downside was the massive hill we had to climb up to get to the hotel. I definitely got my exercise in, climbing up and down that hill!! We also woke on Sunday morning at 7am to council workers trimming the hedge on a nearby retaining wall with their loud hedge trimmers. But it wasn't too much of a problem for us as we had to be up early anyway. I rate my overall experience of the Shangri-La hotel as excellent and would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Stunning View Great Service Wonderful Breakfast Buffet Comfy Bed”
Reviews.Author: bunzley
Reviews.Content: I will stay here again.............We loved everything about our room, the view and the service............Phoenix AZ

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel”
Reviews.Author: emmaSouthYorkshire
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Shangri- La for our honeymoon in Dc 07 but I must write a review as I cannot believe the negative comments some have made! It was absolutely the best hotel either myself or my husband has ever stayed in! Everything from the amazing bar (with the best views of a city at night ever) , fantastic breakfast and beds that were so comfy it was difficult to drag yourelf out of. But you only need to look our of the massive windows to make you want to get out of bed! We didnt have a opera house room or any of the fancier upgrades but we did get a Darling harbour view room and it was amazing. We stayed over christmas and new year and so the party mood was certainly in the air. I cannot rate this hotel high enough- dont listen to the negative reviews.

Reviews.Title: “3 days 2 nights of relaxation. Children Welcome”
Reviews.Author: ulladulla
Reviews.Content: Executive lounge makes the experience (a must have) special. Great work by Jerry special attention for our daughter, slippers and her refreshments delivered to the computer room, these extra touches above and beyond makes this a true 5 star hotel, all our additional requests were honoured late check out early check in, and childrenâ€™s meal delivered to the lounge nothing a problem. Great choice if you have children, many Exec lounges at other hotels in Sydney do not permit entry for children. A great place to unwind and be pampered

Reviews.Title: “Expectations”
Reviews.Author: Bonusmater
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at Shangri-La Hotel Sydney once before and absolutely loved it. I stayed in a Horizon suite grand habour view - breathtaking. I looked very much forward returning the hotel in November 2009. I wrote an e-mail to the reception. I didn't hesiate to inform about my preferred view and that I had stayed there before. I had trouble with applying fro advcance purchase deals and asked questions regarding this. The reply from the reception was dissapointing and standard. There was no answers to any of my questions raised in my mail. Based upon the view - which is fabulous - I stilled booked a Horizon Habour Grand View room. I do hope that the standard reply was an exemption as I have high expectations to this hotel and Horizon club. Hopefully the service will give raise to more stars upon next visit in November.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel - Great Service, Brilliant views.”
Reviews.Author: titantraveller
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Shangri-La end of Sept 09. Picked the hotel because of other positive reviews and I can only emulate all the positive comments. No negatives about the stay at all. Service was excellent thoughout, food was fantastic, cleanliness and attention to detail second to none. Had an opera house view room which was great - huge bed and fantastic view across Circular Quay and the Opera House. Concierge was extremely helpful and spot-on with taxi fare estimates! Didnt find any problems with access - walked down the steps or the road to get to George Street and / or the Rocks area. Some comments about no LCD TV - well if you're on holiday why sit in and watch TV?! The CRT set was fine for watching before going to sleep!! Swimming pool and fitness centre was good - nice and quiet when we went. Good lockers with PIN code doors so you dont need keys etc. Cannot rate the hotel highly enough. Finished off a great visit to Oz. Dont hesitate in staying here.

Reviews.Title: “love the view, love the room, love the breakfast, love the life music”
Reviews.Author: CanberraTourist
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at Shangri-La Sydney 3 times for work function and I have loved it each time. It has spectacular views of Sydney Harbour and Opera House, not to mention the 5 star hotel room and service. All staff are friendly, courteous and efficient. The breakfast each time have been excellent with good selection of food. I love the Horizon bar with the spectacular view of the sydney harbour I love the life music on friday and saturday nights at the lobby cafe. In fact this has become my favourite cafe in Sydney and whenever I am in Sydney, I'd like to bring friends to the lobby cafe for a cuppa and listen to the live light music, even though I am not staying here. The price of the cafe is very reasonable. Love it, Love it Love it.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: WorldTravellor_7
Reviews.Content: Good staff, good rooms. HOWEVER, large crack in window was a little disconcerting, and the meal in the "Buffet" restaurant was simply awful. Very poor choices - 2 bad curries, some tired seafood, and stale lollies to dip into choc fountain. For this they charged $50 + $7.50 for a mineral water. Pool and gym were closed for renovation. I completed their questionairre, but have received no response. My recommendation is stay there (after renovations are complete) but don't eat there

Reviews.Title: “Superb hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: lahlahlo
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in a great location, 10 minute walk to circular quay, 5 minutes to The Rocks. Views of opera house and/or harbor bridge from the room as well as the top floor bar really make it a top experience. The rooms were very comfortable and had all our simple conveniences like tea set and iron. Bed very comfortable, bathroom well appointed, and the service staff all top notch. Price we felt was very reasonable for this quality and location. Unless you're there for a business breakfast, here is a tip... walk 5 minutes into The Rocks and there are easily 10 different places to get fantastic brekky and coffee, many with outside seating in the shade or sun.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic views and superb location”
Reviews.Author: Crystal231
Reviews.Content: We loved the rooms here, really large with huge picture windows with views of the Harbour Bridge and the Opera House (we were upgraded!). The bathroom was really luxurious, with a large bathtub and large separate shower cubicle. Nice toiletries. The only downside was the long queue for breakfast - the restaurant is really large but obviously there are a lot of guests at weekends and people linger to make the most of the spectacular views. But it was quite annoying. On the second day a member of staff announced that there was another restaurant on a lower level and he escorted anyone there who was happy to swap the view for faster service. So we had a nice quiet breakfast without the crowds. Oh and because the beauty/spa area was in the process of being redeveloped it did feel a little weird walking along corridors draped with dust sheets whlst going for a pedicure appointment - the beauty area definitely needed a makeover so I'm sure the new faciliies will be a welcome addition. We loved being so close to the Rocks area (my favourite part of Sydney), including the Nelson pub and brasserie and the staff were incredibly helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Rip Off Alert!!! the place scammed me and is unresponsive”
Reviews.Author: esens
Reviews.Content: Me and my fiancÃ©e stayed at the Shangri-La in late August for one night. I wish we hadn't. I had to cancel my credit card to report the fraudulent charges this hotel charged to my account. SCAM!! I got home to SF after a nice holiday and immediately reviewed charges to my credit card. I noticed two unusual charges from Shangri-La hotel. One for $47 and one for $49. I had pre-paid as I booked through orbitz, so did not bother to check out on last day as I was in hurry to get to airport. I was charged US$49 for three vodka drinks and red bulls taken out of mini bar. I don't drink. My wife doesn't either. We did not touch the mini bar. I was also charged US$47 for a seven minute phone call to US. I guess that one was my fault for being an idiot and not asking how much the hotel was going to rape me for. Regardless, I immediately contacted the hotel, via phone and email to ask about the charges. They did nothing. I contacted them again a few days later. Nothing. Then I called my credit card company and told them about the fraudulent charges. They contacted the hotel; thirty days later, thatâ€™s when they mentioned the BS mini-bar charges and the expensive phone calls. I said I protest the mini bar charges. They said the only way is to cancel the credit card. So I did. What a hassle!! Regardless of that whole ordeal, the check in was totally impersonal, the pool was closed, the room was smallish and some of the furniture in it was broken. Stay at the AMORA hotel nearby, a much better value and an honest establishment! I hate this kind of treatment for top dollar.

Reviews.Title: “only hotel to stay at”
Reviews.Author: bedouin08
Reviews.Content: Outstanding service, horizon club is well worth the extra expense, concierge services fast and courteous, only complaint some cold pancakes at one of the buffets (so what). The only hotel I will stay in in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: dicka1981
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 1 night but wish i had stayed more! It was probably the best hotel ive ever stayed in. Fantastic views across the harbour/opera house. Service brilliant, Immaculate in all areas. Quite expensive but well worth it for a treat! The bar on the 42nd floor is well worth a visit for a cocktail and to watch the sunset over the harbour...amazing! Would definatley stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Room Great View Great Service”
Reviews.Author: towtaylor
Reviews.Content: Another flying visity to Sydney and the Shangri La was our first choice! No cause for regrets here - on our ridiculously early arrival the reception staff got us registered and in a superb room within 20 minutes. The view, as always, was stunning and helped us stay awake to make the most of a wonderful day, despite the jet lag. A minor worry arose when we heard the leisure centre was closed for renovation - but opened the next day. The new facilities are great the new gym is bright, airey and has a super selection of machines. The pool refurb has really transformed it and there is more to come I am told. We can't wait to get back.

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful room with a spectacular view.”
Reviews.Author: Honest_Fox
Reviews.Content: For our 1 year anniversary, my husband and I stayed at this hotel. Check in was so easy. The receptionist was really nice. Our room was so amazing! It was spacious and the view was incredible! We were overlooking the Harbour bridge and the Opera house. It was beautiful. The bed was really comfy. The breakfast was a bit of a disaster the first day. It was up on the top level and it was so busy. When we arrived, about 8am, we were about 5th in the line for a table. When we left about over an hour later, the line had about 12 couples waiting for a table. It seemed quite unorganised and they kept running out of plates and glasses. We decided to avoid the mess the next morning and have room service breakfast, which was really lovely. We had our anniversary dinner at Altitude, the restaurant at the top of the building. It was a wonderful dinner. The staff were amazing and the meals were brought out at exactly the right time. We had a wonderful experience and would recommend this place to all people celebrating something special.

Reviews.Title: “A belated thank you!”
Reviews.Author: albertmunroscotland
Reviews.Content: It was rather remiss of me not to mention the angelic (the patience & the face of) Deanna. I mentioned previously that I chose to end my stay in Sydney at this hotel totally on the strength of a review describing the views here. The woman had mentioned the views to be had from the Horizon Premier Harbour Room I believe from memory. Well, I took the reviewers advice without any disappointment. Again, I thank the hotel for giving my mum and me a great stay. Especial thanks to Deanna (hope I have spelt correctly) from the Horizon Club for looking after us magnificently. Thanks once more to all!

Reviews.Title: “the best”
Reviews.Author: canberrabayb
Reviews.Content: We stayed just one night in Sydney. We arrived with little time to spare to fit in dinner before a concert. This was unknown to the hotel. However from the moment we arrived, staff from the valet service on were welcoming, efficient, and met our every need often anticipating them in advance. Check-in was prompt, and friendly and we were upgraded to a very nice Horizon club room. The concierge organised dinner for us at Cafe Sydney by booking a table at short notice. The room was large comfortable clean and luxuriously appointed with many extras. The bed was super comfortable. We enjoyed sweet s'berries dipped in chocolate and great views of the harbour from our room at night and the restaurant on the 36th floor for a full hot breakfast with lots of choice and great service. Checkout was also efficent and friendly. We were able to leave our car parked while we did some shopping til mid afternoon. All in all our stay was faultless and very enjoyable. Would highly recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a 5 star experience.

Reviews.Title: “Choose Horizon Club rooms - fabulous views, fantastic service”
Reviews.Author: GDevine
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 nights in August and had a fantastic time. Following a great deal of research into Sydney hotels, we booked the Shangri-La despite some of the trip advisor reviews! We had a Grand Harbour View Horizon Club room which had a spectacular view onto the harbour. Large, well equipped room and bathroom. The horizon club included afternoon tea and evening cocktails, as well as the separate check in and computer facilities. The staff were absolutely fantastic. All were very friendly and accommodating (special mentions for Jerry in the evening and Franco at breakfast). Room service were quick to replace a broken hairdryer (5 mins) and fix the DVD player(10 mins), though the earl grey tea bags were promised but never materialised! That was soon rectified by the horizon club staff. There is a lot of re-furbishment ongoing at the hotel but it didn't detract from our stay and I would definitely use it again and recommend it wholeheartedly. It is not quite as grand or palatial as some of the Asian Shangri-La hotels, but the staff are easily as good.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Shangri La and the Horizon Club”
Reviews.Author: katie1234
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Shangri La Sydney for 4 nights in Aug 2009. We prepaid for the hotel and got a great deal and chose a room in the Horizon Club. It was $40 extra for the Horizon Club when we booked it, which we thought was totally worth it. My understanding is that the Horizon Club rooms have been upgraded while some of the regular rooms have not. Our room was very nice - huge bathroom with shower and separate jacuzzi tub, flat screen TV, very comfortable bed. If you are in the Horizon Club, you can choose to have a full breakfast on the top floor or a continental breakfast in the Horizon Club (30th floor). We chose the full breakfast every day and thought it was excellent. The Horizon Club also has evening drinks (wine/beer/cocktails) and appetizers from 6-8 each night. We enjoyed this every night - it was great to have a glass of wine and enjoy the views of the Harbour Bridge and the Opera House. There are also 2 computers in the Horizon Club to use the Internet. These could get busy but it was a nice extra. Our room was a Darling Harbour View room on the 33rd floor. Initially we hoped to upgrade to an Opera House view room but based on the layout of the hotel, I think unless you book a suite, you won't be able to get a great view of the opera house - you will only see it when you look out of the window at an angle. The Suites, which are all on the front of the building would have excellent Opera House views but those are obviously much more money. Plus, you can go enjoy the view in the Horizon Club any time you want. The other advantage to the Darling Harbour View rooms is that they face west, so we could watch the beautiful sunset from our room. The hotel is a great location - a quick walk to Circular Quay, Opera House, The Rocks. One thing that I saw mentioned in several reviews was the "big" hill that you have to walk up coming back from Circular Quay. I thought the hill was very minor and not something to worry about at all (although I do live in San Francisco, which is quite hilly). My one complaint was the complimentary shoe shine - I sent my shoes out twice and both times they returned dirty! Overall, I would highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great close to Australian holiday”
Reviews.Author: WatfordTraveller
Reviews.Content: Booked two night stay in one bedroom suite for the last two nights of our trip to Australia. At the start of our holiday we had stayed in a suite at the Marriott Sydney Harbour (I do not recommend, see other review) which was yuk, so we had high expectations even more so as we have previously stayed at the Shangri-La in Muscat and I am pleased to say we were not disappointed. On arrival we were escorted to the Executive check-in on the 30th floor. We were upgraded to an Executive suite on the Executive floor (please Shangri-La I cannot understand the difference between an Executive and non-Executive suite) on the 34th floor. Anyway, the room did not disappoint in either its presentation or its location. It gave us views of just over 270 degrees from Darling Harbour (the Blue Mountains were just visible in the distance), the Harbour Bridge, Opera House, Taronga Zoo through to the Naval docks, with the Rocks in the immediate foreground. You can even see the Harbour Bridge climbers from the window. The suite consisted of a sitting room with large flat screen TV and a DVD player and views of the Bridge to the naval docks. Off the entrance hall was a guest toilet. The bedroom was large (but a CRT TV) and marble bathroom was large with separate toilet, walk in shower, the bath was placed next to the large windows so you could enjoy panoramic views from Darling Harbour to just before the Harbour Bridge whilst laying in the bath. This was especially memorable at night. There was also a separate dressing table with hair dryer. Bathroom products were from Lâ€™Occitane. The towels were large, white and very fluffy. Our sonâ€™s rollaway was set up in front of the window in the sitting room overlooking the Bridge and Opera House, but to be honest the view is a bit wasted on a 9 year old boy. The windows all have wide ledges which you can sit in to really appreciate the views especially at sunrise and sunset. The great thing was that WiFi is free in the room which was the case only here, of the four hotels we stayed in whilst in Australia. The desk in the room came with bull dog clips, cellotape, stapler, paper, envelopes. The room also comes with fresh fruit and a couple of bottles of water (complimentary) each day. The service in the Executive lounge was exemplary as is the view. There was usually a host on hand and of particular note was the lovely gentleman who spoilt my son by not only making him a hot chocolate with marshmallows, but even took it to him whilst he was surfing the net. There are complimentary tea, coffee, soft drinks and some snacks during the day. There are hot hor dâ€™oeurves in the evening and alcohol. Unfortunately the swimming pool and main restaurant were out of commission. Breakfast was either on the 36th floor (a temporary location) for a full buffet breakfast or in the continental on the 30th. We opted for the full breakfast. The choice was large, bacon came either very crispy or non-crispy, two types of sausages were available, veal or pork and there was an egg station for omelettes. Also waffles, pancakes etc. (Dear Shangri-La you could do with renewing the juice containers, they are a little old and tired). On our first evening we had room service as we were tired from flying down from Brisbane. Our meal arrived in 20 minutes and was piping hot. On the second evening we tried the temporary CafÃ© Mix which was relocated because of the refurbishments. As other reviewers have commented, this was disappointing. I donâ€™t eat sea food, and these were over represented and not much salad material. It is also fair comment that it is relatively overpriced given the limited choice available. My experience is that generally, Shangri-Laâ€™s buffet restaurants are an excellent choice. Certainly the one we went to in Oman was wonderful and in Hong Kong we couldnâ€™t get a reservation during a one week stay (at another hotel) in the city. We therefore elected to have room service again. This was a poor experience compared to the previous evening. The food was lukewarm and took 70 minutes to arrive. Given that we were tired from sightseeing all day and our son hungry we ate it. Following discussions with a manager we were not charged, but the hotel needs to review their food service. To have two experiences which varied so widely is not good, especially when you know they can do so much better. This was the only negative comment. On another note, our son loved the koala bear he received from reception when he went to post a card. Lovely touch! Also the child size slippers were great from the Executive Lounge host. An even nicer touch would be if they were delivered together with the rollaway bed, trust me you would endear yourselves to families. As a parent, often the hotel you choose is based on their attitude and treatment of your children. Would I recommend this hotel, absolutely! It is a real five star (forget the Marriott), without the inflated charges at the Four Seasons next door with great views and the service is high. Staff are both professional and polite without being clawing.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome views, great service”
Reviews.Author: winksHouston
Reviews.Content: On advice from TripAdvisor we reserved a room on the Horizon Club level. It was spacious, well appointed, with very comfortable bed and pillows. Fresh fruit and complementary bottled water were provided daily. We had a view of the Opera House from our window (albeit we had to be right up next to the window to see it). Having access to the Horizon Club was tremendous. The postcard view of the Harbor Bridge and Opera House was extraordinary. We had complimentary full breakfast there each morning. They also arranged for us to have a "freshen up" room on our 9:00am arrival after a 14+ hour flight from Sydney while we waited for our regular room to be readied. The Club offers a happy hour with complimentary cocktails and wine and appetizers (which were so substantial, like beef tenderloin, that they served as dinner for us one night!) The service at both the Horizon Club desk and the concierge was absolutely outstanding. Offering to take our picture with the beautiful view as background. Remembering our preferences at breakfast. Very attentive. Despite our tight schedule the Concierge crew managed to arrange great tours for us on very short order. One slight drawback is that the Shangri La, while located only 4 blocks from the Circular Quay, is on a rather steep hill...so the last block of the walk back was "breathtaking". Nevertheless, if that small challenge can be met the walk to the Opera House, Bridge, Circular Quay is very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: choogirl
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for five nights towards the end of June. We arrived at 6am in the morning and we were given tea and coffee and they got us an early check in at about 9am. The room was lovely and large with a huge bed and great view over the harbour. The bathroom had a separate bath and shower and was very large. Breakfast in the morning had everything-it was all buffet style and there was tons of choice. The location which was about five minutes away from Circular Quay was perfect. We were so close to everything. You have to walk up quite a steep hill to the hotel from Circular Quay but it was only a couple of minutes. The swimming pool was lovely and very warm. Staff were very pleasant and we were allowed to go into the business centre to use the internet whenever we needed to. Would stay here again on our return to Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel to stay with great views though its more pricey than your average stay”
Reviews.Author: Sydney_Aussie21
Reviews.Content: Hi All, Stayed overnight at Shangri-la hotel on a friday and was great! Ok so check around certain websites to see if you can get cheaper rates etc but I called 2 months before hand to their sales and the lady gave me an ok deal. It was a decent price and included the premier grand hotel room with front rows seats of the harbour bridge and the opera house. Now when we arrived because I organised a trip on the harbour bridge, we arrived with our car and told the guy to take our luggage to our room later when we check in. Went to harbour bridge for our walk and by the time we came back it was around 2:30 so got our keys and the best thing with Horizon club is you get access to floor 30 which has the room where you can get free afternoon snacks.. us being buggered we had our free snacks and then it was time to check out our room. Got into our room (2813) and small walkway, the bathroom wish that was bigger and then the view is great! the room is really big as well too as you can see from the pictures. Our luggage wasn't there so we told the guy to collect it, seemed a bit arrogant saying if i requested it which i did or else i wouldn't have complained that my luggage isn't in the room. One small dissapointment to the room is the wall that blocks the overall view but this is ok because you can see it from the other window, plus the tv is a big one, would have thought a think LCD one would have been more professional for the hotel. Eventually they came and we just relaxed in the room. we also moved the bed so we would have a mad view when we woke up. Apart from that, horizon also has evening drinks between 6-8pm free for horizon patrons. we had alot and that could of been enough for dinner hehe but we went to the rocks for a snack (wedges! lol) and then we were hammered. Come breakfast you can either have it on horizon club or downstairs, go downstairs! more variety and all you can eat. we also tried to get late check-out but were told we had to out by 11! grrrr but oh wells. overall a good experience for the price I paid for, probably wouldn't do it again as this was special because it was one of our anniversaries. If you were a tourist, theres probably better places to be but if you had to splurge on one night in sydney and willing to pay $500 then get the horizon premier grand room, then this is the place to do it. The only small problem i suppose is access to the hotel during the night, even though its right in sydney the walk from the back entrance to the rocks doesn't look appealing in the dark when the place looks empty, your find when you get to the road that leads up to the rocks but yeah from the back to the road, it doesn't look enticing. not much people around so you would get a sense that someone could rob you there so i think thats a problem with the shangri-la location.

Reviews.Title: “Great view...big hill.”
Reviews.Author: DfromOC
Reviews.Content: Check in was smooth. Very sweet and helpful service. Decided to upgrade to an opera house view, which was worth it after the look on my wife's face. Hotel was very comfortable. Nice bathroom. There was one BIG orange stain on the floor on my side of the bed. Some of the paint was chipping a bit. In general it seemed the room needed a little help, but not too much. My main complaint was (as it was at a similar hotel in Auckland), it's time to get flat screen TVs people. Seriously. It's almost 2010, it's not even funny anymore. Only other complaint was the big hill up from the rocks. I shouldn't complain. My wife keeps telling me it was a good workout. I hear there's a way to bypass it by going through the four seasons and quay west, but that seems like a lot of trouble. Didn't eat a single meal in the place so can't comment. All in all, a very nice place. Would get 5 stars with a flat screen TV and new carpet!

Reviews.Title: “When they get it right here, its unbeatable”
Reviews.Author: holiday_read
Reviews.Content: No hotel will get everything right every time, especially one with 500+ rooms. But my rating of this hotel is ultimately justified by their swift solutions when given the opportunity to put something right. I have stayed here twice each year for the last three years in various room categories. Four times out of six, the rooms have been wonderful from the onset. Twice I received a room that I was unhappy with- in one room one of the wheels had come of the bed, and in another (on another occasion) there was clearly a smell of smoke in the non-smoking room. Problems like this you either get angry about and cause a scene, or you give the hotel the chance to put it right. Each time something has been pointed out like this, the hotel staff have excelled themselves in resolving the issue. The last time I was greeted at the door of the room I was unhappy with by the duty manager, and she was impeccably polite, she noted everything I said and she asked for just a few minutes to sort something out for me. She returned with the Housekeeping manager, and they took me to another room, on another floor, showed me round and made sure it was comfortable, which it was. In general then, the hotel location is excellent, up a hill from George street, but there are numerous ways to approach it, some routes easier than others, try some of the side streets for a gradual incline rather than walking straight up from George St, explore a little and you'll find an easy route. Try leaving the hotel from the lower ground floor, you get direct street access and a quicker walk in to town/harbour. The beds are wonderful. The bathrooms are beautiful in marble. The views are AMAZING, no question. I have stayed in Opera House view, Grand Harbour view and most recently I took a Premier Grand Harbour view... the latter was so perfect I couldn't stop smiling to myself. Windows galore, and window seats, you can lose hours sitting there watching the harbour, there cannot be a better view! Finally, the staff are always ultra-professional. The reception/check in are always helpful and I have never found them anything other than friendly. The last time I checked out the the lady behind the desk was telling me all about the New Years Eve experience in Sydney, and other places she had been etc. So give it a go; and if you find your stay anything less than acceptable, let them have the chance to put it right for you, because that is the measure of a five star hotel! Oh and the room service food was excellent too, try the Club Sandwich whenever you need a snack, perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay :)”
Reviews.Author: G_the_Globetrotter84
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Shangri-La on our honeymoon and it was quite a good hotel. It had a great location and views from the rooms. The staff were polite and helpful. However, the rooms were nothing great. They were quite ok given the price.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: ness42
Reviews.Content: My partner and i stayed in the Shangri la last night for our two year anniversary. We stayed in the corner premier grand harbor view room on the 31st floor with access to the Horizon club lounge. When we first got to the room, i was truly amazed at the view (which is even more beautiful when the city is lit up at night). I had seen photos and read reviews here but nothing can compare to actually standing in front of a view like that. The room itself was beautifully furbished, and the slippers provided in the closet could not have been more comfortable. It is the little details such as this, the newspaper at our door in the morning and the attention of the staff in the club lounge that made the hotel truly memorable. After reading many reviews on here, i was a little wary as to my expectations from the staff, but found that they were nothing but friendly and smiling (the staff in the Altitude restaurant were exceptional, as was Deanne at the font desk who kindly gave us an upgrade on request). The breakfast was amazing, the drinks and canapes far exceeded my expectations and the Altitude restaurant is truly a 5 star place. Thanks to everyone who made us feel so welcome and made our anniversary so amazing. I am only 19 years old but i would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for amazing views and five star treatment!

Reviews.Title: “this is definitely not a five star hotel”
Reviews.Author: rhafiella
Reviews.Content: previously visited in 2000 - 2009 brilliant view from our grand harbour view corner room. the hotel is now looking very tired and needs a refurb. Housekeeping non existent, holes in sheets and duvet, room never dusted could write your name on the windowledge. Bathroom outdated, towels too smalland hard. In room breakfast a joke, never in 7 days did they get the order correct. TV old and too big, not enough storage space, no fax or dvd/cd player. Mini bar never re filled. Altitude restaurant amazing. Access to hotel from circular quay 102 steps not good. Attitude of reception staff very frostie. jj October 2009

Reviews.Title: “WONDERFULL”
Reviews.Author: oneboat
Reviews.Content: could not fault anything, staff wonderfull, very helpfull , views to die for can't wait for the next visit

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic room, location, and service, except poor Internet service”
Reviews.Author: Todd_Whitehurst
Reviews.Content: The location of the ShangriLa is great, right in The Rocks and Circular Quay. The rooms are very spacious, very modern, clean, and quite nice overall. The room had free coffee and tea service. The staff were very polite and attentive. One thing I really appreciated is that we showed up at the hotel in the morning of the day that we were to check in, and the hotel allowed us to check in and go to our room. We had just arrived after a very long flight from the US, so we were very appreciative. I found the Internet service to be very disappointing. Free wireless Internet is provided in the lobby and on floors 30 and above. However, the ShangriLa has for some reason decided not to supply wireless Internet to the floors up to floor 29. A wired Internet connection is available in the room. However, connecting through it is difficult. It took a while to get the Internet connection to work, and I had to reboot my computer a couple of times. It worked for a while, but when I left and came back, I found that the Internet connection would time out and kick me off after about a minute. Even rebooting did not work. I called the Internet support desk, which I will admit was readily available, but after 20 minutes I was no closer to having my Internet connection restored. I ended up going to the lobby and working on the Internet there. It was very disappointing for a 5-star hotel. I hope that the ShangriLa extends their wireless Internet, which seemed much more accessible and reliable, to all of their guest rooms. Additionally, I booked a room with a view of the Sydney Opera House. While the room did have a view of the Opera House, the Opera House was pretty far to the left side of the window. We had to stand at the right edge of the window to see the Opera House to the left. This might have been because we were allowed to check in quite early. If that was the case, then that was understandable. I likely would have asked for a different room with a better view of the Opera House, except that I was so grateful just to have a room early in the day. Overall, our stay was very nice. If you need Internet access, then Iâ€™d request floor 30 or above. Also, if you have booked a room with a view of the Opera House, Iâ€™d recommend that you check the view when you get the room.

Reviews.Title: “Views to die for..........”
Reviews.Author: david_rapley
Reviews.Content: Decided to treat myself to an suite on Australia day overlooking the harbour. From the moment that we arrived to the moment that we left it was nothing short of spectacular. The rooms have the most amazing view, comfortable beds, awesome bathrooms. The club-lounge with the view over the harbour is just fantastic. The location is excellent also. It is expensive but trust me when I say you actually get exactly what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Stupendous views, good service, lovely rooms, but some flaws”
Reviews.Author: fatfingers
Reviews.Content: My bride and I spent two nights at the Shangri La for a mini-honeymoon in April, and it was wonderful, though I may have been biased by my joy at getting married :) The view was mesmerising from the 32nd floor, a stunning vista of our fair city's harbour. Complimentary binoculars would have been nice, but I really can't complain. The views from the 36th-floor bar Altitude are even better, the ambience is upscale-wine-bar perfect, and the cocktails aren't much more than what you would pay elsewhere - highly recommended. The bed was luxurious and the furniture/fittings were quite good, but nothing to write home about. A light and proper coat-hangers in the hallway closet were small, pleasant surprises. The bathroom was vast and well-appointed, and I wished I could take the great shower stall with me. The staff were friendly and polite and professional, though they did leave the breakfast cart in our room for ages. The buffet breakfast was excellent, with an abundance of choice. Then again, some of the choices didn't look very appealing, even to our world-travelled palates. Problems - the TV was an old-fashioned CRT. Largish for its type, but far smaller than the LCD I have at home, and certainly sub-par for a 5-star hotel. It brought down the tone a bit, compared to the rest of the room. It also had bad reception on some channels. In addition, the selection of entertainment on demand was quite small. The room-service breakfast was very nice, but we had to eat off the breakfast cart because there was no real table, just a desk against the wall. That would have been fine, except it was basically a solid box, so we had to splay our legs or sit sidesaddle in order to eat. Lastly, I see by their website that they now have "complimentary in-room broadband internet". Well, that wasn't the case when I stayed, and it was quite annoying, because it should have been a standard feature for years.

Reviews.Title: “The Beard Hair Incident”
Reviews.Author: ArizonaDoglover_50
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Shangri La checking in June 7th and checked out on June 11th. I had researched extensively the 5-star hotels on Circular Quay, and this was where we wanted to be! Let me start with the positives. The hotel itself: Stunning. Room: Nicest I have ever stayed. Concierge: Amazing. Location: Perfect. Helpfulness of the staff: Impeccable. Matt at the front desk: Should be given a raise. He bent over backwards to try to help us with the circus I am about to describe, bud sadly, and despite his best efforts, these problems just didnâ€™t get fixed as one would expect (namely, after complaining about it ONCE). We checked in to room 2914â€”Opera House view. Gorgeous room, except that given the design of the hotel, a view to see the whole Opera House is partially obstructed by the design of the hotelâ€”nothing horrible, but as I had researched the Shangri La extensively (and no mention of this is made on the hotel website) and I had flown in from the U.S., I was hoping for the complete view. We went downstairs and were immediately helped; we were told the hotel was fully booked that night (Queen's birthday weekend), but our things would be moved the next day to a room with an unobstructed view. Excellent. When we returned the next evening from our touring, we were given keys to a new room (2916â€”two double beds) and our bags had already been moved. Sadly, this is where the story just begins. When we moved to the new room, we noticed some cleanliness issues: There was a dirty towel on the closet floor; there was a large, disgusting, highly questionable stain on one bed spread ; and there was only one robe and one set of slippers (should have been two); and by the hot/cold water handles in the sink, there was clipped beard hair. YUK! It was late, we were tired and went to bed. First thing next morning we marched to the front desk to ask for help. Matt was on the job and assured us it would be taken care of. However, in doing so, we ALSO discovered that there were some registration problemsâ€”they had us (incorrectly) in the computer as checking out that day and were going to charge us for drinks from the mini bar (which we hadnâ€™t touched)! It seemed like the prior guest had not been checked out properly on the computer. No worries, that problem was fixed immediately in the computer. Upon our return later that night, the dirty towel had been taken and Matt had left a handwritten note of apology! We appreciated that, butâ€¦nothing else in the room was addressed! So we contacted Matt at front desk againâ€”we again described the exact location of the beard hair, and Matt again took charge of taking care of it. Clearly, there were some major communication problems between front desk and housekeeping. So we headed out for dinner or some such and upon return expected to put this whole episode behind us. BUT NO! The same stained bed spread was there, and about half of the beard hair was cleanedâ€”but the other half was still there! OMG! At this point, it was all just too much So feeling the need to be more proactive, we folded the bedspread and took it downstairs to show the problem and get the thing out of our room. Matt at the front desk was mortified and could not have apologized more profusely. He gave me a complaint card to fill out, which I did, including my email. He took a bit of the room costs off and gave us coupons for drinks/dinner. We appreciated his doing this, we really felt like he was doing his best to help. We then spent some time out of the room getting drinks (at the bar at the top of the hotel, and the view is spectacular and it was lovely), then back to the room--and the gentleman who appeared to be the housekeeping supervisor was in the room. He finished inspecting the room and informed us the new bed spread would arrive soon. The second robe had been delivered. A new, clean spread arrived and we were ready for bed. I went to put on my robe and slippersâ€”OOPS, still no 2nd pair of slippers. And when I went to brush my teethâ€”the remaining half of the beard hair was still on the sink! This was beyond belief. We were pooped, but did call the front desk AGAIN to note this ongoing problem before we went to bed. The next morning, I left early for Cairns while my travel companion stayed on one final day in our room at the Shangri La. After a day or touring Sydney on the 10th, she returned to the room to find a message from the hotel manager. But when she called him back, the person manning the front desk (it was someone other than Matt) who fielded the call refused to put her through directly to the manager (despite her explaining the problem and noting she was returning the managerâ€™s call)! So she was never able to hear back from the hotel manager. And despite my leaving my name and email on the complaint card, and the room being in my name and paid by me, I never heard back from the manager, either. To top it off, my travel companion later returned to the room (her final night at the hotel) to find the house keeper on hands and knees cleaning the bathroom floor. Beard hair on sink still there. So she showed the house keeper the hair, which was finally removed. Oh--and the second set of slippers finally showed up. This is a lovely hotel with great staff. We felt like housekeeping did the best they could, as well as the front desk. But clearly there were *major* communication issues between the front desk staff and house keeping staff to take care of these minor matters. It was only when I returned home to the U.S. and found out from my travel companion what had happened when she tried to call back the manager, and that the manager had not tried to communicate with me via the email address I left on the complaint card, that I decided to write this review on TripAdvisor. This is an amazing hotel, but this bizarre set of events and breakdown of communication between front desk staff and housekeeping (AND MANAGER) did leave a â€œstainâ€� on our impression of the Sydney Shangri La.

Reviews.Title: “Shangri-la bliss”
Reviews.Author: KatieBerkshire
Reviews.Content: Great start to Australian holiday. Nice welcome (even though we'd come by airport shuttle), efficient check-in staff and the most wonderful beds and pillows imaginable. Minor grumbles would be TV needed updating and we had to ask twice for coffee in Cafe Mix at breakfast on one of the days. We found returning up the 102 poorly-lit steps from Circular Quay to the hotel at the end of the day a bit of a chore - the street alternative was obviously steep as well. Wish we had thought of going via Four Seasons and Quay West as suggested by another reviewer.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely room, fabulous view, really comfy bed - aaahhh!”
Reviews.Author: phoyo
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely hotel that lives up to the term luxury. We were only here one night on the last night of our honeymoon, and used a points program to get a 29th floor "grand view" room (bridge + opera house, the whole harbor essentially). The room was really great, and definitely worth having this view for at least one night. The bed was sublimely comfortable, like a giant feather pillow, with a down comfortor and down pillows on top. The room was very spacious and had luxury level furnishings and finishings, bathrobes and slippers, pretty bathroom fixtures, etc. There was a fridge (mini-bar), pot to boil water for coffee/tea, teabags and coffee (instant, surprisingly), free (wired) internet in the room. If you value luxury and a view and will be in your room enough to enjoy it, this is a great choice in Sydney. We were more than happy to bring a bottle of champagne to the room and just take in the view from our own private space rather than going out searching for a decient bar to have a drink in. The location is excellent too, just a couple of blocks from the Quay, train station, everything in The Rocks, etc., so you really can't do better for central Sydney. We don't usually go in for such luxury hotels so we always feel a bit out of place since we prefer to carry our own bags and so forth, and we were probably the only people in jeans (so many suits - why?!), but once in our room we just relaxed and enjoyed the comfort. The hotel was fine with a late checkout (12:30 pm) which was also nice (although our keys expired at the usual time and we had to take an extra trip downstairs to get them reactivated).

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic views, great location, nice room, terrible food”
Reviews.Author: TylerTheTraveler84
Reviews.Content: I stayed with a friend of mine for three nights in May, 2009. We had booked a Deluxe Water View Room. Upon checkin (at 7:30AM) we were told our room was ready and was upgraded to an Opera View...excellent! We were escorted to the room, shown the features and the fantastic view and promptly received our luggage. Room: Awesome View! Decorated in a classic style Basic tv (not that it really mattered) Bathroom was very nice and spacious Free High Speed Internet (not wireless in room though) Food: As part of our Amex rate, we received a $100 Food/Beverage credit and daily breakfast via room service or at Cafe Mix. Altitude Restaurant: On the first afternoon, we stopped by Altitude Restaurant (restaurant on the top floor) and asked to see a menu as we stated that we were interested in dining there the following evening (Saturday night). Note that all items on the menu we were shown were A-la-carte...at no point were we told that there was a mandatory prix fixe menu. The following morning (Saturday), we contacted the concierge to book a table at Altitudes. When we returned from our sightseeing at around 5pm, we were told that we had been confirmed for a 4 course dinner. I made a call to the concierge only to find that there is always a mandatory 4 course dinner for Fridays and Saturdays...would have been nice for the hostess to show us the correct menu! Because we only had 1 hour and 15 minutes to dine (we had a show to catch at the Opera House), they told us to just go to the bar where we could grab a table and order off the bar menu. The bar menu was extremely basic, but we were able to convince them to allow us to order off of the regular a-la-carte menu. Service was fair, and the food was a 7/10. Cafe Mix: The first morning, we decided to dine at Cafe Mix. They had a pretty wide variety of choices served buffet style. Unfortunately, almost everything (except the muffins) were fairly close to inedible. The omlet station had no one working at it (I had to politely yell to the back of the kitchen for someone to come after a line of 5 people had formed), there was no one around to clear plates (I just put the dirty plates on another empty table), and I had to ask twice to get coffee. Room Service: The second and third mornings we decided to try room service for breakfast. The first time around, breakfast was served on time and was hot. Unfortunately, the quality was just as bad as Cafe Mix (same food choices). The third morning, we had a flight out at 8am, so we needed to get the breakfast as early as possible. I called down to room service and was told to just put a note on the breakfast door hanging card indicating that you wanted it delivered at 6:00 (there were 15 minute increment choices beginning at 6) and that it wouldn't be a problem. At 6:14, I received a call that breakfast was going to be another 5 minutes...I told them to not even bother. At 6:22 I received the breakfast and literally had 2 minutes to eat what I could...food was equally horrible. Concierge: Overall, excellent. Always polite and provided good suggestions. Front Desk: Very nice. At checkout, the front desk person understood my frustration with the food, but there wasn't much she could do. Overall: Great location, nice views, spacious rooms. Terrible food with room service and Cafe Mix, above average food at Altitudes (but obvious misinformation with the menu). This is a nice property, but should not be compared to hotels like the Four Seasons or Park Hyatt which are just a few blocks away.

Reviews.Title: “Great view and hotel”
Reviews.Author: jjmmd2003
Reviews.Content: I was here over the long weekend for the Queen's birthday June-8. Had a great view from our room in room 3016 which is on the horizon club floor. Everything was great though the lines getting into the cafe Mix for breakfast were very long over this busy holiday weekend and the horizon club was also busy and long lines over this busy weekend. I also wonder if they should really be letting small children in the club room even during cocktail hour as it detracts from the mood/environment with kids running around screaming. The way to get down to the rocks and circular quay and back without climbing up all those hills is as follows; Depart Shangri-la on the LG (lower ground ) level. Walk outside and across street to the Quay West Building and take the elevator down 1 floor. Again go outside and walk across street and into the 4 seasons hotel and take the elevator down 2 floors from level 3 to level 1 and you are then right on george Street. VERY convenient. Repeat for the harder way up.

Reviews.Title: “Awsome room, Staff and food.”
Reviews.Author: FarKaz
Reviews.Content: Lived in Sydney for 40 years and this is by far the best CBD hotel we have stayed in. We stayed in the Executive Grand Harbour suite and it was the nicest Sydney accomodation we have ever used (and we have used a few). The staff, food, accomodation were outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “Dissapointing start to trip”
Reviews.Author: sean.casaidhe
Reviews.Content: I'd researched and selected this hotel because of it's location, and the reviews here on TripAdvisor. I've previously lived in Sydney so I knew the location. I selected the Premier Grand Harbour View room for the view and the welcome luxury after a series of long-haul flights. The problems started with check-in - the receptionist didn't understand that "Advance Purchase" meant "purchased in advance" - basic English, I would have thought. I insisted that the room was already paid for and my card was to be used just for incidentals, and showed her the hotel confirmation email. She insisted that it wasn't already paid for and my card would be billed the entire amount. After a 27-hour journey, this wasn't the way I wanted to start my stay in Oz. Eventually a supervisor appeared from a backroom on another errand, and sorted the problem out (card details for payment are on another screen...), but this bad start put me completely off using any of the hotel facilities - including the upgrade that started the whole discussion. The receptionist then got shirty with us and brushed off her mistake saying "Oh! It's so complicated!" Um, no, it's not, Advance Purchase means just what it says on the tin. For a 5-star hotel, there are remarkably few concessions - the bottled water on the night-stand was $3.50, which annoyed me - I've frequently had complimentary bottled water at 3-star hotels, and it's precisely the sort of customer-care that I expect at a 5-star establishment. And that seemed to be the theme for the entire stay - not so much "what can we do for you?" but more "what can we charge you extorbitant fees for?". The room had the expected fantastic view, at least from one side. The other side looked out onto neighbouring apartment blocks and hotels, so the curtains on that side remained closed for the entire stay. Due to this I rather regretted not getting one of the rooms to the side, and saving a few hundred dollars a night. So if you are thinking of getting a corner room, do ensure it's one with views of the harbour from BOTH sides. The room was was very nice and spacious with a big comfy bed and excellent bath-room. The hotel is modern enough, but due to the above billing problem I didn't bother trying out any of the bars or amenities, including the spa. Location-wise it's at the top of a steep hill, not far from Wynyard, except that the usual route from Wynyard is closed due to building works. All in all, the next time I think I will be checking out the Four Seasons or something like that, same view, same cost, but hopefully better trained staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay even with kids!”
Reviews.Author: SeattleliteinEurope
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 4 nights with our 3 kids. We have traveled all over the world and I have to say we really enjoyed this hotel. Great location, great service, great view, helpful staff, comfy beds, and quiet. Even though there seems to be a lot of business travelers at this hotel- we did not feel out of place with our three children. The only thing we didn't care for was the breakfast buffet - we noticed some of the guests touching the food instead of using tongs provided (which probably happens at all buffets) but it was a tad bit disconcerting since we just happened to be visiting when the media was focusing on the arrival of swine flu in Australia. But the hotel did offer a-la carte menu so we chose that instead. Overall a great stay and we would definitely choose this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with unbelievable view!”
Reviews.Author: snchip0428
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Deluxe Grand Harbor View room with a fantastic view of the Harbor Bridge, Opera House and Sydney Harbor. The rooms are huge and well appointed. The hotel is located in the Rocks and we easily walked to all the sites we wanted to see. My wife and I both loved the breakfast buffet. The fresh fruit was bursting with flavor! The staff is freindly and efficient and we highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Mostly fantastic”
Reviews.Author: sydneyweekendtripper
Reviews.Content: Had a great weekend away. Room was great with a nice bed and wonderful view...you wouldn't have wanted to have been in the next room away though (19) as you would have had a view of the back of buildings and not the opera house. Our shower drain smelled terrible but guess that happens if they are not used all the time. Also one of the phones in the room didn't work. My main issue was with room service at about 11.30pm we ordered toasted sandwiches, had to change our order at first as they did not have turkish bread as specified (guess they had run out), was told it would be 35 minutes (long considering it was late on a Sat night and they were just cheese sandwiches)...almost an hour later no food. Called room service again with no answer and had to be put through by reception. When I checked on the meals I was put on hold for quite a while only to then be asked to wait another 20 minutes (they had forgotten). Declined to wait and luckily it wasn't on the bill. The restaurant has an amazing view which in a way made up for the price! Oh and amazing gym facilities too, a lot of money had been spent there. Was a great hotel but don't order room service if you are hungry.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DavlynDerbyshireUK
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed a 3 night stay in March on our tour of Australia. Only disappointment was not being able to upgrade to a Horizon Room, as we have usually done when staying at a Shangri La Hotel. Room was good and good view of the Harbour but not the Opera House. The Hotel was extremely busy when we stayed but nevertheless service was good. We liked the position and easy access to the Harbour and shopping area.

Reviews.Title: “Really average service.”
Reviews.Author: DomTrnr
Reviews.Content: Myself and my partner decided to do a last minute trip to Sydney after a rather stressful week. We stay in Sydney quite regularly, and have previously stayed at hotels such as the Fraser Suites, Amora on Jamieson, The Westin and the Marriot. Upon checking in we found the rooms to be quite acceptable, if not a little oddly shaped, with an excellent view (We were only on the 12th floor). We enjoyed a lovely afternoon tea (You must try the apple and amaretto tea) in the piano lounge and enjoyed a nice dinner down at darling harbour. Our main problems occurred in the morning, we went to breakfast at about 9.45am and enjoyed a great meal of eggs, bacon, sausage, hash browns and omlettes(any place that has their own egg chef is fine by me) . My partner enjoyed the chinese breakfast of vegetarian noodles. Unfortunately half way through our breakfast the staff started packing up all of the buffet items and scurried around with trolleys picking up the juices, serving utensils etc. we were by no means the only people still in the restaurant and surely this could have waited until the place had cleared out. Our next problem occurred just as we were about to leave our room, at approximately 10.40am there was a knock on our door only to be confronted by a member of staff asking us whether we were planning to check out, or did we have a late check out. Considering that check out was not for another 20mins at 11am this gave us a sense of being rushed out of our room. Our third and most important issue occurred on checking out. We found the girl on the front desk to be surly and gruff . We had booked a package deal that included free parking, which the girl had attempted to charge us for, upon questioning her about this and informing her our parking was supposed to be free she replied "fine, well don't worry about it then". This is a really unacceptable attitude for front of house staff to have as they are the face of your company This overcharging appeared to be not only our problem as the people next to us were also experiencing problems with their bill and items that they had already paid for. As someone who works in the hospitality industry i understand that we are usually the harshest critics as we are usually aware of what should happen and what shouldn't happen and to have three negative "moments of truth" to remember our stay at the Shangri-La was a real disappointment.

Reviews.Title: “Disapointed”
Reviews.Author: doyled0101
Reviews.Content: my stay at the Shgangri-La Hotel, Sydney was good but i found some of the staff to have an attitude. this hotel is 5 stars but not true blue 5 star hotel. i decided to try a wake up call i was very disapointed with the wake up call it was just a voice recorder say this is your wake up call and it just kept repeating the same sentence. 6 times then hanged up. i stay here from the 31st of april to the 1st may. i decided to also order a bucket of ice it came to the room and a young guy delivered it he was quite grumpy he gave it to me and walked away without a thank you. but i must say the only part i enjoyed in the breakfast. and the reason i book becuase the internet in the rooms were for free for the guests staying in the hotel. but also when arrived i was upgraded to the opera house view which was beautiful touch.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - incredible views”
Reviews.Author: ozay_ali
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel - we were there for 4 days at the end of March. Just back from a mega tour of Australia and the far east hence the late posting. We had a Horizon Club room that looked down on the harbour and Opera House. Fantastic staff, food, room, service and location. Brilliant choice for Sydney

Reviews.Title: “If it wasnt for breakfast.......”
Reviews.Author: alwayswanttotravel
Reviews.Content: Sorry this is a late post but I thought it might be helpful. We stayed at the Shangrila Sydney for the purpose of a small xmas celebration for our party of 3 girlfriends. A Grand Deluxe Harbour Club suite was booked. We checked in separately as each was flying/driving in from various places. Checkin for all was above expectation and kind of fun in the fact that we were separately whisked up to the Club lounge and whisked down to our lower level to our suite. I could hardly contain myself at the size of the suite, the incredible views (and I am from Sydney) and the plushness although it is slightly dated. I was hoping around and dying for my friends to arrive.... and they did. We hugged and congratulated on how special we were to be here and then a knock at the door with the Moet'. In our excitement we had forgotten this was with the package. POP. The Hotel had forgotten the extra bed.... but quickly that was whisked in. If we had thought about this we would have had them put this in the massive king bedroom rather than the living room.... but did we care at the time. Did I mention the bathroom. It was huge with floor to ceiling (almost) window and although it was overlooking the toll booths...... once we rang and ascertained no-one could view us we enjoyed the spectacle. We took advantage of the pre-dinner drinks up on the Club Lounge and I would advise to get there right on starting time because we didnt and it was a little too crowded and pushy for food for our liking for a hotel of this class. Anyway we had a quick drink and a snack and ventured out for dinner. We arrived back several hours later and as advised decided to order breakfast to our room for 9.30am. When it got to 10.00am we called and were advised that we should take it in the cafe as no record was made of our booking for room service. This did not suit us and we pushed for it to be delivered to our room. Several phone calls and 1 hr later resulted in a very small poor selection of either cold or frozen food arriving to our room. Not happy. When checking out the Hotel tried to charge us for the breakfast to the room but ON A GOOD NOTE after writing to the Hotel they refunded the cost of the breakfast in a form of a voucher to be used at the Hotel. The follow up service was efficient and sincere and apart from the breakfast fiasco I would recommend this Hotel. PS The views and the pillows are enough reason to stay here! They are heaven. Enjoy

Reviews.Title: “Best Location”
Reviews.Author: tomsun75
Reviews.Content: the hotel is extremely good for both business or leisure travellers. my wife and i stayed at 4 nights and we were allowed to checked in earlier at 12noon time instead of 3pm to allow us get some sleep after tired overnight flight. we booked opera view room but during check in were upgrade to great harbour view room. the room with fantastic view for both opera house and harbour bridge. room was big with very comfortable bed and bathroom was big too with separate shower. free broadband Internet provided. the only downside are room a bit dated with ordinary TV not flat TV and also TV channels limited with not many choices for different nationals travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome view and location”
Reviews.Author: Roaver
Reviews.Content: We stayed four nights at the Shangri-la at a free upgraded room on the 23rd floor corner room. Overlooking Sydney Harbor with the bridge and opera house and watching the marine traffic both day and night represented the best urban view in the world. It was mesmerizing! We had a 270 degree view and could have stayed in the room looking out day and night. Service was excellent and location near The Rocks great. It is on a hill with a 3 block climb from George St. But there is an effortless shortcut.

Reviews.Title: “Everything you need in The Rocks”
Reviews.Author: ValerieST
Reviews.Content: Great hotel! My husband and I traveled to Sydney for a friend's b-day party. Had a blast and I have to say, the hotel was great. We were coming in on an overnight flight and arrived at 9am in the morning, completely exhausted. We just needed to sleep for a few hours before taking on Sydney. Our room wasn't available so they put us in another room type so that we could sleep. This was really nice and especially appreciated since they have no obligation to let us into a room until 3 pm. Honestly, it made our trip. The room was great and had an awesome view of the Sydney Opera House. The staff was always very nice and accommodating. Rooms were very clean and the bed was very comfortable. Only downside is that it is a bit of a hike up a hill to reach the hotel so if you have small kids you would need to take a taxi back to the hotel each time. (We actually enjoyed the hike since we didn't see the gym much on this trip!) Highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Everything was amazing!”
Reviews.Author: JohnDoeSydney
Reviews.Content: From the moment i pulled into the entrance, everything was amazing. Valet parking assistants were polite, receptionist served me immediately and escorted me up to the horizon private reception where staff there were very attentive and polite. They even provided a complimentary bottle of champagne. When i arrived in the room (Horizon Premier Grand Harbour View), the view was breathtaking and you could see every point of Sydney Harbour. The room was spotless and the huge bathroom had all the bathroom amenities you need during the stay. Drinks and H'or dourves in the Horizon club was a great way to start the evening before heading to dinner. King size bed was one of the most comfortable beds i have ever slept in and waking up to an amazing sunrise over the harbour was incredible. Breakfast at the Horizon Club was relaxed and provided a great breakfast and refreshments. From the moment i arrived to the moment i left, nothing was too much trouble and all staff were very polite and helpful, especially the horizon club receptionists. Will definitely be staying at the Shangri La again.

Reviews.Title: “Superb, amazing, relaxing”
Reviews.Author: mocomm35
Reviews.Content: We celebrated my wife's birthday with a weekend at the Sahngri la Sydney, in a Horizon Club room on the 32nd floor. This hotel is amazing. The room was excellent and they put in an extra bed for our 5 year old in the entrance foyer which worked wonderfully. On our arrival we were directed to the Horizon Club where a private check in area awaited. The process was simple, professional and very pleasant. IfÂ  views and food are your thing, this is the place. We dined at Cafe Mix for breakfast which was fantastic and had dinner at Altitude which was the best meal I have ever had. The staff at Altitude really added to the experience, they were simply superb.Â  In fact, all the staff were great, nothing was a problem.
