The views from the room were breathtaking and a lot of time was spent just looking at the ever changing vista. This is a quality hotel with great staff, top location and food and service to please even the hardest marker. Do yourself a favour and pamper yourself!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Views let down by Service Experience”
Reviews.Author: SomiLondon
Reviews.Content: I booked a superior harbour view room last October. Sure, we were given one when we arrived but due to availability it was on the lowest floor (5th) which until recently had been a smoking floor and smelt like it. Nevertheless a lovely room with stunning views of the Bridge and the Opera House. We were moved without fuss to the 16th floor on day 2, a room having become available. All rollaway beds were in use so my little girl had to share our king - not a hardship but I had booked a room for 3 six months back. Very little drawer space so many clothes etc had to remain in our cases. Bad experience in Cafe Mix for buffet dinner. Surly receptionist who continued a phone conversation as we arrived then said we would have to wait for a table (for 5) though the place was more than half empty at around 8:30pm. Hardly any food for vegetarians - Head Waiter suggested salad and the indian option. Much of salad bar empty (and vegetarians are not voracious salad eaters!), the indian vegetarian dish was okra which I don't like. Ordered a plain Caesar Salad - which came with pieces of bacon. Just not good enough. The food for the omnivores was OK but nothing special. I cannot think why I left a tip. The much vaunted bar at the top of the hotel has the same stunning views as had our room but is an uninspiring and rather cold experience apart from that, disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: abandrus
Reviews.Content: We stopped over the easter period and yes that hill is a killer but you get amazing views and we found the entire staff extremely helpful and friendly. We had a meal at Altitude which was well worth the money and the waitress was exceptional. The room was huge, the bed was one of the best I've slept in and the bathroom was nearly as big as the bedroom! The only slight issue we had was on Easter Sunday night we had gone to the lounge bar about 10pm, turned out the bars all shut early that night when a group came in who were exceptionally loud and assumed everyone was there just to serve them. The people who were sat closest to them had to leave as you couldn't hear yourself think. Its a shame someone on the reception area hadn't come and asked them to be a little more considerate of those around them. The bar staff were excellent but run off their feet as only one guy making the drinks and one girl delivering them. Overall we loved it and would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect view”
Reviews.Author: anandberia
Reviews.Content: I just got back from a week long stay at the Shangri-La, Sydney and the experience was simply amazing. Situated right in the heart of Sydney, Shangri - La offers you a breathtaking view of the the city skyline. Overlooking the Harbour Bridge and the Opera House, it offers the perfect comfort for business travellers and honeymooners alike. Din't need any city tour since I was staying on the 29th floor. It was like staying on top of a beautiful lighthouse overlooking the majestic city skyline which was a perfect combination of both - the historical look as well as the modern city centre. Spacious rooms and bathroom are a getaway from the matchbox like feeling of being in a big city. I specially loved the large windows in each room, an absolutely perfect place to spend with your morning tea. A spacious lobby, business centers and asthetically well designed resturants offer a perfect place for business meetings or a romantic evening out. With an in-door swimming pool, a well equipped gym and a spa, I dint miss a single day of my morning workouts. Above all, the courteous and hospitable staff went out of their way to make me feel at home. Shangri - La made prefect sense for a well deserved holiday

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: VanesI
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Shangri La for our honeymoon in August 08. It was a great place with an excellent location in Sydney. The restaurant upstairs was expensive but we had a great meal! The place was clean, the staff was very friendly and attentive in meeting our every need. If I were to go back to Sydney I would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “5 Star?”
Reviews.Author: Mulvan
Reviews.Content: GREAT VIEWS!!! Having stayed at several Shangri La Hotels world wide I must say Sydney Shangri La is rather disappointing. Booking completely messed up, even after calling the four times after an online booking. Had to find someone to park the car, waited 15 minutes to be acknowledged at the front desk on check in and need to wait until late afternoon for a room. Staff rarely smiled or said hello. Never in my life have I seen such a lack of staffing numbers in a hotel. Waited 25 minutes to be seated for breakfast. Very table was either full of people or mess left uncleaned. Similar in the Horizon Club. Hyatt is a far better choice. However the rooms, view, & location at Shangri La Sydney are second to none.

Reviews.Title: “View spectacular, room needs to be updated. Lobby lounge- BAD service. Rude woman upon check out.”
Reviews.Author: kauailover11
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Shangri La in late February through the Amex deal. The view from our room was excellent overlooking the harbour and the Opera house. The room itself needs to be refurbished as it is tired and old, but somehow the bed was great, excellent linens. Bathroom was beautiful with marbled floors and separate shower area. A major set back was the waiting staff at the Lobby Lounge, hideously slow to take orders, the place was empty on a Friday night (530pm) it took them 10 minutes to notice us (I timed, ridiculous for a luxury hotel like this) as they chatted away in the bar area polishing glasses. I did wave my hands several times, they kept signalling that they will come to take orders ( they did not). Finally somebody came with a nice smile but with no apology, pleasant girl but I do wonder the level of discipline and training they receive to work in a prestigious hotel like the Shangri-La, for this is not some sort of cafe in the streets? Having said that, the appetizers and the drinks were great. We tried the Altitude Restaurant, excellent service (prompt and attentive) and good food and the magnificent views. The next morning upon check out there was a lady sitting at the Check in Concierge Desk who used her chin and pointed whilst telling me that the check out was made at reception. Not the lovely check in concierge girls generally sitting there but was a middle aged woman. Very surprised again indeed that although it was early in the morning and the place was busy, a Shangri La staff would do that. I do wonder (again) if the whole Shangri-La level has slipped these days. However I do note that the receptionist upon checkout was very polite and cheerful. Having read other traveller's reviews, I will probably stay either at the Four Seasons, Park Hyatt or the Observatory (See my other review) upon staying in Sydney but not the Shangri- La..

Reviews.Title: “Great Views of Sydney Harbour”
Reviews.Author: berniel7
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nites recently at the Shangri-la in a Deluxe Grand Harbour View room. Pros and Cons summarized as follows: Pros: (1) Fabulous views of Sydney Harbour, including Harbour Bridge and the Opera House. (2) Spacious and comfortable room with nice bath amenities. (3) We booked under the value rate packgage, although quite expensive, included many features which were helpful to us, including free limo transfers to/from airport, buffet breakfasts, free laundry service and a late 6 pm checkout which was very useful given our 9pm flight. (4) Concierge was very helpful and friendly. (5) Hotel is located close to the Rocks, Circular Quay and Opera House, although a steep hill or numerous stairs had to be navigated. Cons: (1) As mentioned above, there is either a steep hill to navigate on George Street or steep stairwells through the side of the hotel. Although we inquired, we were never informed of a possibly easier way through adjacent hotels to avoid steep hill. The steep hill may be difficult for guests that are elderly or not in good physical condition. (2) No flatscreen TV in the room - still the old fashioned ones. (3) The food and service at Cafe Mix buffets is not up to the level expected of a five star hotel. (On this trip we also stayed at the Langham Hotel in Melbourne and found their buffets to be much superior in food quality, presentation, room ambience, and service.) In summary, it was still a very nice stay at the Shangri-la and will certainly consider it again on our next return.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: V Traveler
Reviews.Content: I flew down to Sydney from LA for 2 1/2 days for a concert, and booked the Shangri-La on short notice. Great experience. I had previously stayed at the Four Seasons when it was the Regent - bad experience all around. The Four Seasons is in a slightly better location, since you don't need to walk up a hill, but because of the previous bad experience I chose the Shangri La this time. Great choice. I arrived at 7:05am - easy train ride from the airport to Circular Quay and then a 3-block walk up to the hotel. They let me check in to my 17th floor Opera House view room immediately - nice surprise. Not a perfect view, since the side of the building blocked the Opera House from some parts of the room, but pretty darn good for under A$200/night. It was great watching the sunrise from there the first morning. Everything was great. I would leave for an hour to get breakfast in the Rocks area each morning, and when I came back the room was always made up already. No waiting until 4pm like at some places. The internet was free, and worked perfectly. Bathroom was large, well laid out and spotless. My last morning I requested a late checkout and it was granted immediately. I then went to the spa to see about getting a massage, and they fit me in only an hour later. One of the best massages I've gotten anywhere. I did not try the restaurants or bar, since there are so many great places within a couple blocks of there, so I can't speak to the food. But everything else was great - no complaints at all.

Reviews.Title: “The Best of the Best....absolutely stunning”
Reviews.Author: bumpiola
Reviews.Content: POssibly the best hotel we have ever stayed in the world. There are no words to explain just how exquisite this hotel is. Excellent Service, magnificent rooms, views. Will always return to Shangri La Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Wow!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: areayuu
Reviews.Content: I don't know what else to say. We came to sydney and stayed at this hotel - we booked an Opera House view room and we got whole of circular quay view!!! (room 2909) As soon as we walked into the room the very first thing we saw was the sydney bridge straight in front of us, then we both raced to the almost floor to ceiling windows and saw the opera house to our right, bridge to our left and the rocks area right below us. We could watch the ferries coming in and out of the port, the view was out of this world and you would look out for what seems like seconds and hours had passed becuase it was that good. The hotel staff are lovely!!! especially the doorman who you can ask any question about sydney and they could give you a full answer, often including the ferry times of ticket price. The food was amazing we only had breakfast but that was all you needed with the range of cooked foods, fresh fruit and juicies, we drank litres of apple juice every morning. The rooms were very clean with internet points, two phones and massive bathroom with huge seperate shower. One important fact the hotel is on a very steep hill so go out the entrance to the right of the reception point and that comes out half way down the hill once you have go down a few steps. Butif you are not a step person go right out of the main entrance and that will take you to the rocks area. This hotel is in the perfect location for everything just ten mins from circular key, within 25 mins you can be sitting on the steps outside the opera house, and the bridge climb centre is on the same road, and if you are going to sydney - DO THE BRIDGE CLIMB - it is worth every penny as is the hotel!!! can't wait to go back!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Superb location with outstanding views”
Reviews.Author: VirginiaGuildford
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a couple of nights at the end of a great holiday to Australia. The hotel is superbly located with very short walks to the Bridge, the Harbour, shopping and the Opera House. The service was friendly and the rooms very clean with great views over the Bridge. You have to have cocktails on the roof as the view is so terrific, but it is really annoying that you have to wait to get seated for ages and that there is no preferential seating for hotel guests. Breakfast was a scrum, with a great buffet, but overcrowded and rushed service and poor table clearing.

Reviews.Title: “Have just checked in - a running review”
Reviews.Author: Spaghettilegs
Reviews.Content: We checked in a couple of hours ago - room 3215 - and have been nothing short of stunned with everything, from the service to the room, it has been perfect! Normally we write a review of hotels once we've checked out, but this place is so amazing I just want to let everyone about every aspect as we experience it. The view. The service. The robes. The location. Amazing. Here's hoping that they can keep it up.

Reviews.Title: “On the Rocks with a View”
Reviews.Author: ManxManandWoman
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Shagri La in Sydney for 5 nights at the end of February.We upgraded our room to the Horizon Club on the 30th to 35th Floors. We had a great view over the Harbour Bridge and Opera House,it was so good we could have stayed in our room all day and watch the ferries ,traffic and people moving round the harbour.We had breakfast on the 30th floor but also tried the buffet on the 1st floor,both were good.Evening drinks and nibbles on the 30th floor were excellent. They do have a rule of no shorts and sandles which was a bit of a pain. Our check in could have been better , we arrived after a long flight delay to find our room was not ready but the staff were very friendly and efficient. We loved our time in Sydney and this Hotel has a great location if you get the rooms with the view.We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant hotel”
Reviews.Author: maggiemayDerbyshire
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Shangri La for six nights from 8th March 2009 to celebrate our 41st wedding anniversary. We had booked a Darling Harbour View room but were upgraded to Room 1811, which had a Harbour Bridge and Opera House view. Views were amazing. Very large room with exceptionally comfortable bed and super large bathroom. The location of the hotel is very good, handy for Circular Quay and the rail transport system. In walking distance of the Opera House and Harbour Bridge. The Harbour Bridge climb starts about 100 metres away from the main entrance to the hotel (although we did not do it!) The staff were all brilliant, from the porters to the concierge, nothing was too much trouble. All in all a super stay at a great hotel. We woud certainly re-visit.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous experience for our Large family”
Reviews.Author: meljup
Reviews.Content: We are a large family (5 children under 10), So accommodation is also difficult for us, usually taking the option of a serviced apartment, we decided to pay a lttle extra for 2 rooms at this magnificent hotel. we are frequent visitors to Sydney, but have never ever had such a comfortable and easy stay in the Emerald City. The rooms are huge, so we had ample space, the bathrooms are also huge, bigger than mine at home even, and they have lovely deep baths. Internet was easy and free, and the beds were oh so comfy. The kids were welcomed like family when we arrived dishelveled after a 10 day cruise, and they even got little soft koala toys as souvenirs as soon as we checked our bags. We left our bags in the morning, and went off sightseeing whilst we waited for our room, a quick call o the mobile le us know when we could return. Nothing was a problem. The only quirks that I will say annoyed us, was them charging us for our room before we checked out along with a very large bond, which we were not made aware of. These things are irritating when you are traveling, and making lots of transactions on your CC. The only other thing was the lack of TV channels suitable for children, so we had to buy our own DVD player to keep them quiet at night. Otherwise it is a magnificent property. Be aware that there are a lot of stairs on the street around the hotel, so getting around with a pram is a bit tricky (as it would be for anyone with mobility issues).

Reviews.Title: “Better Value and Service Elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: Grouponeinoz
Reviews.Content: We booked 4 nights in a deluxe harbour room. I arranged a car to pick us up from the airport and this worked fine. Upon check in we were given a room on the 10th floor, however the key wouldn't work. I made 3 trips downstairs only to have the reception staff swipe the card again and send me on my way for the same result. No offer of assistance whatsoever. Finally i was moved to the 15th floor where guess what? The key didn't work. This time someone came up with me and let me in with a master key. Eventually we were brought some keys which worked. The room itself was perfectly fine and the view was amazing. The bathroom was spacious, however whereas most decent hotels will provide a bottle of still water complimentary, there is a $10 charge here, what a joke. I had booked a dinner weeks earlier for the Altitude restaurant and had made the person taking the booking aware that we would also be staying in the hotel and would love a window view if possible as it was my wife's birthday. I was advised that they would do their best however they could not reserve tables. On the night we were given a pokey table miles from a window, despite there being a couple of window tables empty. When I enquired I was told that these were reserved, contrary to what I had previously been told. The service was good but the food was rather ordinary and certainly not worth the money or the hype. After dinner i filled in a feedback form provided by the reception staff detailing the issues mentioned above. I stated on the form that we were staying a few more days and hoped that things would improve. this form was handed to the guest relations officer at his desk in the lobby. As yet I have not received any response whatsoever. I would find it particularly unprofessional and insulting if I see a 'Management Response' to this review when no previous courtesy has been shown. Overall our stay was ok but could have been much better. For the price i feel you could get better alternatives elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel - perfect rooms, staff and location”
Reviews.Author: Maria1808
Reviews.Content: This hotel was amazing! The service we received from all members of staff was great - they were always helpful with anything that we needed. The location is fantastic - 10 minutes walk from the Harbour, and the views were incredible. The rooms were big and extremely clean and tidy - as were the HUGE bathrooms. We spent 8 nights here and I'd gladly go back.

Reviews.Title: “Very good location, good rooms and service”
Reviews.Author: MDouvrou
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights at a Darling Harbour view room and we were not disappointed at all. Spacious and clean room, good internet connection, very good breakfast buffet and excellent location. I would definately recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Best view of Sydney Opera House in the city”
Reviews.Author: tacostuff
Reviews.Content: Before going to Sydney, I looked around at all of the hotels trying to find the hotel with the best view of the Opera House. After looking at a number of hotels such as the Four Seasons, the Intercontinental, and Park Hyatt, we decided on the Shangri La. It was definitely the right choice. Some may think that the Hyatt is a better view because you are closer, but personally, I would rather be looking down at the whole view, not just across the harbor from it. There are varying levels of "opera house" view rooms at the Shangri La, but if you get the "Premier Grand Harbor View" room, this is the best possible view. Apparently, according to other reviews here, some "opera house" views are skewed off to the side. With the room we had, however, (see pictures) you could wake up on the morning and look out from your bed at the sunrise over the opera house. Truly phenomenal. Overall the hotel is in a great location. About a 15 minute walk to the Opera House, 10 minutes to the ferry docks, and a couple minutes to the Bridge Climb office. The service at the hotel was good, and the breakfast buffet was very good as well. Overall, the room at the hotel was very nice, and the quality was what I would expect for this price range. I definitely recommend it for both the business and leisure traveler.

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic way to end a beautiful wedding day.”
Reviews.Author: FunkyIngy
Reviews.Content: It was our wedding night and I booked the occassions package which included : # Breakfast for two at CafÃ© Mix # Bottle of Moet & Chandon Champagne We arrived at midnight as we had a very late night from the reception and night shots. It was cold and we were very tired from a very long day and a very long train on my dress i had to carry around for about 12 hours. Check in was just wonderful - very quick and we were on our way in 5 minutes. The room was smaller than I expected for a 5 star hotel but we didn't have time or energy to argue - we did have a fantastic view of the opera house and the harbour bridge. unfortunately they also forgot our champagne however a quick call to reception and all was well. Hubby was hungry so we ordered room service and it arrived quickly which was great service! although expensive no one has time to be picky about pricing at midnight. bed was comfy and we had a late checkout so we were able to take our time. The breakfast at cafe mix was very disappointing - not much choice and the hot food was not very nice actually. We went back upstairs to enjoy the view of our room before heading back home to pack for our honeymoon. All in all i recommend the shangri-la - excellent staff, excellent service , could do with bigger rooms but the view more than made up for it.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel with a cracking view”
Reviews.Author: Chrisandlynne
Reviews.Content: There's not much to add to the favourable reviews already posted about the Shangri-La. We stayed for three nights and the views from our Harbour View Room were second to none - we were on the 17th floor. The room was spacious, clean and comfortable but could do with tea/coffee making facilities. The hotel is busy - even bustling - with sometimes lengthy queues at the reception and concierge areas. However, it must be said that in our experience all the staff were proficient (and polite) in dealing with the heavy demand and the queuing time was therefore not as lengthy as feared. We were particularly impressed with the concierge service which was helpful, obliging and thorough. Something to be aware of with this hotel, and this is by no means a criticism of it, is its elevated position. Access to the Rocks (3 to 5 minutes walk) and Circular Quays (about 10 minutes walk) is downhill but quite a steep uphill return, which some might struggle with and maybe require a short taxi ride. However, if you are a visitor to Sydney and would love to wake up to a glorious sunrise view over Sydney Harbour, Bridge and Opera House et al in a comfortable, modern five star hotel, then you'd do well to consider the Shangri-La.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of credit card fraud”
Reviews.Author: Jez&Carly
Reviews.Content: Although this is a lovely hotel with great views, I feel that I need to make other travellers aware of the extremely unprofessional service you receive if something goes wrong. I booked a room at this hotel as a gift. I booked it over the internet for 1 night in January and gave my own credit card details for payment. I told my guests that I had given these details so they would not need to pay for anything. Upon checking into the hotel, reception demanded a copy of my guests credit card although they stressed that the night had been given to them as a gift. The next morning when they went to check out they were told the amount that was due for payment. Again my guests explained that it was a gift and that other credit card details were given at the time of booking for the total amount to be charged to. My guest made it clear that their credit card was not to be charged and was assured that it would not. A few weeks later I had an embarrassing phone call from my guests saying that they had been charged for the nights acommodation on their credit card - a charge that was not authorised and hence why my heading is called credit card fraud because that is exactly what it is. I have been emailing and calling for the past week to have my guests credit card refunded and my own credit card charged for the amount. Despite the phone calls and emails I have had only 1 response on the first day I raised the issue with them. Ever since then I have been ignored which is not what you expect from a 5 star hotel that charges 5 star rates. If you are purchasing a room for another person, make sure you stress to them not to hand over their credit card details as this saga could happen to you also. I would have prefered not to write this comment as I have stayed in this hotel myself and loved every minute of it but the total disregard of following up and showing some respect and courtesy has left me with a very bad impression.

Reviews.Title: “Shangrilah Hotel, Sydney, Australia”
Reviews.Author: buzz13Sydney
Reviews.Content: To:Jane Roennfeldt, Director of Sales & Marketing Shangrilah Hotel, Sydney I just wanted to write to you to thank you very much for your efforts in making our stay at the Shangrilah even more enjoyable. Many thanks for the upgrade much appreciated, room 2213 most certainly provided an amazing aspect of the harbour. Both myself and my girlfriend had not seen the harbour from such a spectcular view and to have it straight in front of us when waking up was special. And the delivered bottle of red went down a treat with the room service dinner too. We had a lot of fun and very much enjoyed the buffet breakfast and sauna spa in the morning after a run over the harbour bridge. I will most certainly be singing the praises of your hotel to others and may be in touch with you again for another stay in the near distant future (next time 2 days). Many thanks again. Kind Regards Gary Busby and Sabrina Scheuer

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: KSTArmstrong
Reviews.Content: I was visiting Australia with my mother on a month-long trip, and we stayed at the Shangri-La in Sydney for 7 days. We stayed at the Shangri-La based on reading Trip Advisor reviews, and we couldn't have been happier. The Shangri-La is perfectly situated in the area around The Rocks and Circular Quay, and is within easy walking distance to the CBD and the fantastic shopping that Sydney has to offer. Our room was superb - stunning view of the Opera House in our deluxe twin room, and the bathroom amenities were refreshed everyday. We were extremely impressed with the concierge, Colin, who gave us wonderful recommendations for dinner reservations in Sydney, and organised it all for us. We were treated extremely well by all the restaurants. This concierge was truly world-class. Many thanks for a wonderful stay. We highly recommend the Shangri-La.

Reviews.Title: “Fab Fab Fab”
Reviews.Author: Brnwyn
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Shangri-La twice - once for 3 nights over the New year period and then one night at the end of our trip when we splashed out on a suite with a view of both the Opera House and the Bridge. Views were incredible. We thought the service was wonderful - we had a big bag of laundry and didn't want to pay hotel prices so we called a local laundry ("Wash on the rocks" )who said to leave our laundry with the concierge. It was then returned to our room wahsed and pressed later in the day for a fraction of what a hotel would charge. I just can't imagine a hotel in Europe allowing you to do that - certainly not without raised eyebrows anyway and they certainly wouldn't return your clothes to your room for you when it has been laundered by a third party. Everyone was friendly and the hotel is in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Top marks for the Horizon Club”
Reviews.Author: iamallovertheplace
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Shangri La for 8 nights during a Far East and Australia holiday. I spent some time researching the hotels in Sydney, mainly using Tripadvisor, but found many differing views in the accomodation available. I eventually decided on the Shangri La as most who stayed stated that the views over the harbour were the best. I ended up booking an 'Opera House' view room in the Horizon Club area. I arrived late at night, but after a quick check-in was taken to the 33rd floor, and was able to see the outstanding view, even though it was dark. The view during the day got better - I was able to see over Circular Quay across the Opera House right up to the Headlands that make up the entance to the harbour, several miles way. Apart from the view, the room was very clean, wih a comfortable bed and spacious bathroom. As part of the Horizon Club, you can use the lounge on the 30th floor, which has super views over the Harbour Bridge as well as the view that I could see from my room. In the lounge, you could have a limited but sufficient breakfast and early evening drinks and canapes (all included). Also, you get free WiFi in the lounge or you an use the two PCs that are available. The bar on the 36th floor is a great place for a cocktail, although I didn't have chance to use the restaurant. Location is great - 5 minutes to Circular Quay, although to get back to the hotel requires several flights of steps or a steep hill. As a summary - I would definately recommend this hotel and if your budget can stretch to it, go for the Horizon Club rooms on floors 30-35 - you only live once!

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location.”
Reviews.Author: greeny_4
Reviews.Content: Views to die for, walking distance from the Rocks and Circular Quay (via quite a few steps), rooms huge, lovely bathrooms, great cocktails in the 36th floor harbour view bar. Rather disappointed with the frosty welcome from reception, when being told our room still wasn't ready after the 3pm check-in time, (funny how they find one when you refuse to take no for an answer). Great choice for a first time visitor to Sydney (as I was).

Reviews.Title: “Location and Views are magnificent”
Reviews.Author: Fredrik_V
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights for vacation (free bonus nights) *The best views you will ever get anywhere! And there is room to sit in the window to take it all in. *Location is very good *Service was very good - we had some odd requests and they were all catered for! *Rooms are quite nice, beds were great Only downside is a mediocre breakfast

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel but does anything work properly”
Reviews.Author: Loeckers
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Shangri La on a recent business trip to Sydney. The hotel is in a lovely location, within walking distance to the CBD but also close to a lot of the common tourist destinations. The negatives. - Breakfast quite average for a 5 star hotel. Main gripe was the food not replentished regularly and had to constgantly ask for the to get more out. Service in this area was also ordinary as the staff seemend disorganised. At one stage my table was given away to the next couple when I went up to get some food. - Sydney was going through a few hot days and the airconditioning was struggling in most parts of the hotel. My room was very warm and after 3 complaints I was eventually moved to another room that was a lot cooler. - Room service. One room service meal for my daughter (hot dog) took 1hr 15 mins and three reminder phone calls to finally get. When we did get the mean the hotel made it complimentary and later sent a couple of glasses of champagne up to us to apologise which was a nice gesture. - Movie system didnt work but charge still appeared on bill. This was removed when contested. - Had to wait 20 mins for a lift after breakfast one morning which resulted in me being late for a business meeting Postives - Lovely location - Great views from the rooms facing the harbour. View gets better the higher your room - Staff were very apologetic for all the mistakes Overall I feel this could be an excellent hotel if they can just get everything working as it should

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience at Shangri La Sydney”
Reviews.Author: pm2539
Reviews.Content: My wife and I come from the South Coast of NSW and booked into the Shangri La for my wifes birthday and a bit of a romantic getaway. Firstly I must say that we have stayed in Sydney a number of times in different Hotels and Motels and have been generally disappointed with quality and cleanliness. Our impression of the Shangri La was second to none. The porters and assistants at the front door started the experience with friendly information and luggage assistance. Book in was a little delayed but the hotel is so close to The Rocks that we went for a quick walk and enjoyed what the place had to offer. When we got to our room we were blown away by the view of the harbour. We asked for a Darling Harbour view and got upgraded to a grand harbour view without asking for it. My wife was delivered champagne and a lovely birthday cake on arrival which made this whole experience really special. Onto the rooms: Our room was extremely clean and well appointed with marble bathroom. Beds comfortable. TV wasn't even watched due to the magnificent view. We paid for the emerald package which I would suggest to anyone. It costs an extra $50 Aus per day but well worth it. This allows you valet parking/free breakfast and entry to gym and spa. On estimation the valet parking and breakfast for 2 would cost an extra $110 per day on it's own. Breakfast is a well appointed full continental selection with lots of tastes catered for. A egg chef will make you what you like on demand. The only downside to the Hotel was that the Altitude restuarant was closed both days we were there (Sunday and Australia Day Monday), but we knew this at least 1 month prior so we made other dinner arrangements. Drinks at Blue Horizon are expensive but this is not unlike any other exclusive cocktail bar. The view is magnificent from the 36th Floor and a great place to enjoy a romantic drink. I must say this Hotel is on the expensive side but after the weekend we had I would pay the money again, again and again for the experience alone. It was simply sensational.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and views, rooms are tired”
Reviews.Author: Peripatetic_Pro
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a Harbour Suite on the 23rd floor. Room size was great and the views were perfect. Furniture in the suite was scratched, old TV's and carpet bubbled. Horizon club lounge looks like an old airline lounge. The hotel TV channel mentioned a recent renovation program, but I can't see where the money went? All in all enjoyed the stay. It would be nice to have better quality rooms given the great location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Concierge and Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: deniselagrange5
Reviews.Content: The concierge recommended just the right restaurants for my 14 year old son and I. We wanted to experience all the great foods and views but in a little more casual setting. We were very pleased with his choices. We began each morning at the coffee shop downstairs. The ladies there were very attentive and the pastries very fresh and delicious. My son says the hot chocolate is some of the best. The front desk staff was highly professional and very friendly. Be sure and ask for a harbour view room. There was a fireworks display at the Opera House and it was very beautiful from our hotel window. When we return to Sydney, the Shangri La will be our home.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but not worth $400 USD per night”
Reviews.Author: sdbcruise
Reviews.Content: This was our first time to Australia and we wanted to stay somewhere special before going on our 12 night Princess Cruise from Sydney to Auckland. Contrary to many of the reviews, we had a pleasant experience at check in and were given our room immediately by a very pleasant employee. As I mentioned, we wanted something special so we reserved an opera house view room. We were on the 23rd floor and the furthest down the hall from the best view of opera house but the view was still breathtaking. The concierge was very helpful with all of our requests and we felt the service was more than adequate. However, the room itself was very disappointing and certainly not what I would consider 5 star. The room was small and rather shabby. As others have mentioned, the furniture was chipped and worn, the carpet stained and the water pressure in the shower was rather pathetic as mentioned in an earlier guest's review. The tv and amenities certainly didn't come anywhere near 5 star in my estimation. We arrived on New Years day so I understand the fact that Altitudes (restaurant on the top floor) was busy but why would they be closed on Sundays? They made no attempt to help us with a reservation for any other night unless we wanted to dine after 9:30 PM. The buffet breakfast was awful (and terribly expensive given the lack of quality)....everything was cold and stale and to add to that, the waitress spilled coffee all over me and never even apologized!!! Needless to say, we did no other dining in the hotel. Thank goodness there are plenty of wonderful restaurants within walking distance. We loved Sydney and we'll definetly return some day but I think I would opt for a different hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Superb view 24 hours a day”
Reviews.Author: StaffsStroller
Reviews.Content: We booked a Horizon room with Opera House view which was well worth the extra cost. Arriving at 7.30 a.m. after a long flight from the UK, we were delighted with the swift registration and immediate access to our room. The room was spacious and comfortable with a view that was superb. We enjoyed substantial breakfast sand canapes and drinks in the Horizon lounge. We were suprised at the lack of turn down service, replenishment of fruit, and cost of 'real coffee' which we would have expected. Otherwise I would recommend 'Horizon' rooms as a great base for exploring tourist Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Well Perfect Weekend”
Reviews.Author: BobMacG
Reviews.Content: Booked a Harbour View Room direct with the Hotel, and chose an Occasions package which included parking, breakfast (which we never got to) and free internet access. On arriving the car was whisked away by the very efficient front door staff and we were booked into our room on the 28th floor within a minute or so. When I review a hotel I always zero in on the attitude of the reception staff as this makes or breaks a hotel in my view - and the young man was smiling, made eye contact and was ultra efficient. The view from the room was stunning as were the comfortable beds - probably amongst the best in Sydney. On departing 2 days later my car was waiting for me downstairs and I was checked out again within minutes - who could ask for more? Well, I had some issues which are minor really but which might make me think of staying at the Intercontinental (for example) rather than the Shangri-La. The first was the menu for in-room dining - the selection was woeful compared to the full restaurant menu available at the Intercontinental - and we went out for a meal rather than eat in. The second issue was the weak water stream from the shower (in the otherwise perfect bathroom). Minor points perhaps, but sometimes in a competitive market it is the minor points that make the difference! A major attraction of the hotel is the Altitude Bar, this was a fabulous location to watch over Sydney at night with a pleasant crowd and excellent service from the hard-working bar staff. If you want to know why we never made breakfast it was entirely our fault because of late nights in the Altitude Bar the night before!

Reviews.Title: “Best for views but not for service”
Reviews.Author: JB4
Reviews.Content: I chose the Sydney Shangri la due to excellent stays at the Island Shangri La Hong Kong and the Shangri la in Singapore. The harbour views here are the best.But a hotel should be not just this. The previous reviews take all a similar trend and I am suprised following the management comments standards have not improved. The welcome at reception is cold.A smile may help. We had no newspaper through our entire stay even though it was mentioned to reception. The concierge did what was expected but again was not welcoming. Bellboys and doormen would have to be spoken to rather tahn the other way around. The service and clearing away of dirty plates in the cafe was slow. The egg station was well !!! The lounge area was nice but again service not attentive. The pool area was nice but the outside area was a joke.Parasol stands with no umbrellas and loungers and chairs not laid out neatly and used towels lying around the place. Yes we enjoyed our stay but the staff and management need to go to the other Shangri La to compare the difference and get some serious training. What summed it up was the lift was half full and then the bellboy still entered the lift with luggage trolley so we were squashed like sardines.Not Professional.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding service and location, whilst very suitable for wheelchair user”
Reviews.Author: Humbugcat
Reviews.Content: The customer service in the Shangri-La Hotel can only be described as outstanding. What helpful and friendly people. All requests are received with a courteous and helpful response. And, it is worth remembering, our period of stay was during the most hectic time of year. Not a single hiccup. We most particularly appreciated the fact that we were able to check in immediately on our arrival from a long haul flight from the UK which landed at 0645. I knew beforehand that the Shangri-La prides itself on its ability to accommodate very many long haul early arrivals â€“ but this was Boxing Day!! Full marks all round. As a wheelchair user I am going to concentrate on disabled friendly aspects of the hotel in this review. The shower is walk in with a full glass surround with door, with a step of around 9-10cm into the cubicle. The floor is non-slip tiling. There are no grab handles in the shower itself but if you only need to hold something lightly for balance rather than for full support then the taps are useful and there is a small knob on the door. The hotel is happy to supply a plastic stool to use in the shower. The shower head can be adjusted to pull forward, which changes the height of the water flow. The bathroom floor itself is non-slip flooring. The bath has grab handles on the side but would probably not be suitable for most disabled guests. The inside has rounded oval sides, Although there is a level top which is wide at the tap end, there is no shower head on the bath for use with a bath board. Because this is a standard room the sink area is not designed for use with a wheelchair. It is however possible to get fairly close to the sink area. The make-up mirror is fixed too high for seated use. This is a huge room, 70 sq m inclusive of the wardrobe/luggage area by the door. An entrance corridor leads into the bedroom/lounge area, with the bathroom fully separate. There is masses of room for manoeuvring a wheelchair around the room, which has more the feel of a suite. Three large picture windows give a stupendous panoramic view of the harbour, including the bridge, the Opera House, the Rocks and East towards the Heads. It is one of the renowned â€˜number 13â€™ rooms (2013 on floor 20). I can think of no better introduction to our stay in Sydney than to walk into this room. I hired a mobility scooter for use in Sydney. This could have been brought into the room for overnight charging, but hotel staff agreed for it to remain outside in the corridor where there was a convenient plug socket. The room was accessed from a corner of the main corridor so it was not obstructing the passage way. Travellers may already know that the hotel is situated in an area where there is a bit of a steep walk up from The Rocks and Circular Quay area. However wheelchair users and less mobile people do not need to have concerns about this as the hotel staff will explain an extremely user friendly way of travelling up and down between buildings and accessing the hotel elevator from the LG Gloucester Street entrance. Ingenious. There is of course a ramped level access to the principal hotel entrance. I would have no hesitations in thoroughly recommending this hotel to any traveller, whether for vacation or business (the hotel being situated at the Northern end of the CBD and possessing the usual full range of business facilities â€“ of which we only used the broadband connection). Probably, the charge for broadband is the only minor downside of this hotel â€“ and I would say the same about all properties that make such a charge. Having now stayed at several good hotels in Sydney, the Shangri-La is the one to which we would return. For any potential disabled or reduced mobility travellers who have found this review useful, I advise them to also consult the website www.wheelie-easy-hotels.com which offers information on hotels world-wide. Hotel management representatives may also wish to enter information regarding their own property onto the same website.

Reviews.Title: “Shangri La for New Year 2008”
Reviews.Author: RD4011
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Shangri La in Sydney over New Year 2008. The hotel is fantastically well located in the Rocks area close to Circular Quay. The Check In was not handled professionally in the sense that we were left waiting for our room for over an hour in the lobby and well past the guaranteed 3pm Check In time. From here on, the experience improved considerably. We opted for a Darling Harbour View Room and were impressed by the views over the City and the spaciousness of the room. On the first evening, we had dinner in Altitude Restaurant on the top floor of the Hotel which has excellent views over the Opera House and Sydney Harbour Bridge. The food and service was excellent. Overall, we found the staff to be very helpful and friendly and would recommend the hotel to other travellers given its location and views.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely not a 5* hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: AnonNottinghamUK
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were celebrating our 30th Wedding Anniversary by travelling for 6 weeks around the world. Having been to superb 5* hotels along the way, we were extremely disappointed in the Shangri-la Hotel, Sydney. We booked a triple room for 9 nights, as our daughter was flying from the UK 4 days before Christmas to be with us over the festive season. We arrived at the Shangri-la 2 days before our daughter was due to join us, only to find the room had everything for 2 people! (We paid for a triple room for whole duration). I feel we were given a bog standard double room, in which they would put in a fold up bed. (The view over Darling Harbour was excellent though). To cut a very long story short, the day our daughter arrived, we explained to reception that our room was made up to accommodate 2 people. To be fair, no sooner was that said, than housekeeping brought a fold-up bed!! We told him to foget it, as there wouldn't be any room for us to move around if that had been put up. We then had to request more towels, more shampoo, slippers, dressing gown etc. - Oh yes, and a cup and saucer would have been good - if it had been clean when they handed it to us!!! I ran after the housekeeper in the corrider and pointed out the sticky jam etc on the underside of the saucer - yeuch! On to the dining room - a LOT of training of the waiters/waitresses (and the chef who makes the omlettes) is required here. I requested an Eggs Benedict on my first morning and that was no problem, he would bring it over to my table, which he duly did. The day before Xmas Eve was very busy in the hotel and this showed in the attitude of the waitresses and the chef. When I requested an Eggs Benedict again, I was told in no uncertain terms they did not have time! We were told on 2 separate occasions by the waitresses "the buffet will be closing in 15 minutes". Any 5* hotels we have stayed in in the past, have NEVER acted in this way. When I requested 2 tea bags for my pot of tea at breakfast, you thought I was asking for the moon! Eventually I was brought a tea pot - with no lid - he was looking for one!!! When he eventually did bring one with a lid, the lid had no handle. Result - one pot of COLD tea. As for the chef, his hygiene skills need looking at. I overheard a lady in the dining room say that the day before, the chef dropped his spatula he was using to make the omlettes on the floor and immediately picked it up and used it again without washing it!!! One day they had run out of bread, the next it was butter. There just seemed to be these little niggling anomalies happening, that shouldn't. Totally unacceptable and unsatisfactory in a hotel of this supposed status. We will definitely not be returning to the Shangri-la Hotel, Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Gobsmacked”
Reviews.Author: BobbyGAus
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights in an Excecutive Harbour View Suite. This was part of a deal through NSW Tourism (buy 1, get one free, also free dessert if dining at Altitude Rest.) at $520 for the two nights, awesome value. O/K, so check in was delayed by 25 minutes but as a % of life, pretty miniscule. The room, the view and the meal at Altitude was of the highest standard. I have read most of the reviews on this Hotel on T/A and some people are just born to whinge. My wife is a Travel Agent and as such has seen many properties around the world. She rated this in her Top 5. On check out we walked staight to the counter and and within 5 minutes in our car and off to do some more exploring. Whilst at the hotel we wandered The Rocks, had Dinner one night at The Lowenbrau Keller which was spot on, visted The Sydney Observatory and took a guided tour of Susannah Place. As I mentioned previously we dined at Altitude Rest. on the 36th floor. We thought the view from our room on the 28th floor was breathtaking but 8 floors up it was lung busting! We had booked more than 2 weeks in advance and were seated at the window. All facets of the meal were first class. All in all FANTASTIC (no I don't work for/with them!)

Reviews.Title: “This cannot be 5 star!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Rich1974
Reviews.Content: Well where do i start! I guess i better get the only thing nice i have to say out of the way now.........booking our stay online was easy! Ok........my new wife and i were given an opportunity to have a night on her job as she had been doing some very late nights at work and was rewarded with a free night away to make up for the time we missed together........why on earth did we choose this property?? We decided to book a Pyrmont view room as we didnt want to blow the works budget. This was booked on thier website and was easy to do. The first problem arose when we tried to contact reservations. The first day i called them they could not find my reservation. The second day i called them they still could not find it but after i 'poked' them a little bit they found it. They then could not find the form which said to charge 'all charges' to the credit card provided. After about 20 minutes it was found and about 48 hours later i was happy my reservations was ok. All reservation staff i spoke to could not speak proper english which made it hard for me to communicate to them. Check in was a nightmare. There was a nice 'meet and greet' lady to welcome us into the hotel. She then followed us around the foyer which made me feel like i was being watched as we were about to steal something. The check in process took so long as they could not find our booking. Lucky for us i printed out our confirmation and the booking was found (somehow they put out first name last and vice versa). Unfortunately we were being booked in by a trainee which took an eternity. This is ok as its good to receive a nervous smile from people on the front desk. The room we checked into was large but very tired looking. The bathroom was also large but just as tired looking. We could hear a neighbours talking and the slam from their doors echoed all night. For a 5 star hotel i was very dissappointed in the room (at over $500.00 for a night i would expect a bit more actually!) I tried to call their phone sevice people to ask a few questions and was left standing there on hold for over 10 minutes.........i hung up. I tried again and thank goodness i was only holding the phone for 5 minutes. If you try to call anyone for help please expect someone who cant speak proper english and also expect to wait until your hair falls out. We dined in the restaunt for dinner. The food was great and i lost count how many lobsters i ate. The service was ok. Only one person was kind eniough to ask us if we wanted a drink the entire night. The buffet dinner was very expensive but at least i ate my way through the lobsters to make up for the cost :-) Breakfast was also very nice and plentyful. Check out the next day was also slow. The line was leading out the door to the check out desk and the person who served us looked like a robot with no smile. The valet threw me my keys and i was happy to be out of the place. Overall the Shangri-La has disappointed me yet again (the last disappointment came from the Fiji Shangri-La but thats another story). Their lack of service and claim to be 5 star is crazy. Their rooms are definately not 5 star. I never even received a reply to my complaint made via thier website even though it stated all emails are replied to. As this is the second Shangri-La hotel to dissappoint me i will never set foot in another Shangri-la property again. This is definately one hotel group who needs to lift their game! I really would have been dissappinted if i had paid for this mess :-)

Reviews.Title: “Great views and good location”
Reviews.Author: vacationloveruk
Reviews.Content: I had one night alone to Kill in Sydney before catching a flight. I didn't know the city, and immediatly saw both the Four Seasons and Shangri La had large skyrscraper overlooking Darling Harbour. The Shangri was the cheapest - Â£150 Sterling for the night, in a harbour view room. The lobby and valet were as expected. The room was spacious and comfortably and had huge windows with amazing views. The bathroom was marble and had a tub plus a walk in shower. Nice robes etc as standard. Room service was great. Had a burger and a pizza from lunch and dinner respectivly. Would stay again if the price is right, but would also stay at Four Seasons or Inter Continental if they had better rates. Nice for walking around the Rocks and good for jogging down into the Botanical Gardens. Restaurants looked nice, but didn't use them. Left some litter in my car on the passenger seat - coke can etc, subway wrapper, and thought the valet might have cleaned that up as would normally happen at a five star place. Needless to say no tip. Funny how if I check into a hotel in A Mustang you get amazing valet service and if you pull up in a Hyandi Elentra you get nothing!

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the very expensive cost!”
Reviews.Author: BecMat24
Reviews.Content: We styaed here for our final night in Sydney which was meant to be a very special occassion. We booked one of the club rooms overlooking the harbour. The room itself (when we got let into it) was amazing, lovely views, huge bed, bathroom etc. However, the room wasn't ready at check-in time and the staff on the club floor were basically rude. They asked us to come back in a couple of hours and said they would call when the room was ready. A good 2 hours later, no phone call, so we trudge back to the hotel and the room is ready, just. Then it takes a good 30 ins for the luggage to arrive. The bar in the club floor has nice views but the wine/food does not compare to some hotels with cheaper club floor options. Overall the stay was ok but no where near what we paid. We were asked if we had a good stay as we left and asked to fill in the complaints from- even at that time we received no apology. I wouldn't recommend paying for the club floor here.

Reviews.Title: “Great Sydney Location”
Reviews.Author: Fionausvi
Reviews.Content: If you're a tourist, this hotel is in a fabulous location in The Rocks area. I had a room with an Opera House view. The room was beautiful and I loved the huge bathroom. It is hard to fault this hotel on all counts. When I arrived in the morning I expected to leave my bags and be given a room later, but they had a room ready for me. Staff were courteous and helpful. My only complaint is that in the evening a family member (Australian female cousin) met me for dinner. Before leaving the hotel we had a drink in the Club lounge (I was on the Club Floor). We were approached by a staff member who told her open toed shoes weren't allowed. This was both surprising and embarrassing as she was not scruffily dressed. She asked the staff member if she preferred that she change into trainers, at which we were told it was okay to stay. I wish somobody had been around earlier to tell a man who was talking loudly and forcing everyone to share his cell phone conversation that this was inappropriate behavior!

Reviews.Title: “Great Service and Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Baxie
Reviews.Content: The Shangri La Sydney is located close to Circular Quay and the Rocks, and just over a 5 minute walk to Wynyard metro station. The rooms are large and well appointed with equally large bathrooms. Service, as with all Shangri La hotels, is top notch - nothing is too much trouble. A slight problem with my room booking (smoking room erroneously booked) was quickly resolved and compensated on my return visit later in the week with an upgrade to an Opera house view room. Breakfast was immense and truly sumptious and great value for those Golden Circle members who receive a 50% discount. One of the truly great things about this hotel is the bar on the 36th floor that enjoys truly spectacular views of Sydney harbour - although you dont need to stay here to enjoy this great location.

Reviews.Title: “Great view, bad service”
Reviews.Author: Brunos
Reviews.Content: Spent 7 nights with my wife, for a conference and leisure. Booked room with the best view, and it was amazing. It was their most expensive, but still reasonably priced. Rooms are OK equipped but not high-tech as usual in Australia (e.g. no flat screen TV) Service is just very, very bad. This is not based on a couple of anecdotes but consistent accross many incidents during 8 days. Some examples: poor housekeeping. One day we left at 10am and asked (by tel and to the maid in the coridor) for the room to be made before 2pm as we wished to nap. At 3pm we returned room not made and the same maid apologized in poor english. Often room really poorly cleaned, glasses not cleaned, ... At pool/spa/gym jacuzzi not working, no reading material (sorry the hotel did not have enough for hotel guests so we got no newspaper today; happened 3 times), long wait for pool/gym towels to be available (cleaned). Porters/Bell boys tend to congregate inside chatting together, rahter than greet guests outside or call taxis. Shoe shine, every night we called and leave the shoes outside ("they will be ready by 6am"), twice we did not found them in the morning (say at 9am) and after severalcalls they showed up with apologies ("we had forgotten about them"). BTW to get the operator or anyone to answer the phone, it usually takes long minutes (>3, sometimes 5). When you call for ice cbes it takes between 30 and 90 min to be delivered. I could multiply the examples. There is a difference betwwen beeing cool and careless.This hotel is clearly unmanaged. The worse service, by far, in any 5* hotels in the world.

Reviews.Title: “Fantasticâ€¦â€¦ And More!”
Reviews.Author: globeman235
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Australia after celebrating my 40th and had a truly brilliant time at the Shangri-La as part of our holiday. We'd be planning the overall trip for a good while and booked a 5 night stay at the Shangri-la through Trailfinders who were really helpful. Our deal included a free upgrade to Opera House view which was brilliant. My partner had corresponded with the hotel on several occasions beforehand to ensure everything went smoothly e.g. to ask for early check-in as we were arriving at 8.00am and the response was always fast, efficient and very polite. As soon as the taxi pulled up outside the hotel, our cases were whisked off and we were welcomed to the hotel by a very lovely lady (Mo) who escorted us to the check-in desk (the lobby/reception was buzzing with people as it was 8.30ish). We were served by Julie who was a real joy and very helpful. Unfortunately, our room wasn't ready (the hotel did say that they couldn't guarantee early check-in) but Julie said that they would ensure that the room was on the priority list to clean as soon as it become available. Although we were tired after our 24 hour flight, we were high on adrenalin and just wanted to get out and explore, so it didnâ€™t really bother us. However, we were shown to shower rooms on the second floor (complete with toiletries) in order that we could freshen up which was great. We eventually checked in at 2.00pm (could have checked in sooner but were to busy exploring!) and although the room did have a side view of the Opera House, we were rather disappointed that the adjacent hotel was literally 40ft opposite us and was rather overbearing. My partner decided to go back to reception to see if we could improve the room. The manager was very polite and although the hotel was fully booked, she managed to upgrade us to a fantastic corner room on the 10th floor with stunning views of the harbour/bridge and of courseâ€¦ the Opera House. We did have to pay a slight upgrade fee, but considering what the standard cost for the room should have been, we got a great deal. 10 minutes after arriving in our room, a porter brought a bottle of champagne to our room with compliments from the hotel for any inconvenience caused which we thought was a really nice touch. Our room was really nicely furnished with kind size bed, sofa, armchair, minibar (rather expensive), coffee table and desk in the main living area (plus wide window seals that you could sit/lay on). The bathroom was lovely and included bath, separate shower and double sinks. The odd piece of furniture did show signs of ageing, but it wasnâ€™t obvious and certainly didnâ€™t cheapen the room. Our room was serviced daily and my actual birthday, the maid organised for a birthday cake to be left in our room (presumably as she'd seen my cards!) and I also had another complimentary bottle of champagne from the hotel later that day. My partner had booked a meal at Altitude restaurant on the 36th Floor of the Shangri-la on my actual birthday and it was truly amazing in terms of food and night time views of the harbour. Our waiter was so attentative and although the meal was expensive, it was so worth it just for the whole experience. Check-out was really smooth and our bill was spot on i.e. no overcharges. We returned to the hotel a week later for one night before our flight back to the UK and were given a 25 dollar voucher to use at The Blu Horizon Bar (next to Altitude on 36th floor) when we checked in (a nice touch!). Location of the hotel is perfect to explore Circular Quay although very steep hill/lots of steps to get to it, so probably not suitable for the infirm. Overall, we just couldnâ€™t fault the hotel and what the staff did for us, it made it the best 40th birthday anyone could wish for.

Reviews.Title: “Great Views, Not so great service”
Reviews.Author: A_Guy_80
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights at grand harbour view room recently. And I had a mixed experience, positives first â€“ we reached hotel at 9:30 in the morn and room was available for us to check-in which was great. Views from the room are just fantastic â€“ it was really worth the money - room was also spacious and though I canâ€™t compare it with other Sydney hotels but I think it delivered on the promise. Also the location close to rocks & circular quay is a definite plus in planning your sightseeing. Now the negative â€“ I had read a lot about the service @ the hotel on TA pages but I was a little disappointed. I had previously informed the hotel regarding certain arrangements for my wifeâ€™s birthday which we were celebrating then and I had received confirmatory e-mail from them. But when I checked on that at hotel, they had no clue about it. Anyways I asked them again for the same arrangements but execution left a lot to be desired and they even spoiled a surprise. Wish they were more careful with service request but then that takes nothing away from views and location.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful last night in Oz”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer_UK
Reviews.Content: Wanted a central location for our last night in Sydney. We had seen this hotel and after reading reviews on Trip Advisor, decided to pay for a Horizon Club room. We were not disappointed. The room was brilliant, furnishings and fittings first-class. Sabrina in the Horizon Club Lounge made sure we had everything we needed, and was most charming and helpful. The harbour views from the lounge are fantastic - you don't really need to pay for an upgraded view from your room if you are in the Horizon Club. Free internet access, and snacks and drinks all day long make you want to linger in the lounge anyway. The bed was wonderfully comfortable - only our own bed at home is better! Just wish we could have stayed longer to take advantage of all the facilities. One little niggle: here and in other hotels in Australia we found no thermostatic shower controls.

Reviews.Title: “What Have They Done?”
Reviews.Author: oneword
Reviews.Content: I used to stay at the Shangri La Hotel in Sydney regularly in my previous job. That was several years ago when it was called the ANA Hotel. Back then, it was the best five-star hotel in Sydney. Everything about the hotel was first rate â€“ the service, the rooms, the views. Well, after returning there recently under the current ownership, all itâ€™s got going for it now are the views. Boy, has the Shangri La chain - or at least, the current management of the hotel â€“ spoiled an outstanding property. The air conditioning in our room didnâ€™t work properly and our first night was quite uncomfortable. I had asked to be relocated shortly after checking-in but was told there were no alternative rooms available. At 7:00am the next day, we were told the AC would be fixed by 8:00am. It wasnâ€™t. We had to insist on being relocated and after a display of heavy sighs from front desk staff, we were moved â€“ to a smoking room that reeked. Back down to the front desk where the staff again made us feel like we were putting them out. Finally, a non-smoking room with working air conditioning was found and we were relocated to our third room in 14 hours. We joined five other couples for a business gathering at the hotel. Four of the five couples had their reservations messed up. This was a recurring theme across the two days we stayed at the Shangri La in Sydney. We heard numerous people complaining, in the elevators and in the queues at the front desk, about not getting the room type they had booked. There was a surprising number of unhappy customers across the two days, actually. Another poor chap had checked-in then gone to his room, only to discover the receptionist hadnâ€™t returned his credit card. In the short time it took for him to go back to the front desk, the card had gone. The receptionist had left it sitting on the desk â€“ in easy reach of people on the other side of the counter. The staff response was lacklustre and at times dismissive of the obvious seriousness of the situation. I donâ€™t know if his card was ever found. Other observations? There simply arenâ€™t enough staff to cope when the hotel is busy, unlike previous years when the Shangri La (ANA) used to pride itself on a high guest-staff ratio. Our party of 12 waited 15 minutes for service in the lobby lounge bar which is supposed to be table service, only. We got our drinks only after we went to the bar and ordered them directly. The room service number was constantly engaged, every time I dialled it over the two days, so I called the hotel operator who put me throughâ€¦ to an answering machine! The breakfast cafÃ© on the first floor is a shambolic nightmareâ€¦ too small and pokey with pylons in the wrong places and the various food displays laid out illogically. With a hundred-plus guests trying to navigate around narrow aisleways, pillars and each other, itâ€™s positively claustrophobic. And again, simply not enough staff to cope with demand. As other reviewers have noted here, the â€˜Opera House Viewâ€™ room we were assigned was seriously misrepresented. Of the four windows in our large bedroom plus sitting room suite, the Sydney Opera House was visible from just one widow IF you stuck your face against the glass and craned around to an extreme angle. The other windows looked out to a high-rise apartment block and the Harbour Bridge freeway. Nasty. Most of the above things happen from time-to-time at all hotels, even the good ones. But we and our fellow travellers were left with the distinct impression that this hit-and-miss style of operation is the norm at the Sydney Shangri La. I suppose if my wife and I hadnâ€™t experienced the Shangri La in its former ANA life, our expectations would have been lower. But is that a satisfactory excuse? I donâ€™t think so. By Australian standards, The Shangri La is an expensive 5-star hotel, one that trades on (and charges dearly for) some superb views of magnificent Sydney harbour and a long-held reputation for quality. Our experiences and observations of those who shared the hotel with us, this time around, indicate that management has a lot to do â€“ a lot â€“ to bring the Sydney Shangri La back to the standards it was once renowned for. Summary? A nice, upmarket hotel but by no means great.

Reviews.Title: “Shangri-fab-u-la!!”
Reviews.Author: gubette
Reviews.Content: I wanted to spend a couple of nights in Sydney before flying home to LHR, so did a quick check on TA for good hotel with harbour views. The Shangri-la came out well so booked a Horizon Club room via their own website. This gives you a fantastic Opera House or Bridge view, large room, inclusive breakfast, unlimited drinks during the day in the club lounge, complimentary afternoon tea and drinks (including champagne) and canapÃ©s in the evening. I paid approx Â£175 per night for this which I thought was a great deal. (I think for the small amount you pay extra itâ€™s well worth it) Room was clean, bright and well appointed. I was travelling alone and didnâ€™t mind what type of bed I had, I was allocated a twin room. Bed was larger than normal and very comfortable. Bathroom was large and had a fantastic separate shower, lovely Lâ€™Occitane toiletries and amenities like a shower puff, toothbrush/toothpaste etc. I had the afternoon tea on both days which was lovely, plenty of scones with jam and cream and pastries to help yourself to in the Horizon Clun lounge. From 6pm the drinks and canapÃ©s are served, as it was a Saturday night it was very busy, but I managed to get a seat. On offer was a good range of finger food from Sushi to Thai fishcakes and cheese and biscuits to hot chicken satay sticks. Champagne was flowing, but there were plenty of other drinks including tea or coffee available. Sunday was quieter so was able to relax a bit more. I agree with the other reviews, Jerry was a star and sent a complimentary bottle of champagne to my room as he was worried I didnâ€™t have enough the previous night because it was so busy, bless him! I had hot buffet breakfast one morning in the restaurant and once in the club lounge, plenty to choose from and all good. Computer/internet access is free in the lounge which was handy when checking in for my flight. In all great location, great room, fab views, (had my own personal firework display as it was the final of Australian Idol which was being filmed outside the Opera House and that as the finale!!) great staff and the Horizon club is a top deal and good idea. I would stay here again in an instant!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, fantastic location!!”
Reviews.Author: vastgotta
Reviews.Content: First of all, this hotel is extremely well located. I find Sydney initself a very attractive city, and within Sydney this hotel is very ideally located at the foot of the harbour bridge, minutes away from the opera house. Welcome: Check in was smooth and very friendly, Mrs Tara helped me who was 'in training' but processed the check in very smoothly. I got a corner room, overlooking the Opera house. Room: The room was very spacious for Australian standards. It had a seperate 'living room/t.v. corner', large size bathroom with seperate shower&bath and a large bedroom. The TV's where not flatpanel, but had the benefit that they could be moved to either face the desk or face the bed. Food: I only used the breakfast in the breakfast room, which offered a wide choice of Asian, Continental and Full breakfast options. It had 10 different juices on offer and the fresh fruit seemed to be really fresh. Location: As mentioned in the beginning, the location is great. I went for a few runs from the hotels and you can cross the bridge back and forth within 20 min. Also a run around the Opera house can be finished in 20 min. For the rest it is close to the entry of the BridgeClimb entrance and close to plenty of restaurants and nightlife. Summary: This hotel has it all: Location / Staff / Great rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great overall but minor service issues”
Reviews.Author: johnathome
Reviews.Content: Arrived in the early evening via taxi from the domestic airport. Baggage was immediately taken and delivered to the room. Hotel was very busy, lots of people in and out. Check-in was ok, we had someone who was new (trainee?). I had to confirm our room package with her as she was not familiar with the benefits. Our room, 1709 was fantastic. Large room with huge bathroom. Room looked new. We had excellent views of the harbour, the bridge and the opera house. Bed was extremely comfortable with excellent comforter (we didnâ€™t want to get up in the morning). Hotel location is excellent. Walking distance to the Rocks and Circular Quay. Was a steep hike as the Shangri-La is on top of a hill. Breakfast was included in our rate and the buffet breakfast was excellent and full of choices. However, waiting for drinks was unnecessarily long and one of the hot order cooks looked like he wanted to be anywhere but there. Had the dinner buffet one night at CafÃ© Mix. Here we ran into a few problems. First, the hostess insisted on sitting us at a table that was extremely dark. Our son wanted to read and we asked for a table with more lights (there were plenty of empty tables). She promised to bring a candle. We waited and finally asked another gentlemen whether we could move or get some light. Again, meet with uncertainty and a promise of some more light. Finally, got up and asked the hostess again, finally she agreed to move us. My wife and I did enjoy the buffet which had a wide selection of hot and cold foods. My son though, wanted pasta (even though the buffet was free for him) so we ordered him a pasta dish. This took forever to get to us (even the waiter apologized for the wait) and our son ate bread and picked from our dishes. By the time the pasta came, we were all done eating and he never touched the pasta. Had some problems with my bill which they rectified when I pointed it out to them at checkout. Overall, our room was excellent and service (outside CafÃ© Mix) was fine.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning introduction to Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Mikon
Reviews.Content: This has to be the best location in Sydney and perfect for the first time visitor. The harbour view rooms are well worth the extra, with high quality furnishings, big bathrooms and the most amazing views! Little touches were helpful - european and GB power sockets - generous Tea and coffee etc. Don't bother with in house dining - there are so many excellent restaurants at Circular Quay and in the Rocks district, they give a much better flavour of Sydney than a hotel. However, the exception is the bar on the top floor. Here you are treated to double hight windows over looking the harbour, all lit up at night so you don't notice the price of the drinks!!! We arrived from an overnight flight and our room was ready straight away - this is the advantage of giving them your flight details. Rooms are neutrally furnished so that the focal point of the room is the view. I am so glad that I went for the view but as a non business traveller I'm glad I did not pay more for the club floors given the quality of what is on your doorstep - you really do want to be out and about rather than in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wow!”
Reviews.Author: IDzine
Reviews.Content: We just returned from Australia. It had taken some doing to talk my hubby into staying at the Sydney Shangri-La, with an Opera House view. I finally succeeded by suggesting we book the Horizon Club, thereby saving on breakfast and dinner (more about that later). When we arrived early, which was no problem, we were ushered to the 30th floor Horizon Club lounge for private check-in. We were told, "Your room is ready, but we can offer you a very good rate on a better room. Would you like to see it?" Of course we wanted to, if only to sample the view! She first showed us our room with the Opera House view. It was perfectly lovely and acceptable. Yes, you had to look sideways to see the Opera House, but it did provide a good, full view of it. Then we went to room #3313. No. 3313 -- one of the famous #13 rooms, as someone referred to them -- was a corner room (sort of a junior suite) with commanding view of the harbor, including Harbor Bridge, Opera House, The Rocks, the inlets and outlets all the way to the Pacific and, from the side windows, a city view. The price would be $80 Australian more per night than the room we booked originally. Having just barely talked my husband into the Opera House view, I told him it was his call. He said, "We'll take it!" And it was so worth it! I spent so much time looking out those windows and thinking, "This is what people come to Sydney to see." It was beautiful, day and night, and we saw the most incredible rainbow from there -- double at times -- that made almost a complete circle.
