The bar is staffed by extremely capable young bartenders all franticly mixing cocktails. My martinis were nicer than I make myself and I tend to use that as a guide. The Sommelier Tom is very knowledgeable and will guide you in a suitable selection to compliment your meal and is a particularly pleasant person to speak with. All the staff I found were pleasant and helpful and this with the hotel full to capacity so if they can keep smiling under that work load it is a credit to themselves and the management.

Reviews.Title: “Less than expected”
Reviews.Author: globetrotterfirst
Reviews.Content: This was the second time my wife and I stayed at the Shangri-la and our experience was certainly inferior to last time. We tried to check in about 3 hours before official check in time as we had requested an early entry to the room but this was not available owing to late departures. When we were given a room it was clear that it had been used as a smoking room and we had expressly stated that we would not accept a smoking room. This delayed us getting a suitable room for a further hour or so. The reception manager apologised to us, stating that he now had to close the room down as a Japanese visitor had obviously broken the no-smoking rules. So, our room had an opera house view-just, but after a long journey we could have done without the aggro. The rooms may be upgraded but, frankly, they are quite dingy and not especially spacious. Breakfast was like a chimps tea party. Like so many hotels now the Shangri-la goes in for breakfast buffets. I would suggest most discerning travellers are not frantic to manoeuvre their way around other guests to claim half cold, and generally uncovered food which has been fingered and sneezed over. Some buffets work tolerably well. This certainly did not. And if you try to order a la carte, you wait and wait and wait! Overall, I doubt if I will stay there again

Reviews.Title: “devastatingly disapointed”
Reviews.Author: sk8ergirl73
Reviews.Content: Absolutely disappointed with our stay at the Shangri-La Hotel. We booked 1 night of their Easter Deal, which is advertised, for 2 adults and 2 children. We were provided with a room that contained only 3 single beds (1 was a fold away and absolutely no room for another) which was meant to sleep my husband, 2 children and I. What a joke the duty manager was contacted and she couldnâ€™t see what the problem was. She was unable to give us another room, as the hotel was fully booked, she refused to apologise or compensate us in anyway. In fact in the managers own words "we should be grateful as this is a great deal and the rooms would usually be much more expensive". My husband and I slept top and tail in a single bed.

Reviews.Title: “Agree its a 5 star because of the views”
Reviews.Author: bluwes
Reviews.Content: I agree with what has been said in a number of recent reviews. The hotel is in a great position (for the able bodied) and views from the deluxe harbour view rooms (we were on the 26th floor) were worth spending the extra for, especially when the Queen Victoria sailed into the harbour on our last morning. However the rooms are already looking tired and are nothing special for a 5 star hotel. The bed was large and comfortable and the bathroom was ok. had trouble getting the turn down service as they kept wanting to come in whilst we were getting ready to go out. They didnt do anything after we went out. Also trying to get ice was a major effort. All in all saved by the view

Reviews.Title: “The place with those views”
Reviews.Author: TravelChick78
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here a number of times now and we keep comming back. The views are unbeleavable, nice sydney harbour views. The key is to ask for a room on a higher level when you check in to get even better views. If you you want a really full breakfast or it's included in your rate enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: TrAvELer001_8
Reviews.Content: It was a beautiful experince, The room was clean, nicely decorated, and spacious. Bathroom clean as well. Good food, but very over-priced. Beautiful views, we had a corner room. Friendly staff. In easy walking distnace of the rocks and circular quay. Overall a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome view”
Reviews.Author: OldWorldCharm
Reviews.Content: If you want a harbour view, it's hard to beat the panoramic scenes offered by the grand harbour view rooms. From the observatory to the opera house; it's all there to see both day and night. And the breakfast in the club lounge (in fact snacks pretty much all day) is an added bonus worth the extra little bit of cost. As for the room itself, above average and fairly large but nothing to scream about if it weren't for the views.

Reviews.Title: “Aimed at the business traveller”
Reviews.Author: DavidCon
Reviews.Content: After spending 2 nights in the Peninsular in HK we were looking forward to staying in the Shangri-La in Sydney. We arrived early morning and had requested an early check in but were surprised to find that our request had not been processed. The front desk made us very aware that an early check in was a request only and not guaranteed. Having said that they were able to find 2 rooms on the 13th floor. The rooms themselved were devoid of any personality and view (you have to pay more for a view). I did ask to change rooms as I had been given a twin instead of a double bed but this proved to be impossible. During my stay I was only able to use the phone in the bathroom as both the other phones did not work. Despite mentioning this on several occassions the phones were not replaced and I had to make all calls through the hotel operator. A bottle of Fiji water cost $10 and the internet was $0.50 per minute (max $26 per day). That might be standard in hotels but in this case it was expensive for the quality of the rooms and service. Clearly the shangri-la is aimed at the business traveller. On the plus side the bathroom was nice and the beds were comfortable. The bar at the top of the hotel is good fun with great views although it's packed on the weekend. The location was good as it's only a short walk to the bridge and opera house. Overall not a hotel to remember.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and staff, let down by rooms, needs refurb.”
Reviews.Author: Douzer
Reviews.Content: stayed at shangri la for 6 nights in feb this year while touring australia for a month. we booked a darling harbour deluxe room. arrived in hire car from sydney airport, they dealt with the car very efficiently every time we needed it, booking in was ok. staff were friendly enough, we were on the 23rd floor. the room was abit grubby though which was disappointing, it had not being cleaned properly around the edges of the taps on the bath, the wooden unit that surrounded the sink had veneer missing, and was damp. the carpet edges around the room and outside in the corridor had a line of dust along them. the whole hotel looks like it could do with an update/refurb. The location is good, ideal for the bridge walk and access to the rocks.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely staff!”
Reviews.Author: quin-i-bog
Reviews.Content: After walking out of the Sir Stamford at Circular Quay we walked in to the Shangri-La at the Rocks - what a difference. We turned up out of the blue at 11am on a Sunday morning - checked into a suite and had a fabulous 5 night stay. The hotel is not the smartest, but the staff are fantastic. We had a suite which was large and well appointed, but starting to look just a little bit tired. The Horizon lounge on the 30th floor is an echoing cavern of a club lounge with no atmosphere and only 2 food servings a day (breakfast and canapes) - but it does have fantastic views over Sydney Harbour and staff for whom nothing is too much trouble. Staying on the Exec floor gives you access to a dedicated concierge and they couldn't be more helpful. They even arranged to store bags over the weekend for our friends not even staying at the hotel! From the valet parking team to the restaurant staff eveyone was customer focused and supremely efficient and friendly- well done Shangri-La!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: jessicadawn13
Reviews.Content: The Shangri-La is not all it's cracked up to be - Described as one of Sydney's newest hotels, it certainly has aged quickly. The staff were very helpful and professional, but the rooms were a huge disappointment and overall the hotel just seemed run down. I would definitely recommend staying at the Observatory Hotel over the Shangri-La any day.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mrandmrssmith01
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights in Sydney at the Shangri-la, in an executive deluxe Horizon room. The room was spacious, clean, modern and best of all came with access to the Horizon club. The Horizon club, not only gave you a fab breakfast every morning (served until 10am for the lazy amongst us), but also served canapes and drinks every evening from 6-8pm. the canapes were so good, that I saw many people substituting their main evening meal with a huge platful of Californian rolls, dim sums, Cheese and crackers, fruit and cake! The Horizon club, situated on the 30th Floor, has spectacular views and will also give you free access to their wi-fi, as opposed to the charge you will get in your room. the staff are very friendly and helpful and the location is perfect. Nestled in the Rocks, it has easy access to most of the main sights and to the circular Quay where all the ferries run from. The hotel also has a indoor pool and sun deck, and does a great massage! i would recommend this hotel to all, but just make sure you spend that little extra and upgrade to enjoy the Horizon club benefits. (you know its worth it).

Reviews.Title: “Beautifyl Hotel with amazing views”
Reviews.Author: Irish2007
Reviews.Content: We spent some time in The Shangri La hotel as part of our honeymoon in Jan 2008 and were not disappointed. We had a deluxe harbour view room and the views of the Opera House were amazing. Our room was very modern and exceptionally clean. Reception and concierge staff were friendly and attentive. Buffet breakfast was very nice but expensive if not included in your package. The location was excellent and one 2min walk to the Rocks and 5min walk to Circular Quay, note the walk to and from the hotel is on very, very steep hills. My only complaint would be the Spa, the treatments were expensive and the reception staff of the spa, I found very unhelpful. The hotel is very expensive but as a treat, worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ciarao
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 5 nights in December as part of our Honeymoon. We were upgraded to a fabulous corner room on the 22nd floor with amazing views of the Harbour. The room itself was gorgeous and huge with a lovely big bathroom. Very contemporary in design and extremely comfortable. This goes fro the whole hotel itself.Definitely one of the nicest hotel rooms I have ever had the pleasure of staying in. The Hotel itself is very conveniently located just a short stroll from Circular Quay. The bar and lounge area is very relaxing and a lovely place to chll out and have a drink. In the evening, there is lovely piano entertainment. A very busy hotel but still all staff we encountered were friendly, helpful and always had time for us. Quite an expensive hotel but you get what you pay for and i didnt regret paying to stay in such a luxurious hotel. Definitely earns its five star status in my opinion. Dont hesitate to stay if your budget allows.

Reviews.Title: “Club Lounge lets hotel down”
Reviews.Author: JA/IRBolton
Reviews.Content: Having stayed in many Shangri-La hotels around the world, we did have a high expectaction. Most areas of the hotel are very grand however I do feel other areas need some attention to detail. The Club Lounge is starting to look a little grubby in places and the service in the lounge was a big disappointment . The health club was nothing to rave about, the pool was too cool and the seating area outside is right next to a very busy main road. The hotel is able to charge the very high prices due to the views you get from your room, if you book a room overlooking the Harbour bridge and Opera House the view is amazing. If I was to stay at this hotel again I would not book a Horizon club room as to be honest you get very little value for the extra cost. The breakfast in the Cafe Mix was very good indeed and a fantastic selection. Where as in the lounge you had the views but a very limited breakfast selection. It's such a shame that the service does let the Sydney Shangri-La hotel down. There is a mixed bag of reviews on this site and I feel they need to work on delivering the consistent service I have previously had from the hotel group in Asia.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: IndigoNorfolkEngland
Reviews.Content: Staff were all very helpful and friendly. Great view from the room and from the Blue Horizon Bar at the top of the hotel (fantastic cocktails). Modern decor throughout. Buffet breakfast was good though a little pricey however if you complete a form to become a member of the Golden Circle to become a privileged guest you are entitled to 50% off your breakfast. Location excellent, 5-10 minute walk from Opera House.

Reviews.Title: “First Class hotel !”
Reviews.Author: Jerseytraveller
Reviews.Content: We stayed 9 nights and had reserved a de luxe harbour view room with views of Darling Harbour. On arrival we were delighted to be offered an upgrade to similar accommodation but with views of the Opera House, and with the bonus of breakfast included. In fact we had a vast suite with the most comfortable bed imaginable. The views were stupendous, on 20th floor, and being a corner suite (number 2019) had views of Darling Harbour as well! The bathroom and lounge were spacious and quite soundproofed. Aircon efficient and quiet. We were glad that breakfast was included as as part of the upgrade as it would have been AUD 76.00 for the two of us. This is expensive, but was of excellent quality and if you can eat lots of food at that hour of the morning, will tide you over until dinner. The Cafe Mix restaurant has a wonderful evening buffet to include Chinese and Indian food, but was too much for us (see those breakfasts!) but smaller dishes were available for days when you had walked your feet off and were too tired to go out. The cocktail bar on the top floor has absolutely unparalled views of the Bridge and Opera House and serves wicked margaritas. A smart local crowd collect up there Friday and Saturday nights giving it a good buzz. All staff friendly and very helpful and I could not hesitate to recommend this hotel. There is even a decent sized pool to work off all the food! We shall definitly return next year

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: GaylePDublin
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for four nights in November with my husband as part of a three month trip around the world. When arriving by taxi our driver told us the hotel was one of the best in Sydney and certainly it was a fantastic place to stay. Our room was excellent. Very large and spacious, decorated in a traditional style. We had stayed in a lot of contempory hotels and found the antique style furniture and marble bathroom nice for a change. The two best things about the room though were the view from the window and the bed! To wake up every morning to a view of the Opera House and Circular Quay and to sit on the large window sill and watch the ferries coming in and out was very special. I had wanted to stay somewhere with a view of the harbour and this did not disappoint. The bed also deserves a special mention, in three months of travelling this was the most comfortable I slept in! The hotel's location is perfect, withing walking distance of the Bridge, Opera House, Circular Quay and The Rocks. There is also a bus station and train station at Circular Quay so anywhere you want to go is easily accessible, We did the bus tour one day when it rained and I can highly recommend it. We did not eat in the restaurant but it is meant to be good. We did have a drink in the top floor bar one night and the views were very good. If you are on a tight budget this is not the place to stay but it is not over the top in price and for the views and location (and the bed!) it is worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: “The Sydney Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Corcamore
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for my last five nights in Sydney after nearly a month travelling around. We stayed in a room on the 33rd floor with a view of the Opera House and the Harbour, it was fantastic. On going to bed at night it was lovely to check out the view, and first thing in the morning I was jumping out of bed to open the curtains to check it out again. There was a percolator in the room, it was nice to be able to make a nice cup of coffee instead of the instant. I booked a room in the horizon club which cost a bit extra, but was well worth it. Included in the price is your breakfast each morning and canapes & drinks every evening between 6 and 8. This included breads, hummus, olives, roasted peppers, sushi, mini-tartlets, samosas, spring rolls, a variety of desserts. It varied from evening to evening and was delicious. The service was great, they couldn't have been nicer really. We went to the horizon bar aswell one of our nights and the list of cocktails and wines was very impressive. The panoramic views of Sydney from here are so impressive. I cannot recommend this hotel enough, it's location is the best, the views are the best, the service is second to none and the food delicious, what more would you want?

Reviews.Title: “Owners of this hotel, spend some money and it would be excellent”
Reviews.Author: mrsraynor
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the shangri la Sydney after stopping three nights in the Shangri la Singapore. The Singapore hotel was fantastic, so we expected the same standard. We booked a Delux grand harbour view room as it was for our honeymoon. On arrival we shown to our room, which to be honest was a bit dissapointing. The room seemed to need a bit of a face lift. The sprinkler system in our toilet was stuffed with toilet tissue, but to be fair, they did swap our rooms pretty fast after informing them. The hotel pool, is inside, and again the whole thing looked like it could do with a bit of money spent on it. The pool itself was cold and we spent little over 10 minutes in spa area. However this hotel should be used for it location, which is handy for everything, but don't expect 5* accomodation.

Reviews.Title: “Treat yourself while in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: TS10
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as a family over Christmas 2007 with young kids and were delighted with our choice. The staff are very accomodating particularly the concierge. The location is fantastic, near The Rocks. You are also right next to the Australia Hotel which does amazing gourmet pizzas. We only took breakfast in the Shangri La but it was excellent. If I had any complaint, it was that the pool was a bit small and cold and entry is not possible to the top floor bar if you are wearing shorts. Torn jeans fine but clean crisp shorts no! However these would not ruin your stay and we highly recommend it. You can walk everywhere from the hotel and the Bridge Climb is only a stones throw away.

Reviews.Title: “Impeccable service, amazing location”
Reviews.Author: PureIndulgence
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Shangri-La a few times now, however the addition of the personal greeting upon arrival (the same as they do in Asia) was a stand out of our latest visit. We are always impressed with the food, service and of course the views. Blu Horizon can not be beaten for their expansive cocktail list and again the views are second to none in Sydney. Altitude is a must for dining - the degustation on Saturday nights is pure indulgence and the wine matching is to perfection. The chef is an artist!

Reviews.Title: “THE HOTEL to stay while in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: monsterlondon
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a trip to Australia during which, we spent 3 nights at the magnificent Shangri-La Hotel, Sydney. We were very much impressed by the incredible service and facilities. We stayed in a Premier Grand Harbour view room overlooking both the Bridge and the Sydney Opera House - which is so impressive and worth every penny. With such a view, we decided not to close our curtains at night so we could enjoy the view last thing at night and first thing in the morning....so so amazing! The views of the harbour from the Shangri-La Hotel are the best - better than the Four Seasons next door. The concierge facilities were very good indeed and a special mention to Collin who is very knowledgable about not only Sydney but Australia and who could not do enough to help us in finding the right answers to our requests. As we stayed on the Club Floor, we had access to the wonderful lounge again with the amazing view of the harbour serving a very tasty continental breakfast in the morning and drinks and lovely canapes in the evening. The Blu Horizon Bar was a great place to have pre-dinner drinks and from what we could understand from the locals, very much the place to be and be seen in Sydney. They served magnificient cocktails. The Restaurant Altitude was a truly worthwhile experience - the food was to die for and we were very impressed by the wine selection. The service was fautless and very friendly and still the amazing view of the harbour.. Overall, I would probably say that the Shangri-La Hotel, Sydney is the best hotel we ever stayed in and I am very fussy. The location, the views, the service, the value for money - the perfect place to stay while in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Wow!”
Reviews.Author: Raci_Roo
Reviews.Content: This was definatley the best hotel I have stayed in! My boyfriend and I stayed here for one night as a treat and we were not disappointed. We were upgraded from a standard room to the Grand Appartment which turned out to be suite with a huge lounge, kitchen, dining room, and of course bedroom. The room had 270 degree views of Sydney Harbour which were breathtaking! If you stay at this hotel, be sure to have a drink at the Blu Horizon bar at the top of the hotel which again had amazing views of the harbour. The service was great as soon as we set foot in the hotel and nothing was too much trouble.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: obs1909
Reviews.Content: This was my third stay at the Shangri-La Sydney, and as usual it was an exceptional experience in every way. The hotel is easy to get to and the well-dressed and enthusiastic staff are on hand to ensure that you receive a warm welcome. Check-in was seamless, despite our early arrival. Our room was immaculately clean and well appointed, but this is of course is surpassed by the breathtaking views of Sydney Harbour, the Opera House and the Bridge that greeted us on entry to our room. What an amazing view is afforded by the hotel's practically harbourside location! We had an early evening drink in the lobby bar, and enjoyed watching the comings and goings. Dinner was room service pizza, which was surprisingly good - it came to our room after only a 20-minute wait, piping hot and very tasty. I had a sensational night's sleep on the gloriously comfortable bed and rose early to run across the Harbour Bridge (what a treat!) and then used the hotel's gym, which has a generous array of modern, well maintained equipment. After this I felt justified in tucking into a delicious buffet breakfast in Cafe Mix - even the coffee was good, so the hotel's management have obviously taken the thought to invest in decent barista training for their staff. A thoroughly enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Not up to the normal standard”
Reviews.Author: smaragdpete
Reviews.Content: Location at the The Rocks was great but the rest of the hotel was very average considering the price. This was a very ordinary business type hotel and far less impressive than the Shangri La in Singapore. Guests do not seem to get priority to the bar on the top floor, that is not normal at any hotel. When we did finally get access the staff more or less ingnored us and were really quite rude. I would not recommend this hotel to either the business traveller or tourist. The rest of the facilities were nothing special.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome locations & views!! Average hotel.”
Reviews.Author: SGJMG29
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is awesome. Best to upgrade to a harbour or Opera house view room if you can as the views are outstanding. We upgraded to Horizons Club but the services are not as good as other Shangri-La Club rooms. The lounge is featureless apart from the amazing view and the food and drink is basic. If you want to an amazing location then this is the hotel for you but otherwise the hotel is overrated. Our room key broke several times a day and the lifts were temperamental. Breakfast was fairly tasteless and same choice every day.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location!”
Reviews.Author: Tygaman
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Shangri-La for two nights for work purposes. The hotel was located a short walk from The Rocks area of Sydney with restaurants and cafes as well as a short walk from the Harbour Bridge and the Opera House. The CBD was a 10-15 minute walk from the hotel. The room I stayed in was a Grand Harbour View room which had excellent views over the Harbour Bridge, Opera House and the harbour itself out to Manly. The rooms were large, clean and bright but the room I had still had an older television but we were told they will be upgrading soon. The beds were very comfortable, two king singles as I was sharing with a work colleague. Breakfast is either a continental breakfast in the Club Lounge for those with access or a full cooked buffet in Cafe Mix on the first floor. Had dinner one night at Cafe Mix and it was a mixed buffet with Indian, Chinese, Japanese and seafood sections. The hotel pool is indoors on the second floor and probably needs a facelift. There is also a spa in the pool area and separate saunas in the male and female change rooms. The hotel also has a fitness centre although I did not use it. Overall, the hotel is in an excellent location with spectacular views over the harbour and is highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dath
Reviews.Content: Stayed 5 nights in Horizon Club on 32nd floor with Darling Harbour views. Larger than average room, spotlessly clean and with huge picture windows. Drinks and canapes each evening on the 30th floor [with amazing views over the harbour] was an added bonus and we really didn't need dinner afterwards. The staff were the friendliest I've ever come across and always greeted us with a smile and a welcome without being too imposing. . Only downside was the hotel had 100% occupancy at the weekend so you had to queue for breakfast. No-one was annoyed though, everyone was happy to wait until a table became available. Again this was mainly because of the friendly efficient staff. Go to the 36th floor for cocktails, no need to visit look out towers, this is the best view in town. I've already recommended the hotel to friends and will most definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “OK experience”
Reviews.Author: travels21
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Shangri-La during our stay in Sydney on our Honeymoon. Room: we had picked the Premier Grand Harbor View Room. The view was outstanding. You could see the Opera House and the Harbor Bridge while in bed. Unfortunately, other than the view, the room does not meet the basic standards one would expect of a hotel of this caliber. Room Service: poor quality food. it was served on time, but the breakfast was cold and poor quality food. Staff: several problems, which in a lesser hotel one could overlook, but again in a hotel of this caliber should not be a concern: - the concierge staff while they tried to be helpful, often were simply too busy. there was often a line waiting for the concierge. also, they did not seem well versed in the local restaurants beyond just a few restaurants (for example, where one can get good vegetarian cuisine). - the maid service was again below average for this level of hotel. turndown service was performed only once. we returned only to find the ironing board and hair dryer still out. some trash had not been thrown away. - bell staff: we requested a taxi only to see the bell man than go on to take care of some other guests. we finally had to flag another bell man to hail a taxi for us. were 15 minutes late for our restaurant appointment. - there were a number of other details where the staff simply failed and as a result we would become more and more frustrated. Bottom Line: while the views from (at least) our room were outstanding, the experience was otherwise very poor, particularly when it came to meeting basic expectations.

Reviews.Title: “A+++”
Reviews.Author: BigTimeTravel
Reviews.Content: Booked a 2 night stay to happen after arriving in Sydney on a cruise ship. Booked a deluxe Club room with a harbour view on a higher floor. Arrived at the hotel early at 10AM and was thrilled to find out that my room was available. Check in was slow but I forgot about that when I found out the room was ready. The room was excellent with terrific views. Extremely comfortable king bed and a wonderful bathroom that had a big deep tub and separate glass enclosed shower with strong water pressure. I ordered room service the first night and had one of the best cheeseburgers ever. There staff were very helpful and friendly. The Club on the 30th floor was comfortable. I will absolutely stay there again on my next trip to Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel with one of the best views of Sydney Harbour”
Reviews.Author: Longdrive
Reviews.Content: Many years ago we booked a corner suite at the Regent Hotel in Sydney prior to catching a Pacific Cruise. It was one of the best rooms that we have ever experienced with one of the best views. So as it was my birthday and we were having a luxury weekend in Sydney we wanted to enjoy the experience once again. Only problem was that over twenty years the property had changed entities several times and I thought it was now the Shangri La so we booked a corner suite on a celebrations package for $588 which included $150 in food and drink credits, a bottle of Moet, breakfast and an early check in. Not a bad deal. Only problem was when we got to Sydney and discovered that the old Regent is now the Four Seasons and the Shangri La is next door up the hill, not to worry it still looked good. The previous night we spent at the Park Hyatt so we were looking forward to comparing the two high end properties. Check in was slow and at 1.30pm room was not available, but we could take a similar room on the 5th floor or wait for our assigned room on the 22nd, we decided to have a walk around Sydney for an hour and wait for the higher floor. The wait was worth it, the corner suite was magnificent, the views so stunning we were tempted to spend the rest of the afternoon swilling Moet, and enjoying the views. We had a dinner booking in the hotel's signature restaurant, Altitude on the 35th floor, which was pricey but the quality food, service and overall experience was worth it. The bed so comfortable it was almost worth the cost of the room and I was looking forward to a lazy Sunday morning reading the Sunady paper in bed looking out over the harbour, but to my surprise no paper......so off downstairs to breakfast and a paper. Buffet breakfast was adequate without being lavish, service levels not quite up to scratch. In comparing the two hotels we considered that the Shangri La was overall better value and provided far better Harbour views, but the personal service of the Hyatt staff was far superior. Next time we will try out the Four Seasons.

Reviews.Title: “Good, but not quite good enough”
Reviews.Author: HongKongMember
Reviews.Content: I had booked a Horizon Club room for a recent 2 night stay and was upgraded to a harbour view suite. Very pleased that I was not paying the rate for same as, of the 3 windows in the suite, 2 overlooked the highway at the rear of the hotel and the third was really overlooking an adjacent building, but with some care you could see the harbour. Odd also that the suite provided for a lounge area, but without a second TV. Check-in was at the Horizon Club lounge, but there was a massive queue for the lifts, so a good 10 minutes wait. Given my late arrival, the staff at Altitude restaurant managed to find me a table, good service and food quality and nice to see a selection of wines by the half bottle. Views, of course, are fantastic. Club lounge offers an adequate breakfast and a wide selection of drinks and hors d'oeuvres in the evening. However, despite all the good, I felt that it still came up short when compared to the Inter-Continental where I normally stay. Certainly, the club lounge is no match, so I think the Inter-Con will win next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay, A Safe Choice”
Reviews.Author: doctorfoxtrot
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel from Oct 30-Nov 3 for a leisure trip with my family. Arrived quite early and as expected rooms were not yet ready. Rooms manager offered us the use of their Business Center lounge facilities while we wait. We booked a deluxe room during our stay which I found to be spacious. Good lighting with comfortable beds. Bathroom facilities are very nice. Hotel in itself was luxurious . Not a huge lobby but the elegance is somehow quite evident. We had our buffet breakfast at the Cafe Mixx restaurant during our entire stay and we found the food choices to be extensive and the taste to be average but definitely not bad. We got to use their health club and pool facilities which is quite small and unexpected for a 5 star hotel. Getting to know the staff is quite interesting since they are composed of various nationalities who seem to have multi-tasking capabilities. Good service on a consistent level is very much noted. The hotel is located on the quaint side of Rocks district. It is within walking distance to the CBD, Circular Quay, Harbour Bridge and Opera House. Restaurants, shops and historic landmarks are nearby. The steep hill is not a major issue once you get adjusted. High occupancy even though it is not yet peak season is an indication of the good reputation it has enjoyed since the rebranding and refurbishing . Would definitely recommend this hotel .

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: ymmum
Reviews.Content: What a fabulous Hotel. From check in to check out we were treated with 5 Star hospitality. The rooms are amazing and the most comfortable beds I have ever slept in. The food is spectacular. Definately the only place to stay when in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in central location regular guest”
Reviews.Author: Coza
Reviews.Content: For those in Sydney on business or pleasure this hotel is sure to please. Great service and rooms and nice views if you get the good side not facing the Harbour Bridge toll gates, aviod this side if you can. Short walk to the rocks, and most major tourist sites.

Reviews.Title: “Superb location, Fabulous View”
Reviews.Author: TravelBoo2
Reviews.Content: We were immediately impressed, because we arrived at 6:30am and were checked right into our room. WOW, fabulous large room, view of the bridge and opera house, with a window ledge to sit on and admire the view. Kingsize comfy bed, large lcd tv, mini bar with space, tea/ coffee facilities, armchair and side table. Wardrobe was limited as was drawer space, but adequate for us. Robes, slippers, safe, iron and ironing board inside robe. Superb bathroom, large shower cubicle, bath etc and nice toiletries, which were replenished sometimes twice daily. Turn down service in the evening was a nice touch too. We found the staff were superb and very friendly, despite other reviews to the contrary. AUD40 taxi fare from the airport. We didnâ€™t eat in the hotel restaurants, although we did use the bakery at the back of the hotel for breakfast one morning. Nice if a little more expensive than other places in Sydney. A little tip for you, go down one more level from reception and exit from the back of the hotel, beside the bakery. Go left and take the steps down to the next street, it cuts out the very steep hill. Lots of places for breakfast on George Street, just a 2 min walk down the dreaded hill and also plenty of ATMs. You are right in the rocks area, 5 min walk to the Bridgeclimb office, 10 min walk to Circular Quay and 25-30 min to Darling Harbour. We walked everywhere from the hotel, the location was great. We didnâ€™t make it to the famous bar for the view, but then I would assume that it is just the same as the great view that we had. Used the pool once, it was good and there is a little terrace off the reception at the fitness centre, gym looked good. The hotel car took us back to the airport for AUD50, nice executive style car and worth the AUD10 extra dollars. Driver was also very friendly. Without exception we were very impressed with the hotel and wouldnâ€™t hesitate to recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Breakfast...concierge rude”
Reviews.Author: desertrosegemini
Reviews.Content: I celebrated my wedding in this hotel , we stayed in the harbour view room which was too die for. Rooms are clean, amenities faboulous. The restaurant on the top floor had the best suckling pig dish....melts in your mouth..compliments to the chef. Just one gripe...one of my guest were not allowed in the bar because he was wearing trendy loafers....i thought the bouncer could have handled the situation better but he acted like a big bully. Needless to say i reported it directly to the manager on duty and he wasn't helpful at al!!!! Breakfast was great. awesome selection.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: leelou28
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Shangri La for work for 3 nights in Sept. I was updated to a room with a view of the harbour and could just see the Opera House. The room itself was nice, with a gorgeous bathroom and the normal fittings you'd expect. I did have problems with the air conditioning and it took two requests on 2 separate days for it to be finally fixed. The inhouse gym is good and the proximity to The Rocks is great. Overall the hotel is very nice but not amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Cocktails looking over Harbour Bridge & Opera House”
Reviews.Author: UKRaj
Reviews.Content: The views from the top floor bar or restaurant "Altitude" are possibly the best in Sydney. Book a Horizon Club bedroom on the upper floors with a specially good view and you get treated like royalty. The hotel is a stones throw from the "Bridge Climb" company. You can stand on top of the Harbour Bridge and possibly identify your Shangri La hotel room. The concierge managed to get me a table at top Sydney restaurant Tetsuyas after my own attempt was unsuccesful.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing overall”
Reviews.Author: TechnoProf
Reviews.Content: The views from the rooms are just amazing and thatâ€™s good enough reason to book into The Shangri-La but I expected more and was disappointed. The staff were generally all helpful especially at check in, but the hotel housekeeping and overall coordination was disorganised and lacked care. The room I was checked into was not fully made up â€“ this was remedied quickly. The new room was good but its looking a bit shabby in the bathroom furniture. The turn down service was scruffy (curtains not drawn properly, some not drawn at all, bathroom items not replaced) - looked as if someone had dashed in and done less than half a job. I mentioned this twice to staff. The Horizon Club is more like a cafÃ© than a place to relax- I have been too spoilt by other Shangr-Las maybe. The food quality and attention to detail in the 1st floor cafÃ© is also a bit ragged, slow service and in parts has a â€˜thrown together feelâ€™.. Sorry to be writing such a review as I am great Shangri-Las enthusiast. So overall this is not 5* service and what a shame.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: Snedders
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 5 nights in July for our first trip to Australia. We arrived at night so did not really have any idea where to wander at night! Very foolish since in the morning when we went for a walk we discovered we were right in the heart of the Rocks. The hotel is in a great location for walking to Circular Quay, Harbour Bridge, Opera House, Botanic Gardens and the main shopping area as well as the Rocks itself which has some nice shops and cafes. Hotel itself was really nice and the bar on the top floor was really good (although service was slow). Would definitley stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great View, Great Hotel, Great City !”
Reviews.Author: Warby40
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Shangri La for 5 nights and had booked a Deluxe Grand Harbour View Room. On arrival met by very friendly porters. Reception staff and check-in process were refreshingly quick. We arrived at approx 9am and were delighted that we were able to gain immediate access to our room. At check in we were initially offered a room on the 7th floor, however having read previous reviews we requested a room on a higher floor - got floor 28. Beware of lower floor rooms - there is a highway that runs past the hotel, so possibility of noise and certainly a spoilt view!! The room was spacious and the view awesome - to our left the Harbour Bridge and to our right the Opera House. Two large twin beds, tv, Tea/Coffee facilities, large bathroom with bath & separate shower. The room had a safe and if you wish Safety Deposit Boxes are available through reception (free - but don't lose the key it will cost you $AU300). A newspaper is delivered to your room each morning, and the beds turned back in the evening. Bathrobes & slippers provided in the room - very handy if you go down to the pool! The pool and Gym are on the 4th floor. The pool was a bit murky but of a reasonable 15m size (and very quiet). Water was a bit chilly but the spa pool made up for that. Didn't use the gym but it appeared well equipped and quity busy. You can book treatments in the spa or visit the hairdresser. There is a gift shop in the basement - we thought it may prove expensive, but was certainly on a par with, and sometimes cheaper than, other shops in the area. Breakfast in the hotel is quite expensive, however if you go out of the hotel's rear door there is a little coffee shop (Gloucester Street Pantry) which offers a selection of pastries, sandwiches, cakes, fruit cups etc. There is a pub (Harts) next door to the hotel - a bit like stepping back to the 70s. If you just want a quick, basic bite to eat then its handy, but certainly dated compared to the many restaurants you wll find around Circular Quay. The hotels own Altitude Restaurant on the 36th Floor offers fantastic food with views to match (smart dress). The hotel is located in the Rocks district of the city and within easy walking distance of the bridge, opera house, circular quay (train station, ferries and restaurants) The Queen Victoria & Strand Shopping centres and Darling Harbour are walkable (approx 15-20mins). Be aware that the hotel is on a hill which is fairly steep (especially if you decide to walk from the station pulling a couple of heavy suitcases)!! We found all of the staff to be very helpful, courteous and keen to see us enjoying our visit. There are usually taxis parked just outside the hotel so getting around is simple. Taxi to/from airport is approx $AU40.

Reviews.Title: “from someone who knows the place”
Reviews.Author: Inspector_to_be
Reviews.Content: For those of you going to Sydney on Business or Leisure, and dont mind staying in a large hotel, this is the place. Extremelly well located, great facilities (just went through a $40 million refurbishment program). Leisure: The best harbour views in Sydney. There is no two ways about it. I've been to Grand Harbour rooms in evey 5* hotel in Sydney, and the views from their Deluxe Grand Harbour View rooms cannot be toped, ever. The area in front of the hotel is a heritage site, so the views will never get blocked. Dont go for the Deluxe Opera House Rooms. They are partial views (cant see the harbour bridge). PLEASE DONT. Pay the extra $40 or so and get a room with one of the best views in the world. If you feel like spending a bit more, go for the Premiere Grand Harbour View. Its a Junior Suite on the corner of the hotel (room number 13 in every floor). Its got a panoramic view, with windows all around the corner, and the bed facing the window!!! (also known as the honeymoon suite). Its absolutely lovely. Also, request floors 12 - 18 (this way you see the opera house when laying in bed!!!) The Executive Grand Harbour Suites are stupid. They are more expensive, on the other corner of the holel (view not as great) and the living room makes the guest room very small. Go for the Premiere, unless you need a separate living room. Corporate - fantastic facilities: business center, internet connection and wireless in public areas. Good Gym, loads of function rooms and a superbe Executive Lounge. Horizon Club. for an extra ($40, I think) you get to use the louge: again, best views, free internet, breakfast, pre dinner-drinks and exclusive recetion area. All in all, the facilities are great as well. There is a Cocktail Bar (Blue Horizon) and a Fine Dinning restaurant (Altitude) on the 36th floor. Again, great views, but also excelent ambiance and food and beverages. The only shortfall is the service. Even though everyone does their best, it lacks teamwork. Its the kind of service that is acceptable, but not excelent. Nevertheless, I wouls So stay there every time I came to Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “best views”
Reviews.Author: watchitLondon
Reviews.Content: Upgraded to a Grand Harbour view room and overlooked the harbour opera house and bridge. To just sit and see these was worth the cost of this hotel. Short (hilly) walks to harbour, ferries and bridge and superb restuarants near the waterfront. There are short cuts through the adjacent hotel elevators to save the legs - ask the conceirge. Friday and sat nights are bit rowdy outside the bars with lots of good natured youths queing outside bars. Hotel is superbly placed and upmarket and breakfast is buffet style and good.

Reviews.Title: “The view”
Reviews.Author: johnwilliamson66
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights in club room with great veiws of harbour and quays.Could not fualt service or room.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: bowwow2gill
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to Australia to celebrate 25 years of marriage (and our first holiday alone, without the children!) The views from this hotel were wonderful and took our breath away - it made our 22 hour trip so worth while. We were lucky with the weather, with sunshine every day during our 5-day stay. The staff were pleasant and very accommodating - our porter, after bringing our suitcases to our room, was only too pleased to offer advice on where to visit in Sydney and seemed genuinly interested in our stay and where we had travelled from. (Northern England) The bathroom was roomy and the lounge area was unexpected and therefore a nice surprise. I loved to sit on the window sill and watch people traveling to or from work. The only gripe I would have about our stay was that the car park staff lost our car keys and it took them 40 minutes to find them, delaying our trip to the Blue Mountains and when we came to settle our bill we asked for a reduction in the car parking charges, only to be told that the car park was operated independently from the hotel and that we should take the matter up with the car park operators. The car parking charges were expensive at this hotel, but with being first time visitors to Sydeny (and Australia) we had little choice but to park at the hotel. (However, later into our trip we were pleased to discover that the car park at the Novotel, in Brisbane, was FREE). Despite this, we will definetly be returning to Sydney. We could live there, the Oz people are so friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Shangri-La saved our marriage!!”
Reviews.Author: Pinkpuffle
Reviews.Content: One of the best weekends in Sydney we have ever had and a must do for every Sydney sider! Book the 'Occasions' package which gives you a fabulous harbour view room, Moet et Chandon (not the cheap plonk usually on offer at other hotels) and a four o'clock late check out plus a few other goodies. Leave the kids with grandma and pamper yourself for the weekend. We were offered the Hoizon Club when we booked for $100 but declined, note that you can ask at the front desk and upgrade for only $80 when you arrive. The Horizon Club lets you play princess in the lounge on level 30, (find Gerry he's wonderful) and includes free drinks (6pm G&T's mmm) and breakfast the next moning. We spent a bomb at Blu Hoizon and Altitude Restaurant on the top floor but is worth every cent for the view and special service. What a great experience - well done Shangri-La!

Reviews.Title: “Great situation - would stay again!”
Reviews.Author: CazRob
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a week at the Shangri-La and it was excellent! We had a Deluxe Grand Harbour View room on the 22nd floor which wasn't cheap but worth every penny! The views were amazing! The room had two large double beds with beautifully soft linen and a variety of pillows. There was a very well equipped mini bar and plenty of tea /coffee if you prefer this to room service. The bathroom was excellently appointed with good quality toiletries and towels changed twice a day. The room service is the best I've ever experienced - fast and efficient (although they did put pineapple on a pizza when we ordered from 'The Movie Menu' but that seems to be an Australian thing!). The hotel laundry / dry cleaning was superb and I particulary liked the way they were delivered in a basket folded with tissue paper! Food at breakfast was excellent but the service was very hit and miss - too often tables weren't cleared between courses and they kept presenting us with the wrong bill which after a week was very wearing (so much so that one morning we refused to sign the bill). Especially strong points included the evening housekeeping service (ice, fresh towels etc) and the concierge service (very knowledgable and swift parking). The only negative aspect was the bar (right at the top of the hotel) - you had to queue to get in (?) and the view from our room was far better! We also had trouble one evening as the bar wouldn't allow children in (admittedly it was nearly midnight and we did have 6 with us!) but the bar downstairs was closed and there was nowhere else to go! They also refused to serve coffee "after 11pm" - an odd situation indeed. Despite this gripe I would definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: JojoA19
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful stay! What a great view from the rooms. Staff were welcoming and really helpful. Would recommend it highly.

Reviews.Title: “Wow, what a view”
Reviews.Author: oldwanderingwoman
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel in The Rocks area of Sydney provides a perfect setting to explore the area around the Circular Quay and the Opera. The view from our room and from the restaurant/bar at the top was simply magical. We could see the Sydney Harbor Bridge and the Sydney Opera House from our window and watch the ferries as they skittered about the harbor. Though the weather was wet while we were there, the setting and proximity to excellent restaurants, museums, and the harbor itself more than compensated. The room itself was comfortably furnished and obviously had been recently updated. Combining the view and the room itself, staying any where else if I returned to Sydney would be a disappointment.

Reviews.Title: “My favoriate Hotel in Sydney - Shangri-La Hotel Sydney”
Reviews.Author: DeliciousHongKong
Reviews.Content: My family and I had a wonderful 3 days there, the rooms are large and have great veiws, the team are professional and friendly, the new restaurant on the top floor Altitute was amazing, the new chef there has done a wonderful job on the menu and everything we ate was mouth watering and the staff there gave us great recommendations on food and wine.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel Experience ever!”
Reviews.Author: spottygoose
Reviews.Content: We just enjoyed a fantastic 5 night stay at Shangri-La, Sydney. We booked (through Expedia) a Premier Harbour View Room ie is one of the corner suites (rooms ending in 13). We had the most amazing view over Sydney Harbour including the Harbour Bridge and Opera House. The room was huge and the service second to none. The staff are all extremely customer friendly and professional. All our room service orders, whether it be breakfast or dinner, were set up on a table next to the window (or wherever we chose) so we could eat while taking in the view. We didn't have the best weather in Sydney but the room more than made up for it, it was great. We also found the location great. It is in the Rocks area, handy to Circular Quay and not too far a walk into the CBD for shopping. We stayed in 1513 and noted down the number as we know we will want to go back for a weekend sometime. An awesome experience.

Reviews.Title: “horizon club well worth the extra”
Reviews.Author: ahoramismo
Reviews.Content: the hotel will always have arguably the best views in sydney as well as all the attributes expected of a 5 star hotel. However the real bonus is the Horizon Club.with fabulous views on the 30th floor. Since shangrila group took over the hotel some 4 years ago they have attempted to market this feature which is very successful in other parts of their group. Basically the idea is that for an extra charge you have access to a lounge for breakfast/afternoon tea/cocktails in the evening. Until recently the idea has never been terribly effective because it has not been effectively managed. A new manager has now been appointed who has revitalised the concept, refocussed a very willing staff team and improved the place beyond all recognition. So NOW it is certainly worth the extra to stay in a Horizon Club room once more.

Reviews.Title: “Great Expereince - but trouble since!”
Reviews.Author: ChantelleG
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Shangri-La in Sydney at the start of our honeymoon. We paid on arrival to upgrade to the Horizon level which was well worth it. We had a corner room and it was fantastic. The hotel was great and everyone was very friendly. We had an all inclusive deal which included food and drink credit every day. About two months after we returned from our stay we were sent a bill for additional mini bar items. I made contact and explained that these should have been included in our deal and I got a response appologising for their error. However they took this money off my credit card and I am still fighting to get it back now - months later! Sadly this has put a sour feeling about the experience! So beware!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Aussiegal15
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 4 night weekend visit to Sydney staying at this hotel. We had a room on the 27th floor overlooking Darling Harbour. The view was fabulous. Our room was a good size with a wonderful, comfortable bed. We were able to choose from both Down and Foam pillows. The bathroom was fully tiled in travetine marble and was very roomy with a great bath as well as a shower recess. The toiletries provided were of good quality and were replaced twice a day as necessary. The towels were huge and luxurious. The only downfall was the breakfast. It just wasn't up to 5 star hotel standard. There was only one chef cooking omeletes and he was extemely slow. All the other eggs eg. scrambled, poached and fried were all pre-cooked. My husband chose fried eggs one morning and they were freezing cold as they had been sitting on a plate with no warmer underneath. The bacon wasn't crisp and the sausages weren't good. There were plenty of Asian selections and we both realized that as this hotel is part of the Shangri-la group, it would be geared for overseas visitors from Singapore, China and Malyasia. Our breakfast was included in our room rate, but if we had to pay $38Aud p.p. for breakfast then we would have found somewhere else to eat. Other than this criticism, we did have an enjoyable stay especially as the back entrance leads to Argyle Street and the Rocks area. There are numerous cafes and restaurants nearby which are quite inexpensive. It is also very close to Circular Quay and the overseas cruise terminal.

Reviews.Title: “What a view!”
Reviews.Author: KylieOberon
Reviews.Content: we recently stayed at the Shangri-la for the second time and loved it. The view is just amazing and the beds to die for. We stayed on their horizon level with full harbour view rooms. I agree the service is a little poor ( especially when comparing to asian hotels) but the view certainly makes up for it. Treat yourself and remember the service we get in most Australian hotels is not the same standard as many overseas places.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great views”
Reviews.Author: itrapnell
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 5 nights in June, and can definately recommend it. The Shangri-la is in a great central location in The Rocks - very easy to get around whether staying for business (right in the CBD) or pleasure. The rooms are a good 5* standard, and the higher up you go the views are fantastic, especially if you pay for a harbour view. The service is good as you would expect in a Shangri-la, and the bar at the top of the hotel is really nice. The only down side is that we paid for a club room, which meant you got breakfast included in the price (which is excellent), a high room with a view (also excellent) and free cocktails and canapes in an executive lounge every night - we only went once as it was in the most soulless room you can imagine! I don't know why they bother with it, because it's like being in a meeting! Aside from that, this is an excellent hotel - I've stayed there before, and would do again.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful views”
Reviews.Author: anthony_martin18
Reviews.Content: We decided to spoil ourselves and booked an upgraded room with views of the harbour, bridge and opera house. We weren't disappointed! This was the most expensive hotel we stayed in during our 3 week trip but it was worth it for the 4 nights we had in Sydney. Great location and a luxurious room which made us feel spoilt but the hotels restaurants are very expensive and are quite sterile. That's not a problem though as there are lots of restaurants within walking distance. Its also well worth going for a drink in the top floor bar of the hotel just for the views.

Reviews.Title: “Good views, but bed was rather uncomfortable for a hotel of its class”
Reviews.Author: The_Soh_Family
Reviews.Content: Stayed a the Shangri-La for two days in July with my family of three. My experience there was generally better than other similar 5-star hotels in Sydney, in terms of service and views the room offers, although I won't rate it the best. The good points 1. View was great and unblocked. Stayed at a grand harbour room with views of the harbour, opera house and bridge. The view was good, but not great as we were given a room on a pretty low floor which was a little disappointing as we'd paid more hoping to enjoy a better view. 2. Level of service was generally better than other 5-star hotels in Sydney (having stayed at others like Intercontinental and Marriott Sydney Harbour), although the porter who brought our luggage to our room on check in was I thought, a little unfriendly. 3. Within short walking distance to Circular Quay. For someone who enjoys an early morning walk along the fantastic harbour that Sydney offers, this is a major plus point. Now, the bad points. 1. Bed was rather uncomfortable for a 5-star hotel, especially for a Shangri-La. I've stayed at Marriott Sydney Harbour, Intercontinental and Sheraton and the beds there were much comfortable, at least more to my liking, especially Marriott's which I think was the best. 2. Not the best rate is offered to hotel guests. I initially intended to stay one night (as Sydney was meant to be a short stop over en route to Singapore after our holidays in Cairns), but decided to extend it for another night. The front desk offered me a standard rate which was more than what was offered on its hotel web site the previous night when I checked. This was highlighted to the staff who insisted that rates fluctuate with demand. I could have rejected the offer and went back to my room and book a room through Shangri-la's web site, but decided not to go through the hassle. The difference was only A$10-15 but I thought it was only right that existing hotel guests not be made to pay more than those who haven't even checked in, bearing in mind that I'm also a member of Shangri-la' Golden Circle. 3. Not given a welcome fruit basket when it 's supposed to be offered to members of the hotel's Golden Circle. No big deal but I thought that a hotel of Shangri-La's standard wouldn't have overlooked such finer details. Overall, it was a pretty positive experience at the Shangri-La Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Pool Needs A Scrub”
Reviews.Author: nowvoyager1
Reviews.Content: Sydney has many things going for it but really good hotels are few and far between. As this was a business trip, staying in the CBD was a necessity. The Shang is a good, solid and totaly unmemorable choice compensating for its overall blandness with excellent views and a generally friendly and helpful staff. I stayed in an Opera facing room on one of the Horizon Floors. The room had one spectacular view over the harbour while the other windows faced a neighbouring apartment block, making it ideal for a remake of Rear Window. Room layout was more akin to a suite albeit that the sitting room had no phone or television and was as appealing as a dentist's waiting room. Can't comment on the food as the last thing one does in Sydney is eat in. The hotel's pool is small at 15 metres and had the water clarity of thick soup. The staff in the gym didn't seem overly concerned and thought it might be the chlorine levels or the filter. As it was like this for 4 days, I assume it wasn't that much of a priority but pretty unpleasant. Would I stay there again? Probably. Would I recommend it? No better or worse than any of the other supposedly top end hotels in the city.

Reviews.Title: “My kinda town...”
Reviews.Author: Twobucks
Reviews.Content: This was our second visit to the Shangri La Sydney and it proved as good as the first. As before we ordered a Grand Harbour View room (this upgrade is well worth the cost) and the vista is truly one of the great sights of the world... Sydney harbour bridge and the opera house... just magic. The rooms are spacious, well maintained and very clean. Bathrooms are also of a good size with facilities to cater for the extended traveller. The hotel is located in the Rocks area of Sydney and very handy for shopping and for the many restaurants in and around the Rocks and Circular Quay. For the tourist, transport services are very local to the hotel with links to rail, boat and bus only a few minutes walk away.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, but expensive place”
Reviews.Author: pam89
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent hotel with a very attentive service. Rooms are large and nice, most with a beautiful view over the Sydney Opera or Darling Harbour. It is very centrally located, only a few minutes walk from the Harbour Bridge and Circular Quay. The hotel is pretty expensive, though. Also note that they charge for extras that may be included in other places. Broadband internet access costs AUD 29 per day and there is also a charge for using the fitness center. If breakfast is not included in your package it will cost you AUD 38, which seems overpriced, although the selection is big.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Elysium73
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights on a Honeymoon on the way to Fiji. Shangri-La was a great hotel for us to explore this fantastic city. Located in the Rocks, it was only a 5 minute (downhill) walk to the Circular Quay, a 2 minute walk along the street to the offices of the BridgeClimb (which I would strongly advise doing), and a $15 taxi ride to Darling Harbour. From our room we could see the Opera House (though not the bridge unfortunately). Room was large, clean and comfortable. Comfy bed. Bathroom was excellent. Good choice of TV channels. Only downside was the cost of things such as laundry and room service (not unusual for a hotel of this type).

Reviews.Title: “Shangri La - Pretty Darn Good”
Reviews.Author: Canada_One
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Shangri-La on business - there for 6 nights so expereinced a fair bit of the place. I would say the Shang is definitely above average - but not quite excellent. Here is the lowdown. Booked room on the Club level, giving one access to the Club Lounge, free internet, breakfast included. I was expecting free internet in my room for this price, so was a little surprized to find out this only applied while in the Club Lounge. The lounge is open from around 7:00 AM to 9:00 PM. The views from my room (Darling Harbour) and the Club Lounge (Sydney Bridge and Opera House) were indeed excellent.. The service in the lounge was great - you are treated very well. Lots to drink, and OK eats - although a little limited. IMPORTANT: You can have the FULL breakfast buffett in the main dining room at no extra cost if you book Club level. This is highly recommended. Room was nice, clean. Very large bathroom with nice amenities. No complaints here. The corner room was nice as it had corner windows and a expanded view, but there is a very small and strangely placed living area just as you enter the room, and then down a long hallway to the bedroom. Never used the "living" room. Kinda weird layout. Breakfast generally very good, although I would not recommend going just upon opening, they are generally disorganized. Ordered room service once - hamburger well done. Received it medium at best, and not very good at that. Overall the food at the Shang is not memorable at all. Except for breakfast eat elsewhere when you can. The day Concierge was extremely helpful, recommended sights, gave good directions, overall excellent. Location of the Shang is very good for sighseeing - close to the Rocks, museums and ferries. There seemed to be a lot of groups hitting the Shang - at times it was a long wait for an elevator. Room was extrememly quiet, which is a must for me. Bed very comfortable. Chief minuses were food quality and extra internet charges. If I ever go back, will be tempted to try the Four Seasons (also great location and looked nice from outside).

Reviews.Title: “3 star posing as 5 star, do not expect more. Very poor value.”
Reviews.Author: davidharding
Reviews.Content: Our description "terrible" reflects what is reasonable to expect from a 5 star hotel and the reality of our experience. Admittedly, we are prepared to pay top dollar and expect to receive commensurate value. We hardly slept he first night. The double bed was zip and link and the zip was evident as were the springs! This must have been the honeymoon mattress for many years, the way it sagged in the middle! I did complain that having a bed spring up my backside was not a pleasant experience. They promised to change the mattress, in fact they placed a cover over it. Leaving our room for dinner at 8pm, a food trolley was in the corridor, it was only removed the next morning after my complaining. A flicking light bulb in the lift area was still evident the following day. The room offered "superb internet service" with no price indication. On enquiring this was $A25 per day. I accept the need for the hotel to have revenue streams bur $25 per day and no mention of the cost. On complaining this was not charged. My opinion in this review was given to the management almost verbatim in their request for guests opinions. I have not been contacted regarding my slating the hotel. This just adds to my opinion that they should quit the hospitality industry.

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic hotel absolutely loved it”
Reviews.Author: Tricia_Addlestone
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Shangri La in Sydney in May for my husband's 50th birthday. I can't fault the hotel in any way. The service was excellent. I checked in at 10am and they found me an available room immediately. We also had a late check out till 4pm. The room was wonderful and the views amazing. Breakfast was included and we had champagne in our room. All the staff were polite and helpful. I would definitely stay here again and would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Give it a miss”
Reviews.Author: harry4444
Reviews.Content: We were celebrating our 25th wedding anniversary and it was part of a multi stop holiday and even though management were aware of the occasion they ignored the fact. The other hotels we stayed in acknowledged the event by either an upgrade or wine/chocolates for my wife---but the Shangri la--forget it. The rooms were nothing special considering the price and 5 star rating and it took an eternity to check out. Overall it was a disappointing experience--but Sydney made it all worth it.

Reviews.Title: “A good hotel but can improve”
Reviews.Author: flyingroo
Reviews.Content: I usually clock up around 60 hotel nights in Sydney each year and thought I'd share my thoughts on my experiences. Travelling with work I have the option of staying at the Shangri La, Four Seaons and Westin in Sydney. The Shangri La is a good hotel, I've had some great stays there and I've had some average stays there. But over all my stays I've had the opportunity to try different rooms, restaurants, health club facilities etc so I'll try and give a run down on each. Rooms - size wise, the rooms are very generous, especially when compared to the Four Seasons, and if your budget allows, try and secure one of the Full Harbour View rooms, however be aware that some of the Partial Harbour View rooms can obstructed by your view into the Four Seaons. Room decor is starting to show its age but still very comfortable overall. Bathrooms are also large and spacious, and better than FS, but Westin bathrooms are much better. Internet charges are somewhat on the high side too but comparable with other hotels. Service - service is generally attentive without being spectacular, not as good as Four Seaons but way ahead of the Westin. Check in is usually prompt and friendly but check out can be rather hectic during peak times. Food - room service quality is average and somewhat pricey. Altitude restaurant has great sweeping views of the Harbour, food is good but once again you are definitely paying for the view. Rather dissapointed with portion size as well. Breakfast in the cafe downstairs (Cafe Mix) however was great, fantastic variety and service was excellent. Staff there do a wonderful job. Health/Spa - needs improvement, spa/health club services (such as massages) are ok, but much better at FS. Use of gym is free (unlike the ridiculous $20 charge at the Westin) and gym will generally cater for all needs. Overall, the Shangr La is a good hotel, and if its views of the harbour that you're chasing and large rooms then it won't dissapoint however, for an overall experience I prefer the Four Seasons.

Reviews.Title: “Just a Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AussieAnge
Reviews.Content: We stayed last Saturday night. The room was large the view was good (although not as good as at the Four Season). The staff were pleasant but generally nothing special. We paid only $350 for a Premier Grand Harbour view so it was good value. We were on the 7th floor and felt the rooms were very tired - our friends were on the 13th and it was better. Generally the hotel was tired and dated. The lobby was non impressive. As I said it was a decent hotel but not what I would have expected from a 5 star property. The walk up the hill was fine for us. The Rocks is a great location in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing ”
Reviews.Author: Cleopetra
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 10 nights so thet upgraded us for free to this amazing room which i thought was very good. The location is perfect to get everywhere you want, however the four seasons is better if they are the same price i would stay there instead. All in all though had a great time and the 360 bar on the roof is wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay.....Perfect 5*”
Reviews.Author: RouseysTravels
Reviews.Content: We arrived at Sunset to our room overlooking the Opera Houseâ€¦Oh what a view!! Our room was spacious with a huge bed and large marble bathroom. This stay was the final 3 nights of a 3 week stay in Australia. The hotel lives up to itâ€™s 5 star image. The restaurant was excellent as was the Altitude Bar on the top floor looking out over Sydney. Stunning! The concierge was very helpful and knowledgeable as this was our first visit to Sydney. He told us where to find a very good Italian restaurant, booked our 1 day car hire with Avis for our 1 day visit to the Blue Mountains, told us the best views, he wasnâ€™t wrong, helped us plan our 2 days in the city to see all the sights. So, we had a great, if short stay in a superb hotel, with very helpful and friendly staff. A luxury end to a fantastic visit and stay in Australia.

Reviews.Title: “Good base to explore Sydney”
Reviews.Author: MikeMoss
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for seven nights last December. As many posters have said, you can get rooms here with the best views in town, but thatâ€™s what you pay for ultimately (AUD 434 per night). We had a room with the full view over the Bridge and the Opera. We went to a few restaurants for their views (e.g. The Summit, Altitude) but the view from our room was even better. After staying in the Shangri-La in Singapore (which was great) a few years ago, we thought weâ€™d give the chain another go. But the hotel in Sydney pales in comparison. I thought it was a fairly characterless business hotel. The hotel is pretty ugly from the outside. When we stayed there, one of the letters was missing/not lit up on the hotelâ€™s sign at the top of the building â€“ not very good publicity. The hotel is very well located, between five and ten minutesâ€™ walk to Circular Quay and the Rocks. Our room was nicely furnished (if you like shades of brown) and the bed very comfortable. There was a nice marble bathroom with shower and bath. However, Iâ€™m pretty sure a room was missing from the suite that I had paid for; instead there was a long, L-shaped corridor, with a window looking onto the neighbouring Four Seasons hotel. There was insufficient cupboard and drawer space in the room and there was no CD player, which was a bit disappointing. We tried room service a couple of times and the food was expensive and tasteless â€“ donâ€™t bother. We didnâ€™t have breakfast in the hotel; instead we went to a cafÃ© in the basement of the hotel which was good value. I was particularly happy that we got the early check-in that I had requested, as we were tired after a long flight from Europe and arrived in the morning. We otherwise came into little contact with hotel staff. We tried the bar towards the top of the building, where the service and drinks were very good. We then went to the restaurant Altitude, where the service was inattentive. We waited 45 minutes for a menu (!) and people who arrived after us were served well before. The food was nice but the portions small. We ordered some very nice but expensive wine and the staff only poured half the bottle into our glasses so that at the end of the meal there was half a bottle of $200 wine left over. We asked to take it back to our room and they said we couldnâ€™t (by law), but we insisted and they put it in a bag for us in the end. I wouldnâ€™t go back to this hotel again, although the overall experience wasnâ€™t bad. I think I would try somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but a bit disappointed with the rooms”
Reviews.Author: lea321
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Shangri La for five nights on our tour around Australia on a room only basis. The hotel is located in the Rocks, very close to Circular Quay, shopping etc. The hotel is situated at the top of a hill so it is quite a steep climb back up the hill or via steps after a busy day sight seeing. On arrival we were given a twin smoking room (when we had booked a double non smoking room) but we were offered by friendly staff, an alterative twin room (only room available) later that day. The hotel does have fantastic Bridge and Opera House view rooms but unfortunately these were a little out of our price range. Our room had a view over the industrial end of Darling Harbour which was still very impressive. The rooms in general were fine but a bit worn â€“ perhaps not up to the usual Shangri La standards. Breakfast in one of the lovely coffee shops in the lanes around the hotel is a must and much cheaper than the hotel. Did not try any of the hotel's restaurants but the top floor bar with great views of the Bridge/harbour was fab. Dinner at Circular Quay is a must if only for the spectacular views and watching the world go by. Would particularly recommend Wild Fire for a special occasion. Overall would still recommend the hotel if only for its location.

Reviews.Title: “What's so amazing??”
Reviews.Author: TAAC
Reviews.Content: From what I see nobody can fault the Shangri La and in many ways nor can I. We were able to check in as soon as we arrived at 8am which was great. The room was a nice size and the bathroom fabulous, however.........our Darling Harbour view was basically a view of the toll plaza and I felt the room was in need of refurbishment. It was a 1970's style in need of an upgrade. We were due to receive a bottle of sparkling wine which did arrive at 1pm. We were also due, as part of the package, chocolates but there was no sign of them. It was our honeymoon. We stayed 5 nights in total. It was a perfect location in the Rocks and check out the AustraliIan Hotel (practically next door) for amazing pizzas! I guess I expected something better from a Shangri La hotel. Also, the bar on the top floor has amazing views but don't expect preferential treatment as a residence.

Reviews.Title: “You can't do better”
Reviews.Author: AlegreVancouverBC
Reviews.Content: This is a first class modern hotel now a bit older than when it was a ANA Hotel. Location is perfect in the Rocks overlooking Circular Quay. Down duvet, large rooms and lovely views all make this a great, but expensive choice. If there is anything not perfect besides a $36 breakfast it is that the pool is indoor and the east facing deck is tiny. So who needs the pool and rather than a hotel breakfast there are plenty of choices five minutes by foot in the Rocks or 15 minutes by foot in Darling Harbour. The hotel is a $50 cab ride from the airport.

Reviews.Title: “great views, great location”
Reviews.Author: kay-l-gee
Reviews.Content: Despite booking the cheapest room we could find on the internet (our budget didn't run to an opera house view), we were shown into a huge corner room, with dual aspect windows across the harbour, and a separate sitting room. It was very well appointed and comfortable and matched up well to my expectation of a five star hotel.
