The hotel is situated close to the Rocks and Circular Quay, although I'll agree it is a steep walk back up the hill from the Quay. It is a flat walk to Wynyard station, where you can get a direct connection to the airport. We managed this easily in about 10-15 mins with two large suitcases and it was much quicker than the long taxi journey we'd had on arrival. I didn't eat in the hotel - there are plenty of lovely breakfast venues in the Rocks. We did, however visit the bar on the 36th floor which was not a good experience. The views are fantastic, but we were shown to a seat as far away from the window as possible - and later, when a window seat became available, told we couldn't have it. The distainful staff took half an hour to take our drink order and constantly moved the furniture around us to cordon off areas for separate groups. This is really my only criticism of an otherwise excellent stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic views but over priced”
Reviews.Author: GillianandJames
Reviews.Content: We spend the last 3 nights of our honeymoon at the Shangri-la as a huge treat to ourselves. The views are amazing, you want to sleep with the curtains open they are that good, we could see the people climbing the bridge from our Harbour view room. The rooms are huge with lavish bathrooms but how long do you really want to spend in your room in such a fabulous city. Service was good but the staff on reception were not over friendly and you weren't greeted with a smile, which you would expect from Shangri-la. The location is great but there are plenty of other good 4 and 3 star hotels very close by that are less expensive. If we return to Sydney again we wont stay at the Shangri-la unless its a very special occasion.

Reviews.Title: “Lovin' the view from the top”
Reviews.Author: melmosa
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the first two nights of our honeymoon. The room was well appointed and the bed was amazingly deliciously comfortable, I could fall asleep just thinking of it! We stayed in a Premier room with the 270 degree view of the bridge and the opera house--worth the extra $$ in my opinion. The view was great and we considered just hanging out in the room looking out the window to be one of our favorite "attractions" in Sydney! The staff at this hotel were not rude to us, though I am not surprised that some people gave the staff negative points since they weren't exactly "sweet" either--don't come here if you want to be fawned upon. The spa and pool area are nothing extraordinary... the pool room roof had lights installed in it that might be cool at night but since they're only open till 8 pm you don't actually get to experience this in the summer..it's not the hotel to book if you are looking for a fabulous hotel pool/sunbathing area. The hottub was lukewarm and there was no way to adjust the intensity of the jets. We didn't do the Horizon Club thing and this seemed to be maybe not the best value because the stuff you get for "free" seemed to cost less than what they charge for the club. The Horizon Club level was only one floor above our room so going there for the view didn't make sense to us either. The location of the hotel is pretty good--it's right in the middle of The Rocks and if you are young and urban and professional you can go mingle with your peer group in the bar upstairs. We were denied entry because I didn't pack the approriate footwear--we went to Oz to scuba dive and hike, not to prance around in Prada, so oh well. Check the hotel website for prices and beware the prices on other travel websites--when I looked there was >$100US difference between Orbitz and Travelocity on the same room.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel with great views!”
Reviews.Author: cosmic_dot
Reviews.Content: This is my preferred hotel in Sydney. After a couple disappointing experiences at the Four Seasons (in fact it aggravated me so much that I ended up cut short my stay in the FS), I made the Shang my home when I'm in town. Rooms are huge and the beds are incredibly comfortable. I have stayed in rooms that has a view of the Harbour Bridge and the Opera House and in others where you face the Darling Harbour side. The hotel's airport pick up service is prompt. There was one occassion when their contractor failed to show up and the hotel paid for my taxi ride there. Everyone from the concierge and the customer relation person apologised about it. They even greeted me at the door! The staff are great in terms of managing client relations--they were so sincere that I didn't hold the mix up against them. Incredible bar with great views of Sydney and relatively inexpensive drinks! And if you have access to the horizon club, the view is just as great. Canopies and drinks there were fantastic in the evenings. There's a convenient store a street below and the hotel is right next to the Rocks. If you don't want to climb up the entire hill, you can cut short the journey by 1) using the Four Seasons elevator and get to the 3rd floor or 2) use the escalator on the building across from the Four Seasons (enter via George Street). The hotel has a lower level entrance.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Views”
Reviews.Author: StrabDoc
Reviews.Content: Incredible views. If you are going to stay in Sydney this hotel has the view to enjoy. We stayed on an upper floor and had a fantastic view of both the bridhe and opera house. The food on the buffet was excellent and we ate in the hotel several nights. The room was quite large.

Reviews.Title: “"Does what it says on the tin"”
Reviews.Author: ECAH
Reviews.Content: We recently spent 4 nights in a Grand Harbour Room and whilst the hotel lacks the grandeur of its' Asian counterparts it was absolutely fine. Our room was big, well serviced, clean and best of all had breathtaking views. The staff were efficient and when we did have a problem (poor room service meal) it was dealt with promptly. It terms of location there are probably no better in Sydney and the hotel's proximity to Central Harbour was a major plus. This hotel is not cheap and appears more geared up for the business traveller, but we thoroughly enjoyed our stay and if you want a "room with a view" then this has to be it. Given the selection of hotels in Sydney I doubt we would stay there again but for for a first visit to the area this hotel suited us fine. Don't be put off by previous reviews, give it a go.

Reviews.Title: “sydney 2007”
Reviews.Author: gresty
Reviews.Content: Stayed 08/01/07 until 12/01/07. Excellant hotel after bad experiences at Amora over new year. Room biggest we stayed in during our trip around the world. Check in was quick and room upgrade given without asking if any were available. Room clean and tidy only thing was the separate sitting room could have done with tv, so you could watch away from bedroom while one of us had a siesta. We had to use the business centre during our stay almost daily, Emma (business centre secretary) handled everything extremely professionally (very impressed). Would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great View, Shame about the rest!”
Reviews.Author: Ann C
Reviews.Content: This stay was to celebrate my husband's birthday and our wedding anniversary and we booked into a suite. Concierge whisked our car away (later we found parking was $33 a day) but that was the end of any service! Check in, as we had a suite which included Horizon Club, was on 30th floor. Probably about 90% of staff don't have a good command of English which makes life very difficult. Views from the suite were incredible and the suite was large, bathroom was enormous. We did wonder if they cleaned up after the last guests as we found scrap paper on the floor in the bedroom, bottle top in the bathroom, peanuts on the floor in the lounge and some sticky mess all over the side of the coffee table. Horizon Club was great, all day drinks, morning & afternoon tea, evening drinks and canapes. In fact so much food in the evening we weren't hungry for dinner. Breakfast was on the 36th floor in Altitudes restaurant, and very mediocre. Food was only warm, air temp was too hot (great views, big glass windows but not enough air-con). My husband asked for some particular cereal after seeing it the day before and they said it would take more than 10 minutes to get and walked away and didn't bother! We discovered on the first night that the bass noise from the bar music (directly above) stopped us sleeping. We rang the bar, rang the Manager etc etc but no luck, so waited until it closed at 1am. Next day when we complained they said we couldn't have heard the noise from the bar it must have been coming from somewhere else as the hotel is soundproofed. (If the soundproofing was so good how could we hear noise from anywhere???). We later spoke to another couple at breakfast and they had the suite under ours (34th floor) and they said they could hear the noise too. When we complained we were told to go and wait at Reception and the Manager would see us but after 1/2 hour nobody came. We ended up complaining to 6 different people during that day but still no action. It took us almost 19 hours to get to talk to someone who would listen. We ended up moving into another room on a lower floor and shortly after we moved in someone from the next room came through the adjoining door into our room which of course hadn't been locked! Then there was the bathroom plug that didn't work and we found a toothbrush (NOT OURS) down there. We did have a good room service meal on the last night but it was too late as our celebrations were spoilt. Hygiene seems to be a major worry in this place and this should not even be an issue in a so called 5 star hotel! As I said wonderful view but what a shame they don't even know what service is!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: mrwanderlust
Reviews.Content: We stayed in five hotels on our 3-week trip to Australia/New Zealand. This was our favorite. The guest rooms here are awesome, particularly the bathrooms. Twice, we ordered breakfast from room service and it was very good. There is a high-speed Internet connection right in the room. The rooms are nicely decorated. There is a buffet lunch/dinner at the restaurant on the second floor, called Cafe Mix. The food was good. There's also a rooftop restaurant/bar on the 38th floor. We didn't eat there, but we did go up there to check out the nice view. The fitness room here is wonderful. It's very spacious, with over a dozen cardio machines and about as many weight machines, plus some free weights. Best of all, it's free to hotel guests, which was a pleasant surprise. So, this hotel gets two thumbs up from me. Happy traveling.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning Sydney @ the Shangri La Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Chloe55
Reviews.Content: Before booking the Shangri La Hotel, I saw that the reviews were mixed but formed my opinion as soon as I walked into the lobby and my room, which faced the Habor Bridge and the Opera House. Well worth it to upgrade and get a room with a view. It will take your breath away and there is no amount of money that can replace waking up in the morning to that glorious view. The hotel is stunning and is beautifully situated high atop of the Rocks. This vista provides a spectacular view of Sydney's breathtaking harbor. I found the staff extremely friendly and helpful. The location was perfect for exploring Sydney. The Rocks is where Sydney was born and you can feel that history as you walk the streets. The hotel have a full range of facilities so if you want to work out in a gym, have a massage or treatment, get a pedicure, etc., it is all there for your convenience. It is a short distance from the Circular Quay that is bustling with activity. It truly exceeded my expectations and would highly recommend this hotel for its location and class.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: marsie001
Reviews.Content: My mum and I stayed at the Shangri La for 4 days from the 8th of January, as part of an extended trip to Australia and the far East. The location cannot be faulted, we were in the middle of everything. However we were disappointed by the size and location of our room. We booked a deluxe harbour view at an extra charge and had to crane our necks to see the Opera House from our window, and had a busy road under our window. So beware if booking this type of room, its probably worth upgrading. The room was cramped for two of us with all of our luggage. Staff were helpful, but not overly friendly. We did not eat in any of the hotel restaurants. We felt the hotel was overpriced and will stay elsewhere on our next visit to Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “so so”
Reviews.Author: SuzanneUk
Reviews.Content: After staying in the Kowloon Shangri La in Hong Kong we were looking forward to staying in the Shangi La Sydney, but upon arrival we could quickly see that the Kowloon hotel far out shines this one. There was no friendly welcome, the lobby area lacked any comfort or atmosphere and the rooms (we had booked the same grade) were definitly not of the same standard. We booked a deluxe harbour view room but the room was poky, dull, the bed covers had a damp smell and also overlooked the very busy main road to the Bridge. Luckily the hotel had a Suite available for an additional Â£60.00 per night. This was a huge improvement. The rooms were so much more spacious, the view was amazing and breakfast was also included. You also get access to the Horizon club, which gives you your own concierge (instead of waiting forever in the reception downstairs), free internet access, check-out services and free soft drinks through out the day. The hotel is in a great location close to shops and Circular Quay - which has many great restaurants. We ate at the Oyster Bay (try the seafood platter), Woolfies, Waterfront and Ocean (something?) - we had lovely meals at all of these!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed - waste of money”
Reviews.Author: lnd_beale
Reviews.Content: We booked at the Shangri-La on the recommendation of Travel Mall - a lovely Australian travel service. I do not understand why they say it is the best that they can recommend. We had 2 rooms from the 23rd Dec until 30th Dec. The hotel organised a van to fetch 4 of us from the airport after a long international flight. To our dismay there was only a car & we had to wait 30 mins for another car to arrive. The rooms (Deluxe Opera View) were disappointing at best and very staid and very small. We and our daughters battled to put our clothes in the small space provided. The breakfasts (which we had opted for instead of a free night on their special) were not nice. The staff also cleared the buffet as quickly as possible when the breakfast time ended. All in all we were happy to move on although the view of the Opera House was good. The one concierge was very good in coming back with a dentist's name as we needed to see one during our stay. I would say that the hotel doesn't really have too much going for it besides the view - if you are allocated to a good floor.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with amazing view of the harbour!”
Reviews.Author: MLD2000
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel in the Rocks area of Sydney. Room was well appointed, staff very courteous and efficient, and the views are spectacular. The only issue I had was that I booked a corner suite with a full view of the harbor - and while the view was magnificent and worth every penny for the upgrade - the room heated up like an oven during the day since it got direct sun for most of the day - even with the air conditioner on full blast it had to have been 85 degrees in my room!

Reviews.Title: “Frosty Reception”
Reviews.Author: Travelem06
Reviews.Content: I was really dissapointed with this hotel's staff. It truely is a fantastic hotel in an amazing position but the staff really let this hotel down. They are snooty, unapproachable and down-right rude at times. We stayed in a Grand Habour View Room over New Years Eve and the veiw was out of this world. Our room was also beuatiful with an extremely comfy bed and bathroom. We had a problem when checking in and the check in manager was so unhelpful and rude, it really ruined the first day of our stay. We didn't eat or even have any drinks at this hotel as there is so many places close by. For a special meal or evening head down to the Opera Bar in circular quay (although it gets so busy Friday and Sat nights) Whilst at the hotel we heard about 6 other people complaining. Upon checking out the hotel tried to charge breakfast to our room (despite the fact we had never had it) We also heard one other woman having this problem! Overall the hotel itself is beautiful in a great location but the attitude of most staff and the expenses of everything lets this hotel down.

Reviews.Title: “damp smell”
Reviews.Author: Scandinav
Reviews.Content: Room smelled really damp. The reason for it was that in bathroom there was no air circulation. One day I washed 1 peace of underwear and hanged it to drying line in bathroom. Full 24 hours later it was still wet!! Room was nice, kind of small but we could not stand the smell. Location is on hill and kind of hard to reach, which bothered us as we did not have car. All staff we met was asian.

Reviews.Title: “Overrated”
Reviews.Author: ValueSeekerLeeds
Reviews.Content: We booked a "deluxe Opera House view" room but were sent to a harbour view room on the 25th floor. We queried the mistake and were taken back to the 17th and given a room with a view of the building next door. Sure, you could see the Opera House if you spent the entire stay at the window with a twisted neck. Wish we'd stayed on the 25th - our mistake. I think the room had been prepared in a hurry as the carpet had "all sorts" on it. I dread to think what was on there but a hoover may be a good idea. The mini bar is so well stocked you can't get anything of your own in it. We took a load of their expensive stuff out so we could get a bottle of wine and water in. Call me tight but I'm not paying $10 for water. We then found a notice saying they would confiscate any personal beverages found in the fridge and hold until checkout!!! Excuse me, but that's stealing! Fine, have a notice saying it's their fridge and don't use it but who are they to take things away and keep? We found the staff aloof and dismissive on the whole. We went to the Altitude Bar which should be renamed ATTITUDE bar. There was some bouncer looking type on the "door" and we didn't venture any further as you had to wait to be seated. Sorry, but it can't be that good to have to queue to get in and pass the bouncer test. The hotel is in a good location and is ok but not that good. Certainly not as good as they think they are. If you've not stayed anywhere decent you would probably think it was great but if you look closely it fails on some of the basics, e.g. a vaccumed carpet. And the threat to steal my property was the cruncher. Considering the price you're paying I'd be surprised if there wasn't better about. Sure, if you'd paid half the price you may be reasonably satisfied but at those prices I'll be trying elsewhere next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great Visit!”
Reviews.Author: KBSUFFOLK
Reviews.Content: The room allocated to my wife and I was on the fifteenth floor with spectacular views of Sydney Bridge and The Opera House. The staff were polite and attentive at all times and were keen to ensure that our stay with them was a memorable experience. Should we visit NSW again we would for sure stay at the Shangri La, Sydney

Reviews.Title: “Horizon club”
Reviews.Author: Njhammers
Reviews.Content: We booked horizon club level with opera house view, well worth it. Breakfast & evening drinks & snacks make this worth while Location is very good for the rocks & circular quay. Gym well equipped but i dislike lack of windows, it made me feel in prison & pool is poor. Good location, good view, freindly helpful staff. i would go back!

Reviews.Title: “Romantic Night”
Reviews.Author: Lucan
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed for one night in October during our trip around Australia. I found the people on reception to be rude and far from welcoming however....... We stayed in an Opera View Room and we were not disappointed, the view and the decor was perfect and it was the most comfortable bed I ever slept in, we even wrote down the name of the mattress!! We had dinner in our room as it was a romantic night away and we didn't want to see anybody else. The food was fantastic. Overall we had a very pleasant stay and if we are ever lucky enough to go back to Sydney we would both stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: AD72
Reviews.Content: Had a three night stay at end of November. Hotel did not match up to expectations or reputation. Location is fairly good, however if walking to or from hotel to Circular Quay or the Rocks, can be difficult to find and involve several dark stairways. The darkest of which is right beside the hotel, they could install some lights. We booked a double room with a king size bed. The room we we given had a "zipper mattrass". This means two singles made up as one king. Not really what you would expect from a five star hotel. Worse still one side was very soft the other firm. Neither reception nor housekeeping seemed to think there was anything amiss with this and admitted they had many similar beds. We were allocated another room. The decor is dated, especially the bathroom, plenty of 1980s marble. Some of the room furniture is also a bit knocked about. The views are excellent even if the rooms are plain and rather ordinary. In short nothing special. Be sure to avoid the top floor bar. The attitude of the staff is incedible. A lady on the door might let you in to stand at the bar then wait for a allocated seat, from which you must not stray. Choice of 5 different gins for you G&T but not much gets in the glasses, stingy measures and well diluted. In summary stay somewhere else, Four Seasons where I stopped two weeks later is much better for a similar price.

Reviews.Title: “Don't let the chill put you off”
Reviews.Author: Mattthepoet
Reviews.Content: The main fault with the Sydney Shangri la is the staff. The glacial expressions on the front desk sent a chill through me every time I had the misfortune to have to deal with them, though in fairness they were efficent in all they did. But their attitude matched, or maybe even set, the tone for the whole hotel, which is cold, without much character, but good at what you're paying for ie a luxury city centre hotel. Our room was sumptious, clean and comfortable and gave a panoramic Darling Harbour view. Ok you get a good chunk of carriageway and traffic jam included within that view and of course it isn't quite as good as the ones afforded by the rooms overlooking the opera house, but we still liked it. It also goes without saying that the hotels' central position makes it ideal as a base to explore Sydney's myriad of attractions. Really all we wanted was a comfortable hotel with a reasonable location and a nice view and that's what we got. Though it is a little pricey, but what the heck it was our honeymoon!!, it is I feel more aimed at business travellers than holidaymakers. If we go back to Sydney we'll probably choose another hotel though that will be based on cost rather than any great disapointment with the hotel. One final note we stopped at several hotels during this our honeymoon break, including two more in the Shangri La chain, yet this one was the only that didn't give us a complimentary bottle of champagne and chocolates. Now we didn't expect this off any of the hotels and it doesn't really matter that much to us that the Sydney Shangri La were the only ones who didn't do this, but I do feel ultimately it does lead back to my first point about the coolness and unfriendly nature of the staff at the hotel. Their attitude and the atmosphere created by it is the only thing letting this otherwise excellent hotel down.

Reviews.Title: “Book the Club Floor”
Reviews.Author: studiojr
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Shangri La two years ago, but I was just browsing some of the current negative reviews and thought I'd add a tip: If you book the club floor, you will end up with incredible service and a good chance for an upgrade. We booked two opera house/bridge-view club floor rooms on expedia at a very reasonable rate. We checked in on the club level and snacked on dim sum and wine and were told that we were being upgraded to a a penthouse-style apartment with a full kitchen, dining room, living room, washer, dryer, multiple bathrooms, multiple plasma screens, etc, all with to-die-for floor-to-ceiling views. The biggest problem was our kids didn't want to leave the room to see Sydney, but we managed to lure them to the spectacular asian buffet at one of the hotel restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “What a view!”
Reviews.Author: TravelFan_01
Reviews.Content: Myself and my husband spent 5 nights at Shangri-La, and we had a wonderful time. We arrived at the hotel a little early for check in so we left our cases for an hour or so with the bell desk, and went for an explore around the Rocks area. On our return, the room was ready and up we went to 13th floor. I was actually quite concerned about our room being on floor 13 as to me, it sounded quite low down. As we had booked a Premier Grand Harbour View room with a high floor request, I was concerned that we might have buildings obstructing our view. However, I shouldn't have worried. We were given a corner room and the view was absolutely breathtaking. We had an absolutely perfect view of the Opera House and Harbour Bridge, which I could even see when lying down on the bed! The view was literally picture perfect. Being a corner room, we had huge windows all down 2 sides of the room which not only gave us the stunning view, but made the room very light and bright too. The room itself was beautiful. It was very contemporary and was decorated in lovely, neutral tones. The bed was comfortable and the bathroom was absolutely huge. The amenities in the room were good, although I was surprised at the lack of a free local newspaper and bottled water in the room which is usually commonplace. We purposely chose to be in Sydney for our wedding anniversary, something which our travel agent back home had clearly mentioned during the booking as within a few minutes of being in the room, a bottle of sparking wine, some chocolates and a handwritten card was brought to us which was a nice touch. We ate once in Cafe Mix for breakfast, which was very good. I thought the choice available was excellent. Twice we ordered room service breakfast as we had early starts for tours and both times they arrived promptly and with everything present and correct! The staff we found to be patchy. The servers in Cafe Mix and the people who brought our room service were nice and polite. One member of staff who went out of his way to help us was actually one of the doormen. On the day of our anniversary, we had booked to go on a seaplane for a picnic on a beach. We waited at the front entrance for our transfer to arrive and it basically didn't. After 10 minutes, the doorman asked us who we were waiting for, then took it upon himself to find the phone number of the company in question and ring to find out what was going on. When another 10 minutes later they still didn't arrive, he rang them again. In the end, he put us into a taxi and told us to hang onto the receipt so we could claim the fare back from the company which we did. He did all of that without us even having to ask him to which we thought was a mark of very good service. However, what let the staff down in our case was the front desk. The gentleman who checked us in originally was a bit aloof, and we found we had to deal with him again for a problem during the last day of our stay. We came back to our room after a day out to find a curt note asking us to contact the front desk about our check out time. My husband rang them to find out what the problem was and it turned out that they were trying to kick us out a night early. Because of a problem with one of our flights, we had to add an extra night on in Sydney with our travel agent which he added on at Shangri-La and had confirmed with them many months in advance. This was also reconfirmed upon check in. However, the person on the other end of the phone was extremely argumentative and basically accused my husband of lying about the extra night we had booked. It wasn't until my husband told them in a rage that we would be coming straight down to the front desk to get the matter resolved that by the time we got down there, they sheepishly admitted that they'd located the paperwork but still took our itinerary from us to photocopy as proof and gave us no apology. On our return to the room, we immediately had a phone call from housekeeping asking us when we would like our room cleaned (and it had not been done that day because of the check out confusion). I said to them 'about half an hour's time' which they said was fine but when we returned in the evening after a meal out, it hadn't been done. So for these reasons and the lack of a couple of expected amenities in the room, I cannot give it a full 5 out of 5. It's a shame as the hotel is gorgeous and luxurious and the view we had from our room was the thing dreams are made of. But the questionable attitude from some of the staff is not something that should be the case in a 5 star hotel such as this.

Reviews.Title: “Three strikes and your out!”
Reviews.Author: Chilligurl
Reviews.Content: Thought we would give Shangri La another chance. Location seemed ideal. Poor service.... room wasn't ready, were advised we would be on high floor, when we came back in the afternoon room still not ready would then be a little longer and we were then given a low floor, as they had already allocated our promised room to someone else. Not five star and not four star - maybe three. Heidi Toowoomba, Queensland, Aust.

Reviews.Title: “Excellant Location, Sub Standard Value for Rooms”
Reviews.Author: w4c71101
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Shangri La Hotel Sydney from November 14th to the 18th. I felt that the hotel rooms were very plain for the money and in much need of an over haul. The bathrooms were amazing but so little time is spent there, as they take up half the room. For the money $300+ per night I would consider staying elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Confused identity”
Reviews.Author: Ruskieray
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on business but with limited business centre hours and large tourist traffic it didn't reach business hotel level. Staff not over friendly but perfectly competent. Bedrooms quite large, big bathrooms, opera house views good if on that side of hotel. I felt bedrooms lacked style. Unlike public areas which were well thought out with very impressive decor and design. Very comfortable ground level bar. Spectacular 'altitude' restaurant - top floor with some of the best views in Sydney (good food too). Situated in historic 'rocks' but opposite hotel entrance is ugly walled embankment and if going out on foot always steep climb back to hotel. Room card key required to activate lift which is a pet hate of mine.

Reviews.Title: “Fab location”
Reviews.Author: mn3
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in an excellent location for the main attractions in Sydney. In places the room was fading slightly but the bathroom and main areas of the hotel were fabulous. The pool was disappointing for such an expensive hotel but it was lovely after a day of sightseeing. The hotel staff were very helpful and friendly and rooms were very clean. Overall a very enjoyable stay in a great location - particularly for a first timer to Sydney who wants to see as much as possible in a short space of time.

Reviews.Title: “Understated. Underrated.”
Reviews.Author: senojxam
Reviews.Content: Should you stay at The Shangri La Sydney? Absolutely. Comfortable accomodation, prime location, more than adequate Business facilities, and most importantly, affordable. The Shangri La (one of only two in Australia) has an imposing location within 2-3 minutes walking time from Circular Quay and Harbour Bridge. A word of advice - allow at least 5 minutes to walk back, due to the near 45 degree slope you need to conquer in order to make it back. After a few days of this, you will wish they operated a helicopter transfer to take you from George Street upto the lobby on Cumberland Street. If you find yourself arriving prior to check-in time of 2pm, there are showers and changing rooms in the Business Centre on Floor 3. All accomodation is of a good standard, tastefully furnished with a warm feel. If you can, book a Premier Deluxe Harbour View room. Its well worth the extra $50.00 per room. These rooms are corner rooms of the building and offer 270 degree views of Sydney. Not to mention several extra square metres of floor space, sitting area and desk. You could be forgiven for thinking you were walking into an apartment the first time you get to your room! Friendly and helpful staff throughout, although beware that the Business Centre closes at 5pm, but can be re-opened on request for internet access. Checkout was smooth and painless. Overall, a very impressive property.

Reviews.Title: “Not up to expected standard.”
Reviews.Author: Rashleigh
Reviews.Content: As a frequent user of Shangri-la Hotels through the Middle East and Asia, this hotel, or most notably its Horizon Club facilities, were far from usual standard. Service, ambiance and availability of well prepared canapes and drinks at cocktail time in the club lounge was particularly poor, rather than a sheer pleasure as with other hotels in the group. In the same vein, Club lounge breakfasts were dull and with very little choice forcing us to use the main restuarant after our first day - much better. Generally Shangri-la Hotels offer an excellent 5 star service but on this occassion having booked through the group, we consider they were very remiss in not informing us at that time that the Sydney hotel was a relatively recent purchase from another group, and had been acquired in a condition needing sinificant refurbishment. Basically, our Horizon Club room was good but tired and antiquated and with a visible hole from damage in one wall, and it was definitely in need of refurbishment. However, I would be reasonably confident that in time this hotel will be brought up to the groups normal excellent standard. In our case, knowing what a Shangri-la Horizon Club experience should be, and on pointing out the shortcomings we were immediately able to negotiate a far more realistic price. This hotel does have a stunning position, and will be enjoyed by many, but until it is brought up to standard there are other excellent hotel options locally, some also with prime views over the harbour and Opera House. We would suggest that if booking that you enquire first about what refurbishment has been carried out, then enjoy knowing what the situation is in advance!

Reviews.Title: “Stellar Views! Amazing City”
Reviews.Author: mybelle
Reviews.Content: My husband I went to Australia for our Honeymoon (5 week vacation). We ended up at the Shangri la for our 3 night stay in Sydney. When we arrived from Adelaide in Sydney we were very much looking forward to a great night rest and a fresh start in Sydney the next day. To our dismay, our room was double booked...this is where the storey gets good. I specifically asked for a hotel room above the 17th floor, as I heard the views of the harbour are the best at this level and above...The front desk, was not sure if they could accomodate our request and asked us to sit patiently in the lobby while they worked out a solution. I still remember the look on the hotel staff face when they presented us with a key to a suite about 1600 square feet, with 4 rooms a kitchen, laundry facilties and 2 bathrooms! We felt like we won th the lottery. We were so happy! I felt tears accumulating when I saw the view from the room, it was breath taking and certainly unfortgettable. On our right from our bedroom we had a clear view of the opera house. In our living room our view was of the harbour bridge, from our kitchen we had a view of the city. We were so thrilled with the service provided by the hotel. We recommend staying here based not only on superior service, but also on location (this is in the heart of the Rocks district and walking distance from Circular Quay. Just a beatiful city... We'll always remember it :)

Reviews.Title: “Superb location, great view”
Reviews.Author: cliffandjules
Reviews.Content: Stayed in an Opera House view room. Excellent staff and facilities. Opera House view was a little restricted as we were a little too far along the corridoor. You need a room below 18 on the floor you are staying. Highly recommend the horizon club floor rooms, as a continental breakfast, tea and coffee all day and early evening drinks are complimentary, plus you are guaranteed to be on floor 30 or above. View is magnificent from the club's lounge over the harbour Cocktail bar on top floor superb. All in all, a really good hotel in a superb location, would not now stay anywhere else in Sydney

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, Amazing Location, More Amazing Views”
Reviews.Author: sfcafox
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located within the Rocks area of Sydney, historic and quaint. The views of the Opera House and Harbor Bridge are the best in Sydney, considering the hotel is high on a hill overlooking these great monuments. The only other hotel with similar views but at a lower elevation is the Park Hyatt. Nothing else compares. Rooms are spacious and the bar and restaurant on the top floor is simply stunning, with breathtaking albeit vertigo induced views (it's very very high up). Easy walk to Circular Quay for ferry rides to many other destinations along the harbor and an easy walk to shopping and nightclubs within the Rocks districts (right out the back door of the hotel) plus a short 10 minute walk to the main shopping district in Sydney. I'd stay there again in a heart beat.

Reviews.Title: “Shangri-loved it.”
Reviews.Author: Thaibite
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights at the hotel in early September. Our room was on the 33rd floor, giving us great views of Darling Harbour and beyond to the Olympic Stadium. Unfortunately, the room's orientation meant that we couldn't actually see the Harbour Bridge and Opera House. Nevertheless, the location, in the Rocks area, was perfect for sight-seeing and travelling around the city. My wife use to work for a 5* hotel in Bangkok, so every hotel stay is compared to this. Sometimes our holidays feel more like business than pleasure, as each hotel is taken apart. Not so with the Shangri-la. The standard of the room was fantastic. Reasonable sized reception area, beautiful bathroom and ample bedroom area. The king size bed provided a relaxing night's sleep. Staff in the hotel were extremely helpful, especially the front office staff, and in particular the concierge. On the Wednesday evening we ate in the Altitude restaurant on the 36th floor. The title of 'Restaurant of the Year 2005' was well deserved. My wife and I can't cite any criticisms with the food or service. Every dish was excellent: quality, presentation and size of portion. Staff were friendly and knowledgeable without being pretentious. As it was mid-week we got a window seat which offered views across the harbour including the Bridge, Opera House and extending to the North Beaches etc. Magnificent. Our only criticism was the service by staff in the Blu Horizon bar. We decided to have a drink after dining. Staff took our order quickly enough, but we waited 20 minutes or more for the drink to arrive. Considering the professionalism of the restaurant, we were surprised and disappointed. With the exception of the Blu Horizon incident, we would certianly recommend staying at the Shangri-la.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: rocker1a
Reviews.Content: Having just come from the Shangri La in Hong Kong we were a bit disappointed by this Shangri La. We went from 2 complimentary bottles of water a day to a big sign on the water telling us what it cost to drink it. Also the staff weren't nearly as eager to please as they were in HongKong. It felt very much a business hotel perhaps reflected in the restaurant prices. However in saying that it was a good place to stay if you are in Sydney. We had a good room with a view. Our children were in a room next door (however it was not adjoining as we had booked) Bathroom standard good and room servicing good. Lovely little swimming pool which wasn't heavily used. Only minutes down to the harbour but quite steep if you are old. I did enjoy my stay but I didn't feel as if I was in truely 5 star luxury.

Reviews.Title: “First class from top to bottom”
Reviews.Author: luckystrike
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for five nights in July of 2006 as part of a round the world trip, and found the Shangri-La to be excellent. On arrival we were given the opportunity to inspect the Opera House View room we had chosen, and were then shown a Full Harbour View room which was available at only an additional AUD$40 per night. We immediately took this as the new room we were shown on the 29th floor had without doubt one of the best views in the world â€“ the photo doesnâ€™t do it any justice. We both said that the view would be one of those that would last forever and would be worth nearly any money. The only time we had a view of a similar standard was over looking the city of Cape Town and Table Mountain. The room was very large, as was the bathroom, and had every luxury we required. It had also just been fully refurbished. The location could not have been better â€“ The Rocks is buzzing and Circular Quay is stuffed full of bars and restaurants. Both the Harbour Bridge and the Opera House are literally on the doorstep. We spent a couple of hours on the day we arrived having a pizza and a few beers in Hartâ€™s Pub, and also enjoyed a few games of pool. Apart from this, we did not eat in the hotel, and didnâ€™t feel the need to go up to Blu restaurant for the view, as we could see the same from our room! The Concierge was most helpful, organising a day trip to the Blue Mountains at short notice and recommending local bars and restaurants. One thing that did surprise me was that this Shangri-La was not like the ones we had previously stayed in. However, in this case, it is a very good thing as we had not come to Sydney to feel as if we were in China or SE Asia. Well done on being a thoroughly Aussie hotel! When in Sydney we recommend visiting the Opera House, walking over the Harbour Bridge and climbing the pylon closest to the hotel on the way (rather than the long and expensive Bridge Climb), do a hop-on hop-off city tour, lunch at Darling Harbour, take the return ferry trip to Manly for a bargain AUD$7, and have a schooner of Tooheyâ€™s at the Bondi Icebergs Swimming Club overlooking the beach. A day trip to the Blue Mountains is also worth while. When we return to Sydney, we will only stay in the Shangri-La Hotel, and will most certainly book one of the Full Harbour View rooms.

Reviews.Title: “A memorable stay”
Reviews.Author: JT1978
Reviews.Content: The Shangri-La holds a special place for me now. What can I say, Amazing Views! â€¦.and the bed was sooo comfy.

Reviews.Title: “Magnificent views and Service of High Standard”
Reviews.Author: heartbeat
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights from 12 August (wife and 13yr old son) in Barbour View Deluxe Suite having arranged everything direct through emails with Hotel. Firstly by contacting hotel for best offered rates we managedto get two special deals on offer (but not apparent on web site) whcih meant the cost of accomodation was much better and included breakfasts for 2 of us (although that seemed a bit petty rather than 3 - however must not grumple as still good rate). When we arrived room wasnt ready until 3pm (ok as we knew that and they made it a priorty to prepare). When we got to the room we were thrilled with the view - full view of harbour and opera house. Ok this is what we asked for but seeing it was something else. The room was excellent - two double beds, internet access (for laptop for those that way inclined), and all the little luxuries that here in Uk we so often dont deliver (dressing gown, slippers, complementary drinks, bathroom extras etc. Excellent in every way other than the storage space was no where near enough. During our stay whatever we asked for we received excellent service - you are made to feel most welcome and treated very well from the moment we stepped out of the taxi. The breakfast service was excellent, and the quality the best we had during our 3 week holiday to Australia and back. Meals we had were also of the same standard and staff were excellent also. The pool was relatiely small but more than adequate, and a great way to relax at the end of the day. As pointed out by others the hotel was on a hill and although there were various ways to reach the hotel it did take some energy to get there. That said, unless youre really unfit that wouldnt be a problem. The time to get to Circular Quay was about 5/6 minutes (the quick way). This was certainly the best hotel we stayed in during our trip made that much better by the wonderful views and quality service. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic view”
Reviews.Author: jfromuk
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel Dec 25 for 3 nights as part of trip to Oz . Booked on airline network who upgraded us to harbour + opera house view. Had 3 rooms on floor 8- 12-14. Views were amazing even though we were not on high floors . Rooms were clean and room service was excellent . Only gripe was on checking out tried to charge for the use of playstation which kids had not touched. It was on the bill 11 times and the times were on the hour every hour 11 times . When I ponted out staff were not very freindly and at first said we must have used it but after looking again took it off. I was about 100 AUS dollars. Because of this I failed to check rest of bill anfd it was pretty high so always check. Maybe next time I would go to Quay West but I would go there again just for the view !!!!!!Not sure about 5* I would say 4.

Reviews.Title: “Not for the tourist !!!”
Reviews.Author: maz36d
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated in the Rocks area of Sydney. It is very pretty area but very very hilly so not for the unfit!!! The view from our room was magnificent BUT the hotel staff are very cold & hostile. This hotel is more for business people and not for tourists. The weather was cold & wet so we decided to watch a film. The TV was not working and it took nearly 5 hours and 4 visits from an engineer for them to tell us that it was broken !!! There was no apology given. Our flight did not leave until early evening and when we asked for the possibilty of a late check out - we were told in no uncertain terms that we could not. They did not even ask our room number. We had paid nearly Â£200 per night for a full harbour view and the staff made us feel as if we were not welcome. Such a shame - would not stay there again even for free !!!! Marion Fisk - London - England.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, can't wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: BUD123
Reviews.Content: We stayed for just one night here while we were on our way to Fiji, and I am kicking myself that we did not stay for a few more days. The hotel was excellent, and they had allocated us a room looking towards Manley. We asked them if there was any rooms overlooking the harbour/opera house and we were quickly moved to a room with the best view I have ever seen. Super service and extremely helpful concierge. Will definitely stay here if I am lucky enough to get back to Sydney!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!!”
Reviews.Author: Nimes
Reviews.Content: The best hotel I have ever stayed in!!

Reviews.Title: “What a view!”
Reviews.Author: HLW11
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Shangri La twice as part of our honeymoon. On our first visit, I had booked a Premier Grand Harbour View King this was fabulous corner room which had views of both the Opera House and Harbour Bridge. We arrived on a very early fight from Singapore and were at the hotel by approx 7am, we were very pleased to discover that our room was ready and we were able to check in and more importantly get a couple of hours sleep before heading out to see the sights. The hotel was happy to store some of our luggage until our return visit 6 days later which was excellent. On our second visit, I had booked the cheaper Deluxe Opera House View King, however, on arrival we were upgraded to Grand Harbour view room again. This room was not on the corner but the view was almost as good and in some ways the layout of the room was better. In general, the rooms were very good and the bathrooms excellent. The service was also very good and we found the concierge particularly helpful in sorting out restaurant bookings, they even managed to get us a table at Tetsuya's at short notice. We paid a couple of visits to the Blu Horizon bar although the view is excellent and the staff try to move you to a table close to the window as soon as they come available, we found the drinks service to be very slow. On one occasion we had to gulp down cocktails because we had waited so long and we had to leave for our restaurant reservation plus don't expect any preferential treatment because you are a hotel guest. We also enjoyed dinner at the Rocks Teppenyaki next door to the hotel and at Nicks seafood restaurant at Cockle Bay Wharf.

Reviews.Title: “Its true about the views and the room”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I am giving this hotel an excellent rating for many important reasons. I was in Sydney for work and my partner and daughter came up with me this time as it was her birthday and we didn't want to be apart this time. I spent hours searching for a special place they could stay at whilst I went to work. I must admit I was nervous booking the shangri-La because I wasn't too familiar with the foreshore area of Sydney and there are many hotels around the harbour who claim to have the 'best' views. It was also because of some of the reviews I read, there was just this element of doubt. anyway to get to the point, this hotel is 36stories with unobstructed views of both the harbour bridge and opera house. It is situated on a slight hill - not as bad as other reviewers think and there are shortcuts down to Circular Quay. Walking to Darling harbour is at least 10mins away. I stayed in room 3207 a horizon executive suit. This type of room is not available on the 'last minute' websites. rooms entitles 'Grand Harbour suite or room' are on the lower floors and are much smaller in size. I strongly suggest you log onto their website as it has a room comparison chart. This room is 83sqm - the sort of size you expect for a suite. It has a seperate lounge room to put your kid(s) on roll out beds - they usually come at a cost but becuase I rang the hotel directly I got it thrown in for free. The room was very well furnished and tasteful. other reviewers say their rooms were worn, well unfortunately I may agree - but only slightly. Put it this way, if the Shangri-La doesn't do another refresh in the next 5 years then yes they would lose their 5 star rating. the bed was a huge King, the bathroom is large and really nice amenties - bath is large enough for 6ft person and two people can fit in shower under large rose head nozzle. Tv, stereo, cd player (no dvd), are all great. Broadband internet access, airconditioning, bed linen, minibar and 2nd ensuite are all excellent.. there is not much at all bad I can say as it was a really nice room. the windows in this place are floor to ceiling, you can sit on the window sill against the window 32 stories high! there is no doubt about it, this is truly one of the most magnificent views anywhere in the world. You can sit in the bath and look at Darling Harbour, lie in bed and see the Harbour Bridge, in the lounge room you look directly at the opera house. Again, I must stress, this hotel and un-interrupted views, it is at the front and all rooms have large windows. I walked across the bridge and looked back to see the Four Seasons hotel with these really tiny windows compared to this hotel. The Quay West Suites are adjacent to the Shangri-La, as I have a kid I might check this place out next time as it might be a bit cheaper. The room cost me $AU500- per night, but as I said before, I rang the hotel up directly and said, I want to pay $500 a night for four nights, the lady put me on hold, and came back and said yes. I got upgraded to the Horizon suite and the rest is history. Make sure you get room 3207 - it is a corner suite so you get 270 degree views. You also get access to floor 30 (although it seems anyone can really go up there, the floor is not blockd on the elevator.) In this room its quite 80's looking but even still it looks good. The service in this hotel is exceptional. Remember though to switch the privacy switch so that they know you don't want to be disturbed. believe me, if you leave it on service, then they will be in as quick as flynn doing this and doing that - turn-down service etc.. The restaurant down on level 2 is fantastic as well. All food in Sydney is expensive so $60- for the buffett including this unreal array of sweets is included. The food is 5 star and variety about right. I must recommend you go there if you have kids - the desserts are fantastic. anyway, I totally recommend this place if you are a couple and find it hard to get a hotel with a seperate room for the kid(s), get quality roomservice 24hrs and be of good quality. This hotel is definitely 5 star, but I wouldn't pay rack rates - negotiate with them. These are really nice and genuine people - it seems anyway. Not too intrusive and always smile and willing to help. As I said, I stayed in the Horizon exec suite - this is probably better than your regular rooms . make sure you visit the website and check out your room size before you book. all rooms have views of bridge, darling harbour, or opera house. Overall, excellent. I will go back - especially for the views.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Views”
Reviews.Author: AussieGirl99
Reviews.Content: My husband & I recently stayed at the Shangri-la in Sydney in a Club room. The views are fantastic ~ harbour bridge, opera house, circular quay etc. Whilst we found the service to be less than acceptable the views made up for it. (Very 'snotty' service on check-in......wrong room and when we asked to be changed it became a huge deal etc). A club room entitles you to the drinks, nibble, breakfast in the 'Club'. Which is a very ordinary room saved by the fantastic views. The value is however great. Very substantial nibbles from 6-8 each night along with drinks (spirits inc). The breakfast (also inc in the Club rate) is however very disappointing. Not a huge selection, and the same every day so not appealing if you are staying more than 2-3 days. Given the proximity to the Rocks & Circular quay it is a good place to base yourself if you haven't been to Sydney before. The extra payable for a Club Room is made up on the breakfasts & drinks every night & I would recommend that you take up the option. The location is in a steep part of Sydney, so if you are not up to walking up and down hills this may not be the best option for you. The rooms themselves are fairly dated. The shower (v.small) in our room leaked, but otherwise the facilities were fine. If in Sydney would recommend doing the walk from Bondi along the coast (can catch a bus from nearby Circular Quay) it is REALLY great!

Reviews.Title: “Nice View”
Reviews.Author: Travelhobbyist
Reviews.Content: The Shangria La offers wonderful views. The room we stayed in had extensive view of the harbor. Staff was helpful and room relatively clean. Some refresh work is needed for room and carpeting - at least in our room with a great view. The lobby was very noisy, not too inviting and crowded,coach group arrival noise overflowed into the lobby bar area. It is a very steep walk up from the central harbor terminals. Be prepared to use a taxi. The pool could do with some deep cleaniing and the ceiling needs to be repaiired to get rid of some of the peeling paint. The spa staff were very nice. We enjoyed the The Mix - one of their restaurants. This was an interesting upscale dinner buffet offering amazing selections of pacific and asian cusine. Seafood spread was extensive.

Reviews.Title: “Comfort and View all in one”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: One of the best experiences I have ever had, pulling back the curtain in the bedroom and seeing the Opera house. Well worth paying the extra for a room with a view. The standards and quality of the rooms and reception staff were exactly what you would expect from a hotel of this standard. However the necessity to charge for everything, including $30 to have a minibar emptied, does let the hotel down a little, particulary given the rates they are charging. The only downside from the hotel's point of view was the attitude of the staff in the Horizon bar, as if they were doing us a favour for letting us have cocktail, but the view was spectacular and this made up for the staff. When I go back to sydney I will be staying there again, without a doubt.

Reviews.Title: “Really 5 star”
Reviews.Author: ukcas
Reviews.Content: Stayed 5 nights at this hotel in a Opera House view room on the 29th floor during April 2006. The hotel is really well presented from reception through to the individual rooms. If you stay here a must do is dine in the Altitude restaurant but book in advance if you wish to have a window table. The views are the only thing better than the food. The rooms are spacious and well furnished and well maintained by housekeeping. If in Sydney again there will be no where else to consider.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Five-Star View”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Shangri-La's Premier Grand Harbor King room had the most breathtaking and magnificent view of the Sydney Opera House and the Bridge. The bed was incredibly comfortable and sumptuous, the decor sophisticated and subtle, and the bathroom was spacious and luxurious. The staff at the hotel is excellent, I enjoyed the nightly turndown service. Centrally located and within walking distance to Circular Quay, Darling Harbour, George Street, and the downtown area. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “standards are slipping”
Reviews.Author: Kramax
Reviews.Content: Having been a fan of this hotel since it opened over 10 years ago, it pains me a little not to be able to write a top review as I have after previous stays. On checking in at Reception I was told "welcome back" by the receptionist. A nice touch and I appreciated it. However, on entering the "renovated" deluxe harbour view room I was disappointed that the room was of a lesser standard than previously. The lovely huge cabinet which previously held a TV was replaced by a cheap looking IKEA table. The room was not as luxuriously appointed as before. The bathroom was unchanged, ie still fabulous. The view from the window was still million dollar and the reason you should stay here, even disregarding the fact that it is not of the same high standard as it was. Staff were very friendly, room service food average (I also note the room service menu has shrunk from about 20 pages to about 6 - one of the reasons I previously loved the Shangri La). But that is economics and I don't hold it against them since they have great eating places at the hotel. My bath tub was not cleaned during room service and this would not have happened before. The carpet in the hallway also was not vacuumed during my stay. Maybe they were short staffed during Easter? Also, room service took forever. I will stay here again, but for the price, if you don't need the view, there are lots of other great hotels in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Great place! Great location! Wonderful reception! Friendly and helpful!”
Reviews.Author: Kiwitraveler
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful stay with my wife in April 2006 at Shangri La in Sydney. Stayed in Horizons Club floor. View was beautiful of the entire Harbor! Breakfast in the club lounge was good, but it gets very old after the first day or two, there is no variety and is the same eggs, bacon, carbs, cereals every day; although the free drink and canapes in the evening up there were geat! The restaurant and bar on the top floor is great! I can not even describe how wonderful the reception staff were during our stay. I was a bit worried based on other reviews, but they were absolutely wonderful, welcoming and friendly! Perfect location to the Quay and The Rocks district. Rooms were huge. Bathrooms were modern and clean. Compared Shangri La to the Quay West and there really is no comparison, Shangri La is much nicer, much more luxurious. Larger rooms than the Four Seaons, with lower rates than them as well. Would highly recommend the Grand Harbor View over the opera house view, spend a little extra, stay on a lower level if you have to for the better view. Cheers to the Shangri La, would definitely stay there again! *****

Reviews.Title: “If you get the chance, stay there!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: One of the best hotels we have stayed in. From the moment we got there to the time we left, the staff could not have done any more to make our stay any better. The concierge service was outstanding and the general feel of the place was quality. The rooms were exellent and clean with a large bathroom. The decor was good, if not a little dark, but this was more than made up with the view of the opera house we had. The bar on the ground floor was ideal for a few drinks before you hit the town and again the bar staff were very friendly and polite. You will pay through the nose to use the mini bar, so beware. To the reviewers who stated that the hotel was not that good, I have to ask you if it is possible to please you at all. Considering that it's not overly expensive and the level of service you get, you cant do much better. If you go to Sydney, then stay here. Its central to everything you need, and you wont be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Heaven”
Reviews.Author: devoflo
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Shangri-la for three nights in March with a group of 4 for a girls weekend. The hotel was fabulous and the service outstanding at every turn. We were upgraded to Opera View rooms. The staff were always helpful and bent over backwards to answer any queries. The rooms were very comfortable - the beds divine. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Comfort in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: NRT
Reviews.Content: The Shangri-La is a very comfortable hotel with some nice luxury touches. Overall, I would say it feels like a really upscale business hotel, rather than a luxury hotel. If you are traveling on business and want to comfortable place, the Shangri-La would be a good choice. However, if you are on a holiday and want a pampering luxury experience, you might want to consider other options. Probably the hotel's best feature is the location - it is really close to the Circular Quay and many of the rooms have fantastic views of the harbour. You can easily walk to the ferry terminals, Opera House, etc. It is also adjacent to the charming and historic Rocks area too. The rooms are very nicely decorated and the housekeeping is excellent. Probably the best feature of the rooms is the bathroom - very large and luxurious with a huge tub and separate shower. My only complaint is that my room (a standard twin) was pretty small by luxury hotel standards. On the downside, I was pretty disappointed with the gym and pool area. At best, the gym is like something you would find in a YMCA, not a world-class luxury hotel. I didn't use the pool, but it is really small and there is only a tiny outdoor sundeck. I would also say that the service was only adequate and not stellar. I didn't experience any problems (other than one morning when I went downstairs for breakfast and found that there were propbably 25 people waiting for a table - I didn't have time to wait and had to skip breakfast that day). The problem I had with the service was that the staff just seemed a little indifferent to the guests. Whenever I would pass a staff member in the lobby, hallway, etc. they would never acknowledge me with a greeting. It was not the welcoming feeling I usually experience at luxury hotels. I had a fine stay but would probably try a different place next time. I've also stayed at the Four Seasons and Intercontinental in Sydney, and would probably choose these places over the Shangri-La.

Reviews.Title: “A very enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: velvetcrush
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Shangri-La Sydney for 2.5 weeks in February for work purposes. The hotel is situated very close to the Rocks area, which is very pleasant for strolling and viewing the tourist attractions, although dining options can be rather pricey. Check-in service was prompt and very pleasant, although porter service had to be self-initiated. I was allocated a corner room on a higher floor which was slightly disappointing, as there are some rooms with views of the Opera House (but may cost more). However, the room was fantastically clean and spacious and the bathroom had a separate bathtub/shower. However, I had no idea what to do in the separate living room area which didn't have a television. The bed was very comfortable for a good night's rest with ample pillows. Altogether a very enjoyable stay indeed for superior rooms and the location is hard to beat.

Reviews.Title: “Not so iddeal location!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Shangri-la in the Rocks area of Sydney. The hotel is more suited to business travellers than holidaymakers, and lacks ambience. Although the rooms are very well equipped and comfortable, and the views of Sydney Harbour are unbeatable, the main problem with this hotel is that it is on a hill. There is a steep climb each time you return making it unsuitable for elderly or less mobile visitors, unless you use taxis. Breakfast and room service (especially drinks) are very over-priced, but there is a pleasant cafe on the lower level at the rear of the hotel, in Gloucester Road. A better choice would be the Four Seasons, which lies at the bottom of the hill near Circular Quay, or for a cheaper option, the Old Holiday Inn at the Rocks is well situated on a level location.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic rooms and views!”
Reviews.Author: frequent_fam_travel
Reviews.Content: This hotel is beautiful and the rooms are huge, new and clean. Our room on the 23rd floor overlooked the whole Sydney harbor and Opera house; It was absolutely stunning. We also stayed at the Marriott Circular Quay, which although a bit closer to the central ferries (which you will want to take when you visit) is not nearly as nice as the Shangri La and much more expensive. You do have to take several stairs to get down to the main area from the Shangri La, but if this doesn't cramp your style, it is highly recommended. The Four Seasons is ideal as well.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic - well worth the extra money”
Reviews.Author: bella1981
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Shangri-La Sydney twice, and have to say, if you are going to stay there, be prepared to pay a little extra for indulgence, otherwise don't bother. If you are going to stay at a 5 star hotel, then pay the price. We stayed the first time in early 2005, by booking a pretty standard room for $400. Upon checkin, everything went smoothly, the staff were very friendly and we had no problems. It was a harbour view room, and it was awesome, even from the 7th floor. Wanted to have dinner in the Altitude restaurant, was boked out though. So decided to go for the buffet restaurant on level 1. This is no ordinary buffet - it was about $80.00 a head, with the most beautiful food I had ever tasted. Maybe the other "reviews" who have been there, have been on a bad night, but I have been there 3 times now, and every time I come away feeling totally satisfied. We went to the bar on level 30 also, wow what a bar! It looks out over the bridge on one side, with glass tabletops and glass floor to ceiling windows. Drinks are pretty pricey though, so be prepared to pay upwards of $15.00 for a cocktail. We stayed again in late 2005, this time going for the honeymon suite. Upon arrival, we got upgraded to the horison club level. For this room we got a magical view of the opera house and bridge, as well as 2 bottles of champainge (moet), chocolates and full breakfast for 2 delivered to the room. The room was awesome, large seperate living area, large bedroom and an even bigger bathroom, with sunken bath and floor to ceiling windows, all on level 13 in a corner suite. The room cost us about $600 for the night, but it was so worth it. We had dinner at Altitude restaurant and it was amazing. We expected top class service and food and we got it. I now know why it is always booked out - this restaurant is really for the elite of sofistication, the food is elegantly prepared and tastes amazing. Our table was right next to the window with a view of, you guessed it, the harbour bridge and opera house. The staff wait on you hand and foot, we weren't waiting long periods for anything. The dresscode is strictly elegant, theres no doubt about that. I have absolutely nothing bad to say about this place, 2 stays and 4 dinners later (we have been back just for the food!) we love it. It is a 5 star hotel to a tee.

Reviews.Title: “fabulous”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel for 4 days from Dec. 1st. as part of our journey from the UK. to Australia via San Francisco( stayed at The Radisson) and Honolulu( The Hyatt Regency, Waikiki) all of which were excellent hotels so as we had only booked basic rooms here we were unsure what to expect. Well we soon found out. On arrival the lady at the desk informed us that they had decided to give us free breakfasts and free upgrading to the Horizon club on the 33rd floor without any explanation why they were doing it. On arrival at our room I opened the curtains to look down at the opera house and the bridge which was quite awesome. The room was huge and the bathroom nearly as big all tiled out in marble and with bath and shower filled by gold taps. There was a notice stating free pressing of suits so I phoned down and mine was collected within minutes. Breakfast was 3 floors below in the private restaurant with the most unbelievable views I have ever seen and there was free coffee and canapes each afternoon. We visited all the attractions including the 3 hr morning coffee boat ride up the harbour (the lady on the microphone was very well informed of her facts) and I also had $18 knocked off because she found out we were Welsh. We also had a good fish and chips meal at Doylies? but this was expensive for what you get. This was a fantastic break at this hotel but I do realise the upper floors are for people with more money than myself but it also made me relise that its worth saving up and paying extra if you are going to the other side of the world. PS. Just one point. After this we flew on to the Shangri La at Cairns. Sorry but this was the worst hotel of all the hotels we stayed at.

Reviews.Title: “Satisfactory Stay... GREAT room”
Reviews.Author: hwtStu
Reviews.Content: go for the premier grand harbour view room, you will be VERY happy i tried checking in 10 mins before the official time (3pm) and was told the room wasn`t ready....mmmm....it wasnt full so some maids have got it easy! good location, great bar at the top and i believe the restaurant (altitude) is top notch...

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Ending to an Amazing Holiday”
Reviews.Author: Aquatamer
Reviews.Content: After 3 weeks of touring this amazing country we finished our vacation with 4 days in Sydney at the Shangri La Hotel. From check in to check out everything was perfect. The room and the view were truly incredible. The breakfast buffet (included in the room rate) was a total and complete feast. This hotel is within walking distance of many tourist attractions and restaurants. The staff are very customer orientated and there to please, your wish is their command. We will not hesitate to stay at this hotel on our nect trip to Australia.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Very disappointed from the moment we arrived. This had been booked and paid for back in the summer and we stayed for 6 nights over the New Year period. First of all we arrived to be told we had no reservation - can you imagine that feeling when you have just arrived from the UK on the 30th December!! Not good to be told - however as i had my confirmation in front of me they said they would upgrade us to a suite and to wait 10/15 minutes. Ok so maybe that wasnt too bad but we were still getting over the shock. 5 minutes later we were then told they had found our reservation so all is OK now and we can have our original harbour view deluxe room - errm excuse me - no everything is not ok - so not only do they upset me by telling me they do not have my room they then get my hopes up telling me i have a suite only 5 minutes later to then tell me i havent!!!!! Not impressed so far - eventually get taken to our room and the view of seeing the Opera House and Bridge should have been amazing but the moment was completely spoilt from what had happended on arrival and i was most upset. The room was ridiculous! It had a tiny wardrobe as you walk in then a huge corridor of wasted space leading to the bed and seating area - there was no wardrobe space or drawers whatsoever and we straight away had to ask what could be done only eventually to be given a clothes rail to put in the corridor - very impressive - not! Do they really expect people to stay in these top hotels and have no clothes with them!!!!!! To add insult to injury they lost two pieces of our luggage - laptop and ruck sack - which were eventaully retrieved some 45 minutes later. There was glass on the floor that i cut my foot on and the bedside phone buzzed all night and had to be changed. One evening i got out of the shower only to find we had been left NO towels that day! The inside pool area was very poor and would be more suitable to a 3 star hotel. If your going to Sydney stay at the Four Seasons, we spent all our time there and only wish we had booked there originally.

Reviews.Title: “More Than Happy With The Shangri La”
Reviews.Author: Peter Street
Reviews.Content: I booked the SHANGRI LA because of its reputation and location. The price was 'right' [special-rate offer] but did not include breakfast. It had previously been an ANA hotel and there many exacting Japanese guests, mostly uncommunicative but friendly. Much was 'lost in translation'. As for the hotel facilities, I was not disappointed, although the ambiance was rather bland. I arrived at 1130, the front desk staff were very helpful and I was in my room around noon! The view of the Harbour was fine from the 15th floor, although above a multi-lane highway. In spite of this, there was utter silence in the amply-sized room. The soundproofing was extraordinary and the best I have ever encountered, anywhere, any time, I may note. The king-size bed and pillows were first-class, I slept well and the room-service was friendly and to the point. No complaints on that count. The hotel has a chic rooftop bar and good restos. The cafe buffet was reasonable value, considering the endless lobster, oysters, sushi etc., you could help yourself to. The indoor pool was quite large but the sun deck was miniscule! To reach the hotel calls for a mild uphill stroll but it was not that exacting. The check-out was fairly flexible around mid-day and rapid. Not a bad stay at all, given the proximity to the Quay and Opera House, so plus or minus, I would probably book this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Good times at the Shangri-La”
Reviews.Author: Holliday
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Shangri-La for 4 nights. The location is simply superb, we had a grand harbour room which looked right out onto the Opera House and Sydney Harbour Bridge. On check-in the front desk staff were a little rude and unhelpful and on check-out we did not feel that valued, I think they were quite arrogant. The room was spacious and generally the staff were helpful and friendly. The hotel is ideal for its location and the rooms are pretty large and special. We booked the value rate which includes return airport transfers, this was a real bonus. Choose this hotel for its location.

Reviews.Title: “Love, Love, Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: ljrmsp
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights at the Shangri-La. We loved it. The room was very clean and spacious,and also very tastefully decorated. The staff was very curtious and nice. On our last day, we accidentally had thrown something away and then the trash had been taken out. But they immediatly offered to go through the trash and track it down!!Overall we would defianetly stay at this hotel again. Also, the location was great!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel & Location”
Reviews.Author: Wooshi
Reviews.Content: The Shangri-La in Sydney is in a perfect location. There are lots of hills in Sydney and the hotel is set slightly back up the hill, but it only a 7 minute walk down some steps to the Rocks and is near some great restaurants. Obviously you have the walk back though! We had a room facing the harbour which had excellent views. The room was clean and turned down each evening with fresh linen and towels each day as you would expect. The hotels Horizon Bar on the 36th floor is SUPERB to watch the sunset with a cocktail, but very busy so you need to be early if you want a seat in or near the window! Cost approx Â£9 for a champagne cocktail. The concierge, porters and check in staff were all excellent and polite, always helping with directions when we looked a bit puzzled or checking where our tour guide was if we had been stood there a while! We had room only, and used the hotel coffee shop (at the back entrance) each morning for coffee, fresh fruit salad and fresh bagels â€“ was good value for money with friendly service, but sadly not open at weekends (seems to be targeting the business market). We used the hotel restaurant once, which was OK, but I think there are better more reasonably priced restaurants in walking distance. Would definetly use this hotel if I visit Sydney again.

Reviews.Title: “The views are as you dream about”
Reviews.Author: Worldwideharrier
Reviews.Content: Originally booked in on the 21st Floor but due to problems with the room were immediatley upgraded to a room on the 28th Floor overlooking Opera House Harbour and Bridge. Staff most courteous and helpful, room excellent, the all marble bathroom did it for us. Restaurant prices not expensive when comparing the same grade of restaurant elsewhere. The buffet in Cafe Mix was superb it takes a time to edge away from the sea food. We wanted an exceptional hotel for this leg of our round the world trip as it was our 30th Wedding Anniversary. Would return without a shadow of doubt. Considering other Shangri La hotels.

Reviews.Title: “not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
