Reviews.Content: Only good thing about the stay was the view we had of the opera house and bridge. Although the room was clean, we asked for non smoking room, room we were given had previously been used by smokers and stank every time we walked in, the front of the safe was hanging off when we arrived, as was the internet box on the skirting. The reception staff were very rude when we checked in, the most friendly and polite people in the hotel were the porters, we had complimentary breakfast included which was just as well as food is expensive in this hotel. I have stayed in other Shangri La hotels and this one did not compare at all well, will not be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great views!”
Reviews.Author: Davidq100
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights in a Grand Harbour view Suite. Definitely the best views from any hotel in the world I have stayed, overlooking the bridge, opera house and Darling Harbour. Hotel is situated right next to the rocks area, and quite close to everything (although 4 Seasons is closer) We also had access to the Horizon club, which is worth it for the free drinks, breakfast and the even more stunning views! Staff were very professional, although perhaps a little impersonal as you might expect in a large hotel. I am sure there were huge amounts of facilities, but there's so much to do outside and room was so great that we didn't use them. Highly recommended - worth spending the extra for a room with a view.

Reviews.Title: “Great View!”
Reviews.Author: mpl1853
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 6 days in September, 2005. The location is walking distance to everything in The Rocks area and Circular Quay(which links you to everywhere in the city). It is located at the top of a hill. We counted 66 steps via the shortest route from the Rocks area which included cutting through the Four Seasons and using their elevator. We had a harbor view room on the 12th floor and had a beautiful view of the Opera House and the Harbour Bridge. Room was spacious and well appointed. Bathroom was marble with seperate tub and shower. Very nice. Hotel restaurants were expensive. We found other options in the Circular Quay or Rocks area for meals after our first one. We found internet access and laundry services to be costly. We would have appreciated a guest laundry. We ended up asking the folks at the Sydney Visitor Center who directed us to a laundry that delivered our clean, dry folded laundry the same day at a fraction of the hotel cost. Overall, beautiful view, nice hotel. If I were to return, I'd seriously consider the Four Seasons, which seemed to be a comparable hotel in a much better location.

Reviews.Title: “Great sleeping... a little impersonal.”
Reviews.Author: windy74
Reviews.Content: We had a very pleasant experience here. The room was extremely comfortable -- everything you would expect from a luxury hotel. From my research, probably the best deal in The Rocks. My only complaint would be I felt like they were always try to stick us in a less than desirable space until we complained. For instance, even if you book a deluxe room, they will try to put you on a low floor or seat you in a bad seat in the bar with no view. I guess it is hard to make each guest feel special at such a large hotel. But I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “The best views in the world”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I arrived at the Shangri-La on a warm sunny morning in December 2004 and was directed to a room on the 22nd floor. The view from the window was just the most breathtaking sight I have ever seen - the Sydney Harbour Bridge was on the left, the harbour directly in front, with the many hundreds of yachts that had gathered for the Sydney to Hobart Yacht race on Boxing day, and on the right was the spectacular Opera House glinting in the sun. This hotel used to belong to the Japanese Airline ANA, and before they sold it to the Shangri-La chain they spent $500,000 on EACH room. The marble bathroom was huge and the room was extremely comfortable. The bed was the most comfy that I have ever slept in. Even if you don't stay at the Shangri-La, make sure you have dinner there because the view from the restaurant is the most spectacular in the whole city. The food is excellent although quite pricey by Australian standards. If you want an authentic Aussie BBQ style dinner, go to Phillip's Foot pub / restaurant at the bottom of York Street. You BBQ your own food and there is a great atmosphere. It's also very reasonably priced. Please feel free to send me an e-mail if you want any information on Sydney, Port Douglas, Noosa, Brisbane, Melbourne or Ballarat because we visited all these places last year. Australia is a fantastic, fascinating and fun place to go - I can't wait for my next visit

Reviews.Title: “I like it A LOT”
Reviews.Author: tooyoungtodie
Reviews.Content: This Shangri-La is everything you'd expect from a 5 star hotel. The location is excellent and in close proximity to the Opera House, Sydney Tower, Darling Harbor. Request a room facing the Opera house, although I think all rooms have a pretty good view. Eat at the restaurant/bar on the top floor. Great food and atmosphere. Bigger standard rooms than the Four Seasons just down the street. I would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic View”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: You can't go far wrong with Shangri La and I was not dissapointed with my first stay in Sydney. For a city Hotel I could not fault it. We were on the 18th Floor and the view was spectacular. The room was of the usual Shangri La high standard and the staff were all very friendly. The food in the restaurants and room service was excellent and I would highly recommend the week-end Seafood Buffet in the Cafe. A very enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location and Views ; remainder average”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Great location in the Rocks and near Circular Quay. Stunning views of Opera House / Harbour from most rooms. Hotel itself felt like a good 4 star ; rooms, restuarants and facilities adequate rather than exceptional.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Luxury Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel during our first trip to Sydney (5 nights). We opted for the club class rooms which were well worth the money. The views were amazing and we could not fault the service. There are many luxury hotels in Sydney all in similar positions (Park Hyatt is an exception) but after a lot of looking about I found this the best value for money. If there is a Shangri La in a city where I am staying I usually choose it as I have learned to trust thebrand. I was not disappointed. The location is in walking distance to most things in the area but is up a steep hill so beware if you are not hot on your heels - it may be worth to find a hotel not so raised by the harbour.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing views”
Reviews.Author: Anna678
Reviews.Content: My mother and I had a weekend in Sydney recently and we stayed at the Shangri La. We booked online for the cheapest available room (A$280) and were delighted to find that even low down on the 7th floor we still had a view of the harbour to the west of the bridge. Not the traditional Sydney view but still very pleasant. We had a drink in the bar on the 36th floor to sample the full views, which were truly spectacular. Our room was very comfortable and well-appointed, and all the staff were keen and attentive. Yes, there is a steep section walking up the hill to the hotel from the harbour, but it is by no means unmanageable. We were very happy with the Shangri La.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT TIME AT SHANGRI LA”
Reviews.Author: DallasTexasTraveler
Reviews.Content: Had two stays in July(9th to 12th) & (16th to 18th)-super service, & friendly staff. Its worth it to be one on of the Horizion Level floors-private lounge, super breakfast & two hour open bar with excellant hor' dourves. We paid $495. australian for a room on 11th floor & same for room on 32nd floor-each time a two room suite-looking right down on the harbor & opera house-have two children & roll away beds were free. So for about $375.00US-we have a family of 4 with two large rooms, free & solid breakfast & great food in the evening club & fabulous views. Room on the 11th floor had two bathrooms. This hotel is a 5 minute walk to the Bridge Climb entrance & about a EASY 10 minute walk to all of the ferries. The hotel is on a hill but the walk is no big deal. Rode down on the elevator on our last day with Sean Connery & that was pretty cool. Will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A must-stay in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Hawthorn08
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights in July with my girlfriend. We had booked a deluxe view room (can't remember the exact descriiption, but was described as having view of bridge, harbour and opera house). On check-in we were upgraded to a corner junior suite. If you can afford it, stay at these rooms (normally about $450 I think) as they are spacious and the views are amazing. The room number will finish with "13" e.g. 813, or 1313, so request this. The view, from floor to ceiling windows, is fabulous and guaranteed to woo your other half. The bar and restaurant on the top floor (36) are worth going to, and the wine-list in the restaurant is excellent - a lot of top, select wines. Very friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious Hotel in a Central Part of the City”
Reviews.Author: MULLAGHMORE
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel in February 2005 while on our honeymoon. It is a beautiful hotel where the staff are more than helpful and polite - nothing is too much bother for them. We had a Harbour and Bridge view, which we were upgraded to on arrival, and which was stunning. The room was huge and decorated beautifully with a massive bathroom. The bar area was also great for a quiet drink. While we were there the Prince and Princess of Denmark where also there and so this made for a lot of press etc around the hotel which was interesting!!! Sydney is a brilliant city to visit, but you need a lot of time to see it. We took a helicopter trip while there and it was well worth the money as it is a fantastic sight from the air! There are numerous bars, discos and restauants especially in the rocks area, where the Shangri La is located.

Reviews.Title: “Great Room; filthy spa”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We opted for the special "B&B" rate which put us in the rooms above the 30th floor so views were spectacular. The room was immaculate, but the housekeeping was sporadically forgetful and we had to call for touch-ups 5 of the 10 days we were there. The guest lounge was private with stunning 180 degree views of the main harbor, bridge, ferries and Opera. The food served was upscale and fresh. Staff here was top-notch and attentive. Keep a close eye on your bill, as we found several small charges that were not valid, posted over several days. Management deleted them but gave no explantion on how such charges came to be added to the room. The pool and spa are another thing altogether. The spa was so filthy, with a scummy, grease ring of human deadskin, oils and what not that it encircled the entire 15-foot spa witha 6-inch wide black ring. There was a variety of debris on the bottom of the pool, including used bangages. We witnessed infants in the spa without swim diapers. All this was reported to the staff -- repeatedly -- we rechecked every other day, as we wished to use the facilities after a full day of touring. After the 3rd day of no action, we called management, no action and then on 6th day we finally reported the condition to the GM staff. The spa was never cleaned in all 10 days of our stay. Frankly, this may be partly our fault. In researching the hotel we found several reviews with the same complaint posted for a stay several months prior to ours. Fooled int othinking that a 5 star hotel would not allow such a condition to persist, we booked anyway. To date (July '05) we have never received the courtesy of a reply to our letter of complaint to the owners. We strongly recommend you avoid this hotel if the pool and spa are important to you. The Four Seasons, located a a few yeards away was always sparkling clean . . . it was also booked when we traveled -- go figure.

Reviews.Title: “Totally Overated!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is one hotel that I must say is totally overated. The views from the hotel are good (proving you get the right room). Despite what their brochure says not all rooms have great views (avoid rooms 1 and 19 on each floor - although they offer the best in terns of space - and even then they are pretty small, the views are only achieved, especially in rooms xx19 by twisting your next round the window to see the Opera House). Best rooms are 6 to 14 on each floor for the views. Housekeeping is quite frankly the worst I have ever seen, with items being missed (i.e. shampoo etc) left on each day of my 7 night stay, clean towels were not left (on 2 days the towels left were soiled) and the floor didn't appear to be hoovered for my entire stay. During the stay they added items to the bill such as food, mini bar etc that were never useda and the TV in the room had a mind of it's own and next stayed on 1 channel for more than a few minutes. If you have children in a puishchair forget coming to this hotel - it is a nightmare. the hotel is up a number of very steep hills and pushing a push chair up and down the hills was an absolute nightmare. The Cafe Mix restaurant is where they serve the buffet breakfast. I took breakfast on each morning and was very poor. The supposed hot buffet was always cold, the coffee was cold (you always have to ask 2 or 3 times for a cup of coffee and they are not at all proactive) and to add insult to injury they will try to charge you for a full Australian Breakfast even if you only have continental - check your bill carefully. This hotel would charge you for fresh air if they could and is not worthy of the Shangri La brand. Overall the staff are too concerned about how they look to take any notice of their guests, the service is incredibly slow and not at all attentive. The gym according to their corporate literature is supposed to be free, but when you use the bill they charge you AU$12. Yes it has the views, but sadly in my eyes that is all it has. Stay at the Four Seasons, where you will not have any steep hills to navigate, the staff are more attentive and pick your right room and you can still get a good view of the Opera House. For those that have stayed at a Shangri La in Asia and are planning a stay...watch out you will be disappointed...the Asian style and service has not, and will probably never, reach the Shangri La Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Another great Shangri-La”
Reviews.Author: JJYork
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in several Shangri-la hotels and this was of the same high standard we have come to expect. During our trip we stayed at this hotel for 3 x nights. We had been to Sydney before and knew we wanted to be close to the rocks, this was perfect. We had a private transfer from the airport and had arrived quite early in the morning from Singapore where we had stayed at Raffles. We had to wait a few hours for our room to be ready so we had access to the Business Centre which had shower, tea/coffee facilities. Our room was very spacious and clean and had breathtaking views of the harbour and opera house. Breakfast was buffet style and the choice was excellent. However, if you prefer a lighter breakfast, there was a patisserie style cafÃ© serving coffee and freshly baked croissants, bagels and muffins etc in the basement of the hotel. The concierge was very helpful and recommended and organised tours for us. We would highly recommend the wine tours whilst staying in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Best Rooms In Sydney”
Reviews.Author: sallyhess
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night after moving from the Marriott Harbor. Best hotel in Sydney. Had an end room with a sitting area which they had put a fruit basket and orchid while I was in the Health Club, I went to dinner and turn down service was performed but I reopened the drapes as the view was stunning. My view was of Darling Harbor and the City and was magnificent. If you join their club, free I might add, you'll receive all these extras along with my room being ready in the morning. Ask for the Discovery package which includes coupons for meals.

Reviews.Title: “Unbetable luxury”
Reviews.Author: Francaphile
Reviews.Content: For our first five nights in Sydney we booked into the Shangri La on a family recommendation. We had a room with a river view (rather than a bridge view) and from the 27th floor the views were stunning. The room was large and well furnished, with tea / coffee making facilities and even UK electricity sockets! We had a separate bathroom and lounge / sitting area and there were all the extra facilities (safe, ironing board, mini bar etc). Service was second to none, and staff were never anything other than helpful and pleased to be of assistance. Not a cheap hotel, but if you want to splash out on a little luxury in life then this is the place!!

Reviews.Title: “Great views at the Shang”
Reviews.Author: 206flyer
Reviews.Content: Had a harbour view room with 2 double beds. The room was very large and clean and had an excellent view of both the Sydney Harbour Bridge and the Opera House. Bathroom was large and full of ammenities as well. While the room was great, the service was not consistent with what you'd expect at such a hotel. At check-in, the agent was not sure of what she was doing and that night at the beautiful bar on the top of the hotel, they were also confused and we had to wait 25 minutes for our drinks. All in all a very good hotel though!

Reviews.Title: “The hill is not a problem!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The views from the Grand Harbour View Room are unbelievable!! Just returned from our honeymoon and spent 5 days at the Shangri-La in Sydney - the views are worth the price of the room alone! As honeymooners we were also treated to a bottle of bubbly, fresh strawberries and chocolates! Didn't try any of the restaurants but went to the Blu Horizon Bar and paid AUS$23 for a glass of wine!! People who have complained about the hill must be hugely unfit - I was expecting a mountain and it's not too bad at all!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great service”
Reviews.Author: kidscomingwith
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Shangri-La while on our honeymoon, and I was rather pleased with the service and accommodations. When we arrived, the concierge was kind enough to call and confirm reservations that I had made before we arrived. Our view, as you can guess, was magnificent. I sat in the window every morning and watched the sun rise over the Opera House. I recommend reserving the Horizon Club level. We were on a top floor and couldn't have been happier. Our room was not shabby by any stretch, and the housekeeping staff was always available by phone. The laundry service was reliable, and took care with my garments. I will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Sorry for the negativity”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Okay, so the room service? Never happened. I was there one week and well, my sheets were cleaned maybe once. And that was because I had to call-but they arrived three days later, all cranky and stuff. There were not rats in my room, but there were Asian Beatles. Also, the quality of the room was poor- half the wall paper was coming of the wall for instance, and one of the chairs was broken. And the toilet? Half the time it didn't flush because either a. the handle was broken or b. it was clogged. I was severely disappointed. For what I paid, I might as well have stayed at Days Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Does not live up to expectations”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After staying in the Shangri la Cairns (which was fabulous !!!) we went onto the Shangri la Sydney expecting a similar experience. We were bitterley disapointed. We "upgraded" to a club room at an additional cost of $99 per night, we had requested a non smoking double but got a smoking twin. As our stay was over Christmas & New Year we were told that we were unable to move as the hotel was full. The room was shabby and in need of redecoration. Not at all what you would expect when spending staying in a 5*

Reviews.Title: “Well up to expectations”
Reviews.Author: Barbarella
Reviews.Content: The Shangri La was definitely one of the best hotels of our five week trip. We spent the long weekend 11 - 15 February there and booked this hotel on the basis of Trip Advisor reviews - we weren't disappointed. Our harbour view room was absolutely gorgeous, it was a shame we didn't have more time to spend in it but there is so much to see outside. We acted on a fellow Trip Advisor's tip and joined the hotel's Golden Circle Club before we arrived - it entitled us to the cold buffet breakfast or a credit towards the full English, which saved us $240 AUD over our stay and the breakfast was fantastic though the dining room was extremely busy on Sat/Sun. The staff were superb, they couldn't do enough for us, and liaised with car hire firm re the car we had booked. Sydney is the most amazing city, the best we have ever visited. The Bridge Climb is a must, it is only five minutes walk from the hotel. You will definitely have 'the climb of your life' as they advertise. If you want to do the twilight climb you will need to book in advance, especially at the weekend but you can easily do this online. If you like zoos, check out Taronga. The ferry trip there is wonderful and you get great views of the harbour from the zoo. We also recommend visiting Manly by ferry for the great beaches and clifftop walks. I could go on all day, but I won't - just visit Sydney, stay at the Shangri La, and you'll see what I mean.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, spacious room, fabulous views”
Reviews.Author: RobertMNZ
Reviews.Content: We had 3 nights at the Shangri-La in early March 05. On arrival we found an an adequate but not imposing lobby. We had a harbour front room on 23rd floor. The room was excellent, spacious and relaxing. The bathroom was also large and beautiful. The views from the wide windows were amazing. Room service excellent and the restaurant at the top of the hotel superb. Our package included a $100 per day contribution to food and beverage. The breakfast cafe is so-so. Adequate but a rather confined space and not in the same league as the restaurant, the rooms or the general hotel service. In our experience one of the best hotels in Sydney - truly world class. A must stay!

Reviews.Title: “Once-In-A-Lifetime Views”
Reviews.Author: LHill
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 days in a corner room on the 24th floor, looking directly down over the harbor, bridge, and opera house. The hotel is expensive by any standard, as is Sydney, but the view alone is worth it, and the location simply could not be better. At night we left the drapes wide so that we could doze off watching the harbor traffic wind down, and awaken to a rising sun and the myriad ferrys going back and forth bringing commuters to their workplaces. The hotel is quiet, staff very good. We only had breakfast in the hotel, but it was everything it should be in a top hotel. Somewhat disconcerting is that complimentary bottled water was not provided even upon arrival, much less each day, as is customary in hotels of this level. A bottle in the mini bar was AUS$10! (did we mention that Sydney is astonishingly expensive?) Take at least one catamaran cruise around the harbor. Take a 1-hr tour of the city on the Red Bus, and consider the 1-hr Blue Bus tour which includes some of the beaches. Take the 12-minute monorail ride. All are worth the time, if not the exceptionally high tarrif (did we mention that Sydney is an astonishingly expensive city?). From this hotel the historic Rocks area is at your feet. We explored every inch of it and were glad we did. If you like authentic Thai food, as we definitely do, experience the casual cantina-style upstairs at Sailor's Thai for lunch or dinner, in the Rocks and barely 5-minutes from the hotel. If you like fusion-style Thai, do try the slightly more formal downstairs room at Sailor's Thai. We liked it enough to eat at Sailor's Thai 3 evenings in a row. Oh, did we mention how expensive...?

Reviews.Title: “Liked this one a lot”
Reviews.Author: Bondman84
Reviews.Content: The hotel was terrific. The concierge, (Colin) was superb. Gave great advice, and excellent service. The views were great, the rooms were comfortable and large. Air conditioning was ok, but not like it should be. On top of large hill, so if you are walking....BE PREPARED. Stay on the concierge level...very nice breakfast, afternoon drinks and service. Free internet access there too. Overall, a great experience, with ok air conditioning (but not good).

Reviews.Title: “Upgrade not the best!”
Reviews.Author: PaulC-7
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Shangri La (formely the ANA) in January, and must say l was very suprised to see the refubishment had actually taken away from the overall standard of the hotel. It seemed to be a new look on the cheap and the hotel has lost the grandure of the ANA. The Horizon Club was dreadful, really small and tables inches apart!. Saying that nothing beats the views and l would go back as it still is a great hotel despite the new design & fittings trying to spoil it!

Reviews.Title: “Let down by poor customer service”
Reviews.Author: liz_s
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Shangri La as part of my honeymoon over Christmas 2004. The room was standard, but have stayed in much more luxurious. The customer service was appauling by the concierge. Eveytime we asked something we were given the distinct impression that we were bothering them. Items were added to our bill that we hadn't had, and were charged $250 for phone calls that we hadn't made. We had to complain to the concierge 5 times before the would accept that we hadn't made the calls. We were disappointed that on Christmas Day they insisted that if you were having breakfast you had to be out of the restaurant by 10:00AM so they could set up the restaurant for Christmas lunch. Fair enough, but it would have been nice if we could get a table for lunch or dinner being as we were hotel guests. Sadly this was not the case, and the concierge couldn't recommend anwhere else and quite frankly couldn't care less. We got the impression that hotel guests came second. My recommendation if you are looking for somewhere to stay in Sydney - go to the Intercontinental. It is fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service with the Best Views in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned from 10 days in Australia, spending five of those days at the Shangri La in Sydney. The location is very central to all the action surrounding the harbor with Circle Quay, The Rocks, Opera House, Harbor Bridge and Ferries withis a 10 minute walk. We upgraded to the full harbor view and were thrilled with the panoramic view of the Sydnet Harbor, Harbor Bridge and Opera House. The room was spacious and well appointed. We did have a couple of issues with our package (no record of included breakfast through Luxury Link) and phone charges. These were resolved promptly and professionally by the Asst. Manager Andrew Allan. Our only complaint was that the Concierge staff could of been more helpful with restaraunt recomendations. Overall an extremely positive experience

Reviews.Title: “Great Choice”
Reviews.Author: Ivy G
Reviews.Content: Shangri-La is a great hotel chain found throughout Asia. I`m almost always given a free upgrade (and I don`t belong to their frequent client program), but didn`t expect it on this trip since a used an Expedia special rate. I had booked their least expense room, and upon arrival was given a corner suite in a club floor (giving access to free breakfasts and evening cocktails in their Horizon Club). Even without all these extras, the place is wonderfully luxurious and elegant, but not pretentious. Friendly staff, great service, and a good location on the border of the historic Rocks area filled with shops, pubs and restaurants and a five minute walk from Circular Quay, Sydney`s transportation hub. I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay at Shangri-la, excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: Katetam
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Shangri-la Sydney for 3 nights on Jan 19-22, 2005. We had previously stayed at Gold Coast's hotels... and coming to Shangri-la Sydney for the last 3 nights of our Australia vacation was treat. After much research previous our reservations, I finally picked this hotel. I was NOT disappointed. For the price we paid, I expected no less. The staff was wonderful, courteous and professional. The hotel is renovated completely in a luxurious, elegant atmostphere. Food at Cafe Mix was great, and the staff there were very good. We have a baby with us, and they tried to make us as comfortable and welcomed as possible each time. The location of the hotel is great. So close to Circular Quay, and the view from this hotel is breathtaking. We booked the Grand Harbourview Room.... if you don't choose this grade of room, you can stay elsewhere .... Four Seasons is also good location, but seems rather old and run down. The hill that leads up to the Shangri-la might be a negative factor for some, but we found so many shortcuts up to the hotel from Harrington Road, you just take elevators from the buildings on Harrington Road, and there are exits from the buildings that allow you to skip the walk up the hill. We had a great time at Shangri-la. The only thing they could improve is having "free" internet access in the rooms instead of charging AUD $ 26.00 a day for it. At the price the guests paid, it's the least they can include.

Reviews.Title: “Don't look elsewhere!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: As part of our honeymoon world tour we booked the Shangri la as it had been highly recommended. As we arrived Richard Branson was just leaving, he had been staying, so you know it's got to be good! It was sensational with views to die for of the Harbour Bridge and the Opera House (Grand Harbour View Room). The room is spacious with a large grand bathroom( wife even took a photo of it!).Try the Altitude restaurant on the top floor( dress code smart) expensive but worth every penny. Staff throughout the hotel were excellent and the concierge amazing, he remembered our name every time and recommended some great trips,bars and restaurants.This truly is a 5 star Hotel with facilities and staff to back it up. Would only stay here if and when we come back. Don't look elsewhere!

Reviews.Title: “Out of this world”
Reviews.Author: mrwalkerLondon
Reviews.Content: I have never stayed at a hotel with such good service, It was a real luxury. The seafood buffet was superb and the staff couldn't do enough for you. Definately be going again, join the hotels Golden Circle club and get a free upgrade. Make sure you join well in advance as they'll ask you how long you have been a member during the booking process. Enjoy

Reviews.Title: “"Fantastic - 5 star"”
Reviews.Author: FionaWarren
Reviews.Content: "We stayed at the Shangri-la, Sydney whilst on our honeymoon. We paid for an Opera House view and on arrival, we were upgraded to a full harbour view!! We had champagne in our suite and as it was a life long dream to visit Sydney - it was amazing to stay at this hotel! The staff were friendly and the location is excellent. I cannot recommend this hotel enough - you must stay here!!!"

Reviews.Title: “Best location/rooms/5 star service in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: travelinspiration
Reviews.Content: This hotel cannot be outdone for it's location, service, and rooms. My husband and I (ages 28/32- no children) are blessed to travel extensively for pleasure and stay in only 5 star hotels. We stayed here for 4 nights recently (Nov.7-11th) as Sydney was our first stop of our Australian vacation (1st time to visit, but definately not last). We paid for a "Grand Harbour View Room" and it was worth every penny! Huge, luxurious room with window seat; huge, luxurious marble bath, and of course the BEST view of the Opera House, Harbour, and Bridge. I researched for this trip for 6 months and contemplated between staying here, the Four Seasons, and the Intercontinental. We like large hotels and wanted the best location. I had read that the rooms are very tiny at the Four Seasons in comparison and the building is smaller. The Shangri-La towers over the Four Seasons, making for better views. I did not choose the Intercontinental for the side of the Circular Quay it was located on and the rooms looked nice, but not as nice as the Shangri-La. I still agree now that I have visited that the Intercontinental is not as well positioned if you don't mind climbing the hill to the Shangri-La (only from one direction though). I think people have over exaggerated and over complained about this hill. Unless you're in bad health, trust me it's nothing!! Also did not choose the other 2 hotels due to the fact they are all over the U.S.A. and we wanted to experience a different, but luxurious 5 star hotel. We would definately recommend the Shangri-La and would like to visit some of their other hotels in the future. We did not use the concierge to book any tours for I had done all that on my own, months prior to our trip. We did a lot of sightseeing on our own and with tours and a private guide named Aiden Mullen - absolutely wonderful! Please e-mail me with any questions re: this hotel or for tour company recommendations, esp. Aiden Mullen. His website is -----------------. E-mail me if that is not correct.

Reviews.Title: “Beware Receptionist Bearing Gifts”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is a very good hotel. Aside from the overall quality of the rooms and service one of its principle feature is its location, overlooking the harbour and Circular Quay. Therefore if you have booked a 'Harbour View' room beware of the receptionist offer of a complimentary upgrade to a junior suite. This is done when there is pressure on 'Harbour View' rooms but what you are not told is the the junior suite will overlook the city or Darling Harbour. The new restaurant 'Altitude' on the top floor is good even if the staff are a little apprehensive. We were asked six times what we though of the 'new' restaurant. However the 'Blue Bar' next door, with its terrific views is overcrowed, hot and stuffy late in the evening. The 'Piano Bar' on the ground floor is a much more pleasant environment for a post dinner drink.

Reviews.Title: “splash out for luxury!!”
Reviews.Author: wildenfree
Reviews.Content: My wife and I visited the Shangri - La in April, our first impressions of the place was that it was well situated, clean and modern. The staff were very helpful and attentive. We upgraded to a penthouse apartment as a treat, and it was fantastic, with a 180 degree view of the Opera House and The Bridge. We had lots of extras in our room as well. I would suggest that if you were looking to upgrade a hotel in a tour of Oz, then this is the place to do it. The hotel is well situated for the sites as well. All in all a very nice place.

Reviews.Title: “Not too shabby”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Carrying a 60llb bag and entering into a five star hotel one would expect a porter to at least offer to assist - but no, not here! It took three trips back down to the reception (with bag - still no offer of help) to sort out a problem with the key to my room that wasn't working. Each time having my intelligence insulted by staff asking me if I had inserted it the correct way. In the end I told them that I had slid it down the crack in the door and tried to force the lock like I'd seen on McGyver!! However, after the pain of checking in had ceased the room was perfect and the views to die for. I visited the Horizons bar which had friendly staff and competent bartenders which russled up all sorts of cocktails to get the evening started at fairly reasonable prices given the location. The pool and spa was adequate but nothing spectacular but with everything on your doorstep this should be the last place in Sydney you should think about going. Not too sure if I'd seen all the hotel, some renovation work was being undertaken which I was not made aware of when making the booking but it didn't really interfer with my stay. Would definately go back if only to wake up to the amazing views and cocktails.

Reviews.Title: “Shangri La Hotel Sydney - Rocks baby!”
Reviews.Author: PauloAmore
Reviews.Content: I had to write this when I read the poor review about the staff. Shangri-la staff at the Sydney hotel are great. Location is great. View is unbelievable. Wish I could post a picture here. Right in front of you is the bridge, too your right is the opera house. Come on, it doesn't get better! Rooms were great too. Spacious and a good bathroom. I had just come from the Shangri-La in Singapore so I know what their specs are meant to be. Downside. The hotel is being renovated to Shangri-la's high standards. The bar on the top floor was closed in June but will probably be open now. You have to be a little forgiving of that but when it's done, you know what they say, location location location. If this review help you, leave a review of another hotel you've stayed in. :-0)

HotelInfo.Name: Shangri-La Hotel Sydney
HotelInfo.Address: 176 Cumberland str., The Rocks, Sydney, New South Wales 2000, Australia
